from בַּיִת and דָּגוֹן; house of Dagon; Beth-Dagon, the name of two places in Palestine; Beth-dagon.
patrial from בֵּית־אֵל with the article interposed; a Beth-elite, or inhabitant of Bethel; Bethelite.
from בַּיִת and אֵצֶל with the article interposed; house of the side; Beth-ha-Etsel, a place in Palestine; Beth-ezel.
from בַּיִת and גִּלְגָּל with the article interposed; house of Gilgal (or rolling); Beth-hag-Gilgal, a place in Palestine; Beth-gilgal.
from בַּיִת and the plural of יְשִׁימַה with the article interposed; house of the deserts; Beth-ha-Jeshimoth, a town East of the Jordan; Beth-jeshimoth.
from בַּיִת and כֶּרֶם with the article interposed; house of the vineyard; Beth-hak-Kerem, a place in Palestine; Beth-haccerem.
patrial from בֵּית לֶחֶם with the article inserted; a Beth-lechemite, or native of Bethlechem; Bethlehemite.
from בַּיִת and מֶרְחָק with the article interposed; house of the breadth; Beth-ham-Merchak, a place in Palestine; place that was far off.

or (shortened) בֵּית מַרְכָּבוֹת; from בַּיִת and the plural of מֶרְכָּבָה (with or without the article interposed); place of (the) chariots; Beth-ham-Markaboth or Beth-Markaboth, a place in Palestine; Bethmarcaboth.
from בַּיִת and עֵמֶק with the article interposed; house of the valley; Beth-ha-Emek, a place in Palestine; Beth-emek.
from בַּיִת and עֲרָבָה with the article interposed; house of the Desert; Beth-ha-Arabah, a place in Palestine; Beth-arabah.
from בַּיִת and רוּם with the article interposed; house of the height; Beth-ha-Ram, a place East of the Jordan; Beth-aram.
probably for בֵּית הָרָם; Beth-ha-Ram, a place East of the Jordan; Beth-haran.
from בַּיִת and שִׁטָּה with the article interposed; house of the acacia; Beth-hash-Shittah, a place in Palestine; Beth-shittah.
patrial from בֵּית שֶׁמֶשׁ with the article inserted; a Beth-shimshite, or inhabitant of Bethshemesh; Bethshemite.
from בַּיִת and the same as חׇגְלָה; house of a partridge; Beth-Choglah, a place in Palestine; Beth-hoglah.
from בַּיִת and חוֹר; house of hollowness; Beth-Choron, the name of two adjoining places in Palestine; Beth-horon.
from בַּיִת and כַּר; house of pasture; Beth-Car, a place in Palestine; Beth-car.
from בַּיִת and the plural of לָבִיא; house of lionesses; Beth-Lebaoth, a place in Palestine; Beth-lebaoth. Compare לְבָאוֹת.
from בַּיִת and לֶחֶם; house of bread; Beth-Lechem, a place in Palestine; Bethlehem.
from בַּיִת and the feminine of עָפָר (with preposition interposed); house to (i.e. of) dust; Beth-le-Aphrah, a place in Palestine; house of Aphrah.
or בֵּית מִלֹּא; from בַּיִת and מִלּוֹא; house of (the) rampart; Beth-Millo, the name of two citadels; house of Millo.
from בַּיִת and מַעֲכָה; house of Maakah; Beth-Maakah, a place in Palestine; Beth-maachah.
from בַּיִת and the feminine of נָמֵר; house of (the) leopard; Beth-Nimrah, a place east of the Jordan; Beth-Nimrah. Compare נִמְרָה.
from בַּיִת and עֵדֶן; house of pleasure; Beth-Eden, a place in Syria; Beth-eden.
from בַּיִת and עַזְמָוֶת; house of Azmaveth, a place in Palestine; Bethaz-maveth. Compare עַזְמָוֶת.
from בַּיִת and a plural from עָנָה; house of replies; Beth-Anoth, a place in Palestine; Beth-anoth.
an orthographical variation for בֵּית עֲנוֹת; Beth-Anath, a place in Palestine; Beth-anath.
from בַּיִת and a derivative of עָקַד; house of (the) binding (for sheep-shearing); Beth-Eked, a place in Palestine; shearing house.
; from בַּיִת and עַשְׁתָּרוֹת; house of Ashtoreths; Beth-Ashtaroth, a place in Palestine; house of Ashtaroth. Compare בְּעֶשְׁתְּרָה, עַשְׁתָּרוֹת.
from בַּיִת and פָּלִיט; house of escape; Beth-Palet, a place in Palestine; Beth-palet.
from בַּיִת and פְּעוֹר; house of Peor; Beth-Peor, a place East of the Jordan; Bethpeor.
from בַּיִת and a derivative from פּוּץ; house of dispersion; Beth-Patstsets, a place in Palestine; Beth-pazzez.
from בַּיִת and צוּר; house of (the) rock; Beth-Tsur, a place in Palestine; Beth-zur.
from בַּיִת and רְחֹב; house of (the) street; Beth-Rechob, a place in Palestine; Beth-rehob.
from בַּיִת and רָפָא; house of (the) giant; Beth-Rapha, an Israelite; Beth-rapha.
or בֵּית שָׁן; from בַּיִת and שָׁאַן; house of ease; Beth-Shean or Beth-Shan, a place in Palestine; Beth-shean, Beth-Shan.
from בַּיִת and שֶׁמֶשׁ; house of (the) sun; Beth-Shemesh, a place in Palestine; Beth-shemesh.
from בַּיִת and תַּפּוּחַ; house of (the) apple; Beth-Tappuach, a place in Palestine; Beth-tappuah.
probably from בַּיִת; a palace (i.e. large house); palace.
from בָּכָה, weeping; Baca, a valley in Palestine; Baca.
the same as בָּכָא; the weeping tree (some gum-distilling tree, perhaps the balsam); mulberry tree.
a primitive root; to weep; generally to bemoan; [idiom] at all, bewail, complain, make lamentation, [idiom] more, mourn, [idiom] sore, [idiom] with tears, weep.
from בָּכָה; a weeping; [idiom] sore.
from בָּכַר; firstborn; hence, chief; eldest (son), firstborn(-ling).
from בָּכַר; the first-fruits of the crop; first fruit (-ripe (figuratively)), hasty fruit.
or (short) בְּכֹרָה; feminine of בְּכוֹר; the firstling of man or beast; abstractly primogeniture; birthright, firstborn(-ling).
feminine of בִּכּוּר; the early fig; firstripe (fruit).
feminine of בְּכוֹרָה; primogeniture; Bekorath, an Israelite; Bechorath.
from בָּכָה; a weeping; by analogy, a dripping; overflowing, [idiom] sore, (continual) weeping, wept.
plural active participle of בָּכָה; (with the article) the weepers; Bo-kim, a place in Palestine; Bochim.
xlit bekîyrâh corrected to bᵉkîyrâh; feminine from בָּכַר; the eldest daughter; firstborn.
from בָּכָה; a weeping; mourning.

a primitive root; properly, to burst the womb, i.e. (causatively) bear or make early fruit (of woman or tree); also (as denominative from בִּכּוּר); to give the birthright; make firstborn, be firstling, bring forth first child (new fruit).
from בָּכַר (in the sense of youth); a young camel; dromedary.
the same as בֶּכֶר; Beker, the name of two Israelites; Becher.
feminine of בֶּכֶר; a young she-camel; dromedary.
by orthographical variation for בִּכּוּרָה; a first-ripe fig; firstripe.
from בָּכַר; first-born; Bokeru, an Israelite; Bocheru.
from בָּכַר; youth-ful; Bikri, an Israelite; Bichri.
patronymically from בֶכֶר; a Bakrite (collectively) or descendants of Beker; Bachrites.
from בָּלָה; properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest; lest, neither, no, none (that...), not (any), nothing.
by contraction for בַּעַל; Bel, the Baal of the Babylonians; Bel.
(Aramaic) from בְּלָא; properly, anxiety, i.e. (by implication) the heart (as its seat); heart.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בָּלָה (but used only in a mental sense); to afflict; wear out.
from בֵּל and אָדוֹן (contracted); Bel (is his) lord; Baladan, the name of a Babylonian prince; Baladan.
a primitive root; to break off or loose (in a favorable or unfavorable sense), i.e. desist (from grief) or invade (with destruction); comfort, (recover) strength(-en).
from בָּלַג; desistance; Bilgah, the name of two Israelites; Bilgah.
from בָּלַג; desistant; Bilgai, an Israelite; Bilgai.
of uncertain derivation; Bildad, one of Job's friends; Bildad.
a primitive root; to fail; by implication to wear out, decay (causatively, consume, spend); consume, enjoy long, become (make, wax) old, spend, waste.
from בָּלָה; worn out; old.
feminine of בָּלֶה; failure; Balah, a place in Palestine; Balah.
a primitive root (rather by transposition for בָּהַל); to palpitate; hence, (causatively) to terrify; trouble.
from בָּלַהּ; timid; Bilhah, the name of one of Jacob's concubines; also of a place in Palestine; Bilhah.
from בָּלַהּ; alarm; hence, destruction; terror, trouble.
from בָּלַהּ; timid; Bilhan, the name of an Edomite and of an Israelite; Bilhan.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to בָּלָה; excise (on articles consumed); tribute.
or (fully) בְּלוֹי; from בָּלָה; (only in plural construction) rags; old.
of foreign derivation; Belteshatstsar, the Babylonian name of Daniel; Belteshazzar.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בֵּלְטְשַׁאצַּר; {Belteshatstsar, the Babylonian name of Daniel}; Belteshazzar.

from בָּלָה; properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.; corruption, ig(norantly), for lack of, where no...is, so that no, none, not, un(awares), without.
from בָּלַל; mixed, i.e. (specifically) feed (for cattle); corn, fodder, provender.
from בְּלִי and מָה; (as indefinitely) nothing whatever; nothing.
from בְּלִי and יַעַל;(often in connection with אִישׁ, אִשָּׁה, בֵּן, etc.); without profit, worthlessness; by extension, destruction, wickedness; Belial, evil, naughty, ungodly (men), wicked.

a primitive root; (also  denominatively from בְּלִיל) to fodder; to overflow (specifically with oil.); by implication, to mix; to fodder; anoint, confound, [idiom] fade, mingle, mix (self), give provender, temper.
a primitive root; to muzzle; be held in.
a primitive root; to pinch sycamore figs (a process necessary to ripen them); gatherer.
a primitive root; to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy; cover, destroy, devour, eat up, be at end, spend up, swallow down (up).
from בָּלַע; a gulp; figuratively, destruction; devouring, that which he hath swallowed up.
the same as בֶּלַע; Bela, the name of a place, also of an Edomite and of two Israelites; Bela.
or בַּלְעֲדֵי; constructive plural from בַּל and עַד, not till, i.e. (as preposition or adverb); except, without, besides; beside, not (in), save, without.
patronymically from בֶּלַע; a Belaite (collectively) or descendants of Bela; Belaites.
probably from בַּל and עַם; not (of the) people, i.e. foreigner; Bilam, a Mesopotamian prophet; also a place in Palestine; Balaam, Bileam.
a primitive root; to annihilate; (make) waste.
from בָּלַק; waster; Balak, a Moabitish king; Balak.
or בֵּלְאשַׁצַּרlemma בֵּלְאשַׁצּר missing vowel, corrected to בֵּלְאשַׁצַּר; of foreign origin (compare בֵּלְטְשַׁאצַּר); Belshatstsar, a Babylonian king; Belshazzar.
lemma בֵּלְשַׁאצּר missing vowel, corrected to בֵּלְשַׁאצַּר; (Aramaic) corresponding to בֵּלְשַׁאצַּר; {Belshatstsar, a Babylonian king}; Belshazzar.
of uncertain derivation; Bilshan, an Israelite; Bilshan.

constructive feminine of בָּלָה (equivalent to בְּלִי); properly, a failure of, i.e. (used only as a negative particle, usually with a prepositional prefix) not, except, without, unless, besides, because not, until, etc.; because un(satiable), beside, but, [phrase] continual, except, from, lest, neither, no more, none, not, nothing, save, that no, without.
from an unused root (meaning to be high); an elevation; height, high place, wave.
the same as בָּמָה; Bamah, a place in Palestine; Bamah. See also בָּמוֹת.
probably from מָהַל with prepositional prefix; with pruning; Bimhal, an Israelite; Bimhal.
prolongation for prepositional prefix; in, with, by, etc.; for, in into, through.
plural of בָּמָה; heights; or (fully) בָּמוֹת בַּעַל; from the same and בַּעַל; heights of Baal; Bamoth or Bamoth-Baal, a place East of the Jordan; Bamoth, Bamoth-baal.

from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); [phrase] afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, ([phrase]) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, [phrase] (young) bullock, [phrase] (young) calf, [idiom] came up in, child, colt, [idiom] common, [idiom] corn, daughter, [idiom] of first, [phrase] firstborn, foal, [phrase] very fruitful, [phrase] postage, [idiom] in, [phrase] kid, [phrase] lamb, ([phrase]) man, meet, [phrase] mighty, [phrase] nephew, old, ([phrase]) people, [phrase] rebel, [phrase] robber, [idiom] servant born, [idiom] soldier, son, [phrase] spark, [phrase] steward, [phrase] stranger, [idiom] surely, them of, [phrase] tumultuous one, [phrase] valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth.
the same as בֵּן; Ben, an Israelite; Ben.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בֵּן; {a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense}; child, son, young.
(Aramaic) or בְּנָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to בָּנָה; to build; build, make.
from בֵּן and אֲבִימֶלֶךְ; (the) son of Abinadab; Ben-Abinadab, an Israelite; the son of Abinadab.
from בֵּן and אָוֶן; son of my sorrow; Ben-Oni, the original name of Benjamin; Ben-oni.
from בֵּן and גֶּבֶר; son of (the) hero; Ben-Geber, an Israelite; the son of Geber.
from בֵּן and a derivative of דָּקַר; son of piercing (or of a lance); Ben-Deker, an Israelite; the son of Dekar.
a primitive root; to build (literally and figuratively); (begin to) build(-er), obtain children, make, repair, set (up), [idiom] surely.
from בֵּן and הֲדַד; son of Hadad; Ben-Hadad, the name of several Syrian kings; Benhadad.
from בָּנָה; built up; Binnui, an Israelite; Binnui.
from בֵּן and זוֹחֵת; son of Zocheth; Ben-Zocheth, an Israelite; Ben-zoketh.
from בֵּן and חוּר; son of Chur; Ben-Chur, an Israelite; the son of Hur.
from בֵּן and חַיִל; son of might; Ben-Chail, an Israelite; Ben-hail.
from בֵּן and חָנָן; son of Chanan; Ben-Chanan, an Israelite; Ben-hanan.
from בֵּן and חֵסֵד; son of kindness; Ben-Chesed, an Israelite; the son of Hesed.
from בָּנָה; built; Bani, the name of five Israelites; Bani.
or (fuller) בּוּנִי; from בָּנָה; built; Bunni or Buni, an Israelite; Bunni.
from the plural construction of בֵּן and בָּרָק; sons of lightning, Bene-berak, a place in Palestine; Bene-barak.
feminine from בָּנָה; a structure; building.
or בּנָיָהוּ; (prolonged) from בָּנָה and יָהּ; Jah has built; Benajah, the name of twelve Israelites; Benaiah.
from the plural of בֵּן and יַעֲקָן; sons of Yaakan; Bene-Jaakan, a place in the Desert; Bene-jaakan.
dual of בֵּין; a double interval, i.e. the space between two armies; [phrase] champion.
from בֵּן and יָמִין; son of (the) right hand; Binjamin, youngest son of Jacob; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory; Benjamin.

sometimes (with the article inserted) בֵּן־הַיּמִינִי; with אִישׁ inserted (1 Samuel 9:1) בֶּן־אִישׁ ימִינִי; son of a man of Jemini; or shortened אִישׁ יְמִינִי; (1 Samuel 9:4; Esther 2:5) a man of Jemini, or (1 Samuel 20:1) simply יְמִינִיxlit Yᵉmînîy corrected to Yᵉmîynîy; a Jeminite; (plural) בְּנֵי יְמִינִיxlit Bᵉnîy corrected to Bᵉnêy; patron from בִּנְיָמִין; a Benjaminite, or descendent of Benjamin; Benjamite, of Benjamin.
from בָּנָה; an edifice; building.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בִּנְיָן; {an edifice}; building.
probably from בֵּן with pron. suff.; our son; Beninu, an Israelite; Beninu.
(Aramaic) of uncertain affinity; to be enraged; be angry.
or בִּנְעָה; of uncertain derivation; Bina or Binah, an Israelite; Binea, Bineah.
from בֵּן and עַם with pronomial suffix; son of my people; Ben-Ammi, a son of Lot; Ben-ammi.
from סוֹד and יָהּ with prepositional prefix; in (the) counsel of Jehovah; Besodejah, an Israelite; Besodeiah.
from בּוּס; domineering; Besai, one of the Nethinim; Besai.
from an unused root meaning to be sour; an immature grape; unripe grape.
from the same as בֶּסֶר; {an immature grape}; sour grape.
(Aramaic) or בְּעָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to בָּעָה; to seek or ask; ask, desire, make (petition), pray, request, seek.
from עַד with prepositional prefix; in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.; about, at by (means of), for, over, through, up (-on), within.
a primitive root; to gush over, i.e. to swell; (figuratively) to desire earnestly; by implication to ask; cause, inquire, seek up, swell out.
(Aramaic) from בְּעָא; a request; petition.
from בָּעַר (in the sense of burning); a lamp; Beor, the name of the father of an Edomitish king; also of that of Balaam; Beor.
masculine plural from בָּעַת; alarms; terrors.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Boaz, the ancestor of David; also the name of a pillar in front of the temple; Boaz.
a primitive root; to trample down, i.e. (figuratively) despise; kick.
from בָּעָה; a prayer; grave.
from בָּעַר (in the sense of eating); cattle; beast, cattle.
a primitive root; also as denominative from בַּעַל; to be master; hence, to marry; have dominion (over), be husband, marry(-ried, [idiom] wife).

from בָּעַל; a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense); [phrase] archer, [phrase] babbler, [phrase] bird, captain, chief man, [phrase] confederate, [phrase] have to do, [phrase] dreamer, those to whom it is due, [phrase] furious, those that are given to it, great, [phrase] hairy, he that hath it, have, [phrase] horseman, husband, lord, man, [phrase] married, master, person, [phrase] sworn, they of.
the same as בַּעַל; Baal, a Phoenician deity; Baal, (plural) Baalim.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בַּעַל; {a master; hence, a husband,}; [phrase] chancellor.
from בַּעַל and בְּרִית; Baal of (the) covenant; Baal-Berith, a special deity of the Shechemites; Baal-berith.
from בַּעַל and גָּד; Baal of Fortune; Baal-Gad, a place in Syria; Baal-gad.
feminine of בַּעַל; a mistress; that hath, mistress.
the same as בַּעֲלָה; Baalah, the name of three places in Palestine; Baalah.
from בַּעַל and הָמוֹן; possessor of a multitude; Baal-Hamon, a place in Palestine; Baal-hamon.
plural of בַּעֲלָה; mistresses; Bealoth, a place in Palestine; Bealoth, in Aloth (by mistake for a plural from עָלָה with prepositional prefix).
from בַּעַל and זְבוּב; Baal of (the) Fly; Baal-Zebub, a special deity of the Ekronites; Baal-zebub.
from בַּעַל and חָנַן; possessor of grace; Baal-Chanan, the name of an Edomite, also of an Israelite; Baal-hanan.
from בַּעַל and a modification of חָצֵר; possessor of a village; Baal-Chatsor, a place in Palestine; Baal-hazor.
from בַּעַל and חֶרְמוֹן; possessor of Hermon; Baal-Chermon, a place in Palestine; Baal-hermon.
from בַּעַל with pron. suff.; my master; Baali, a symbolical name for Jehovah; Baali.
from the plural of בַּעַל and the plural of בָּמָה; Baals of (the) heights; Baale-Bamoth, a place East of the Jordan; lords of the high places.
from בַּעַל and יָדַע; Baal has known; Beeljada, an Israelite; Beeliada.
from בַּעַל and יָהּ; Jah (is) master; Bealjah, an Israelite; Bealiah.
from the plural of בַּעַל and יְהוּדָה; masters of Judah; Baale-Jehudah, a place in Palestine; Baale of Judah.
xlit Baʻălîç corrected to Baʻălîyç; probably from a derivative of עָלַס with prepositional prefix; in exultation; Baalis, an Ammonitish king; Baalis.
from בַּעַל and מָעוֹן; Baal of (the) habitation (of) (compare בֵּית בַּעַל מְעוֹן); Baal-Meon, a place East of the Jordan; Baal-meon.
from בַּעַל and פְּעוֹר; Baal of Peor; Baal-Peor, a Moabitish deity; Baal-peor.
from בַּעַל and the plural of פֶּרֶץ; possessor of breaches; Baal-Peratsim, a place in Palestine; Baal-perazim.
from בַּעַל and צָפוֹן (in the sense of cold) (according to others an Egyptian form of Typhon, the destroyer); Baal of winter; Baal-Tsephon, a place in Eqypt; Baal-zephon.
from בַּעַל and שָׁלִשָׁה; Baal of Shalishah, Baal-Shalishah, a place in Palestine; Baal-shalisha.
a modification of בַּעֲלָה; mistressship; Baalath, a place in Palestine; Baalath.
xlit Bᵉʻêr corrected to Bᵉʼêr; from בַּעֲלָה and בְּאֵר; mistress of a well; Baalath-Beer, a place in Palestine; Baalath-beer.
from בַּעַל and תָּמָר; possessor of (the) palm-tree; Baal-Tamar, a place in Palestine; Baal-tamar.
probably a contraction of בֵּית בַּעַל מְעוֹן; Beon, a place East of the Jordan; Beon.
the same as בַּעֲנָה; Banana, the name of four Israelite; Baana, Baanah.
from a derivative of עָנָה with prepositional prefix; in affliction; Baanah, the name of four Israelites; Baanah.

a primitive root; also as denominative from בַּעַר; to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish; be brutish, bring (put, take) away, burn, (cause to) eat (up), feed, heat, kindle, set (on fire), waste.
from בָּעַר; properly, foot (as consumed); i.e. (by exten.) of cattle brutishness; (concretely) stupid; brutish (person), foolish.
from בַּעַר; brutish; Baara, an Israelitish woman; Baara.
from בָּעַר; a burning; fire.
from an unused root meaning to stink; offensiveness; Basha, a king of Israel; Baasha.
from עָשָׂה and יָהּ with a prepositional prefix; in (the) work of Jah; Baasejah, an Israelite; Baaseiah.
from עַשְׁתְּרָה (as singular of עַשְׁתָּרוֹת) with a prepositional prefix; with Ashtoreth; Beeshterah, a place East of the Jordan; Beeshterah.
a primitive root; to fear; affright, be (make) afraid, terrify, trouble.
from בָּעַת; fear; trouble.
probably the same as בּוּץ; mud (as whitish clay); mire.
intensive from בֹץ; a swamp; fen, mire(-ry place).
from בָּצַר; inaccessible, i.e. lofty; vintage (by confusion with בָּצִיר).
perhaps the same as בְּסַי; Betsai, the name of two Israelites; Bezai.
from בָּצַר; clipped, i.e. the grape crop; vintage.
xlit bᵉtsel corrected to betsel; from an unused root apparently meaning to peel; an onion; onion.
probably from צֵל and אֵל with a prepositional prefix; in (the) shadow (i.e. protection) of God; Betsalel, the name of two Israelites; Bezaleel.
or בַּצְלִית; from the same as בֶּצֶלxlit bᵉtsel corrected to betsel; a peeling; Batsluth or Batslith, an Israelite; Bazlith, Bazluth.

a primitive root to break off, i.e. (usually) plunder; figuratively, to finish, or (intransitively) stop; (be) covet(-ous), cut (off), finish, fulfill, gain (greedily), get, be given to (covetousness), greedy, perform, be wounded.
from בָּצַע; plunder; by extension, gain (usually unjust); covetousness, (dishonest) gain, lucre, profit.
a primitive root; perhaps to swell up, i.e. blister; swell.
from בָּצֵק; dough (as swelling by fermentation); dough, flour.
from בָּצֵק; a swell of ground; Botscath, a place in Palestine; Bozcath, Boskath.

a primitive root; to clip off; specifically (as denominative from בָּצִיר); to gather grapes; also to be isolated (i.e. inaccessible by height or fortification); cut off, (de-) fenced, fortify, (grape) gather(-er), mighty things, restrain, strong, wall (up), withhold.
from בָּצַר; strictly a clipping, i.e. gold (as dug out); gold defence.
the same as בֶּצֶר, an inaccessible spot; Betser, a place in Palestine; also an Israelite; Bezer.
another form for בֶּצֶר; gold; gold.
feminine from בָּצַר; an enclosure, i.e. sheep fold; Bozrah.
the same as בׇּצְרָה; Botsrah, a place in Edom; Bozrah.
masculine intensive from בָּצַר; a fortress; stronghold.
feminine intensive from בָּצַר; restraint (of rain), i.e. drought; dearth, drought.
the same as בַּקְבֻּקxlit baqbûk corrected to baqbuq; Bakbuk, one of the Nethinim; Bakbuk.
xlit baqbûk corrected to baqbuq; from בָּקַק; a bottle (from the gurgling in emptying); bottle, cruse.
xlit Baqbukyâh corrected to Baqbuqyâh; from בַּקְבֻּקxlit baqbûk corrected to baqbuq and יָהּ; emptying (i.e. wasting) of Jah; Bakbukjah, an Israelite; Bakbukiah.
reduplicated from בָּקַר; searcher; Bakbakkar, an Israelite; Bakbakkar.
from בָּקַק; wasteful; Bukki, the name of two Israelites; Bukki.
from בָּקַק and יָהּ; wasting of Jah; Bukkijah, an Israelite; Bukkiah.
from בָּקַע; a fissure; breach, cleft.

a primitive root; to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open; make a breach, break forth (into, out, in pieces, through, up), be ready to burst, cleave (asunder), cut out, divide, hatch, rend (asunder), rip up, tear, win.
from בָּקַע; a section (half) of ashekel, i.e. a beka (a weight and a coin); bekah, half a shekel.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בִּקְעָה; {properly, a split, i.e. a wide level valley between mountains}; plain.
from בָּקַע; properly, a split, i.e. a wide level valley between mountains; plain, valley.
a primitive root; to pour out, i.e. to empty, figuratively, to depopulate; by analogy, to spread out (as a fruitful vine); (make) empty (out), fail, [idiom] utterly, make void.
a primitive root; properly, to plough, or (generally) break forth, i.e. (figuratively) to inspect, admire, care for, consider; (make) inquire (-ry), (make) search, seek out.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בָּקַר; {properly, to plough, or (generally) break forth, i.e. (figuratively) to inspect, admire, care for, consider}; inquire, make search.

from בָּקַר; beef cattle or an animal of the ox family of either gender (as used for plowing); collectively, a herd; beeve, bull ([phrase] -ock), [phrase] calf, [phrase] cow, great (cattle), [phrase] heifer, herd, kine, ox.
from בָּקַר; properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning; ([phrase]) day, early, morning, morrow.
intensive from בָּקַר; a looking after; seek out.
from בָּקַר; properly, examination, i.e. (by implication) punishment; scourged.

a primitive root; to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after; ask, beg, beseech, desire, enquire, get, make inquisition, procure, (make) request, require, seek (for).
from בָּקַשׁ; a petition; request.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בֵּן; a son, grandson, etc.; [idiom] old, son.
borrowed (as a title) from בַּר; the heir (apparent to the throne); son.
from בָּרַר (in its various senses); beloved; also pure, empty; choice, clean, clear, pure.
or בַּר; from בָּרַר (in the sense of winnowing); grain of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension the open country; corn, wheat.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בָּר; a field; field.
from בָּרַר; purify; cleanness, pureness.
the same as בֹּר; vegetable lye (from its cleansing); used as a soap forwashing, or a flux formetals; [idiom] never so, purely.
a primitive root; (absolutely) to create; (qualified) to cut down (a wood), select, feed (as formative processes); choose, create (creator), cut down, dispatch, do, make (fat).
a variation of מְרֹאדַךְ בַּלְאָדָן; Berodak-Baladan, a Babylonian king; Berodach-baladan.Birliy.
from בָּרָא and שְׁמוּאֵל; Jah has created; Berajah, an Israelite; Beraiah.
by reduplication from בָּר; a fowl (as fattened on grain); fowl.
a primitive root,; to hail; hail.
from בָּרַד; hail; hail(stones).
from בָּרַד; hail; Bered, the name of a place south of Palestine, also of an Israelite; Bered.
from בָּרַד; spotted (as if with hail); grisled.

a primitive root; to select; also (as denominative from בָּר) to feed; also (as equivalent to בָּרַר) to render clear (Ecclesiastes 3:18); to select; to feed; to render clear; choose, (cause to) eat, manifest, (give) meat.
passive participle from בָרַךְ; blessed; Baruk, the name of three Israelites; Baruch.
probably of foreign origin; damask (stuff of variegated thread); rich apparel.
of uncertain derivation; a cypress (?) tree; hence, a lance or a musical instrument (as made of that wood); fir (tree).
lemma בֻּרוֹת first vowel, corrected to בְּרוֹת; a variation of בְּרוֹשׁ; the cypress (or some elastic tree); fir.
from בָּרָה; food; meat.
or בֵּרֹתַי; probably from בְּרוֹתlemma בֻּרוֹת first vowel, corrected to בְּרוֹת; cypress or cypresslike; Berothah or Berothai, a place north of Palestine; Berothah, Berothai.
probably feminine plural from an unused root (apparently mean to pierce); holes; Birzoth, an Israelite; Birzavith (from the marg.).
perhaps from the root of בִּרְזוֹת; iron (as cutting); by extension, an iron implement; (ax) head, iron.
from בַּרְזֶל; iron-hearted; Barzillai, the name of three Israelites; Barzillai.
a primitive root; to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly; chase (away); drive away, fain, flee (away), put to flight, make haste, reach, run away, shoot.
by transposition for בַּחֲרוּמִי; a Barchumite, or native of Bachurim; Barhumite.
from בָּרָה; fat; fat.
probably by contraction from בְּאֵרִי; Beri, an Israelite; Beri.
of uncertain derivation; (only in the plural and with the article) the Berites, a place in Palestine; Berites.
from בָּרָא (in the sense of בָּרָה); fatted or plump; fat ((fleshed), -ter), fed, firm, plenteous, rank.
feminine from בָּרָא; a creation, i.e. a novelty; new thing.
feminine from בָּרָה; food; meat.
from בָּרַח; a bolt; bar, fugitive.
or בָּרִחַ; (shortened) from בָּרַח; a fugitive, i.e. the serpent (as fleeing), and the constellation by that name; crooked, noble, piercing.
the same as בָּרִיחַ; Bariach, an Israelite; Bariah.
apparently from the feminine of רַע with a prepositional prefix; in trouble; Beriah, the name of four Israelites; Beriah.
patronymically from בְּרִיעָה; a Beriite (collectively) or descendants of Beriah; Beerites.
from בָּרָה (in the sense of cutting (like בָּרָא)); a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh); confederacy, (con-) feder(-ate), covenant, league.
the same as בְּרִית; Berith, a Shechemitish deity; Berith.
feminine of בֹּר; vegetable alkali; sope.

a primitive root; to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason); [idiom] abundantly, [idiom] altogether, [idiom] at all, blaspheme, bless, congratulate, curse, [idiom] greatly, [idiom] indeed, kneel (down), praise, salute, [idiom] still, thank.

(Aramaic) corresponding to בָרַךְ; {to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)}; bless, kneel.
from בָרַךְ; a knee; knee.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בֶּרֶךְ; {a knee}; knee.
from בָרַךְ and אֵל, God has blessed; Barakel, the father of one of Job's friends; Barachel.
from בָרַךְ; benediction; by implication prosperity; blessing, liberal, pool, present.
the same as בְּרָכָה; Berakah, the name of an Israelite, and also of a valley in Palestine; Berachah.
from בָרַךְ; a reservoir (at which camels kneel as a resting-place); (fish-) pool.
or בֶּרֶכְיָהוּ; from בֶּרֶךְ and יָהּ; knee (i.e. blessing) of Jah; Berekjah, the name of six Israelites; Berachiah, Berechiah.
(Aramaic) perhaps from רוּם with a prepositional prefix; properly, highly, i.e. surely; but used adversatively, however; but, nevertheless, yet.
of uncertain derivation; Bera, a Sodomitish king; Bera.
a primitive root; to lighten (lightning); cast forth.
from בָּרַק; lightning; by analogy, a gleam; concretely, a flashing sword; bright, glitter(-ing sword), lightning.
the same as בָּרָק; Barak, an Israelite; Barak.
of uncertain derivation; Barkos, one of the Nethimim; Barkos.
from בָּרָק; a thorn (perhaps as burning brightly); brier.
lemma בָּרְקַת variant form, corrected to בָּרֶקֶת; or בָּרְקַתxlit bârᵉkath corrected to bârᵉqath; from בָּרָק; a gem (as flashing), perhaps the emerald; carbuncle.
a primitive root; to clarify (i.e. brighten), examine, select; make bright, choice, chosen, cleanse (be clean), clearly, polished, (shew self) pure(-ify), purge (out).
probably from רֶשַׁע with a prepositional prefix; with wickedness; Birsha, a king of Gomorrah; Birsha.
patrial from בֵּרוֹתָה; a Berothite, or inhabitant of Berothai; Berothite.
from בָּשַׂר; cheerful; Besor, a stream of Palestine; Besor.
or (shortened) בְּשֹׂרָה; feminine from בָּשַׂר; glad tidings; by implication, reward forgood news; reward for tidings.
a primitive root; properly, to boil up; hence, to be done in cooking; figuratively to ripen; bake, boil, bring forth, roast, seethe, sod (be sodden).
from בָּשַׁל; boiled; [idiom] at all, sodden.
of foreign derivation; Bishlam, a Persian; Bishlam.
from an unused root meaning to be fragrant; (compare סַם); the balsam plant; spice.
or בֹּשֶׂם; from the same as בָּשָׂם; fragrance; by implication, spicery; also the balsam plant; smell, spice, sweet (odour).
feminine of בֶּשֶׂם (the second form); fragrance; Bosmath, the name of a wife of Esau, and of a daughter of Solomon; Bashemath, Basmath.
of uncertain derivation; Bashan (often with the article), a region East of the Jordan; Bashan.
feminine from בּוּשׁ; shamefulness; shame.
a primitive root; to trample down; tread.

a primitive root; properly, to be fresh, i.e. full (rosy, (figuratively) cheerful); to announce (glad news); messenger, preach, publish, shew forth, (bear, bring, carry, preach, good, tell good) tidings.
from בָּשַׂר; flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman; body, (fat, lean) flesh(-ed), kin, (man-) kind, [phrase] nakedness, self, skin.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בָּשָׂר; {flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman}; flesh.
from בּוּשׁ; shame (the feeling and the condition, as well as its cause); by implication (specifically) an idol; ashamed, confusion, [phrase] greatly, (put to) shame(-ful thing).

from בָּנָה (as feminine of בֵּן); a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively); apple (of the eye), branch, company, daughter, [idiom] first, [idiom] old, [phrase] owl, town, village.
probably from the same as בַּתָּה; a bath or Hebrew measure (as a means of division) of liquids; bath.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בַּת; {a bath or Hebrew measure (as a means of division) of liquids}; bath.
probably an orthographical variation for בַּתָּה; desolation; waste.
feminine from an unused root (meaning to break in pieces); desolation; desolate.
apparently from the same as בָּתָה and אֵל; destroyed of God; Bethuel, the name of a nephew of Abraham, and of a place in Palestine; Bethuel. Compare בְּתוּל.
for בְּתוּאֵל; Bethul (i.e. Bethuel), a place in Palestine; Bethuel.
feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to separate; a virgin (from her privacy); sometimes (by continuation) a bride; also (figuratively) a city or state; maid, virgin.
masculine plural of the same as בְּתוּלָה; (collectively and abstractly) virginity; by implication and concretely, the tokens of it; [idiom] maid, virginity.
from בַּת and יָהּ; daughter (i.e. worshipper) of Jah; Bithjah, an Egyptian woman; Bithiah.
a primitive root; to cut in pieces; thrust through.
a primitive root,; to chop up; divide.
from בָּתַר; a section; part, piece.
the same as בֶּתֶר; Bether, a (craggy) place in Palestine; Bether.
from בַּת and a masculine plural from רַב; the daughter (i.e. city) of Rabbah; Bath-rabbim.
from בָּתַר; (with the article) the craggy spot; Bithron, a place East of the Jordan; Bithron.
from בַּת and שֶׁבַע (in the sense of שָׁבַע); daughter of an oath; Bath-Sheba, the mother of Solomon; Bath-sheba.
from בַּת and שׁוֹעַ; daughter of wealth;  the same as בַּת־שֶׁבַע; Bath-shua,; Bath-shua.
for גֵּאֶה; haughty; proud.
a primitive root; to mount up; hence, in general, to rise, (figuratively) be majestic; gloriously, grow up, increase, be risen, triumph.
from גָּאָה; lofty; figuratively, arrogant; proud.
feminine from גָּאָה; arrogance; pride.
from גָּאָה and אֵל; majesty of God; Geuel, an Israelite; Geuel.
xlit gaʻăvâh corrected to gaʼăvâh; from גָּאָה; arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament; excellency, haughtiness, highness, pride, proudly, swelling.
from גָּאָה; the same as גַּאֲוָהxlit gaʻăvâh corrected to gaʼăvâh; {arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament}; arrogancy, excellency(-lent), majesty, pomp, pride, proud, swelling.
from גָּאָה; the same as גַּאֲוָהxlit gaʻăvâh corrected to gaʼăvâh; {arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament}; excellent things, lifting up, majesty, pride, proudly, raging.
from גָּאָה; haughty; proud.

a primitive root, to redeem (according to the Oriental law of kinship), i.e.; to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.); [idiom] in any wise, [idiom] at all, avenger, deliver, (do, perform the part of near, next) kinsfolk(-man), purchase, ransom, redeem(-er), revenger.
a primitive root, (rather identified with גָּאַל, through the idea of freeing, i.e. repudiating); to soil or (figuratively) desecrate; defile, pollute, stain.
from גָּאַל; profanation; defile.
xlit gᵉullâh corrected to gᵉʼullâh; feminine passive participle of גָּאַל; redemption (including the right and the object); by implication, relationship; kindred, redeem, redemption, right.

from an unused root meaning to hollow or curve; (compare גֵּו and גּוּף); the back (as rounded); by analogy, the top or rim, a boss, a vault, arch of eye, bulwarks, etc.; back, body, boss, eminent (higher) place, (eye) brows, nave, ring.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גַב; {the back (as rounded); by analogy, the top or rim, a boss, a vault, arch of eye, bulwarks, etc.}; back.
from גּוּב; a log (as cut out); also well or cistern (as dug); beam, ditch, pit.
probably from גּוּב (compare גּוֹב); a locust (from its cutting); locust.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to גּוּב; a pit (for wild animals) (as cut out); den.
or (fully) גּוֹב; from גּוּב; pit; Gob, a place in Palestine; Gob.
xlit gebe corrected to gebeʼ; from an unused root meaning probably to collect; a reservoir; by analogy, a marsh; marish, pit.
a primitive root; to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty; exalt, be haughty, be (make) high(-er), lift up, mount up, be proud, raise up great height, upward.
from גָּבַהּ; lofty (literally or figuratively); high, proud.
from גָּבַהּ; elation, grandeur, arrogance; excellency, haughty, height, high, loftiness, pride.
or גָּבוֹהַּ; (fully) from גָּבַהּ; elevated (or elated), powerful, arrogant; haughty, height, high(-er), lofty, proud, [idiom] exceeding proudly.
from גָּבַהּ; pride; loftiness, lofty.

or גְּבֻל; (shortened) from גָּבַל; properly, a cord (as twisted), i.e. (by implication) a boundary; by extension the territory inclosed; border, bound, coast, [idiom] great, landmark, limit, quarter, space.
or גְּבֻלָה; (shortened) feminine of גְּבוּל; a boundary, region; border, bound, coast, landmark. place.
or גִּבֹּר; (shortened) intensive from the same as גֶּבֶר; powerful; by implication, warrior, tyrant; champion, chief, [idiom] excel, giant, man, mighty (man, one), strong (man), valiant man.
feminine passive participle from the same as גִּבּוֹר; force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory; force, mastery, might, mighty (act, power), power, strength.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גְּבוּרָה; power; might.
from an unused root meaning to be high (in the forehead); bald in the forehead; forehead bald.
from the same as גִּבֵּחַ; baldness in the forehead; by analogy, a bare spot on the right side of cloth; bald forehead, [idiom] without.
from the same as גַב; collective; Gabbai, an Israelite; Gabbai.
plural of גֵּב; cisterns; Gebim, a place in Palestine; Gebim.
from an unused root (meaning to be convex); a goblet; by analogy, the calyx of aflower; house, cup, pot.
from גָּבַר; a master; lord.
feminine of גְּבִיר; a mistress; queen.
from an unused root (probably meaning to freeze); crystal (from its resemblance to ice); pearl.
a primitive root; also as a denominative from גְּבוּל; properly, to twist as arope;  to bound (as by a line); be border, set (bounds about).
from גָּבַל (in the sense of a chain of hills); a mountain; Gebal, a place in Phoenicia; Gebal.
the same as גְּבַל; Gebal, a region in Idumaea; Gebal.
; patrial from גְּבַל; a Gebalite, or inhabitant of Gebal; Giblites, stone-squarer.
from גָּבַל; a twisted chain or lace; end.
from an unused root meaning to be arched or contracted; hunch-backed; crookbackt.
feminine from the same as גִּבֵּן; curdled milk; cheese.
from the same as גִּבֵּן; a hump or peak of hills; high.
from the same as גְּבִיעַ, a hillock; Geba, a place in Palestine; Gaba, Geba, Gibeah.
by permutation for גִּבְעָה; a hill; Giba, a place in Palestine; Gibeah.
feminine from the same as גֶּבַע; a hillock; hill, little hill.
the same as גִּבְעָה; Gibah; the name of three places in Palestine; Gibeah, the hill.
from the same as גֶּבַע; hilly; Gibon, a place in Palestine; Gibeon.
prolonged from גְּבִיעַ; the calyx of a flower; bolled.
patrial from גִּבְעוֹן; a Gibonite, or inhabitant of Gibon; Gibeonite.
from the same as גְּבִיעַ; hilliness; Gibath; Gibeath.
patrial from גִּבְעָה; a Gibathite, or inhabitant of Gibath; Gibeathite.
a primitive root; to be strong; by implication, to prevail, act insolently; exceed, confirm, be great, be mighty, prevail, put to more (strength), strengthen, be stronger, be valiant.
from גָּבַר; properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply; every one, man, [idiom] mighty.
the same as גֶּבֶר; Geber, the name of two Israelites; Geber.
from גָּבַר; the same as גֶּבֶר; a person; man.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גְּבַר; {a person}; certain, man.
(Aramaic) intensive of גְּבַר; valiant, or warrior; mighty.
intensive of גְּבַר; Gibbar, an Israelite; Gibbar.
from גֶּבֶר and אֵל; man of God; Gabriel, an archangel; Garbriel.
feminine of גְּבִיר; mistress; lady, mistress.
intensive from גִּבְעָה; a hilly spot; Gibbethon, a place in Palestine; Gibbethon.
probably by reduplication from גָּאָה; a roof; by analogy, the top of an altar; roof (of the house), (house) top (of the house).
from גָּדַד (in the sense of cutting); coriander seed (from its furrows); coriander.
a variation of גָּד; Fortune, a Babylonian deity; that troop.
from גּוּד (in the sense of distributing); fortune; troop.
from גּוּד; Gad, a son of Jacob, including his tribe and its territory; also a prophet; Gad.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גִּזְבָּר; a treasurer; treasurer.
by reduplication from גָּדַד (in the sense of cutting) cleft; Gudgodah, a place in the Desert; Gudgodah.
a primitive root (compare גּוּד); to crowd; also to gash (as if by pressing into); assemble (selves by troops), gather (selves together, self in troops), cut selves.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גָּדַד; to cut down; hew down.
from an unused root (meaning to cut off); a border of a river (as cut into by the stream); bank.
from גָּדַד; a crowd (especially of soldiers); army, band (of men), company, troop (of robbers).
or גְּדֻדָה; (feminine) from גָּדַד; a furrow (as cut); furrow.
feminine participle passive of גָּדַד; an incision; cutting.

or גָּדֹל; (shortened) from גָּדַל; great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent; [phrase] aloud, elder(-est), [phrase] exceeding(-ly), [phrase] far, (man of) great (man, matter, thing,-er,-ness), high, long, loud, mighty, more, much, noble, proud thing, [idiom] sore, ([idiom]) very.
or גְּדֻלָּה; (shortened) or (less accurately) גְּדוּלָּה; feminine of גָּדוֹל; greatness; (concretely) mighty acts; dignity, great things(-ness), majesty.
or (shortened) גִּדֻּף; and (feminine) גִּדּוּפָהxlit giddûphâh corrected to giddûwphâh; or גִּדֻּפָה; from גְּדוּפָה; vilification; reproach, reviling.
feminine passive participle of גָּדַף; a revilement; taunt.
from the same as גָּדָה; a young goat (from browsing); kid.
from גָּד; fortunate; Gadi, an Israelite; Gadi.
patronymically from גָּד; a Gadite (collectively) or descendants of Gad; Gadites, children of Gad.
intensive for גָּדִי; Gaddi, an Israelite; Gaddi.
from גָּד and אֵל; fortune of God; Gaddiel, an Israelite; Gaddiel.
or גַּדיָה; the same as גָּדָה; a river brink; bank.
feminine of גְּדִי; a young female goat; kid.
from an unused root (meaning to heap up); a stack of sheaves; by analogy, a tomb; shock (stack) (of corn), tomb.

a primitive root; properly, to twist (compare גְּדִל), i.e.; to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride); advance, boast, bring up, exceed, excellent, be(-come, do, give, make, wax), great(-er, come to... estate, [phrase] things), grow(up), increase, lift up, magnify(-ifical), be much set by, nourish (up), pass, promote, proudly (spoken), tower.
from גָּדַל; large (literally or figuratively); great, grew.
from גָּדַל; magnitude (literally or figuratively); greatness, stout(-ness).
from גָּדַל (in the sense of twisting); thread, i.e. a tassel or festoon; fringe, wreath.
from גָּדַל; stout; Giddel, the name of one of the Nethinim, also of one of 'Solomon's servants'; Giddel.
or (prolonged) גְּדַלְיָהוּ; from גָּדַל and יָהּ; Jah has become great; Gedaljah, the name of five Israelites; Gedaliah.
from גָּדַל; I have made great; Giddalti, an Israelite; Giddalti.
a primitive root; to fell a tree; generally, to destroy anything; cut (asunder, in sunder, down, off), hew down.
from גָּדַע; feller (i.e. warrior); Gidon, an Israelite; Gideon.
from גָּדַע; a cutting (i.e. desolation); Gidom, a place in Palestine; Gidom.
lemma גִּדְעֹני missing vowel, corrected to גִּדְעֹנִי; from גָּדַע; warlike (compare גִּדְעוֹן); Gidoni, an Israelite; Gideoni.
a primitive root; to hack (with words), i.e. revile; blaspheme, reproach.
a primitive root; to wall in or around; close up, fence up, hedge, inclose, make up (a wall), mason, repairer.
from גָּדַר; a circumvallation; wall.
; the same as גֶּדֶר; Geder, a place in Palestine; Geder.
or (fully) גְּדוֹר; from גָּדַר; inclosure; Gedor, a place in Palestine; also the name of three Israelites; Gedor.
from גָּדַר; a circumvallation; by implication, an inclosure; fence, hedge, wall.
feminine of גָּדֵר; enclosure (especially for flocks); (sheep-) cote (fold) hedge, wall.
the same as גְּדֵרָה; (with the article) Gederah, a place in Palestine; Gederah, hedges.
plural of גְּדֵרָה; walls; Gederoth, a place in Palestine; Gederoth.
patrial from גֶּדֶר; a Gederite, or inhabitant of Geder; Gederite.
patrial from גְּדֵרָה; a Gederathite, or inhabitant of Gederah; Gederathite.
dual of גְּדֵרָה; double wall; Gederothajim, a place in Palestine; Gederothaim.
probably a clerical error for זֶה; this; this.
a primitive root; to remove (a bandage from a wound, i.e. heal it); cure.
from גָּהָה; a cure; medicine.
a primitive root; to prostrate oneself; cast self down, stretch self.
another form for גֵּו; the back; back.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גֵּו; the middle; midst, same, there-(where-) in.
from גָּאָה (corresponding to גַב); the back; by analogy, the middle; [phrase] among, back, body.
a primitive root; to dig; husbandman.
from גּוּב; the locust (from its grubbing as a larvae); grasshopper, [idiom] great.
of uncertain derivation; Gog, the name of an Israelite, also of some nothern nation; Gog.
a primitive root (akin to גָּדַד); to crowd upon, i.e. attack; invade, overcome.
feminine of גֵּו; the back, i.e. (by extensive) the person; body.
the same as גֵּוָה; exaltation; (figuratively) arrogance; lifting up, pride.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גֵּוָה; {exaltation; (figuratively) arrogance}; pride.
a primitive root (compare גַּזָז); properly, to shear off; but used only in the (figuratively) sense of passing rapidly; bring, cut off.
or (shortened) גֹזָלlemma גזָל missing vowel, corrected to גֹזָל; from גָּזַל; a nestling (as being comparatively nude of feathers); young (pigeon).
probably from גּוּז; a quarry (as a place of cutting stones); Gozan, a province of Assyria; Gozan.

rarely (shortened) גֹּי; apparently from the same root as גֵּוָה (in the sense of massing); a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts; Gentile, heathen, nation, people.
prolonged for גֵּוָה; a body, whether alive or dead; (dead) body, carcase, corpse.
or (shortened) גֹּלָה; active participle feminine of גָּלָה; exile; concretely and collectively exiles; (carried away), captive(-ity), removing.
from גּוֹלָה; captive; Golan, a place east of the Jordan; Golan.
of uncertain derivation; a pit; pit.
probably from גָּנַן; protected; Guni, the name of two Israelites; Guni.
patronymically from גּוּנִי; a Gunite (collectively with article prefix) or descendants of Guni; Gunites.
a primitive root; to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire; die, be dead, give up the ghost, perish.
a primitive root; properly, to hollow or arch, i.e. (figuratively) close; to shut; shut.
from גּוּף; a corpse (as closed to sense); body.

a primitive root; properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid); abide, assemble, be afraid, dwell, fear, gather (together), inhabitant, remain, sojourn, stand in awe, (be) stranger, [idiom] surely.
or (shortened) גֻּר; perhaps from גּוּר; a cub (as still abiding in the lair), especially of the lion; whelp, young one.
the same as גּוּר; Gur, a place in Palestine; Gur.
or (feminine) גֹּרָה; a variation of גּוּר; {a cub (as still abiding in the lair), especially of the lion}; whelp.
from גּוּר and בַּעַל; dwelling of Baal; Gur-Baal, a place in Arabia; Gur-baal.

or (shortened) גֹּרָל; from an unused root meaning to be rough (as stone); properly, a pebble, i.e. a lot (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a portion or destiny (as if determined by lot); lot.
or rather (by permutation) גִּישׁ; of uncertain derivation; a mass of earth; clod.
from גַּזָז; a fleece (as shorn); also mown grass; fleece, mowing, mown grass.
of foreign derivation; treasurer; treasurer.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גִּזְבָּר; {treasurer}; treasurer.
a primitive root (akin to גּוּז); to cut off, i.e. portion out; take.
feminine from גַּזָז; a fleece; fleece.
patrial from the unused name of a place apparently in Palestine; a Gizonite or inhabitant of Gizoh; Gizonite.
a primitive root (akin to גּוּז); to cut off; specifically to shear aflock or shave the hair; figuratively to destroy an enemy; cut off (down), poll, shave, (sheep-) shear(-er).
from גַּזָז; shearer; Gazez, the name of two Israelites; Gazez.
from גָּזָה; something cut, i.e. dressed stone; hewed, hewn stone, wrought.
a primitive root; to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob; catch, consume, exercise (robbery), pluck (off), rob, spoil, take away (by force, violence), tear.
from גָּזַל; robbery, or (concretely) plunder; robbery, thing taken away by violence.
from גָּזַל; plunder, i.e. violence; violence, violent perverting.. gozal. See גּוֹזָל.
feminine of גָּזֵל and mean the same; {robbery, or (concretely) plunder}; that (he had robbed) (which he took violently away), spoil, violence.
from an unused root meaning to devour; a kind of locust; palmer-worm.
from the same as גָּזָם; devourer; Gazzam, one of the Nethinim; Gazzam.
from an unused root meaning to cut down (trees); the trunk or stump of atree (as felled or as planted); stem, stock.
a primitive root; to cut down or off; (figuratively) to destroy, divide, exclude, or decide; cut down (off), decree, divide, snatch.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גָּזַר; to quarry; determine; cut out, soothsayer.
from גָּזַר; something cut off; a portion; part, piece.
the same as גֶּזֶר; Gezer, a place in Palestine; Gazer, Gezer.
feminine of גֶּזֶר; the figure or person (as if cut out); also an inclosure (as separated); polishing, separate place.
from גָּזַר; a desert (as separated); not inhabited.
(Aramaic) from גְּזַר (as גָּזַר); a decree; decree.

(in the m patrial from גֶּזֶר; a Gezerite (collectively) or inhabitants of Gezer; but better (as in the text) bytransposition גִּזְרִיxlit Girzîy corrected to Gizrîy; patrial of גְּרִזִים; a Grizite (collectively) or member of a native tribe in Palestine; Gezrites.
probably from גִּיחַlemma גּיחַ missing vowel, corrected to גִּיחַ; (compare גִּיחוֹן); the external abdomen, belly (as the source of the faetus ); belly.
or (feminine) גַּחֶלֶת; from an unused root meaning to glow or kindle; an ember; (burning) coal.
from an unused root meaning to burn; flame; Gacham, a son of Nahor; Gaham.
from an unused root meaning to hide; lurker; Gachar, one of the Nethinim; Gahar.
or (shortened) גַּי; probably (by transmutation) from the same root as גֵּוָה (abbreviated); a gorge (from its lofty sides; hence, narrow, but not a gully or winter-torrent); valley.
probably from גּוּד; a thong (as compressing); by analogy, a tendon; sinew.
lemma גּיחַ missing vowel, corrected to גִּיחַ; or (shortened) גֹּחַ; a primitive root; to gush forth (as water), generally to issue; break forth, labor to bring forth, come forth, draw up, take out.
(Aramaic) or (shortened) גּוּחַ; (Aramaic), corresponding to גִּיחַlemma גּיחַ missing vowel, corrected to גִּיחַ; to rush forth; strive.
from גִּיחַlemma גּיחַ missing vowel, corrected to גִּיחַ; a fountain; Giach, a place in Palestine; Giah.
or (shortened) גִּחוֹן; from גִּיחַlemma גּיחַ missing vowel, corrected to גִּיחַ; stream; Gichon, a river of Paradise; also a valley (or pool) near Jerusalem; Gihon.
or גֵּחֲזִי; apparently from גַּיְא and חָזָה; valley of a visionary; Gechazi, the servant of Elisha; Gehazi.
or (by permutation) גּוּל; a primitive root; properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear; be glad, joy, be joyful, rejoice.
from גִּיל; a revolution (of time, i.e. an age); also joy; [idiom] exceedingly, gladness, [idiom] greatly, joy, rejoice(-ing), sort.
or גִּילַת; feminine of גִּיל; joy; joy, rejoicing.
patrial from גִּלֹה; a Gilonite or inhabitant of Giloh; Gilonite.
of uncertain derivation; Ginath, an Israelite; Ginath.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גִּר; lime; plaster.
from the same as גּוּשׁ; lumpish; Geshan, an Israelite; Geshan.
from גָּלַל; something rolled, i.e. a heap of stone or dung (plural ruins), by analogy, a spring of water (plural waves); billow, heap, spring, wave.
from גָּלַל; a cup for oil (as round); bowl.
from an unused root meaning to shave; a barber; barber.
from גַּל and בָּעָה; fountain of ebullition; Gilboa, a mountain of Palestine; Gilboa.
by reduplication from גָּלַל; a wheel; by analogy, a whirlwind; also dust (as whirled); heaven, rolling thing, wheel.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גַּלְגַּל; a wheel; wheel.
a variation of גַּלְגַּל; {a wheel; by analogy, a whirlwind; also dust (as whirled)}; wheel.
the same as גִּלְגָּל (with the article as a properly, noun); Gilgal, the name of three places in Palestine; Gilgal. See also בֵּית הַגִּלְגָּל.
by reduplication from גָּלַל; a skull (as round); by implication, a head (in enumeration of persons); head, every man, poll, skull.
from an unused root probably meaning to polish; the (human) skin (as smooth); skin.

a primitive root; to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal; [phrase] advertise, appear, bewray, bring, (carry, lead, go) captive (into captivity), depart, disclose, discover, exile, be gone, open, [idiom] plainly, publish, remove, reveal, [idiom] shamelessly, shew, [idiom] surely, tell, uncover.

(Aramaic) or גְּלָא; (Aramaic), corresponding to גָּלָה; {to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal}; bring over, carry away, reveal.
or (fully) גִּילֹה; from גָּלָה; open; Giloh, a place in Palestine; Giloh.
feminine from גָּלַל; a fountain, bowl or globe (all as round); bowl, pommel, spring.
or (shortened) גִּלֻּל; from גָּלַל; properly, a log (as round); by implication, an idol; idol.
from גָּלַם; clothing (as wrapped); clothes.
feminine from גָּלָה; captivity; concretely, exiles (collectively); (they that are carried away) captives(-ity).
(Aramaic) corresponding to גָּלוּת; {captivity; concretely, exiles (collectively)}; captivity.
a primitive root; properly, to be bald, i.e. (causatively) to shave; figuratively to lay waste; poll, shave (off).
or גִּלְיוֹן; from גָּלָה; a tablet for writing (as bare); by analogy, a mirror (as a plate); glass, roll.
from גָּלַל; a valve of a folding door (as turning); also a ring (as round); folding, ring.
or (prolonged) גָּלִילָה; the same as גָּלִיל; a circle (with the article); Galil (as a special circuit) in the North of Palestine; Galilee.
feminine of גָּלִיל; a circuit or region; border, coast, country.
plural of גְלִילָה; circles; Geliloth, a place in Palestine; Geliloth.
plural of גַּל; springs; Gallim, a place in Palestine; Gallim.
perhaps from גָּלָה; exile; Goljath, a Philistine; Goliath.
a primitive root; to roll (literally or figuratively); commit, remove, roll (away, down, together), run down, seek occasion, trust, wallow.
from גָּלַל; dung (as in balls); dung.
from גָּלַל; a circumstance (as rolled around); only used adverbially, on account of; because of, for (sake).
from גָּלַל, in the sense of גְּלָל; great; Galal, the name of two Israelites; Galal.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to גָּלַל; weight or size (as if rolled); great.
a variation of גָּלָל; dung (plural balls of dung); dung.
from גֵּלֶל; dungy; Gilalai, an Israelite; Gilalai.
a primitive root; to fold; wrap together.
from גָּלַם; a wrapped (and unformed mass, i.e. as the embryo); substance yet being unperfect.
probably by prolonged from גָּלַם; sterile (as wrapped up too hard); figuratively, desolate; desolate, solitary.
a primitive root; to be obstinate; (inter-) meddle (with).
from גַּל and עֵד; heap of testimony; Galed, a memorial cairn East of the Jordan; Galeed.
probably from גַּלְעֵד; Gilad, a region East of the Jordan; also the name of three Israelites; Gilead, Gileadite.
patronymically from גִּלְעָד; a Giladite or descendant of Gilad; Gileadite.
a primitive root; probably to caper (as a goat); appear.

by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and; again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea.
a primitive root (literally or figuratively) to absorb; to absorb; swallow, drink.
from גָּמָא; properly, an absorbent, i.e. the bulrush (from its porosity); specifically the papyrus; (bul-) rush.
from an unused root apparently meaning to grasp; properly, a span; cubit.
from the same as גֹּמֶד; a warrior (as grasping weapons); Gammadims.
from גָּמַל; treatment, i.e. an act (of good or ill); by implication, service or requital; [phrase] as hast served, benefit, desert, deserving, that which he hath given, recompense, reward.
passive participle of גָּמַל; rewarded; Gamul, an Israelite; Gamul. See also בֵּית גָּמוּל.
feminine of גְּמוּל; meaning the same; deed, recompense, such a reward.
of uncertain derivation; Gimzo, a place in Palestine; Gimzo.

a primitive root; to treat a person (well or ill), i.e. benefit or requite; by implication (of toil), to ripen, i.e. (specifically) to wean; bestow on, deal bountifully, do (good), recompense, requite, reward, ripen, [phrase] serve, mean, yield.
apparently from גָּמַל (in the sense of labor or burden-bearing); a camel; camel.
probably from גָּמָל; cameldriver; Gemalli, an Israelite; Gemalli.
from גָּמַל and אֵל; reward of God; Gamliel, an Israelite; Gamaliel.
a primitive root; to end (in the sense of completion or failure); cease, come to an end, fail, perfect, perform.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גָּמַר; {to end (in the sense of completion or failure)}; perfect.
from גָּמַר; completion; Gomer, the name of a son of Japheth and of his descendants; also of a Hebrewess; Gomer.
or גְּמַרְיָהוּ; from גָּמַר and יָהּ; Jah has perfected; Gemarjah, the name of two Israelites; Gemariah.
from גָּנַן; a garden (as fenced); garden.
a primitive root; to thieve (literally or figuratively); by implication, to deceive; carry away, [idiom] indeed, secretly bring, steal (away), get by stealth.
from גָּנַב; a stealer; thief.
from גָּנַב; stealing, i.e. (concretely) something stolen; theft.
from גָּנַב; theft; Genubath, an Edomitish prince; Genubath.
feminine of גַּן; a garden; garden.
another form for גַּנָּה; {a garden}; garden.
from an unused root meaning to store; treasure; by implication, a coffer; chest, treasury.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גֶּנֶז; treasure; treasure.
prolonged from גֶּנֶז; a treasury; treasury.
a primitive root; to hedge about, i.e. (generally) protect; defend.
or גִּנְּתוֹ; from גָּנַן; gardener; Ginnethon or Ginnetho, an Israelite; Ginnetho, Ginnethon.
a primitive root; to bellow (as cattle); low.
feminine active participle of גָּעָה; lowing; Goah, a place near Jerusalem; Goath.
a primitive root; to detest; by implication, to reject; abhor, fail, lothe, vilely cast away.
from גָּעַל; loathing; Gaal, an Israelite; Gaal.
from גָּעַל; abhorrence; loathing.
a primitive root; to chide; corrupt, rebuke, reprove.
from גָּעַר; a chiding; rebuke(-ing), reproof.
a primitive root; to agitate violently; move, shake, toss, trouble.
from גָּעַשׁ; a quaking; Gaash, a hill in Palestine; Gaash.
of uncertain derivation; Gatam, an Edomite; Gatam.
from an unused root meaning to arch; the back; by extension the body or self; [phrase] highest places, himself.
(Aramaic) corresponding to גַּף; a wing; wing.
from an unused root meaning to bend; a vine (as twining), especially the grape; vine, tree.
from an unused root, probably meaning to house in; a kind of tree or wood (as used for building), apparently the cypress; gopher.
probably feminine of גֹּפֶר; properly, cypress-resin; by analogy, sulphur (as equally inflammable); brimstone.
perhaps from כּוּר; lime (from being burned in a kiln); chalk(-stone).
or (fully) geyr (gare); from גּוּר; properly, a guest; by implication, a foreigner; alien, sojourner, stranger.
perhaps from גֵּרָה; a grain; Gera, the name of six Israelites; Gera.
from an unused root meaning to scratch; scurf (from itching); scab, scurvy.
from the same as גָּרָב; scabby; Gareb, the name of an Israelite, also of a hill near Jerusalem; Gareb.
by reduplication from גָּרַר; a berry (as if a pellet of rumination); berry.
feminine plural from גָּרַר; the throat (as used in rumination); neck.
patrial from an unused name (of uncertain derivation); a Girgashite, one of the native tribes of Canaan; Girgashite, Girgasite.
a primitive root; to abrade; scrape.
a primitive root; properly, to grate, i.e. (figuratively) to anger; contend, meddle, stir up, strive.
from גָּרַר; the cud (as scraping the throat); cud.
from גָּרַר (as in גֵּרָה); properly, (like גַּרְגַּר) a kernel (round as if scraped), i.e.; a gerah or small weight (and coin); gerah.
or (shortened) גָּרֹן; from גָּרַר; (compare גַּרְגְּרוֹת); the throat (as roughened by swallowing); [idiom] aloud, mouth, neck, throat.
from גּוּר; a (temporary) residence; habitation.

from an unused root meaning to smooth; a threshing-floor (as made even); by analogy, any open area; (barn, corn, threshing-) floor, (threshing-, void) place.

a primitive root; to scrape off; by implication, to shave, remove, lessen, withhold; abate, clip, (di-) minish, do (take) away, keep back, restrain, make small, withdraw.

from דָבַר; a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause; act, advice, affair, answer, [idiom] any such (thing), because of, book, business, care, case, cause, certain rate, [phrase] chronicles, commandment, [idiom] commune(-ication), [phrase] concern(-ing), [phrase] confer, counsel, [phrase] dearth, decree, deed, [idiom] disease, due, duty, effect, [phrase] eloquent, errand, (evil favoured-) ness, [phrase] glory, [phrase] harm, hurt, [phrase] iniquity, [phrase] judgment, language, [phrase] lying, manner, matter, message, (no) thing, oracle, [idiom] ought, [idiom] parts, [phrase] pertaining, [phrase] please, portion, [phrase] power, promise, provision, purpose, question, rate, reason, report, request, [idiom] (as hast) said, sake, saying, sentence, [phrase] sign, [phrase] so, some (uncleanness), somewhat to say, [phrase] song, speech, [idiom] spoken, talk, task, [phrase] that, [idiom] there done, thing (concerning), thought, [phrase] thus, tidings, what(-soever), [phrase] wherewith, which, word, work.

intensive from דָבַר; a word; word.
from דָּבָר; wordy; Dibri, an Israelite; Dibri.
from דָּבָר (perhaps in the sense of דֹּבֶר); Daberath, a place in Palestine; Dabareh, Daberath.

or (fully) דָּאג; (Nehemiah 13:16), from דָּגָה; a fish (as prolific); or perhaps rather from דָּאַג (as timid); but still better from דָּאַג (in the sense of squirming, i.e. moving by the vibratory action of the tail); a fish (often used collectively); fish.

from דָּכָא; crushed (literally powder, or figuratively, contrite); contrite, destruction.

from דָּלַל; properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin; lean, needy, poor (man), weaker.

; from דָּלַק; a burning fever; inflammation.

from דָּמָה; resemblance; [idiom] like.

from יָדַע; knowledge; knowledge, opinion.
feminine of דֵּעַ; knowledge; knowledge.
from יָדַע and אֵל; known of God; Deuel, an Israelite; Deuel.
a primitive root; to be extinguished; figuratively, to expire or be dried up; be extinct, consumed, put out, quenched.
from יָדַע; knowledge; cunning, (ig-) norantly, know(-ledge), (un-) awares (wittingly).
from an unused root (meaning to push over); a stumbling-block; slanderest.
a primitive root; to knock; by analogy, to press severely; beat, knock, overdrive.
from דָּפַק; a knock; Dophkah, a place in the Desert; Dophkah.
from דָּקַק; crushed, i.e. (by implication) small or thin; dwarf, lean(-fleshed), very little thing, small, thin.
from דָּקַק; something crumbling, i.e. fine (as a thin cloth); curtain.
of foreign origin; Diklah, a region of Arabia; Diklah.

a primitive root (compare הָדַךְlemma הָדךְ missing vowel, corrected to הָדַךְ); to crush (or intransitively) crumble; beat in pieces (small), bruise, make dust, (into) [idiom] powder, (be, very) small, stamp (small).
(Aramaic) corresponding to דָּקַק; to crumble or (trans.) crush; break to pieces.
a primitive root; to stab; by analogy, to starve; figuratively, to revile; pierce, strike (thrust) through, wound.
from דָּקַר; a stab; Deker, an Israelite; Dekar.
apparently from the same as דְּרוֹר; properly, a pearl (from its sheen as rapidly turned); by analogy, pearl-stone, i.e. mother-of-pearl or alabaster; [idiom] white.
(Aramaic) corresponding to דּוֹר; an age; generation.
or דֵּרָאוֹן; from an unused root (meaning to repulse); an object of aversion; abhorring, contempt.
(also dor-bawn'); of uncertain derivation; a goad; goad.
apparently from דַּר and דֵּעַ; pearl of knowledge; Darda, an Israelite; Darda.
of uncertain derivation; a thorn; thistle.
of uncertain derivation; the south; poet. the south wind; south.
from an unused root (meaning to move rapidly); freedom; hence, spontaneity of outflow, and so clear; liberty, pure.
the same as דְּרוֹר, applied to a bird; the swift, a kind of swallow; swallow.
of Persian origin; Darejavesh, a title (rather than name) of several Persian kings; Darius.
(Aramaic) corresponding to דָּֽרְיָוֵשׁ; {Darejavesh, a title (rather than name) of several Persian kings}; Darius.
a primitive root; to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending); archer, bend, come, draw, go (over), guide, lead (forth), thresh, tread (down), walk.

from דָּרַךְ; a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb; along, away, because of, [phrase] by, conversation, custom, (east-) ward, journey, manner, passenger, through, toward, (high-) (path-) way(-side), whither(-soever).
of Persian origin; a 'drachma', or coin; dram.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זְרוֹעַ; an arm; arm.
probably a contraction from דַּרְדַּע; Dara, an Israelite; Dara.
of uncertain derivation; Darkon, one of 'Solomon's servants'; Darkon.

a primitive root; properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship; ask, [idiom] at all, care for, [idiom] diligently, inquire, make inquisition, (necro-) mancer, question, require, search, seek (for, out), [idiom] surely.
a primitive root; to sprout; bring forth, spring.
from דָּשָׁא; a sprout; by analogy, grass; (tender) grass, green, (tender) herb.

a primitive root; also denominatively (from דֶּשֶׁן); to be fat; transitively, to fatten (or regard as fat); specifically to anoint; figuratively, to satisfy;  to remove (fat) ashes (of sacrifices); accept, anoint, take away the (receive) ashes (from), make (wax) fat.
from דָּשֵׁן; fat; figuratively, rich, fertile; fat.
from דָּשֵׁן; the fat; abstractly fatness, i.e. (figuratively) abundance; specifically the (fatty) ashes of sacrifices; ashes, fatness.
of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation; a royal edict or statute; commandment, commission, decree, law, manner.
(Aramaic) corresponding to דָּת; {a royal edict or statute}; decree, law.
(Aramaic) corresponding to דֶּשֶׁא; {a sprout; by analogy, grass}; tender grass.
(Aramaic) of Persian origin; meaning one skilled in law; a judge; counsellor.
of uncertain derivation; Dathan, an Israelite; Dathan.
or (Aramaic dual) דֹּתַיִן; (Genesis 37:17), of uncertain derivation; Dothan, a place in Palestine; Dothan. h
a primitive particle; lo!; behold, lo.
(Aramaic) or הָא; (Aramaic), corresponding to הֵא; {lo!}; even, lo.
xlit heâch corrected to heʼâch; from הֵא and אָח; aha!; ah, aha, ha.
by reduplication from יָהַב; gift (in sacrifice), i.e. holocaust; offering.
a primitive root; to be vain in act, word, or expectation; specifically to lead astray; be (become, make) vain.
or (rarely in the abs.) הֲבֵל; from הָבַל; emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb; [idiom] altogether, vain, vanity.
the same as הֶבֶל; Hebel, the son of Adam; Abel.
only in plural, from an unused root meaning to be hard; ebony; ebony.
a primitive root of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation; to be a horoscopist; [phrase] (astro-) loger.
or (by permutation) הֵגַי; probably of Persian origin; Hege or Hegai, a eunuch of Xerxes; Hegai, Hege.
a primitive root (compare הָגִיג); to murmur (in pleasure or anger); by implication, to ponder; imagine, meditate, mourn, mutter, roar, [idiom] sore, speak, study, talk, utter.
a primitive root; to remove; stay, stay away.
from הָגָה; a muttering (in sighing, thought, or as thunder); mourning, sound, tale.
from הָגָה; musing; meditation.
from an unused root akin to הָגָה; properly, a murmur, i.e. complaint; meditation, musing.

intensive from הָגָה; a murmuring sound, i.e. a musical notation (probably similar to the modern affettuoso to indicate solemnity of movement); by implication, a machination; device, Higgaion, meditation, solemn sound.
of uncertain derivation; perhaps suitable or turning; directly.
of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation; Hagar, the mother of Ishmael; Hagar.
or (prolonged) הַגְרִיאxlit Hagrîʼ corrected to Hagrîyʼ; perhaps patronymically from הָגָר; a Hagrite or member of a certain Arabian clan; Hagarene, Hagarite, Haggeri.
for הֵידָד; a shout; sounding again.
(Aramaic) probably of foreign origin; a vizier; counsellor.
probably of foreign origin (compare אֲדַד); Hadad, the name of an idol, and of several kings of Edom; Hadad.
from הֲדַד and עֵזֶר; Hadad (is his) help; Hadadezer, a Syrian king; Hadadezer. Compare הֲדַרְעֶזֶר.
from הֲדַד and רִמּוֹן; Hadad-Rimmon, a place in Palestine; Hadad-rimmon.
a primitive root (compare יָדָה); to stretch forth the hand; put.
of foreign origin; Hodu (i.e. Hindustan); India.
or הֲדֹרָם; probably of foreign derivation; Hadoram, a son of Joktan, and the tribe descended from him; Hadoram.
of uncertain derivation; Hiddai, an Israelite; Hiddai.
lemma הָדךְ missing vowel, corrected to הָדַךְ; a primitive root (compare דָּקַק); to crush with the foot; tread down.
from an unused root meaning to stamp upon; a foot stool; (foot-) stool.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of הֲדֹם; something stamped to pieces, i.e. a bit; piece.
of uncertain derivation; the myrtle; myrtle (tree).
feminine of הֲדַס; Hadassah (or Esther); Hadassah.
a primitive root; to push away or down; cast away (out), drive, expel, thrust (away).
a primitive root; to swell up (literally or figuratively, active or passive); by implication, to favor or honour, be high or proud; countenance, crooked place, glorious, honour, put forth.
lemma הֲדַּר extra dagesh, corrected to הֲדַר; (Aramaic) corresponding to הָדַר; to magnify (figuratively); glorify, honour.
(Aramaic) from הֲדַרlemma הֲדַּר extra dagesh, corrected to הֲדַר; magnificence; honour, majesty.
the same as הָדָר; Hadar, an Edomite; Hadar.
from הָדַר; honour; used (figuratively) for the capital city (Jerusalem); glory.
from הָדַר; magnificence, i.e. ornament or splendor; beauty, comeliness, excellency, glorious, glory, goodly, honour, majesty.
feminine of הָדָר; decoration; beauty, honour.
from הֲדַר and עֵזֶר; Hadar (i.e. Hadad, הֲדַד) is his help; (i.e. Hadadezer, הֲדַדְעֶזֶר); Hadarezer,  a Syrian king; Hadarezer.
a shortened form of אֲהָהּ; ah! expressing grief; woe worth.
by permutation from הָהּ; oh!; alas.

of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who.

(Aramaic) or (feminine) הִיא; (Aramaic), corresponding to הוּא; {he (she or it); self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are}; [idiom] are, it, this.
or הָוָה; a primitive root (compare אָוָה, הָיָה) supposed to mean properly, to breathe; to be (in the sense of existence); be, [idiom] have.

(Aramaic) or הָוָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to הָוָא; to exist; used in a great variety of applications (especially in connection with other words); be, become, [phrase] behold, [phrase] came (to pass), [phrase] cease, [phrase] cleave, [phrase] consider, [phrase] do, [phrase] give, [phrase] have, [phrase] judge, [phrase] keep, [phrase] labour, [phrase] mingle (self), [phrase] put, [phrase] see, [phrase] seek, [phrase] set, [phrase] slay, [phrase] take heed, tremble, [phrase] walk, [phrase] would.
from an unused root; grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance); beauty, comeliness, excellency, glorious, glory, goodly, honour, majesty.
the same as הוֹד; Hod, an Israelite; Hod.
a form of הוֹדַוְיָה; Hodevah (or Hodevjah), an Israelite; Hodevah.
from הוֹד and יָהּ; majesty of Jah; Hodavjah, the name of three Israelites; Hodaviah.
a form of הוֹדַוְיָה; Hodajvah, an Israelite; Hodaiah.
a form for the feminine of יְהוּדִי; a Jewess; Hodiah.
a form of הוֹדַוְיָה; Hodijah, the name of three Israelites; Hodijah.

from הָוָא (in the sense of eagerly coveting and rushing upon; by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin; calamity, iniquity, mischief, mischievous (thing), naughtiness, naughty, noisome, perverse thing, substance, very wickedness.
another form for הַוָּה; ruin; mischief.
of uncertain derivation; Hoham, a Canaanitish king; Hoham.
a prolonged form of הוֹ (akin to אוֹי); oh!; ah, alas, ho, O, woe.
(Aramaic) corresponding to הֲלַךְ; to go; causatively, to bring; bring again, come, go (up).
feminine active participle of הָלַל; folly; madness.
from active participle of הָלַל; folly; madness.
a primitive root (compare הָמַם); to make an uproar, or agitate greatly; destroy, move, make a noise, put, ring again.
from הָמַם; raging; Homam, an Edomitish chieftain; Homam. Compare הֵימָם.
a primitive root; properly, to be naught, i.e. (figuratively) to be (causatively, act) light; be ready.
from the same as הוּן in the sense of אוֹן; wealth; by implication, enough; enough, [phrase] for nought, riches, substance, wealth.
from יְהֹוָה and שָׁמַע; Jehovah has heard; Hoshama, an Israelite; Hoshama.
from יָשַׁע; deliverer; Hoshea, the name of five Israelites; Hosea, Hoshea, Oshea.
from יָשַׁע and יָהּ; Jah has saved; Hoshajah, the name of two Israelites; Hoshaiah.
from יָתַר; he has caused to remain; Hothir, an Israelite; Hothir.
a primitive root (compare חָזָה); to dream; sleep.
for נְהִי; lamentation; woe. (For hiyr. See הוּא, הוּא.)
from an unused root (meaning to shout); acclamation; shout(-ing).
from the same as הֵידָד; properly, an acclaim, i.e. a choir of singers; thanksgiving.

a primitive root (compare הָוָא); to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary); beacon, [idiom] altogether, be(-come), accomplished, committed, like), break, cause, come (to pass), do, faint, fall, [phrase] follow, happen, [idiom] have, last, pertain, quit (one-) self, require, [idiom] use.
another form for הֹוָה; ruin; calamity.
another form for אֵיךְ; how?; how.
probably from יָכֹל (in the sense of capacity); a large public building, such as a palace or temple; palace, temple.
(Aramaic) corresponding to הֵיכָל; {a large public building, such as a palace or temple}; palace, temple.
from הָלַל (in the sense of brightness); the morning-star; lucifer.
another form for הוֹמָם; Hemam, an Idumaean; Hemam.
probably from אָמַן; faithful; Heman, the name of at least two Israelites; Heman.
probably of Egyptian origin; a hin or liquid measure; hin.
a primitive root; apparently; to injure; make self strange.
from נָכַר; respect, i.e. partiality; shew.
probably denominatively from הָלְאָהxlit hâlᵉâh corrected to hâlᵉʼâh; to remove or be remote; cast far off.

xlit hâlᵉâh corrected to hâlᵉʼâh; from the primitive form of the article (hal); to the distance, i.e. far away; also (of time) thus far; back, beyond, (hence,-) forward, hitherto, thence, forth, yonder.
from הָלַל (in the sense of rejoicing); a celebration of thanksgiving for harvest; merry, praise.
from הַלָּזֶה; this or that; side, that, this.
from the article (see הָלְאָהxlit hâlᵉâh corrected to hâlᵉʼâh) and זֶה; this very; this.
another form of הַלָּזֶה; that; this.
from הָלַךְ; a walk, i.e. (by implication) a step; step.
feminine of הָלִיךְ; a walking; by implication, a procession or march, a caravan; company, going, walk, way.

akin to יָלַךְ; a primitive root; to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively); (all) along, apace, behave (self), come, (on) continually, be conversant, depart, [phrase] be eased, enter, exercise (self), [phrase] follow, forth, forward, get, go (about, abroad, along, away, forward, on, out, up and down), [phrase] greater, grow, be wont to haunt, lead, march, [idiom] more and more, move (self), needs, on, pass (away), be at the point, quite, run (along), [phrase] send, speedily, spread, still, surely, [phrase] tale-bearer, [phrase] travel(-ler), walk (abroad, on, to and fro, up and down, to places), wander, wax, (way-) faring man, [idiom] be weak, whirl.
(Aramaic) corresponding to הָלַךְ (compare הוּךְ); to walk; walk.
from הָלַךְ; properly, a journey, i.e. (by implication) a wayfarer; also a flowing; [idiom] dropped, traveller.
(Aramaic) from הֲלַךְ; properly, a journey, i.e. (by implication) toll on goods at aroad; custom.

a primitive root; to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify; (make) boast (self), celebrate, commend, (deal, make), fool(-ish, -ly), glory, give (light), be (make, feign self) mad (against), give in marriage, (sing, be worthy of) praise, rage, renowned, shine.
from הָלַל; praising (namely God); Hillel, an Israelite; Hillel.
a primitive root; to strike down; by implication, to hammer, stamp, conquer, disband; beat (down), break (down), overcome, smite (with the hammer).
from הָלַם; smiter; Helem, the name of two Israelites; Helem.
from the article (see הָלְאָהxlit hâlᵉâh corrected to hâlᵉʼâh); hither; here, hither(-(to)), thither.
from הָלַם; a hammer (or mallet); hammer.
of uncertain derivation; Ham, a region of Palestine; Ham.
from הָמָה; abundance, i.e. wealth; any of theirs.

or (prolonged) הֵמָּה; masculine plural from הֲלַךְ; they (only used when emphatic); it, like, [idiom] (how, so) many (soever, more as) they (be), (the) same, [idiom] so, [idiom] such, their, them, these, they, those, which, who, whom, withal, ye.
