a primitive root (compare הוּם); to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor; clamorous, concourse, cry aloud, be disquieted, loud, mourn, be moved, make a noise, rage, roar, sound, be troubled, make in tumult, tumultuous, be in an uproar.
(Aramaic) or (prolonged) הִמּוֹן; (Aramaic), corresponding to הֵם; they; [idiom] are, them, those.
or הָמֹן; (Ezekiel 5:7), from הָמָה; a noise, tumult, crowd; also disquietude, wealth; abundance, company, many, multitude, multiply, noise, riches, rumbling, sounding, store, tumult.
from הָמוֹן and גּוֹג; the multitude of Gog; the fanciful name of an emblematic place in Palestine; Hamogog.
feminine of הָמוֹן; multitude; , the same as הֲמוֹן גּוֹג; Hamonah; Hamonah.
from הָמָה; sound; noise.
or (too fully) הֲמוּלָּה; (Jeremiah 11:16), feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to rush (as rain with a windy roar); a sound; speech, tumult.
a primitive root (compare הוּם, הָמָה); properly, to put in commotion; by implication, to disturb, drive, destroy; break, consume, crush, destroy, discomfit, trouble, vex.
of foreign derivation; Haman, a Persian vizier; Haman.
(Aramaic) but the text is הֲמוּנֵךְ; of foreign origin; a necklace; chain.
from an unused root apparently meaning to crackle; a dry twig or brushwood; melting.
feminine plural from הוּא; they (only used when emphatic); [idiom] in, such like, (with) them, thereby, therein, (more than) they, wherein, in which, whom, withal.
a primitive particle; lo!; also (as expressing surprise) if; behold, if, lo, though.
(Aramaic) corresponding to הֵן; lo! also there(-fore), (un-) less, whether, but, if; (that) if, or, whether.

prolongation for הֵן; themselves (often used emphatic for the copula, also in indirect relation); [idiom] in, [idiom] such (and such things), their, (into) them, thence, therein, these, they (had), on this side, whose, wherein.
from הֵן; hither or thither (but used both of place and time); here, hither(-to), now, on this (that) side, [phrase] since, this (that) way, thitherward, [phrase] thus far, to...fro, [phrase] yet.
prolongation for הֵן; lo!; behold, lo, see.
from נוּחַ; permission of rest, i.e. quiet; release.
probably of foreign origin; Hinnom, apparently a Jebusite; Hinnom.
probably of foreign derivation; Hena, a place apparently in Mesopotamia; Hena.
a primitive root; to hush; hold peace (tongue), (keep) silence, be silent, still.
from פּוּג; relaxation; intermission.

a primitive root; to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert; [idiom] become, change, come, be converted, give, make (a bed), overthrow (-turn), perverse, retire, tumble, turn (again, aside, back, to the contrary, every way).
; or הֵפֶךְ; from הָפַךְ; a turn, i.e. the reverse; contrary.
from הָפַךְ; an upset, i.e. (abstract) perversity; turning of things upside down.
feminine of הֶפֶךְ; destruction; overthrow.
by reduplication from הָפַךְ; very perverse; froward.
from נָצַל; rescue; deliverance.
from an unused root meaning apparently to be sharp or strong; a weapon of war; chariot.
a shortened form of הָרָר; a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively); hill (country), mount(-ain), [idiom] promotion.
another form of הַר; mountain; Hor, the name of a peak in Idumaea and of one in Syria; Hor.
perhaps from הַר; mountainousness; Hara, a region of Media; Hara.
from הַר and אֵל; mount of God; figuratively, the altar of burnt-offering; altar. Compare אֲרִיאֵל.
a primitive root; to smite with deadly intent; destroy, out of hand, kill, murder(-er), put to (death), make (slaughter), slay(-er), [idiom] surely.
from הָרַג; slaughter; be slain, slaughter.
feminine of הֶרֶג; slaughter; slaughter.
a primitive root; to be (or become) pregnant, conceive (literally or figuratively); been, be with child, conceive, progenitor.
or הָרִי; (Hosea 14:1), from הָרָה; pregnant; (be, woman) with child, conceive, [idiom] great.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to הָרָה; a mental conception; thought.
or הֵרָיוֹן; from הָרָה; pregnancy; conception.
another form for הֲרָרִי; a Harorite or mountaineer; Harorite.
from הָרַס; something demolished; ruin.
from הָרַס; demolition; destruction.
from an unused root (meaning to tower up); high; Horam, a Canaanitish king; Horam.
passive participle of the same as הֹרָם; high; Harum, an Israelite; Harum.
from the same as הֹרָם; a castle (from its height); palace.
perhaps from הַר; mountaineer; Haran, the name of two men; Haran.
a primitive root; to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy; beat down, break (down, through), destroy, overthrow, pluck down, pull down, ruin, throw down, [idiom] utterly.
from הָרַס; demolition; destruction.
from an unused root meaning to loom up; a mountain; hill, mount(-ain).
or הָרָרִי; (2 Samuel 23:11), or הָארָרִי; (2 Samuel 23:34, last clause [), apparently from הָרָר; a mountaineer; {Hararite}; Hararite.
perhaps from the same as חָשֻׁם; wealthy; Hashem, an Israelite; Hashem.
from שָׁמַע; announcement; to cause to hear.
from נָתַךְ; a melting; is melted.
probably of foreign origin; Hathak, a Persian eunuch; Hatach.
a primitive root; to deride; by implication, to cheat; deal deceitfully, deceive, mock.
from הָתַל (only in plural collectively); a derision; mocker.
xlit hâthathʼ corrected to hâthath; a primitive root; properly, to break in upon, i.e. to assail; imagine mischief. w
perhaps for עֵדֶן; Vedan (or Aden), a place in Arabia; Dan also.
of uncertain derivation; Vaheb, a place in Moab; what he did.
probably; a hook (the name of the sixth Hebrew letter); hook.
presumed to be from an unused root meaning to bear guilt; crime; [idiom] strange.
of foreign origin; Vajezatha, a son of Haman; Vajezatha.
for יֶלֶד; a boy; child.
perhaps for עֲנָיָה; Vanjah, an Israelite; Vaniah.
probably from יָסַף; additional; Vophsi, an Israelite; Vophsi.
probably from יִשְׁמְרַי; weak; Vashni, an Israelite; Vashni.
of Persian origin; Vashti, the queen of Xerxes; Vashti. z
from an unused root meaning to be yellow; a wolf; wolf.
the same as זְאֵב; Zeeb, a Midianitish prince; Zeeb.
irregular feminine of זֶה; this (often used adverb); hereby (-in, -with), it, likewise, the one (other, same), she, so (much), such (deed), that, therefore, these, this (thing), thus.
a primitive root; to confer; endure.
from זָבַד; a gift; dowry.
from זָבַד; giver; Zabad, the name of seven Israelites; Zabad.
from זֶבֶד; giving; Zabdi, the name of four Israelites; Zabdi.
from זֶבֶד and אֵל; gift of God; zabdiel, the name of two Israelites; Zabdiel.
or זְבַדְיָהוּ; from זָבַד and יָהּ; Jah has given; Zebadjah, the name of nine Israelites; Zebadiah.
from an unused root (meaning to flit); a fly (especially one of a stinging nature); fly.
from זָבַד; given, Zabud, an Israelite; Zabud.
a form of זָבוּד; given; Zabbud, an Israelite; Zabbud.
or זְבֻל; from זָבַל; a residence; dwell in, dwelling, habitation.
or זְבֻלוּן; or זְבוּלֻן; from זָבַל; habitation; Zebulon, a son of Jacob; also his territory and tribe; Zebulun.
patronymically from זְבוּלוּן; a Zebulonite or descendant of Zebulun; Zebulonite.
a primitive root; to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice); kill, offer, (do) sacrifice, slay.
from זָבַח; properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act); offer(-ing), sacrifice.
the same as זֶבַח; sacrifice; Zebach, a Midianitish prince; Zebah.
probably by orthographical error for זַכַּי; Zabbai (or Zaccai), an Israelite; Zabbai.
feminine from זָבַד; giving; Zebidah, an Israelitess; Zebudah.
from an unused root (meaning to purchase); gainfulness; Zebina, an Israelite; Zebina.
a primitive root; apparently properly, to inclose, i.e.; to reside; dwell with.
the same as זְבוּל; dwelling; Zebul, an Israelite; Zebul. Compare זְבוּל.
(Aramaic) corresponding to the root of זְבִינָא; to acquire by purchase; gain.
from an unused root probably meaning to inclose; the skin of a grape; husk.
from זוּד; arrogant; presumptuous, proud.
from זוּד; arrogance; presumptuously, pride, proud (man).

a primitive word; the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that; he, [idiom] hence, [idiom] here, it(-self), [idiom] now, [idiom] of him, the one...the other, [idiom] than the other, ([idiom] out of) the (self) same, such (a one) that, these, this (hath, man), on this side...on that side, [idiom] thus, very, which. Compare זֹאת, זֹה, זוֹ, זוּ.
(1 Samuel by permutation for שֶׂה; a sheep; lamb.
for זֶה; this or that; as well as another, it, this, that, thus and thus.
from an unused root meaning to shimmer; gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky; gold(-en), fair weather.
a primitive root; to be rancid, i.e. (transitively) to loathe; abhor.
from זָהַם; loathing; Zaham, an Israelite; Zaham.
a primitive root; to gleam; figuratively, to enlighten (by caution); admonish, shine, teach, (give) warn(-ing).
(Aramaic) corresponding to זָהַר; (passively) be admonished; take heed.
from זָהַר; brilliancy; brightness.
for זֶה; this or that; that, this.
for זֶה; this or that; that, this, [idiom] wherein, which, whom.
probably from an unused root meaning to be prominent; properly, brightness (compare זִיו), i.e. (figuratively) the month of flowers; Ziv (corresponding to Ijar or May); Zif.
a primitive root; to flow freely (as water), i.e. (specifically) to have a (sexual) flux; figuratively, to waste away; also to overflow; flow, gush out, have a (running) issue, pine away, run.
from זוּב; a seminal or menstrual flux; issue.
or (by permutation) זִיד; a primitive root; to seethe; figuratively, to be insolent; be proud, deal proudly, presume, (come) presumptuously, sod.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זוּד; to be proud; in pride.
plural probably from the same as זִיז; prominent; Zuzites, an aboriginal tribe of Palestine; Zuzims.
of uncertain origin; Zocheth, an Israelite; Zoheth.
apparently from the same root as זִו (in the sense of prominence); an angle (as projecting), i.e. (by implication) a corner-column (or anta); corner(stone).
a primitive root (compare זָלַל); probably to shake out, i.e. (by implication) to scatter profusely; figuratively, to treat lightly; lavish, despise.
from זוּל; probably scattering, i.e. removal; used adverbially, except; beside, but, only, save.
a primitive root; perhaps properly, to be plump, i.e. (transitively) to nourish; feed.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זוּן; {perhaps properly, to be plump, i.e. (transitively) to nourish}; feed.
a primitive root; properly, to shake off, i.e. (figuratively) to agitate (as with fear); move, tremble, vex.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זוּעַ; to shake (with fear); tremble.
from זוּעַ; agitation, fear; be removed, trouble, vexation. Compare זַעֲוָה.

a primitive root; to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery; (come from) another (man, place), fanner, go away, (e-) strange(-r, thing, woman).
a primitive root (compare צוֹק); to press together, tighten; close, rush, thrust together.
from זוּר; trodden on; that which is crushed.
probably from the root of זִיז; prominent; Zaza, an Israelite; Zaza.
a primitive root; to shove or displace; loose.
a primitive root; to crawl; by implication, to fear; be afraid, serpent, worm.
feminine active participle of זָחַל; crawling (i.e. serpent); Zocheleth, a boundary stone in. Palestine; Zoheleth.
from זוּד; boiling of water, i.e. wave; proud.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זִו; (figuratively) cheerfulness; brightness, countenance.
from an unused root apparently meaning to be conspicuous; fulness of the breast; also a moving creature; abundance, wild beast.
apparently from the same as זִיז; prominence; Ziza, the name of two Israelites; Ziza.
another form for זִיזָא; Zizah, an Israelite; Zizah.
from זוּן; well-fed; or perhaps an orthographical error for זִיזָא; Zina, an Israelite; Zina.
from זוּעַ; agitation; Zia, an Israelite; Zia.
from the same as זֶפֶת; flowing; Ziph, the name of a place in Palestine; also of an Israelite; Ziph.
feminine of זִיף; a flowing; Ziphah, an Israelite; Ziphah.
patrial from זִיף; a Ziphite or inhabitant of Ziph; Ziphim, Ziphite.

(Isaiah 50: (feminine); and זִק; or זֵק; from זָנַק; properly, what leaps forth, i.e. flash of fire, or a burning arrow; also (from the original sense of the root) a bond; chain, fetter, firebrand, spark.
probably from an unused root (akin to זִו); an olive (as yielding illuminating oil), the tree, the branch or the berry; olive (tree, -yard), Olivet.
from זַיִת; olive grove; Zethan, an Israelite; Zethan.
from זָכַךְ; clear; clean, pure.
a primitive root (compare זָכַךְ); to be translucent; figuratively, to be innocent; be (make) clean, cleanse, be clear, count pure.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to זָכָה; purity; innocency.
from זָכָה; properly, transparency, i.e. glass; crystal.
properly, passive participle of זָכַר, but used for זָכָר; a male (of man or animals); males, men-children.
from זָכַר; mindful; Zakkur, the name of seven Israelites; Zaccur, Zacchur.
from זָכַךְ; pure; Zakkai, an Israelite; Zaccai.
a primitive root (compare זָכָה); to be transparent or clean (phys. or morally); be (make) clean, be pure(-r).

a primitive root; also as denominative from זָכָר; properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male; [idiom] burn (incense), [idiom] earnestly, be male, (make) mention (of), be mindful, recount, record(-er), remember, make to be remembered, bring (call, come, keep, put) to (in) remembrance, [idiom] still, think on, [idiom] well.
or זֶכֶר; from זָכַר; a memento, abstractly recollection (rarely if ever); by implication, commemoration; memorial, memory, remembrance, scent.
the same as זֵכֶר; Zeker, an Israelite; Zeker.
from זָכַר; properly, remembered, i.e. a male (of man or animals, as being the most noteworthy sex); [idiom] him, male, man(child, -kind).
from זָכַר; a memento (or memorable thing, day or writing); memorial, record.
from זָכַר; memorable; Zicri, the name of twelve Israelites; Zichri.
or זְכַרְיָהוּ; from זָכַר and יָהּ; Jah has remembered; Zecarjah, the name of twenty-nine Israelites; Zachariah, Zechariah.
from זָלַל; properly, a shaking, i.e. perhaps a tempest; vilest.
by reduplication from זָלַל; tremulous, i.e. a twig; sprig.
a primitive root (compare זוּל); to shake (as in the wind), i.e. to quake; figuratively, to be loose morally, worthless or prodigal; blow down, glutton, riotous (eater), vile.
or זִלְעָפָהxlit zilʻâphâph corrected to zilʻâphâh; from זָעַף; a glow (of wind or anger); also a famine (as consuming); horrible, horror, terrible.
; from an unused root apparently meaning to trickle, as myrrh; fragrant dropping; Zilpah, Leah's maid; Zilpah.
or זַמָּה; from זָמַם; a plan, especially a bad one; heinous crime, lewd(-ly, -ness), mischief, purpose, thought, wicked (device, mind, -ness).
the same as זִמָּה; Zimmah, the name of two Israelites; Zimmah.
or זְמֹרָה (feminine); and זְמֹר (masculine); from זָמַר; a twig (as pruned); vine, branch, slip.
from זָמַם; intriguing; a Zamzumite, or native tribe of Palestine; Zamzummim.
or זָמִר; and (feminine) זְמִרָה; from זָמַר; a song to be accompanied with instrumental music; psalm(-ist), singing, song.
from זָמַר; a twig (as pruned); branch.
feminine of זָמִיר; song; Zemirah, an Israelite; Zemira.
a primitive root; to plan, usually in a bad sense; consider, devise, imagine, plot, purpose, think (evil).
from זָמַם; a plot; wicked device.
a primitive root; to fix (a time); appoint.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זָמַן; to agree (on a time and place); prepare.
from זָמַן; an appointed occasion; season, time.
(Aramaic) from זְמָן; the same as זְמָן; {an appointed occasion}; season, time.

a primitive root (perhaps identical with זָמַר through the idea of striking with the fingers); properly, to touch the strings or parts of a musical instrument, i.e.; play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music; give praise, sing forth praises, psalms.
a primitive root (compare זָמַר, סָמַר, צֶמֶר); to trim (a vine); prune.
apparently from זָמַר or זָמַר; a gazelle (from its lightly touching the ground); chamois.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to זָמַר; instrumental music; musick.
(Aramaic) from the same as זְמָר; an instrumental musician; singer.
from זָמַר; a musical piece or song to be accompanied by an instrument; melody, psalm.
from זָמַר; pruned (i.e. choice) fruit; best fruit.
from זָמַר; musical; Zimri, the name of five Israelites, and of an Arabian tribe; Zimri.
from זָמַר; musical; Zimran, a son of Abraham by Keturah; Zimran.
from זָמַר; instrumental music; by implication, praise; song.
from זוּן; properly, nourished (or fully developed), i.e. a form or sort; divers kinds, [idiom] all manner of store.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זַן; sort; kind.
a primitive root meaning to wag; used only as a denominative from זָנָב; to curtail, i.e. cut off the rear; smite the hindmost.
from זָנַב (in the original sense of flapping); the tail (literally or figuratively); tail.

a primitive root (highly-fed and therefore wanton); to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah); (cause to) commit fornication, [idiom] continually, [idiom] great, (be an, play the) harlot, (cause to be, play the) whore, (commit, fall to) whoredom, (cause to) go a-whoring, whorish.
from זָנַח; rejected; Zanoach, the name of two places in Palestine; Zanoah.
from זָנָה; adultery; figuratively, idolatry; whoredom.
from זָנָה; adultery, i.e. (figuratively) infidelity, idolatry; whoredom.
regarded by some as if from זוּן or an unused root, and applied to military equipments; but evidently the feminine plural active participle of זָנָה; harlots; armour.
a primitive root meaning to push aside, i.e.; reject, forsake, fail; cast away (off), remove far away (off).
a primitive root; properly, to draw together the feet (as an animal about to dart upon its prey), i.e. to spring forward; leap.
from זוּעַ (in the sense of יֶזַע); perspiration; sweat.
by transposition for זְוָעָה; agitation, maltreatment; [idiom] removed, trouble.
from זוּעַ; disquiet; Zaavan, an Idumaean; Zaavan.
xlit zeʻêyr corrected to zᵉʻêyr; from an unused root (akin (by permutation) to צָעַר), meaning to dwindle; small; little.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זְעֵירxlit zeʻêyr corrected to zᵉʻêyr; {small}; little.
a primitive root; to extinguish; be extinct.
a primitive root; properly, to foam at the mouth, i.e. to be enraged; abhor, abominable, (be) angry, defy, (have) indignation.
from זָעַם; strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin); angry, indignation, rage.
a primitive root; properly, to boil up, i.e. (figuratively) to be peevish or angry; fret, sad, worse liking, be wroth.
from זָעַף; anger; indignation, rage(-ing), wrath.
from זָעַף; angry; displeased.

a primitive root; to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly; assemble, call (together), (make a) cry (out), come with such a company, gather (together), cause to be proclaimed.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זָעַק; to make an outcry; cry.
and (feminine) זְעָקָהxlit zᵉâqâh corrected to zᵉʻâqâh; from זָעַק; a shriek or outcry; cry(-ing).
from an unused root (meaning to be fragrant); Ziphron, a place in Palestine; Ziphron.
from an unused root (meaning to liquify); asphalt (from its tendency to soften in the sun); pitch.
a primitive root; to be old; aged man, be (wax) old (man).
from זָקֵן; old; aged, ancient (man), elder(-est), old (man, men and...women), senator.
from זָקֵן; the beard (as indicating age); beard.
from זָקֵן; old age; age.
lemma זָקֻ missing final nun, corrected to זָקֻן; properly, passive participle of זָקֵן (used only in the plural as a noun); old age; old age.
feminine of זָקֵן; old age; old (age).
a primitive root; to life, i.e. (figuratively) comfort; raise (up).
(Aramaic) corresponding to זָקַף; to hang, i.e. impale; set up.
a primitive root; to strain, (figuratively) extract, clarify; fine, pour down, purge, purify, refine.
from זָרַר (in the sense of scattering); a chaplet (as spread around the top), i.e. (specifically) a border moulding; crown.
from זוּר (in the sense of estrangement) (compare זָרָה); disgust; loathsome.
a primitive root; to flow away; wax warm.
from זָרַב and בָּבֶל; descended of (i.e. from) Babylon, i.e. born there; Zerubbabel, an Israelite; Zerubbabel.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זְרֻבָּבֶל; {Zerubbabel, an Israelite}; Zerubbabel.
from an unused root meaning to be exuberant in growth; lined with shrubbery; Zered, a brook East of the Dead Sea; Zared, Zered.
a primitive root (compare זוּר); to toss about; by implication, to diffuse, winnow; cast away, compass, disperse, fan, scatter (away), spread, strew, winnow.

or (shortened) זְרֹעַ; and (feminine) זְרוֹעָה; or זְרֹעָה; from זָרַע; the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force; arm, [phrase] help, mighty, power, shoulder, strength.
from זָרַע; something sown, i.e. a plant; sowing, thing that is sown.
by reduplication from an unused root meaning to flow; a pouring rain; water.
by reduplication from זוּר; properly, tightly girt, i.e. probably a racer, or some fleet animal (as being slender in the waist); [phrase] greyhound.
a primitive root; properly, to irradiate (or shoot forth beams), i.e. to rise (as the sun); specifically, to appear (as a symptom of leprosy); arise, rise (up), as soon as it is up.
from זָרַח; a rising of light; rising.
the same as זֶרַח; Zerach, the name of three Israelites, also of an Idumaean and an Ethiopian prince; Zarah, Zerah.
patronymically from זֶרַח; a Zarchite or descendant of Zerach; Zarchite.
from זֶרַח and יָהּ; Jah has risen; Zerachjah, the name of two Israelites; Zerahiah.
a primitive root; to gush (as water); carry away as with a flood, pour out.
from זָרַם; a gush of water; flood, overflowing, shower, storm, tempest.
feminine of זֶרֶם; a gushing of fluid (semen); issue.
a primitive root; to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify; bear, conceive seed, set with sow(-er), yield.
from זָרַע; seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity; [idiom] carnally, child, fruitful, seed(-time), sowing-time.
(Aramaic) corresponding to זֶרַע; posterity; seed.
or זֵרָעֹן; from זָרַע; something sown (only in the plural), i.e. a vegetable (as food); pulse.
a primitive root; to sprinkle (fluid or solid particles); be here and there, scatter, sprinkle, strew.
a primitive root (compare זוּר); perhaps to diffuse, i.e. (specifically) to sneeze; sneeze.
of Persian origin; Zeresh, Haman's wife; Zeresh.
from זָרָה; the spread of the fingers, i.e. a span; span.
of uncertain derivation; Zattu, an Israelite; Zattu.
apparently a variation for זֵיתָן; Zetham, an Israelite; Zetham.
of Persian origin; Zethar, a eunuch of Xerxes; Zethar. j
by contraction from חָבַב; properly, a cherisher, i.e. the bosom; bosom.
a primitive root (compare חָבַב); to secrete; [idiom] held, hide (self), do secretly.
a primitive root (compare חָבָא, חָבָה); properly, to hide (as in the bosom), i.e. to cherish (with affection); love.
from חָבַב; cherished; Chobab, father-in-law of Moses; Hobab.
a primitive root (compare חָבַב); to secrete; hide (self).
(Aramaic) from חֲבַל; properly, overthrown, i.e. (morally) crime; hurt.
from חָבַר; united; Chabor, a river of Assyria; Habor.
or חַבֻּרָה; or חֲבֻרָה; from חָבַר; properly, bound (with stripes), i.e. a weal (or black-and-blue mark itself); blueness, bruise, hurt, stripe, wound.
a primitive root; to knock out or off; beat (off, out), thresh.
or חֲבָיָהlemma חֲבָיה missing vowel, corrected to חֲבָיָה; from חָבָה and יָהּ; Jah has hidden; Chabajah, an Israelite; Habaiah.
from חָבָה; a concealment; hiding.

a primitive root; to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition); [idiom] at all, band, bring forth, (deal) corrupt(-ly), destroy, offend, lay to (take a) pledge, spoil, travail, [idiom] very, withhold.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חָבַל; to ruin; destroy, hurt.

or חֵבֶל; from חָבַל; a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin; band, coast, company, cord, country, destruction, line, lot, pain, pang, portion, region, rope, snare, sorrow, tackling.
(Aramaic) from חֲבַל; harm (personal or pecuniary); damage, hurt.
or (feminine) חֲבֹלָה; from חָבַל; a pawn (as security for debt); pledge.
active participle from חָבַל (in the sense of handling ropes); a sailor; pilot, shipmaster.
from חָבַל (in the sense of furnished with ropes); a mast; mast.
of uncertain derivation; probably meadow-saffron; rose.
of uncertain derivation; Chabatstsanjah, a Rechabite; Habazaniah.
a primitive root; to clasp (the hands or in embrace); embrace, fold.
from חָבַק; a clasping of the hands (in idleness); fold.
by reduplication from חָבַק; embrace; Chabakkuk, the prophet; Habakkuk.

a primitive root; to join (literally or figuratively); specifically (by means of spells) to fascinate; charm(-er), be compact, couple (together), have fellowship with, heap up, join (self, together), league.
from חָבַר; a society; also a spell; [phrase] charmer(-ing), company, enchantment, [idiom] wide.
the same as חֶבֶר; community; Cheber, the name of a Kenite and of three Israelites; Heber.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to חָבַר; an associate; companion, fellow.
from חָבַר; an associate; companion, fellow, knit together.
from חָבַר; a partner; companion.
by reduplication from חָבַר; a streak (like a line), as on the tiger; spot.
(Aramaic) feminine of חֲבַר; an associate; other.
feminine of חֶבֶר; association; company.
from חֶבֶר; seat of association; Chebron, a place in Palestine, also the name of two Israelites; Hebron.
or חֶבְרֹנִי; patronymically from חֶבְרוֹן; Chebronite (collectively), an inhabitant of Chebron; Hebronites.
patronymically from חֶבֶר; a Chebrite (collectively) or descendants of Cheber; Heberites.
feminine of חָבֵר; a consort; companion.
feminine active participle of חָבַר; a joint; which coupleth, coupling.
a primitive root; to wrap firmly (especially a turban, compress, or saddle); figuratively, to stop, to rule; bind (up), gird about, govern, healer, put, saddle, wrap about.
from an unused root probably meaning to cook (compare מַחֲבַת); something fried, probably a griddle-cake; pan.
or חָג; from חָגַג; a festival, or a victim therefor; (solemn) feast (day), sacrifice, solemnity.
from an unused root meaning to revolve (compare חָגַג); properly, vertigo, i.e. (figuratively) fear; terror.
of uncertain derivation; a locust; locust.
the same as חָגָב; locust; Chagab, one of the Nethinim; Hagab.
or חֲגָבָה; feminine of חָגָב; locust; Chagaba or Chagabah, one of the Nethinim; Hagaba, Hagabah.

a primitive root (compare חָגָא, חוּג); properly, to move in acircle, i.e. (specifically) to march in asacred procession, to observe afestival; by implication, to be giddy; celebrate, dance, (keep, hold) a (solemn) feast (holiday), reel to and fro.
from an unused root meaning to take refuge; a rift in rocks; cleft.
from חָגַר; belted; girded with.
or חֲגֹר; and (feminine) חֲגוֹרָה; or חֲגֹרָה; from חָגַר; a belt (for the waist); apron, armour, gird(-le).
from חָגַג; festive; Chaggi, an Israelite; also (patronymically) a Chaggite, or descendant of the same; Haggi, Haggites.
from חַג; festive; Chaggai, a Hebrew prophet; Haggai.
from חַג and יָהּ; festival of Jah; Chaggijah, an Israelite; Haggiah.
xlit Chaggiyîth corrected to Chaggîyth; feminine of חַגִּי; festive; Chaggith, a wife of David; Haggith.
of uncertain derivation; probably a partridge; Choglah, an Israelitess; Hoglah. See also בֵּית חׇגְלָה.
a primitive root; to gird on (as a belt, armor, etc.); be able to put on, be afraid, appointed, gird, restrain, [idiom] on every side.
abridged from אֶחָד; one; one.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חַד; as card. one; as article single; as an ordinal, first; adverbially, at once; a, first, one, together.
from חָדַד; sharp; sharp.
a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) sharp or (figuratively) severe; be fierce, sharpen.
from חָדַד; fierce; Chadad, an Ishmaelite; Hadad.
a primitive root; to rejoice; make glad, be joined, rejoice.
from חָדַד; a point; sharp.
from חָדָה; rejoicing; gladness, joy.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חֶדְוָה; {rejoicing}; joy.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חָזֶה; a breast; breast.
from חָדַד; a peak; Chadid, a place in Palestine; Hadid.
a primitive root; properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle; cease, end, fall, forbear, forsake, leave (off), let alone, rest, be unoccupied, want.
from חָדַל; rest, i.e. the state of the dead; world.
from חָדַל; vacant, i.e. ceasing or destitute; he that forbeareth, frail, rejected.
from חֶדֶל; idle; Chadlai, an Israelite; Hadlai.
from an unused root meaning to sting; a prickly plant; brier, thorn.
probably of foreign origin; the Chiddekel (or Tigris) river; Hiddekel.
a primitive root; properly, to inclose (as a room), i.e. (by analogy,) to beset (as in a siege); enter a privy chamber.
from חָדַר; an apartment (usually literal); ((bed) inner) chamber, innermost(-ward) part, parlour, [phrase] south, [idiom] within.
another form for חֶדֶר; chamber; Chadar, an Ishmaelite; Hadar.
of uncertain derivation; Chadrak, a Syrian deity; Hadrach.
a primitive root; to be new; causatively, to rebuild; renew, repair.
from חָדַשׁ; new; fresh, new thing.
from חָדַשׁ; the new moon; by implication, a month; month(-ly), new moon.
the same as חֹדֶשׁ; Chodesh, an Israelitess; Hodesh.
feminine of חָדָשׁ; new; Chadashah, a place in Palestine; Hadashah.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חָדָשׁ; new; new.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חָוָה; to show; shew.
also חָיַב; a primitive root; properly, perhaps to tie, i.e. (figuratively and reflexively) to owe, or (by implication) to forfeit; make endanger.
from חוּב; debt; debtor.
feminine active participle of חָבָה; hiding place; Chobah, a place in Syria; Hobah.
a primitive root (compare חָגַג); to describe a circle; compass.
from חוּג; a circle; circle, circuit, compass.
a primitive root; properly, to tie a knot, i.e. (figuratively) to propound a riddle; put forth.
a primitive root; (compare חֲוָא, חָיָה); properly, to live; by implication (intensively) to declare or show; show.
causatively from חָוָה; life-giver; Chavvah (or Eve), the first woman; Eve.
properly, the same as חַוָּה (lifegiving, i.e. living-place); by implication, an encampment or village; (small) town.
from the plural of חַוָּה and a modification of יָעוּר; hamlets of Jair, a region of Palestine; (Bashan-) Havoth-jair.
from חֹזֶה; visionary; Chozai, an Israelite; the seers.
from an unused root apparently meaning to pierce; a thorn; by analogy, a ring forthe nose; bramble, thistle, thorn.
perhaps the same as חוֹחַ; a dell or crevice (as if pierced in the earth); thicket.
(Aramaic) corresponding to the root of חוּט, perhaps as a denominative; to string together, i.e. (figuratively) to repair; join.
from an unused root probably meaning to sew; a string; by implication, a measuring tape; cord, fillet, line, thread.
perhaps from חַוָּה; a villager; a Chivvite, one of the aboriginal tribes of Palestine; Hivite.
probably from חוּל; circular; Chavilah, the name of two or three eastern regions; also perhaps of two men; Havilah.

or חִיל; a primitive root; properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert; bear, (make to) bring forth, (make to) calve, dance, drive away, fall grievously (with pain), fear, form, great, grieve, (be) grievous, hope, look, make, be in pain, be much (sore) pained, rest, shake, shapen, (be) sorrow(-ful), stay, tarry, travail (with pain), tremble, trust, wait carefully (patiently), be wounded.
from חוּל; a circle; Chul, a son of Aram; also the region settled by him; Hul.
from חוּל; sand (as round or whirling particles); sand.
from an unused root meaning to be warm, i.e. (by implication); sunburnt or swarthy (blackish); brown.
feminine active participle of an unused root apparently meaning to join; a wall of protection; wall, walled.
a primitive root; properly, to cover, i.e. (figuratively) to compassionate; pity, regard, spare.
from an unused root meaning to cover; a cove (as a sheltered bay); coast (of the sea), haven, shore, (sea-) side.
from the same as חוֹף; protection; Chupham, an Israelite; Hupham.
patronymically from חוּפָם; a Chuphamite or descendant of Chupham; Huphamites.

or (shortened) חֻץ; (both forms feminine in the plural) from an unused root meaning to sever; properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors; abroad, field, forth, highway, more, out(-side, -ward), street, without.
or (shortened) חֻר; from an unused root probably meaning to bore; the crevice of a serpent; the cell of aprison; hole.
from חָוַר; white linen; white.
the same as חוּר or חוּר; Chur, the name of four Israelites and one Midianite; Hur.
the same as חוּר; white linen; network. Compare חֹר.
or (shortened) חֹר; the same as חוּר; a cavity, socket, den; cave, hole.
a primitive root; to blanch (as with shame); wax pale.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to חָוַר; white; white.
probably from חוּר; linen-worker; Churi, an Israelite; Huri.
probably an orthographical variation for חוּרִי; Churai, an Israelite; Hurai.
probably from חוּר; whiteness, i.e. noble; Churam, the name of an Israelite and two Syrians; Huram. Compare חִירָם.
apparently from חָוַר (in the sense of חוּר); cavernous; Chavran, a region East of the Jordan; Hauran.
a primitive root; to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment; (make) haste(-n), ready.
from חוּשׁ; haste; Chushah, an Israelite; Hushah.
from חוּשׁ; hasty; Chushai, an Israelite; Hushai.
or חֻשִׁים; or חֻשִׁם; plural from חוּשׁ; hasters; Chushim, the name of three Israelites; Hushim.
or חֻשָׁם; from חוּשׁ; hastily; Chusham, an Idumaean; Husham.
or חֹתָם; from חָתַם; a signature-ring; seal, signet.
the same as חוֹתָם; seal; Chotham, the name of two Israelites; Hotham, Hothan.
(Aramaic) or חֲזָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to חָזָה; to gaze upon; mentally to dream, be usual (i.e. seem); behold, have (a dream), see, be wont.
or חֲזָהאֵל; from חָזָה and אֵל; God has seen; Chazael, a king of Syria; Hazael.
a primitive root; to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of; behold, look, prophesy, provide, see.
from חָזָה; the breast (as most seen in front); breast.
active participle of חָזָה; a beholder in vision; also a compact (as looked upon with approval); agreement, prophet, see that, seer, (star-) gazer.
from חָזָה; seer; Chazo, a nephew of Abraham; Hazo.
(Aramaic) from חֲזָא; a sight; look, vision.
from חָזָה; a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle; vision.
from חָזָה; a revelation; vision.
(Aramaic) from חֲזָא; a view; sight.
from חָזָה; a look; hence (figuratively) striking appearance, revelation, or (by implication) compact; agreement, notable (one), vision.
from חָזָה and אֵל; seen of God; Chaziel, a Levite; Haziel.
from חָזָה and יָהּ; Jah has seen; Chazajah, an Israelite; Hazaiah.
from חָזָה; vision; Chezjon, a Syrian; Hezion.
from חָזָה; a revelation, expectation by dream; vision.
from an unused root meaning to glare; a flash of lightning; bright cloud, lightning.
from an unused root probably meaning to enclose; a hog (perhaps as penned); boar, swine.
from the same as חֲזִיר; perhaps protected; Chezir, the name of two Israelites; Hezir.

a primitive root; to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer; aid, amend, [idiom] calker, catch, cleave, confirm, be constant, constrain, continue, be of good (take) courage(-ous, -ly), encourage (self), be established, fasten, force, fortify, make hard, harden, help, (lay) hold (fast), lean, maintain, play the man, mend, become (wax) mighty, prevail, be recovered, repair, retain, seize, be (wax) sore, strengthen (self), be stout, be (make, shew, wax) strong(-er), be sure, take (hold), be urgent, behave self valiantly, withstand.
from חָזַק; strong (usu. in a bad sense, hard, bold, violent); harder, hottest, [phrase] impudent, loud, mighty, sore, stiff(-hearted), strong(-er).
from חָזַק; powerful; [idiom] wax louder, stronger.
from חָזַק; help; strength.
from חָזַק; power; strength.
feminine of חֵזֶק; prevailing power; strength(-en self), (was) strong.
feminine of חֹזֶק; vehemence (usually in a bad sense); force, mightily, repair, sharply.
from חָזַק; strong; Chizki, an Israelite; Hezeki.

or חִזְקִיָּהוּ; also יְחִזְקִיָּה; or יְחִזְקִיָּהוּ; from חָזַק and יָהּ; strengthened of Jah; Chizkijah, a king of Judah, also the name of two other Israelites; Hezekiah, Hizkiah, Hizkijah. Compare יְחִזְקִיָּה.
once (Ezekiel 29:4) חָחִי; from the same as חוֹחַ; a ring for the nose (or lips); bracelet, chain, hook.

a primitive root; properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn; bear the blame, cleanse, commit (sin), by fault, harm he hath done, loss, miss, (make) offend(-er), offer for sin, purge, purify (self), make reconciliation, (cause, make) sin(-ful, -ness), trespass.
from חָטָא; a crime or its penalty; fault, [idiom] grievously, offence, (punishment of) sin.
intensively from חָטָא; a criminal, or one accounted guilty; offender, sinful, sinner.
feminine of חֵטְא; an offence, or a sacrifice forit; sin (offering).
(Aramaic) corresponding to חֲטָאָה; an offence, and the penalty or sacrifice forit; sin (offering).

or חַטָּאת; from חָטָא; an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender; punishment (of sin), purifying(-fication for sin), sin(-ner, offering).
a primitive root; to chop or carve wood; cut down, hew(-er), polish.
feminine passive participle of חָטַב; properly, a carving; hence, a tapestry (as figured); carved.
of uncertain derivation; wheat, whether the grain or the plant; wheat(-en).
from an unused root of uncertain signification; Chattush, the name of four or five Israelites; Hattush.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to חָטָא; an offence; sin.
(Aramaic) from the same as חֲטִי; an expiation; sin offering.
from an unused root apparently meaning to dig out; explorer; Chatita, a temple porter; Hatita.
from an unused root apparently meaning to wave; fluctuating; Chattil, one of 'Solomon's servants'; Hattil.
from חָטַף; robber; Chatipha, one of the Nethinim; Hatipha.
a primitive root; to stop; refrain.
a primitive root; to clutch; hence, to seize as aprisoner; catch.
from an unused root of uncertain signification; a twig; rod.

from חָיָה; alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively; [phrase] age, alive, appetite, (wild) beast, company, congregation, life(-time), live(-ly), living (creature, thing), maintenance, [phrase] merry, multitude, [phrase] (be) old, quick, raw, running, springing, troop.
(Aramaic) from חֲיָא; alive; also (as noun in plural) life; life, that liveth, living.
(Aramaic) or חֲיָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to חָיָה; to live; live, keep alive.
from חַי and אֵל; living of God; Chiel, an Israelite; Hiel.
from חוּד; a puzzle, hence, a trick, conundrum, sententious maxim; dark saying (sentence, speech), hard question, proverb, riddle.

a primitive root (compare חָוָה, חָיָה); to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive; keep (leave, make) alive, [idiom] certainly, give (promise) life, (let, suffer to) live, nourish up, preserve (alive), quicken, recover, repair, restore (to life), revive, ([idiom] God) save (alive, life, lives), [idiom] surely, be whole.
from חָיָה; vigorous; lively.
(Aramaic) from חֲיָא; an animal; beast.
from חָיָה; life; [idiom] living.
a primitive root (compare חָיָה); to live; causatively to revive; live, save life.
or (shortened) חֵל; a collateral form of חַיִל; an army; also (by analogy,) an intrenchment; army, bulwark, host, [phrase] poor, rampart, trench, wall.
and (feminine) חִילָה; from חוּל; a throe (expectant of childbirth); pain, pang, sorrow.

from חוּל; probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength; able, activity, ([phrase]) army, band of men (soldiers), company, (great) forces, goods, host, might, power, riches, strength, strong, substance, train, ([phrase]) valiant(-ly), valour, virtuous(-ly), war, worthy(-ily).
(Aramaic) corresponding to חַיִל; an army, or strength; aloud, army, [idiom] most (mighty), power.
feminine of חַיִל; an intrenchment; bulwark.
or חֵלָאםxlit Chêlʼâm corrected to Chêlâʼm; from חַיִל; fortress; Chelam, a place East of Palestine; Helam.
from חַיִל; fortress; Chilen, a place in Palestine; Hilen.
another form for חֵן; beauty; comely.
another form for חוּץ; a wall; wall.
from חַיִץ; properly, the (outer) wall side; hence, exterior; figuratively, secular (as opposed to sacred); outer, outward, utter, without.
or חֵק; and חוֹק; from an unused root, apparently meaning to inclose; the bosom (literally or figuratively); bosom, bottom, lap, midst, within.
from חָוַר in the sense of splendor; Chirah, an Adullamite; Hirah.
or חִירוֹםlemma חִירֹם missing vav, corrected to חִירוֹם; another form of חוּרָם; Chiram or Chirom, the name of two Tyrians; Hiram, Huram.
another form of חוּשׁ; to hurry; make haste.
from חִישׁ; properly, a hurry; hence (adverb) quickly; soon.
probably from חָנַךְ in the sense of tasting; properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing); (roof of the) mouth, taste.
a primitive root (apparently akin to חָקָה through the idea of piercing); properly, to adhere to; hence, to await; long, tarry, wait.
probably from חָכָה; a hook (as adhering); angle, hook.
from the same as חַכְלִיל; dark; Chakilah, a hill in Palestine; Hachilah.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to חָכַם; wise, i.e. a Magian; wise.
from the base of חַכְלִיל and יָהּ; darkness of Jah; Chakaljah, an Israelite; Hachaliah.
by reduplication from an unused root apparently meaning to be dark; darkly flashing (only of the eyes); in a good sense, brilliant (as stimulated by wine); red.
from חַכְלִיל; flash (of the eyes); in a bad sense, blearedness; redness.
a primitive root,; to be wise (in mind, word or act); [idiom] exceeding, teach wisdom, be (make self, shew self) wise, deal (never so) wisely, make wiser.
from חָכַם; wise, (i.e. intelligent, skilful or artful); cunning (man), subtil, (un-), wise((hearted), man).
from חָכַם; wisdom (in a good sense); skilful, wisdom, wisely, wit.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חׇכְמָה; wisdom; wisdom.
from חָכַם; skilful; Chakmoni, an Israelite; Hachmoni, Hachmonite.
or חַכְמוֹת; collateral forms of חׇכְמָה; wisdom; wisdom, every wise (woman).
from חָלַל; properly, exposed; hence, profane; common, profane (place), unholy.
a primitive root (compare חָלָה); to be sick; be diseased.
from חָלָא; properly, disease; hence, rust; scum.
the same as חֶלְאָה; Chelah, an Israelitess; Helah.
or חֵלֶב; from an unused root meaning to be fat; fat, whether literally or figuratively; hence, the richest or choice part; [idiom] best, fat(-ness), [idiom] finest, grease, marrow.
the same as חֶלֶב; fatness; Cheleb, an Israelite; Heleb.
from the same as חֶלֶב; milk (as the richness of kine); [phrase] cheese, milk, sucking.
feminine of חֶלֶב; fertility; Chelbah, a place in Palestine; Helbah.
from חֶלֶב; fruitful; Chelbon, a place in Syria; Helbah.
from חֶלֶב; galbanam, an odorous gum (as if fatty); galbanum.
from an unused root apparently meaning to glide swiftly; life (as a fleeting portion of time); hence, the world (as transient); age, short time, world.
the same as חֶלֶד; Cheled, an Israelite; Heled.
from the same as חֶלֶד; a weasel (from its gliding motion); weasel.
feminine of חֹלֶד; Chuldah, an Israelitess; Huldah.
from חֵלֶד; worldliness; Cheldai, the name of two Israelites; Heldai.

a primitive root (compare חוּל, חָלָה, חָלַל); properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat; beseech, (be) diseased, (put to) grief, be grieved, (be) grievous, infirmity, intreat, lay to, put to pain, [idiom] pray, make prayer, be (fall, make) sick, sore, be sorry, make suit ([idiom] supplication), woman in travail, be (become) weak, be wounded.
from חָלַל; a cake (as usually punctured); cake.
or (shortened) חֲלֹם; from חָלַם; a dream; dream(-er).
or (shortened) חֹלֹן; probably from חוֹל; sandy; Cholon, the name of two places in Palestine; Holon.
a window (as perforated); window.
from חָלַף; properly, surviving; by implication (collectively) orphans; [idiom] destruction.
feminine passive participle of חָלַשׁ; defeat; being overcome.
probably of foreign origin; Chalach, a region of Assyria; Halah.
by reduplication from חוּל; contorted; Chalchul, a place in Palestine; Halhul.
feminine from the same as חַלְחוּל; writhing (in childbirth); by implication, terror; (great, much) pain.
a primitive root; to snatch at; catch.
from חָלָה; a trinket (as polished); jewel, ornament.
the same as חֲלִי; Chali, a place in Palestine; Hali.
from חָלָה; malady, anxiety, calamity; disease, grief, (is) sick(-ness).
feminine of חֲלִי; a trinket; jewel.
from חָלַל; a flute (as perforated); pipe.
or חָלִלָה; a directive from חָלַל; literal fora profaned thing; used (interj.) far be it!; be far, ([idiom] God) forbid.
lemma חלִיפָה missing vowel, corrected to חֲלִיפָה; from חָלַף; alternation; change, course.
from חֶלֶץ; spoil; armour.
or חֵלְכָה; apparently from an unused root probably meaning to be dark or (figuratively) unhappy; a wretch, i.e. unfortunate; poor.

a primitive root (compare חָלָה); also  denominative (from חָלִיל); properly, to bore, i.e. (by implication) to wound, to dissolve; figuratively, to profane (a person, place or thing), to break (one's word), to begin (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to play (the flute); begin ([idiom] men began), defile, [idiom] break, defile, [idiom] eat (as common things), [idiom] first, [idiom] gather the grape thereof, [idiom] take inheritance, pipe, player on instruments, pollute, (cast as) profane (self), prostitute, slay (slain), sorrow, stain, wound.
from חָלַל; pierced (especially to death); figuratively, polluted; kill, profane, slain (man), [idiom] slew, (deadly) wounded.

a primitive root; properly, to bind firmly, i.e. (by implication) to be (causatively to make) plump; also (through the figurative sense of dumbness) to dream; (cause to) dream(-er), be in good liking, recover.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to חָלַם; a dream; dream.
from חָלַם; a dream; Chelem, an Israelite; Helem. Compare חֶלְדַּי.
from חָלַם (in the sense of insipidity); probably purslain; egg.
probably from חָלַם (in the sense of hardness); flint; flint(-y), rock.
from חַיִל; strong; Chelon, an Israelite; Helon.

a primitive root; properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change; abolish, alter, change, cut off, go on forward, grow up, be over, pass (away, on, through), renew, sprout, strike through.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חָלַף; to pass on (of time); pass.
from חָלַף; properly, exchange; hence (as preposition) instead of; [idiom] for.
the same as חֵלֶף; change; Cheleph, a place in Palestine; Heleph.

a primitive root; to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen; arm (self), (go, ready) armed ([idiom] man, soldier), deliver, draw out, make fat, loose, (ready) prepared, put off, take away, withdraw self.
or חֵלֶץ; from חָלַץ; perhaps, strength; Chelets, the name of two Israelites; Helez.
from חָלַץ (in the sense of strength); only in the dual; the loins (as the seat of vigor); loins, reins.

a primitive root; to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate; deal, distribute, divide, flatter, give, (have, im-) part(-ner), take away a portion, receive, separate self, (be) smooth(-er).
from חָלַק; properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment; flattery, inheritance, part, [idiom] partake, portion.
the same as חֵלֶק; portion; Chelek, an Israelite; Helek.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to חָלַק; a part; portion.
from חָלַק; smooth (especially of tongue); flattering, smooth.
the same as חָלָק; bare; Chalak, a mountain of Idumaea; Halak.
from חָלַק; smooth; smooth.
from חָלַק; smooth; smooth.

feminine of חֵלֶק; properly, smoothness; figuratively, flattery; also an allotment; field, flattering(-ry), ground, parcel, part, piece of land (ground), plat, portion, slippery place, smooth (thing).
feminine from חָלַק; flattery; flattery.
feminine of חַלֻּק; a distribution; division.
patronymically from חֵלֶק; a Chelkite or descendant of Chelek; Helkites.
from חָלַק; apportioned; Chelkai, an Israelite; Helkai.
or חִלְקִיָּהוּ; from חֵלֶק and יָהּ; portion of Jah; Chilhijah, the name of eight Israelites; Hillkiah.
by reduplication from חָלַק; properly, something very smooth; i.e. a treacherous spot; figuratively, blandishment; flattery, slippery.
a form of חֶלְקָה; smoothness; Chelkath, a place in Palestine; Helkath.
from חֶלְקַת and the plural of צוּר, with the article inserted; smoothness of the rocks; Chelkath Hats-tsurim, a place in Palestine; Helkath-hazzurim.
a primitive root; to prostrate; by implication, to overthrow, decay; discomfit, waste away, weaken.
from חָלַשׁ; frail; weak.
from the same as חוֹמָה; a father-in-law (as in affinity); father in law.
from חָמַם; hot; hot, warm.
the same as חָם; hot (from the tropical habitat); Cham, a son of Noah; also (as a patronymic) his descendants or their country; Ham.
from חָמַם; heat; heat, to be hot (warm).
(Aramaic) or חֲמָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to חֵמָה; anger; fury.
or (shortened) חֵמָה; from the same root as חוֹמָה; curdled milk or cheese; butter.
a primitive root; to delight in; beauty, greatly beloved, covet, delectable thing, ([idiom] great) delight, desire, goodly, lust, (be) pleasant (thing), precious (thing).
from חָמַד; delight; desirable, pleasant.
feminine of חֶמֶד; delight; desire, goodly, pleasant, precious.
from חֶמֶד; pleasant; Chemdan, an Idumaean; Hemdan.
or (Daniel 11:44) חֵמָא; from יָחַם; heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever); anger, bottles, hot displeasure, furious(-ly, -ry), heat, indignation, poison, rage, wrath(-ful). See חֶמְאָה.
from חָם; heat; by implication, the sun; heat, sun.
from חַמָּה and אֵל; anger of God; Chammuel, an Israelite; Hamuel.
or חֲמִיטַל; from חָם and טַל; father-in-law of dew; Chamutal or Chamital, an Israelitess; Hamutal.
from חָמַל; pitied; Chamul, an Israelite; Hamul.
patronymically from חָמוּל; a Chamulite (collectively) or descendants of Chamul; Hamulites.
from חָמַם; warm spring; Chammon, the name of two places in Palestine; Hammon.
from חָמֵץ; properly, violent; by implication, a robber; oppressed.
from חָמַק; a wrapping, i.e. drawers; joints.
or (shortened) חֲמֹר; from חָמַר; a male ass (from its dun red); (he) ass.
the same as חֲמוֹר; donkey; Chamor, a Canaanite; Hamor.
or (shortened) חֲמֹת; feminine of חָם; a mother-in-law; mother in law.
from an unused root probably meaning, to lie low; a lizard (as creeping); snail.
feminine of חֹמֶט; low; Chumtah, a place in Palestine; Humtah.
from חָמֵץ; seasoned, i.e. salt provender; clean.
or חֲמִשִּׁי; ordinal from חָמֵשׁ; fifth; also a fifth; fifth (part).
a primitive root; to commiserate; by implication, to spare; have compassion, (have) pity, spare.
from חָמַל; commiseration; merciful, pity.
a primitive root; to be hot (literally or figuratively); enflame self, get (have) heat, be (wax) hot, (be, wax) warm (self, at).
from חַמָּה; a sun-pillar; idol, image.
a primitive root; to be violent; by implication, to maltreat; make bare, shake off, violate, do violence, take away violently, wrong, imagine wrongfully.
from חָמַס; violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain; cruel(-ty), damage, false, injustice, [idiom] oppressor, unrighteous, violence (against, done), violent (dealing), wrong.
a primitive root; to be pungent; i.e. in taste (sour, i.e. literally fermented, or figuratively, harsh), in color (dazzling); cruel (man), dyed, be grieved, leavened.
xlit châmêtz corrected to châmêts; from חָמֵץ; ferment, (figuratively) extortion; leaven, leavened (bread).
from חָמֵץ; vinegar; vinegar.
a primitive root; properly, to wrap; hence, to depart (i.e. turn about); go about, withdraw self.
a primitive root; also  as denominative (from חֵמָר); properly, to boil up; hence, to ferment (with scum); to glow (with redness); to smear with pitch; daub, befoul, be red, trouble.
from חָמַר; wine (as fermenting); [idiom] pure, red wine.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חֶמֶר; wine; wine.
from חָמַר; properly, a bubbling up, i.e. of water, a wave; of earth, mire or clay (cement); also a heap; hence, a chomer or dry measure; clay, heap, homer, mire, motion.
from חָמַר; bitumen (as rising to the surface); slime(-pit).
from חָמַר (compare חֹמֶר); a heap; heap.
from חָמַר; red; Chamran, an Idumaean; Amran.
a denominative from חָמֵשׁ; to tax a fifth; take up the fifth participle
masculine חֲמִשָּׁה; a primitive numeral; five; fif(-teen), fifth, five ([idiom] apiece).
from חָמַשׁ; a fifth tax; fifth participle
from an unused root probably meaning, to be stout; the abdomen (as obese); fifth (rib).
passive participle of the same as חֹמֶשׁ; staunch, i.e. able-bodied soldiers; armed (men), harnessed.
multiple of חָמֵשׁ; fifty; fifty.
from the same as חוֹמָה; a skin bottle (as tied up); bottle.
from the same as חוֹמָה; walled; Chamath, a place in Syria; Hamath, Hemath.
a variation for the first part of חַמֹּת דֹּאר; hot springs; Chammath, a place in Palestine; Hammath.
from the plural of חַמָּה and דּוֹר; hot springs of Dor; Chammath-Dor, a place in Palestine; Hamath-Dor.
patrial from חֲמָת; a Chamathite or native of Chamath; Hamathite.
from חֲמָת and צוֹבָא; Chamath of Tsobah; probably the same as חֲמָת; Chamath-Tsobah; Hamath-Zobah.
from חֲמָת and רַבָּה; Chamath of Rabbah; probably the same as חֲמָת.; Chamath-Rabbah;
from חָנַן; graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty); favour, grace(-ious), pleasant, precious, (well-) favoured.
the same as חֵן; grace; Chen, a figurative name for an Israelite; Hen.
probably from חֵן and הֲדַד; favor of Hadad; Chenadad, an Israelite; Henadad.

a primitive root (compare חָנַן); properly, to incline; by implication, to decline (of the slanting rays of evening); specifically, to pitch atent; gen. to encamp (for abode or siege); abide (in tents), camp, dwell, encamp, grow to an end, lie, pitch (tent), rest in tent.
from חָנַן; favored; Channah, an Israelitess; Hannah.
from חָנַךְ; initiated; Chanok, an antediluvian patriach; Enoch.
from חָנַן; favored; Chanun, the name of an Ammonite and of two Israelites; Hanun.
from חָנַן; gracious; gracious.
from חָנָה; properly, a vault or cell (with an arch); by implication, a prison; cabin.
from חָנַן (in the sense of prayer); supplication; be gracious, intreated.
a primitive root; to spice; by implication, to embalm; also to ripen; embalm, put forth.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חִטָּה; wheat; wheat.
from חָנַן and אֵל; favor of God; Channiel, the name of two Israelites; Hanniel.
from חָנַךְ; initiated; i.e. practiced; trained.
from חָנַן; graciousness; favour.
lemma חֲניִת second vowel, corrected to חֲנִית; from חָנָה; a lance (for thrusting, like pitching a tent); javelin, spear.
a primitive root; (compare חָנַק); properly, to narrow; figuratively, to initiate or discipline; dedicate, train up.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חֲנֻכָּה; consecration; dedication.
from חָנַךְ; initiation, i.e. consecration; dedicating(-tion).
patronymically from חֲנוֹךְ; a Chanokite (collectively) or descendants of Chanok; Hanochites.
from חֵן; gratis, i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage; without a cause (cost, wages), causeless, to cost nothing, free(-ly), innocent, for nothing (nought, in vain.
probably by orthographical variation for חֲנַנְאֵל; Chanamel, an Israelite; Hanameel.
of uncertain derivation; perhaps the aphis or plantlouse; frost.

a primitive root (compare חָנָה); properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition); beseech, [idiom] fair, (be, find, shew) favour(-able), be (deal, give, grant (gracious(-ly), intreat, (be) merciful, have (shew) mercy (on, upon), have pity upon, pray, make supplication, [idiom] very.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חָנַן; to favor or (causatively) to entreat; shew mercy, make supplication.
from חָנַן; favor; Chanan, the name of seven Israelites; Canan.
from חָנַן and אֵל; God has favored; Chananel, probably an Israelite, from whom a tower of Jerusalem was named; Hananeel.
from חָנַן; gracious; Chanani, the name of six Israelites; Hanani.
or חֲנַנְיָהוּ; from חָנַן and יָהּ; Jah has favored; Chananjah, the name of thirteen Israelites; Hananiah.
of Egyptian derivation; Chanes, a place in Egypt; Hanes.
a primitive root; to soil, especially in a moral sense; corrupt, defile, [idiom] greatly, pollute, profane.
from חָנֵף; soiled (i.e. with sin), impious; hypocrite(-ical).
from חָנֵף; moral filth, i.e. wickedness; hypocrisy.
feminine from חָנֵף; impiety; profaneness.
a primitive root (compare חָנַךְ); to be narrow; by implication, to throttle, or (reflex.) to choke oneself to death (by a rope); hang self, strangle.
probably from חָנַן; favored; Channathon, a place in Palestine; Hannathon.

a primitive root; (compare חָנַן); (compare בָרַךְ); properly, perhaps to bow (the neck only  in courtesy to an equal), i.e. to be kind; also (by euphemistically, but rarely) to reprove; shew self merciful, put to shame.

from חָסַד; kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty; favour, good deed(-liness, -ness), kindly, (loving-) kindness, merciful (kindness), mercy, pity, reproach, wicked thing.
the same as חֵסֵד; favor; Chesed, an Israelite; Hesed.
from חֵסֵד and יָהּ; Jah has favored; Chasadjah, an Israelite; Hasadiah.
a primitive root; (compare בָּטַח); to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in; have hope, make refuge, (put) trust.
from חָסָה; hopeful; Chosah, an Israelite; also a place in Palestine; Hosah.
from חָסָה; confidence; trust.
from חָסַד; properly, kind, i.e. (religiously) pious (a saint); godly (man), good, holy (one), merciful, saint, (un-) godly.
feminine of חָסִיד; the kind (maternal) bird, i.e. a stork; [idiom] feather, stork.
from חָסַל; the ravager, i.e. a locust; caterpillar.
from חָסַן; properly, firm, i.e. (by implication) mighty; strong.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to חָסֵר; deficient; wanting.
a primitive root; to eat off; consume.
a primitive root; to muzzle; by analogy, to stop the nose; muzzle, stop.
a primitive root; properly, to (be) compact; by implication, to hoard; lay up.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חָסַן; to hold in occupancy; possess.
(Aramaic) from חֲסַן; strength; power.
from חָסַן; wealth; riches, strength, treasure.
from חָסַן; powerful; strong.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of חַסְפַּס; a clod; clay.
reduplicated from an unused root meaning apparently to peel; a shred or scale; round thing.
a primitive root; to lack; by implication, to fail, want, lessen; be abated, bereave, decrease, (cause to) fail, (have) lack, make lower, want.
from חָסֵר; lacking; hence, without; destitute, fail, lack, have need, void, want.
from חָסֵר; lack; hence, destitution; poverty, want.
from חָסֵר; poverty; in want of.
from חָסֵר; want; Chasrah, an Israelite; Hasrah.
from חָסֵר; deficiency; wanting.
from חׇפַף (in the moral sense of covered from soil); pure; innocent.
an orthographical variation of חָפָה; properly, to cover, i.e. (in a sinister sense) to act covertly; do secretly.
a primitive root (compare חָפָא, חׇפַף); to cover; by implication, to veil, to encase, protect; ceil, cover, overlay.
from חָפָה; a canopy; chamber, closet, defence.
the same as חֻפָּה; Chuppah, an Israelite; Huppah.
a primitive root; properly, to start up suddenly, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, to fear; (make) haste (away), tremble.
from חֻלְדָּה; hasty flight; haste.
plural of חֻפָּה (compare חוּפָם); Chuppim, an Israelite; Huppim.
from an unused root of uncertain signification; a fist (only in the dual); fists, (both) hands, hand(-ful).
from חֹפֶן; perhaps pugilist; Chophni, an Israelite; Hophni.
a primitive root (compare חָפָה, יָחֵף); to cover (in protection); cover.

a primitive root; properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire; [idiom] any at all, (have, take) delight, desire, favour, like, move, be (well) pleased, have pleasure, will, would.
from חָפֵץ; pleased with; delight in, desire, favour, please, have pleasure, whosoever would, willing, wish.

from חָפֵץ; pleasure; hence (abstractly) desire; concretely, a valuable thing; hence (by extension) a matter (as something in mind); acceptable, delight(-some), desire, things desired, matter, pleasant(-ure), purpose, willingly.
from חֵפֶץ with suffixes; my delight (is) in her; Cheptsi-bah, a fanciful name for Palestine; Hephzi-bah.
a primitive root; properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore; dig, paw, search out, seek.

a primitive root (perhaps rather the same as חָפַר through the idea of detection); to blush; figuratively, to be ashamed, disappointed; causatively, to shame, reproach; be ashamed, be confounded, be brought to confusion (unto shame), come (be put to) shame, bring reproach.
from חָפַר or חָפֵר; a pit of shame; Chepher, a place in Palestine; also the name of three Israelites; Hepher.
from חָפַר; a hole; only in connection with פֵּרָה, which ought rather to be joined as one word, thus חַפַרְפֵּרָה; by reduplication from חָפַר; a burrower, i.e. probably a rat; [phrase] mole.
patronymically from חֵפֶר; a Chephrite (collectively) or descendants of Chepher; Hepherites.
dual of חֵפֶר; double pit; Chapharajim, a place in Palestine; Haphraim.
a primitive root; to seek; causatively, to conceal oneself (i.e. let be sought), or mask; change, (make) diligent (search), disquise self, hide, search (for, out).
from חָפַשׂ; something covert, i.e. a trick; search.
a primitive root; to spread loose; figuratively, to manumit; be free.
from חָפַשׁ; something spread loosely, i.e. a carpet; precious.
from חָפַשׁ; liberty (from slavery); freedom.
and חׇפְשִׁית; from חָפַשׁ; (with בַּיִת, a hospital); prostration by sickness; several.
from חָפַשׁ; exempt (from bondage, tax or care); free, liberty.

from חָצַץ; also by interchange for עֵץ; properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear; [phrase] archer, arrow, dart, shaft, staff, wound.
or חָצֵב; a primitive root; to cut or carve (wood, stone or other material); by implication, to hew, split, square, quarry, engrave; cut, dig, divide, grave, hew (out, -er), made, mason.
lemma חָעָה ayin, corrected to חָצָה; a primitive root (compare זֵד)); to cut or split in two; to halve; divide, [idiom] live out half, reach to the midst, participle
a collective form of חָצֵר; village; Chatsor, the name (thus simply) of two places in Palestine and of one in Arabia; Hazor.
from חָצוֹר and a Aramaizing form of the feminine of חָדָשׁ (compare חֲדָת); new Chatsor, a place in Palestine; Hazor, Hadattah (as if two places).
lemma חָעוֹת ayin, corrected to חָצוֹת; from חָצָהlemma חָעָה ayin, corrected to חָצָה; the middle (of the night); mid(-night).
from חָצָהlemma חָעָה ayin, corrected to חָצָה; the half or middle; half, middle, mid(-night), midst, part, two parts.
or חֵצִי; prolongation from חֵץ; an arrow; arrow.
from חֵצִי and the plural of מְנוּחָה, with the article interposed; midst of the resting-places; Chatsi-ham-Menuchoth, an Israelite; half of the Manahethites.
patronymically from חֲצִי הַמְּנֻחוֹת; a Chatsi-ham-Menachtite or descendant of Chatsi-ham-Menuchoth; half of the Manahethites.
a collateral form of חָצֵר; a court or abode; court.
perhaps originally the same as חָצִיר, from the greenness of a courtyard; grass; also a leek (collectively); grass, hay, herb, leek.
from an unused root meaning to hold firmly; the bosom (as comprised between the arms); bosom.
a collateral form of חֵצֶן, and meaning the same; {the bosom (as comprised between the arms)}; arm, lap.
(Aramaic) a primitive root; properly, to shear or cut close; figuratively, to be severe; hasty, be urgent.

a primitive root (compare חָצָהlemma חָעָה ayin, corrected to חָצָה); also as denominative from חֵץ; properly, to chop into, pierce or sever; hence, to curtail, to distribute (into ranks);  to shoot an arrow; archer, [idiom] bands, cut off in the midst.
from חָצָץ;  also like חֵץ; properly, something cutting; hence, gravel (as grit); an arrow; arrow, gravel (stone).
or חַצֲצֹן תָּמָר; from חָצַץ and תָּמָר; division (i.e. perhaps row) of (the) palm-tree; Chatsetson-tamar, a place in Palestine; Hazezon-tamar.
by reduplication from חָצַר; a trumpet (from its sundered or quavering note); trumpet(-er).

a primitive root; properly, to surround with a stockade, and thus separate from the open country; but used only in the reduplicated form חֲצֹצֵר; or (2 Chronicles 5:12) חֲצֹרֵר; as dem. from חֲצֹצְרָה; to trumpet, i.e. blow on that instrument; blow, sound, trumpeter.
(masculine and feminine); from חָצַר in its original sense; a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls); court, tower, village.
xlit Addâr corrected to ʼAddâr; from חָצֵר and אַדָּר; (the) village of Addar; Chatsar-Addar, a place in Palestine; Hazar-addar.
from חָצֵר and a feminine of גַּד; (the) village of (female) Fortune; Chatsar-Gaddah, a place in Palestine; Hazar-gaddah.
from חָצֵר and תִּיכוֹן with the article interposed; village of the middle; Chatsar-hat-Tikon, a place in Palestine; Hazar-hatticon.
by an orthographical variation for חֶצְרוֹן; enclosure; Chetsro, an Israelite; Hezro, Hezrai.
from חָצֵר; court-yard; Chetsron, the name of a place in Palestine; also of two Israelites; Hezron.
patronymically from חֶצְרוֹן; a Chetsronite or (collectively) descendants of Chetsron; Hezronites.
feminine plural of חָצֵר; yards; Chatseroth, a place in Palestine; Hazeroth.
plural masculine of חָצֵר; yards; Chatserim, a place in Palestine; Hazerim.
from חָצֵר and מָוֶת; village of death; Chatsarmaveth, a place in Arabia; Hazarmaveth.
from חָצֵר and סוּסָה; village of cavalry; Chatsar-Susah, a place in Palestine; Hazar-susah.
from חָצֵר and the plural of סוּס; village of horses; Chatsar-Susim, a place in Palestine; Hazar-susim.
from חָצֵר and a derivative of עַיִן; village of springs; Chatsar-Enon, a place in Palestine; Hazar-enon.
from חָצֵר and the same as עֵינָן; village of springs; Chatsar-Enan, a place in Palestine; Hazar-enan.
from חָצֵר and שׁוּעָל; village of (the) fox; Chatsar-Shual, a place in Palestine; Hazar-shual.

from חָקַק; an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage); appointed, bound, commandment, convenient, custom, decree(-d), due, law, measure, [idiom] necessary, ordinance(-nary), portion, set time, statute, task.
a primitive root; to carve; by implication, to delineate; also to entrench; carved work, portrayed, set a print.
feminine of חֹק, and meaning substantially the same; {an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)}; appointed, custom, manner, ordinance, site, statute.
from an unused root probably meaning to bend; crooked; Chakupha, one of the Nethinim; Hakupha.

a primitive root; properly, to hack, i.e. engrave (Judges 5:14, to be a scribe simply); by implication, to enact (laws being cut in stone or metal tablets in primitive times) or (gen.) prescribe; appoint, decree, governor, grave, lawgiver, note, pourtray, print, set.
from חָקַק; an enactment, a resolution; decree, thought.
or (fully) חוּקֹק; from חָקַק; appointed; Chukkok or Chukok, a place in Palestine; Hukkok, Hukok.
a primitive root; properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately; find out, (make) search (out), seek (out), sound, try.
from חָקַר; examination, enumeration, deliberation; finding out, number, (un-) search(-able, -ed, out, -ing).
or (fully) חוֹר; from חָרַר; (compare חֹרִי); properly, white or pure (from the cleansing or shining power of fire; hence (figuratively) noble (in rank); noble.
from an unused (and vulgar) root probably meaning to evacuate the bowels; excrement; dung. Also חֲרִי.
or חֲרֵב; a primitive root; to parch (through drought) i.e. (by analogy,) to desolate, destroy, kill; decay, (be) desolate, destroy(-er), (be) dry (up), slay, [idiom] surely, (lay, lie, make) waste.
(Aramaic) a root corresponding to חָרַב; to demolish; destroy.
from חָרַב; drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement; axe, dagger, knife, mattock, sword, tool.
from חָרַב; parched or ruined; desolate, dry, waste.
a collaterally form of חֶרֶב; drought or desolation; desolation, drought, dry, heat, [idiom] utterly, waste.
from חָרַב; desolate; Choreb, a (generic) name for the Sinaitic mountains; Horeb.
feminine of חֹרֶב; properly, drought, i.e. (by implication) a desolation; decayed place, desolate (place, -tion), destruction, (laid) waste (place).
feminine of חָרֵב; a desert; dry (ground, land).
from חָרַב; parching heat; drought.
or חַרְבוֹנָה; of Persian origin; Charbona or Charbonah, a eunuch of Xerxes; Harbona, Harbonah.
a primitive root; properly, to leap suddenly, i.e. (by implication) to be dismayed; be afraid.
from חָרַג; the leaping insect, i.e. a locust; beetle.
a primitive root; to shudder with terror; hence, to fear; also to hasten (with anxiety); be (make) afraid, be careful, discomfit, fray (away), quake, tremble.
from חָרַד; fearful; also reverential; afraid, trembling.
feminine of חָרֵד; fear, anxiety; care, [idiom] exceedingly, fear, quaking, trembling.
the same as חֲרָדָה; Charadah, a place in the Desert; Haradah.
patrial from a derivative of חָרַד (compare עֵין חֲרֹד); a Charodite, or inhabitant of Charod; Harodite.

a primitive root (compare חָרַר); to glow or grow warm; figuratively (usually) to blaze up, of anger, zeal, jealousy; be angry, burn, be displeased, [idiom] earnestly, fret self, grieve, be (wax) hot, be incensed, kindle, [idiom] very, be wroth. See תַּחָרָה.
from חוֹר and a collateral (masculine) form of גֻּדְגֹּדָה, with the article interposed; hole of the cleft; Chor-hag-Gidgad, a place in the Desert; Hor-hagidgad.
; from חָרָה and יָהּ; fearing Jah; Charhajah, an Israelite; Harhaiah.
from an unused root meaning to perforate; properly, pierced, i.e. a bead of pearl, gems or jewels (as strung); chain.
or (shortened) חָרֻל; apparently, a passive participle of an unused root probably meaning to be prickly; properly, pointed, i.e. a bramble or other thorny weed; nettle.
from passive participle of חָרַם and אַף; snub-nosed; Charumaph, an Israelite; Harumaph.
or (shortened) חָרֹן; from חָרָה; a burning of anger; sore displeasure, fierce(-ness), fury, (fierce) wrath(-ful).
a patrial from (probably) a collateral form of חָרִיף; a Charuphite or inhabitant of Charuph (or Chariph); Haruphite.

or חָרֻץ; passive participle of חָרַץ; properly, incised or (active) incisive; hence (as noun masculine or feminine) a trench (as dug), gold (as mined), a threshing-sledge (having sharp teeth); (figuratively) determination; also eager; decision, diligent, (fine) gold, pointed things, sharp, threshing instrument, wall.
the same as חֲרוּץ; earnest; Charuts, an Israelite; Haruz.
a fuller form of חַרְחֻר; inflammation; Charchur, one of the Nethinim; Harhur.
from the same as חֶרֶס; perhaps shining; Charchas, an Israelite; Harhas.
from חָרַר; fever (as hot); extreme burning.
from a primitive root meaning to engrave; a chisel or graver; also a style forwriting; graving tool, pen.
from the same as חֶרֶט; a horoscopist (as drawing magical lines or circles); magician.
(Aramaic) the same as חַרְטֹם; {a horoscopist (as drawing magical lines or circles)}; magician.
from חָרָה; a burning (i.e. intense) anger; fierce, [idiom] great, heat.
from the same as חוּר; white bread; white.
from חוֹר; cave-dweller or troglodyte; a Chorite or aboriginal Idumaean; Horims, Horites.
or חוֹרִי; the same as חֹרִי; Chori, the name of two men; Hori.
or חָרִט; from the same as חֶרֶט; properly, cut out (or hollow), i.e. (by implication) a pocket; bag, crisping pin.
from the plural of חֶרֶא and the plural of יוֹנָה; or perhaps rather the plural of a single word חֲרָאיוֹן, probably a kind of vegetable; excrements of doves {or a vegetable}; doves' dung.
from חָרַף; autumnal; Chariph, the name of two Israelites; Hariph.
or חֲרִץ; from חָרַץ; (compare חֲרוּץ); properly, incisure or (passively) incised; hence, a threshing-sledge (with sharp teeth); also a slice (as cut); [phrase] cheese, harrow.
from חָרַשׁ; ploughing or its season; earing (time), ground.
from חָרַשׁ in the sense of silence; quiet, i.e. sultry (as feminine noun, the sirocco or hot east wind); vehement.
a primitive root; to braid (i.e. to entangle or snare) or catch (game) in anet; roast.
(Aramaic) a root probably allied to the equivalent of חָרַר; to scorch; singe.
from חָרַךְ; properly, a net, i.e. (by analogy) lattice; lattice.

a primitive root; to seclude; specifically (by a ban) to devote to religious uses (especially destruction); physical and reflexive, to be blunt as to the nose; make accursed, consecrate, (utterly) destroy, devote, forfeit, have a flat nose, utterly (slay, make away).

or (Zechariah 14:11) חֶרֶם; from חָרַם; physical (as shutting in) a net (either literally or figuratively); usually a doomed object; abstractly extermination; (ac-) curse(-d, -d thing), dedicated thing, things which should have been utterly destroyed, (appointed to) utter destruction, devoted (thing), net.
from חָרַם; devoted; Chorem, a place in Palestine; Horem.
from חָרַם; snub-nosed; Charim, an Israelite; Harim.
from חָרַם; devoted; Chormah, a place in Palestine; Hormah.
from חָרַם; abrupt; Chermon, a mount of Palestine; Hermon.
plural of חֶרְמוֹן; Hermons, i.e. its peaks; the Hermonites.
from חָרַם; a sickle (as cutting); sickle.
from חָרַר; parched; Charan, the name of a man and also of a place; Haran.
patrial from חֹרֹנַיִם; a Choronite or inhabitant of Choronaim; Horonite.
dual of a derivative from חוֹר; double cave-town; Choronajim, a place in Moab; Horonaim.
of uncertain derivation; Charnepher, an Israelite; Harnepher.
or (with a directive enclitic) חַרְסָה; from an unused root meaning to scrape; also perhaps from the mediating idea of חַרְסוּת; the itch; the sun; itch, sun.
the same as חֶרֶס; shining; Cheres, a mountain in Palestine; Heres.
from חֶרֶס (apparently in the sense of a red tile used for scraping); a potsherd, i.e. (by implication) a pottery; the name of a gate at Jerusalem; east.

a primitive root; also  denominative (from חֹרֶף); to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter; betroth, blaspheme, defy, jeopard, rail, reproach, upbraid.
from חָרַף; properly, the crop gathered, i.e. (by implication) the autumn (and winter) season; figuratively, ripeness of age; cold, winter (-house), youth.
from חָרַף; reproachful; Chareph, an Israelite; Hareph.
from חָרַף; contumely, disgrace, the pudenda; rebuke, reproach(-fully), shame.
a primitive root; properly, to point sharply, i.e. (literally) to wound; figuratively, to be alert, to decide; bestir self, decide, decree, determine, maim, move.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to חָרַץ in the sense of vigor; the loin (as the seat of strength); loin.
of uncertain derivation; a fetter; figuratively, a pain; band.
from חָרַץ; a sour grape (as sharp in taste); kernel.
a primitive root; to grate the teeth; gnash.
a primitive root; to glow, i.e. literally (to melt, burn, dry up) or figuratively (to show or incite passion); be angry, burn, dry, kindle.
from חָרַר; arid; parched place.
a collateral form mediating between חֶרֶס and חֶרֶשׁ; a piece of pottery; earth(-en), (pot-) sherd, [phrase] stone.

a primitive root; to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness); [idiom] altogether, cease, conceal, be deaf, devise, ear, graven, imagine, leave off speaking, hold peace, plow(-er, man), be quiet, rest, practise secretly, keep silence, be silent, speak not a word, be still, hold tongue, worker.
from חָרַשׁ; magical craft; also silence; cunning, secretly.
the same as חֶרֶשׁ; Cheresh, a Levite; Heresh.
from חָרַשׁ; a forest (perhaps as furnishing the material for fabric); bough, forest, shroud, wood.
active participle of חָרַשׁ; a fabricator or mechanic; artificer.
from חָרַשׁ; deaf (whether literally or spiritual); deaf.
from חָרַשׁ; a fabricator or any material; artificer, ([phrase]) carpenter, craftsman, engraver, maker, [phrase] mason, skilful, ([phrase]) smith, worker, workman, such as wrought.
from חֶרֶשׁ; magician; Charsha, one of the Nethinim; Harsha.
plural of חָרָשׁ; mechanics, the name of a valley in Jerusalem; Charashim, craftsmen.
from חָרַשׁ; mechanical work; carving, cutting.
the same as חֲרֹשֶׁת; Charosheth, a place in Palestine; Harosheth.
a primitive root; to engrave; graven.
from חָרַת (but equivalent to חֹרֶשׁ); forest; Chereth, a thicket in Palestine; Hereth.

a primitive root; properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute; (make) account (of), conceive, consider, count, cunning (man, work, workman), devise, esteem, find out, forecast, hold, imagine, impute, invent, be like, mean, purpose, reckon(-ing be made), regard, think.
(Aramaic) corresponding to חָשַׁב; to regard; repute.
from חָשַׁב; a belt or strap (as being interlaced); curious girdle.
from חָשַׁב and דִּין; considerate judge; Chasbaddanah, an Israelite; Hasbadana.
from חָשַׁב; estimation; Cashubah, an Israelite; Hashubah.
from חָשַׁב; properly, contrivance; by implication, intelligence; account, device, reason.
the same as חֶשְׁבּוֹן; Cheshbon, a place East of the Jordan; Heshbon.
from חָשַׁב; a contrivance, i.e. actual (a warlike machine) or mental (a machination); engine, invention.
or חֲשַׁבְיָהוּ; from חָשַׁב and יָהּ; Jah has regarded; Chashabjah, the name of nine Israelites; Hashabiah.
feminine of חֶשְׁבּוֹן; inventiveness; Chashnah, an Israelite; Hashabnah.
from חֶשְׁבּוֹן and יָהּ; thought of Jah; Chashabnejah, the name of two Israelites; Hashabniah.
a primitive root; to hush or keep quiet; hold peace, keep silence, be silent, (be) still.
