lemma חַשְּׁוּב extra sheva, corrected to חַשּׁוּב; from חָשַׁב; intelligent; Chashshub, the name of two or three Israelites; Hashub, Hasshub.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to חָשַׁךְ; the dark; darkness.
or חֲשֻׂפָא; from חָשַׂף; nakedness; Chasupha, one of the Nethinim; Hashupha, Hasupha.
(Aramaic) a collateral root to one corresponding to חוּשׁ in the sense of readiness; to be necessary (from the idea of convenience) or (transitively) to need; careful, have need of.
from a root corresponding to חֲשַׁח; necessity; be needful.

a primitive root; also interchangeable  with חָשַׁךְ; to restrain or (reflex.) refrain; by implication, to refuse, spare, preserve; to observe; assuage, [idiom] darken, forbear, hinder, hold back, keep (back), punish, refrain, reserve, spare, withhold.
a primitive root; to be dark (as withholding light); transitively, to darken; be black, be (make) dark, darken, cause darkness, be dim, hide.
from חָשַׁךְ; the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness; dark(-ness), night, obscurity.
from חָשַׁךְ; dark (figuratively, i.e. obscure); meaning
from חָשַׁךְ; darkness; dark.
or חֲשֵׁיכָהxlit chăshêkâh corrected to chăshêykâh; from חָשַׁךְ; darkness; figuratively, misery; darkness.
a primitive root; to make (intrans. be) unsteady, i.e. weak; feeble.
(Aramaic) a root corresponding to חָשַׁל; to weaken, i.e. crush; subdue.
from the same as חַשְׁמַן; enriched; Chashum, the name of two or three Israelites; Hashum.
the same as חַשְׁמַן; opulent; Cheshmon, a place in Palestine; Heshmon.
of uncertain derivation; probably bronze or polished spectrum metal; amber.
from an unused root (probably meaning firm or capacious in resources); apparently; wealthy; princes.
feminine of חַשְׁמַן; fertile; Chasmonah, a place in the Desert; Hashmonah.
from an unused root probably meaning to contain or sparkle; perhaps a pocket (as holding the Urim and Thummim), or rich (as containing gems), used only of the gorget of the highpriest; breastplate.
a primitive root; to strip off, i.e. generally to make naked (for exertion or in disgrace), to drain away or bail up (a liquid); make bare, clean, discover, draw out, take, uncover.
from חָשַׂף; properly, drawn off, i.e. separated; hence, a small company (as divided from the rest); little flock.
a primitive root; also interchangeable for חָשַׂךְ; to cling, i.e. join, (figuratively) to love, delight in; elliptically; to deliver; have a delight, (have a) desire, fillet, long, set (in) love.
from חָשַׁק; delight; desire, pleasure.
or חָשׁוּק; past participle of חָשַׁק; attached, i.e. a fence-rail or rod connecting the posts or pillars; fillet.
from חָשַׁק; conjoined, i.e. a wheel-spoke or rod connecting the hub with the rim; felloe.
from an unused root meaning to bind together; combined, i.e. the nave or hub of awheel (as holding the spokes together); spoke.
from the same as חִשֻּׁר; properly, a combination or gathering, i.e. of watery clouds; dark.
by variation for קַשׁ; dry grass; chaff.
patronymically from חוּשָׁה; a Chushathite or descendant of Chushah; Hushathite.
from חָתַת; concretely, crushed; also afraid; abstractly, terror; broken, dismayed, dread, fear.
from חָתַת; terror; Cheth, an aboriginal Canaanite; Heth.
a primitive root; to lay hold of; especially to pick up fire; heap, take (away).
from חָתַת; fear; terror.
from חָתַל; swathed, i.e. a bandage; roller.
from חַת; terror; fear.
patronymically from חֵת; a Chittite, or descendant of Cheth; Hittite, Hittities.
from חָתַת; fear; terror.
a primitive root; properly, to cut off, i.e. (figuratively) to decree; determine.
a primitive root; to swathe; [idiom] at all, swaddle.
from חָתַל; a swathing cloth (figuratively); swaddling band.
from חָתַל; enswathed; Chethlon, a place in Palestine; Hethlon.
a primitive root; to close up; especially to seal; make an end, mark, seal (up), stop.
(Aramaic) a root corresponding to חָתַם; to seal; seal.
feminine active participle of חָתַם; a seal; signet.
a primitive root; to give (a daughter) away in marriage; hence (generally) to contract affinity by marriage; join in affinity, father in law, make marriages, mother in law, son in law.
from חָתַן; a relative by marriage (especially through the bride); figuratively, a circumcised child (as a species of religious espousal); bridegroom, husband, son in law.
from חָתַן; a wedding; espousal.
a primitive root; to clutch; take away.
from חָתַף; properly, rapine; figuratively, robbery; prey.
a primitive root; to force a passage, as by burglary; figuratively, with oars; dig (through), row.

a primitive root; properly, to prostrate; hence, to break down, either (literally) by violence, or (figuratively) by confusion and fear; abolish, affright, be (make) afraid, amaze, beat down, discourage, (cause to) dismay, go down, scare, terrify.
from חָתַת; dismay; casting down.
the same as חֲתַת; Chathath, an Israelite; cathath. f
a primitive root; to rejoice; be glad
the same as טוֹב; good; fine, good.
from טוֹב and אֵל; pleasing (to) God; Tabeel, the name of a Syrian and of a Persian; Tabeal, Tabeel.
passive participle of טָבַל; properly, dyed, i.e. a turban (probably as of colored stuff); dyed attire.
from an unused root meaning to pile up; properly, accumulated; i.e. (by implication) a summit; middle, midst.
a primitive root; to slaughter (animals or men); kill, (make) slaughter, slay.
from טָבַח; properly, something slaughtered; hence, a beast (or meat, as butchered); abstractly butchery (or concretely, a place of slaughter); [idiom] beast, slaughter, [idiom] slay, [idiom] sore.
the same as טֶבַח; massacre; Tebach, the name of a Mesopotamian and of an Israelite; Tebah.
from טָבַח; properly, a butcher; hence, a lifeguardsman (because he was acting as an executioner); also a cook (usually slaughtering the animal for food); cook, guard.
(Aramaic) the same as טַבָּח; a lifeguardsman; guard.
feminine of טֶבַח and meaning the same; {properly, something slaughtered; hence, a beast (or meat, as butchered); abstractly butchery (or concretely, a place of slaughter)}; flesh, slaughter.
feminine of טַבָּח; a female cook; cook.
lemma טבְחַת missing vowel, corrected to טִבְחַת; from טִבְחָה; slaughter; Tibchath, a place in Syria; Tibhath.
a primitive root; to dip, to immerse; dip, plunge.
from טָבַל and יָהּ; Jah has dipped; Tebaljah, an Israelite; Tebaliah.
a primitive root; to sink; drown, fasten, settle, sink.
plural of טַבַּעַת; rings; Tabbaoth, one of the Nethinim; Tabaoth.
from טָבַע; properly, a seal (as sunk into the wax), i.e. signet (for sealing); hence (generally) a ring of any kind; ring.
from טוֹב and רִמּוֹן; pleasing (to) Rimmon; Tabrimmon, a Syrian; Tabrimmon.
probably of foreign derivation; Tebeth, the tenth Hebrew month; Tebeth.
of uncertain derivation; Tabbath, a place East of the Jordan; Tabbath.
or טָהֹר; from טָהֵר; pure (in a physical, chemical, ceremonial or moral sense); clean, fair, pure(-ness).
from טָהֵר; purity; pureness.

a primitive root; properly, to be bright; i.e. (by implication); to be pure (physical sound, clear, unadulterated; Levitically, uncontaminated; morally, innocent or holy); be (make, make self, pronounce) clean, cleanse (self), purge, purify(-ier, self).
from טָהֵר; literally brightness; ceremonially purification; clearness, glory, purifying.
feminine of טֹהַר; ceremonial purification; moral purity; [idiom] is cleansed, cleansing, purification(-fying).
a primitive root; to sweep away; sweep.
a primitive root,; to be (transitively, do or make) good (or well) in the widest sense; be (do) better, cheer, be (do, seem) good, (make) goodly, [idiom] please, (be, do, go, play) well.

from טוֹב; good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well); beautiful, best, better, bountiful, cheerful, at ease, [idiom] fair (word), (be in) favour, fine, glad, good (deed, -lier, -liest, -ly, -ness, -s), graciously, joyful, kindly, kindness, liketh (best), loving, merry, [idiom] most, pleasant, [phrase] pleaseth, pleasure, precious, prosperity, ready, sweet, wealth, welfare, (be) well(-favoured).
the same as טוֹב; good; Tob, a region apparently East of the Jordan; Tob.
from טוֹב; good (as a noun), in the widest sense, especially goodness (superlative concretely, the best), beauty, gladness, welfare; fair, gladness, good(-ness, thing, -s), joy, go well with.
xlit Ădônîyâhûw corrected to ʼĂdônîyâhûw; from טוֹב and אֲדֹנִיָּה; pleasing (to) Adonijah; Tob-Adonijah, an Israelite; Tob-adonijah.
or טוֹבִיָּהוּ; from טוֹב and יָהּ; goodness of Jehovah; Tobijah, the name of three Israelites and of one Samaritan; Tobiah, Tobijah.
a primitive root; to spin; spin.
a primitive root; to smear, especially with lime; daub, overlay, plaister, smut.
from an unused root meaning to go around or bind; a fillet for the forehead; frontlet.
a primitive root; to pitch over or reel; hence (transitively) to cast down or out; carry away, (utterly) cast (down, forth, out), send out.
from an unused root meaning to range in a regular manner; a row; hence, a wall; row.
(Aramaic) corresponding to צוּר; a rock or hill; mountain.
a primitive root; to pounce as a bird of prey; haste.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to טָוָה; hunger (as twisting); fasting.
a primitive root; to stretch a bow, as an archer; (bow-) shot.
xlit ṭuwchâh corrected to ṭuchâh; from טָחָה (or טוּחַ) in the sense of overlaying; (in the plural only) the kidneys (as being covered); hence (figuratively) the inmost thought; inward parts.
from טָחַן; a hand mill; hence, a millstone; to grind.
a primitive root; to grind meal; hence, to be aconcubine (that being their employment); grind(-er).
from טָחַן; a hand mill; hence (figuratively) chewing; grinding.
from an unused root meaning to burn; a boil or ulcer (from the inflammation), especially a tumorin the anus or pudenda (the piles); emerod.
from (the equiv. of) טוּחַ; mortar or plaster; daubing.
from an unused root meaning apparently to be sticky (rather perb. a demonstrative); from טוּא, through the idea of dirt to be swept away); mud or clay; figuratively, calamity; clay, dirt, mire.
(Aramaic) perhaps, by interchange, for a word corresponding to טִיט; clay; miry.
feminine of (an equivalent to) טוּר; a wall; hence, a fortress or a hamlet; (goodly) castle, habitation, palace, row.
from טָלַל; dew (as covering vegetation); dew.
(Aramaic) the same as טַל; {dew (as covering vegetation)}; dew.
a primitive root; properly, to cover with pieces; i.e. (by implication) to spot or variegate (as tapestry); clouted, with divers colours, spotted.
apparently from טָלָא in the (orig.) sense of covering (for protection); (compare טָלֶה); a lamb; lamb.
from the plural of טְלָא; lambs; Telaim, a place in Palestine; Telaim.
by variation for טְלָא; a lamb; lamb.
from טוּל; overthrow or rejection; captivity.
a primitive root; properly, to strew over, i.e. (by implication) to cover in or plate (with beams); cover.
(Aramaic) corresponding to טָלַל; to cover with shade; have a shadow.
from an unused root meaning to break up or treat violently; oppression; Telem, the name of a place in Idumaea, also of a temple doorkeeper; Telem.
from the same as חָרְגֹּל; oppressive; Talmon, a temple doorkeeper; Talmon.
a primitive root; to be foul, especially in a ceremial or moral sense (contaminated); defile (self), pollute (self), be (make, make self, pronounce) unclean, [idiom] utterly.
from טָמֵא; foul in a religious sense; defiled, [phrase] infamous, polluted(-tion), unclean.
from טָמֵא; religious impurity; filthiness, unclean(-ness).
a collateral form of טָמֵא; to be impure in a religious sense; be defiled, be reputed vile.
a primitive root; to hide (by covering over); hide, lay privily, in secret.
from an unused root probably meaning to weave; a basket (of interlaced osiers); basket.
a primitive root; to soil; defile.
a primitive root; to wander; causatively to lead astray; seduce.
a primitive root; to taste; figuratively, to perceive; [idiom] but, perceive, taste.
(Aramaic) corresponding to טָעַם; to taste; causatively to feed; make to eat, feed.
from טָעַם; properly, a taste, i.e. (figuratively) perception; by implication, intelligence; transitively, a mandate; advice, behaviour, decree, discretion, judgment, reason, taste, understanding.
(Aramaic) from טְעַם; compare טַעַם); properly, a taste, i.e.  ajudicial sentence; account, [idiom] to be commanded, commandment, matter.

(Aramaic) from טְעַם, and equivalent to טַעַם; properly, flavor; figuratively, judgment (both subjective and objective); hence, account (both subjectively and objectively); [phrase] chancellor, [phrase] command, commandment, decree, [phrase] regard, taste, wisdom.
a primitive root; to load a beast; lade.
a primitive root; to stab; thrust through.
from טָפַף (perhaps referring to the tripping gait of children); a family (mostly used collectively in the singular); (little) children (ones), families.
a primitive root; or perhaps a denominative from טֵפַח, from dandling on the palms; to flatten out or extend (as a tent); figuratively, to nurse achild (as promotive of growth); span, swaddle.
from טָפַח; a spread of the hand, i.e. a palm-breadth (not 'span' of the fingers); architecturally, a corbel (as a supporting palm); coping, hand-breadth.
from טָפַח (the same as טֵפַח); {a spread of the hand, i.e. a palm-breadth (not 'span' of the fingers); architecturally, a corbel (as a supporting palm)}; hand-breadth (broad).
from טָפַח; nursing; span long.
a primitive root; properly, to stick on as apatch; figuratively, to impute falsely; forge(-r), sew up.
of foreign derivation; a military governor; captain.
a primitive root; apparently; to trip (with short steps) coquettishly; mince.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to צָפַר, and meaning the same as צִפֹּרֶן; a finger-nail; also a hoof or claw; nail.
a primitive root; properly, apparently to be thick; figuratively, to be stupid; be fat.
probably from נָטַף; a dropping (of ointment); Taphath, an Israelitess; Taphath.
a primitive root; to drive on; figuratively, to follow close; continual.
(Aramaic) corresponding to טָרַד; to expel; drive.
a variation of טֶרֶם; not yet; before.
a primitive root; to overburden; weary.
from טָרַח; a burden; cumbrance, trouble.
from an unused root apparently meaning to be moist; properly, dripping; hence, fresh (i.e. recently made such); new, putrefying.
from an unused root apparently meaning to interrupt or suspend; properly, non-occurrence; used adverbially, not yet or before; before, ere, not yet.
a primitive root; to pluck off or pull to pieces; causatively to supply with food (as in morsels); catch, [idiom] without doubt, feed, ravin, rend in pieces, [idiom] surely, tear (in pieces).
from טָרַף; something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food; leaf, meat, prey, spoil.
from טָרַף; recently torn off, i.e. fresh; pluckt off.
feminine (collectively) of טֶרֶף; prey, i.e. flocks devoured by animals; ravin, (that which was) torn (of beasts, in pieces).
(Aramaic) from a name of foreign derivation; a Tarpelite (collectively) or inhabitants of Tarpel, a place in Assyria; Tarpelites. y
a primitive root; to desire; long.
a primitive root; to be suitable; appertain.
or יַאֲזַנְיָהוּ; from אָזַן and יָהּ; heard of Jah; Jaazanjah, the name of four Israelites; Jaazaniah. Compare יְזַנְיָה.
from אוֹר; enlightener; Jair, the name of four Israelites; Jair.
patronymically from יָאִיר; a Jairite or descendant of Jair; Jairite.
a primitive root; properly, to be slack, i.e. (figuratively) to be foolish; dote, be (become, do) foolish(-ly).

a primitive root (probably rather the same as יָאַל through the idea of mental weakness); properly, to yield, especially assent; hence (pos.) to undertake as an act of volition; assay, begin, be content, please, take upon, [idiom] willingly, would.

of Egyptian origin; a channel, e.g. a fosse, canal, shaft; specifically the Nile, as the one river of Egypt, including its collateral trenches; also the Tigris, as the main river of Assyria; brook, flood, river, stream.
a primitive root; to desist, i.e. (figuratively) to despond; (cause to) despair, one that is desperate, be no hope.
or יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ; from the same root as אֲשׁוּיָה and יָהּ; founded of Jah; Joshijah, the name of two Israelites; Josiah.
from אָתָה; an entry; entrance.
from the same as אֲתָרִים; stepping; Jeatherai, an Israelite; Jeaterai.
a primitive root; to bawl; cry out.
from יָבַל; produce, i.e. a crop or (figuratively) wealth; fruit, increase.
from בּוּס; trodden, i.e. threshing-place; Jebus, the original name of Jerusalem; Jebus.
xlit Yebûwçîy corrected to Yᵉbûwçîy; patrial from יְבוּס; a Jebusite or inhabitant of Jebus; Jebusite(-s).
from בָּחַר; choice; Jibchar, an Israelite; Ibhar.
from בִּין; intelligent; Jabin, the name of two Canaanitish kings; Jabin.
a primitive root; properly, to flow; causatively, to bring (especially with pomp); bring (forth), carry, lead (forth).
(Aramaic) corresponding to יָבַל; to bring; bring, carry.
from יָבַל; a stream; (water-) course, stream.
the same as יָבָל; Jabal, an antediluvian; Jabal.
from יָבַל; having running sores; wen.
from בָּלַע and עַם; devouring people; Jibleam, a place in Palestine; Ibleam.
a primitive root of doubtful meaning; used only as a denominative from יָבָם; to marry a (deceased) brother's widow; perform the duty of a husband's brother, marry.
from (the orig. of) יָבַם; a brotherin-law; husband's brother.
feminine participle of יָבַם; a sister-in-law; brother's wife, sister in law.
from בָּנָה and אֵל; built of God; Jabneel, the name of two places in Palestine; Jabneel.
from בָּנָה; a building; Jabneh, a place in Palestine; Jabneh.
from בָּנָה and יָהּ; built of Jah; Jibnejah, an Israelite; Ibneiah.
from בָּנָה and יָהּ; building of Jah; Jibnijah, an Israelite; Ibnijah.
probably from בָּקַק; pouring forth; Jabbok, a river east of the Jordan; Jabbok.
from בָרַךְ and יָהּ; blessed of Jah; Jeberekjah, an Israelite; Jeberechiah.

a primitive root; to be ashamed, confused or disappointed; also (as failing) to dry up (as water) or wither (as herbage); be ashamed, clean, be confounded, (make) dry (up), (do) shame(-fully), [idiom] utterly, wither (away).
from יָבֵשׁ; dry; dried (away), dry.
the same as יָבֵשׁ (also יָבֵישׁ; often with the addition of גִּלְעָד, i.e. Jabesh of Gilad); Jobesh, the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine; Jobesh (-Gilead).
from יָבֵשׁ; dry ground; dry (ground, land).
from the same as בֶּשֶׂם; fragrant; Jibsam, an Israelite; Jibsam.
a variation of יַבָּשָׁה; dry ground; dry land.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יַבֶּשֶׁת; dry land; earth.
from גָּאַל; avenger; Jigal, the name of three Israelites; Igal, Igeal.
a primitive root; to dig or plow; husbandman.
from יָגַב; a plowed field; field.
feminine from גָּבַהּ; hillock; Jogbehah, a place East of the Jordan; Jogbehah.
from גָּדַל and יָהּ; magnified of Jah; Jigdaljah, an Israelite; Igdaliah.
a primitive root; to grieve; afflict, cause grief, grieve, sorrowful, vex.
a primitive root (probably rather the same as יָגָה through the common idea of dissatisfaction); to push away; be removed.
from יָגָה; affliction; grief, sorrow.
from יָגֹר; fearful; afraid, fearest.
probably from גּוּר; a lodging; Jagur, a place in Palestine; Jagur.
from יָגַע; toil; hence, a work, produce, property (as the result of labor); labour, work.
from יָגַע; tired; weary.
from גָּלָה; exiled; Jogli, an Israelite; Jogli.
a primitive root; properly, to gasp; hence, to be exhausted, to tire, to toil; faint, (make to) labour, (be) weary.
from יָגַע; earnings (as the product of toil); that which he laboured for.
from יָגַע; tired; hence (transitive) tiresome; full of labour, weary.
feminine of יָגִיעַ; fatigue; weariness.
a primitive root; to fear; be afraid, fear.

(Aramaic) from a word derived from an unused root (meaning to gather) and a derivation of a root corresponding to שָׂהֵד; heap of the testimony; Jegar-Sahadutha, a cairn East of the Jordan; Jegar-Sahadutha.

a primitive word; in distinction from כַּף, the closed one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote (as follows); a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),; ([phrase] be) able, [idiom] about, [phrase] armholes, at, axletree, because of, beside, border, [idiom] bounty, [phrase] broad, (broken-) handed, [idiom] by, charge, coast, [phrase] consecrate, [phrase] creditor, custody, debt, dominion, [idiom] enough, [phrase] fellowship, force, [idiom] from, hand(-staves, -y work), [idiom] he, himself, [idiom] in, labour, [phrase] large, ledge, (left-) handed, means, [idiom] mine, ministry, near, [idiom] of, [idiom] order, ordinance, [idiom] our, parts, pain, power, [idiom] presumptuously, service, side, sore, state, stay, draw with strength, stroke, [phrase] swear, terror, [idiom] thee, [idiom] by them, [idiom] themselves, [idiom] thine own, [idiom] thou, through, [idiom] throwing, [phrase] thumb, times, [idiom] to, [idiom] under, [idiom] us, [idiom] wait on, (way-) side, where, [phrase] wide, [idiom] with (him, me, you), work, [phrase] yield, [idiom] yourselves.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יָד; {a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.)}; hand, power.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יָדָה; to praise; (give) thank(-s).
xlit Yidălâh corrected to Yidʼălâh; of uncertain derivation; Jidalah, a place in Palestine; Idalah.
from the same as דְּבַשׁ; perhaps honeyed; Jidbash, an Israelite; Idbash.
a primitive root; (compare יָדָה); properly, to handle, i.e. to throw, e.g. lots; cast.
from יְדִיד; properly, affection; concretely, a darling object; dearly beloved.

a primitive root; used only as denominative from יָד; literally, to use (i.e. hold out) the hand; physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands); cast (out), (make) confess(-ion), praise, shoot, (give) thank(-ful, -s, -sgiving).
from יָדָה; praised; Jiddo, an Israelite; Iddo.
from יָדָה; thankful; Jadon, an Israelite; Jadon.
from יָדַע; knowing; Jaddua, the name of two Israelites; Jaddua.
or יְדֻתוּן; or יְדִיתוּן; probably from יָדָה; laudatory; Jeduthun, an Israelite; Jeduthun.
from the same as דּוֹד; loved; amiable, (well-) beloved, loves.
feminine of יְדִיד; beloved; Jedidah, an Israelitess; Jedidah.
from יְדִיד and יָהּ; beloved of Jah; Jedidejah, a name of Solomon; Jedidiah.
from יָדָה and יָהּ; praised of Jah; Jedajah, the name of two Israelites; Jedaiah.
from יָדַע and אֵל; knowing God; Jediael, the name of three Israelites; Jediael.
from דָּלַף; tearful; Jidlaph, a Mesopotamian; Jidlaph.

a primitive root; to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.); acknowledge, acquaintance(-ted with), advise, answer, appoint, assuredly, be aware, (un-) awares, can(-not), certainly, comprehend, consider, [idiom] could they, cunning, declare, be diligent, (can, cause to) discern, discover, endued with, familiar friend, famous, feel, can have, be (ig-) norant, instruct, kinsfolk, kinsman, (cause to let, make) know, (come to give, have, take) knowledge, have (knowledge), (be, make, make to be, make self) known, [phrase] be learned, [phrase] lie by man, mark, perceive, privy to, [idiom] prognosticator, regard, have respect, skilful, shew, can (man of) skill, be sure, of a surety, teach, (can) tell, understand, have (understanding), [idiom] will be, wist, wit, wot.

(Aramaic) corresponding to יָדַע; {to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)}; certify, know, make known, teach.
from יָדַע; knowing; Jada, an Israelite; Jada.
from יָדַע and יָהּ; Jah has known; Jedajah, the name of two Israelites; Jedaiah.
from יָדַע; properly, a knowing one; specifically, a conjurer; (by impl) a ghost; wizard.
contraction for יְהֹוָה, and meaning the same; Jah, the sacred name; Jah, the Lord, most vehement. Compare names in '-iah,' '-jah.'
a primitive root; to give (whether literal or figurative); generally, to put; imperatively (reflexive) come; ascribe, bring, come on, give, go, set, take.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יָהַב; {to give (whether literal or figurative); generally, to put; imperatively (reflexive) come}; deliver, give, lay, [phrase] prolong, pay, yield.
from יָהַב; properly, what is given (by Providence), i.e. a lot; burden.
denominative from a form corresponding to יְהוּדlemma יְהיּד yod, corrected to יְהוּד; to Judaize, i.e. become Jewish; become Jews.
a briefer form of one corresponding to יְהוּדlemma יְהיּד yod, corrected to יְהוּד; Jehud, a place in Palestine; Jehud.
perhaps from a form corresponding to יְהוּדlemma יְהיּד yod, corrected to יְהוּד; Judaistic; Jehdai, an Israelite; Jehdai.
feminine of יְהוּדִי; Jehudijah, a Jewess; Jehudijah.
from יְהֹוָה and הוּא; Jehovah (is) He; Jehu, the name of five Israelites; Jehu.
from יְהֹוָה and אָחַז; Jehovah-seized; Jehoachaz, the name of three Israelites; Jehoahaz. Compare יוֹאָחָז.
from יְהֹוָה and (perhaps) אֵשׁ; Jehovah-fired; Jehoash, the name of two Israelite kings; Jehoash. Compare יוֹאָשׁ.
lemma יְהיּד yod, corrected to יְהוּד; (Aramaic) contracted from a form corresponding to יְהוּדָה; properly, Judah, hence, Judaea; Jewry, Judah, Judea.
(Aramaic) patrial from יְהוּדlemma יְהיּד yod, corrected to יְהוּד; a Jehudaite (or Judaite), i.e. Jew; Jew.
from יָדָה; celebrated; Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory; Judah.
patronymically from יְהוּדָה; a Jehudite (i.e. Judaite or Jew), or descendant of Jehudah (i.e. Judah); Jew.
the same as יְהוּדִי; Jehudi, an Israelite; Jehudi.
feminine of יְהוּדִי; the Jewish (used adverbially) language; in the Jews' language.
the same as יְהוּדִית; Jewess; Jehudith, a Canaanitess; Judith.
from הָיָה; (the) self-Existent or Eternal; Jehovah, Jewish national name of God; Jehovah, the Lord. Compare יָהּ, יְהֹוִה.
a variation of יְהֹוָה (used after אֲדֹנָי, and pronounced by Jews as אֱלֹהִים, in order to prevent the repetition of the same sound, since they elsewhere pronounce יְהֹוָה as אֲדֹנָי); {YHWH}; God.
xlit yireh corrected to yirʼeh; from יְהֹוָה and רָאָה; Jehovah will see (to it); Jehovah-Jireh, a symbolical name for Mount Moriah; Jehovah-jireh.
from יְהֹוָה and נֵס with the prononimal suffix; Jehovah (is) my banner; Jehovah-Nissi, a symbolical name of an altar in the Desert; Jehovah-nissi.
from יְהֹוָה and צֶדֶק with pronominal suffix; Jehovah (is) our right; Jehovah-Tsidkenu, a symbolical epithet of the Messiah and of Jerusalem; the Lord our righteousness.
from יְהֹוָה and שָׁלוֹם; Jehovah (is) peace; Jehovah-Shalom, a symbolical name of an altar in Palestine; Jehovah-shalom.
from יְהֹוָה and שָׁם with directive enclitic; Jehovah (is) thither; Jehovah-Shammah, a symbolic title of Jerusalem; Jehovahshammah.
from יְהֹוָה and זָבַד; Jehovah-endowed; Jehozabad, the name of three Israelites; Jehozabad. Compare יוֹזָבָד.
from יְהֹוָה and חָנַן; Jehovah-favored; Jehochanan, the name of eight Israelites; Jehohanan, Johanan. Compare יוֹחָנָן.
from יְהֹוָה and יָדַע; Jehovah-known; Jehojada, the name of three Israelites; Jehoiada. Compare יוֹיָדָע.
from יְהֹוָה and כּוּן; Jehovah will establish; Jehojakin, a Jewish king; Jehoiachin. Compare יוֹיָכִין.
from יְהֹוָה abbreviated and קוּם; Jehovah will raise; Jehojakim, a Jewish king; Jehoiakim. Compare יוֹיָקִים.
from יְהֹוָה and רִיב; Jehovah will contend; Jehojarib, the name of two Israelites; Jehoiarib. Compare יוֹיָרִיב.
from יָכֹל; potent; Jehukal, an Israelite; Jehucal. Compare יוּכַל.
from יְהֹוָה and נָדַב; Jehovah-largessed; Jehonadab, the name of an Israelite and of an Arab; Jehonadab, Jonadab. Compare יוֹנָדָב.
from יְהֹוָה and נָתַן; Jehovah-given; Jehonathan, the name of four Israelites; Jonathan. Compare יוֹנָתָן.
a fuller form of יוֹסֵף; Jehoseph (i.e. Joseph), a son of Jacob; Joseph.
from יְהֹוָה and עָדָה; Jehovah-adorned; Jehoaddah, an Israelite; Jehoada.
or יְהוֹעַדָּן; from יְהֹוָה and עָדַן; Jehovahpleased; Jehoaddin or Jehoaddan, an Israelitess; Jehoaddan.
from יְהֹוָה and צָדַק; Jehovah-righted; Jehotsadak, an Israelite; Jehozadek, Josedech. Compare יוֹצָדָק.
from יְהֹוָה and רוּם; Jehovah-raised; Jehoram, the name of a Syrian and of three Israelites; Jehoram, Joram. Compare יוֹרָם.
from יְהֹוָה and שָׁבַע; Jehovah-sworn; Jehosheba, an Israelitess; Jehosheba. Compare יְהוֹשַׁבְעַת.
a form of יְהוֹשֶׁבַע; Jehoshabath, an Israelitess; Jehoshabeath.
or יְהוֹשֻׁעַ; from יְהֹוָה and יָשַׁע; Jehovah-saved; Jehoshua (i.e. Joshua), the Jewish leader; Jehoshua, Jehoshuah, Joshua. Compare הוֹשֵׁעַ, יֵשׁוּעַ.
from יְהֹוָה and שָׁפַט; Jehovah-judged; Jehoshaphat, the name of six Israelites; also of a valley near Jerusalem; Jehoshaphat. Compare יוֹשָׁפָט.
probably from the same as הַר; elated; hence, arrogant; haughty, proud.
from הָלַל and אֵל; praising God; Jehallelel, the name of two Israelites; Jehalellel, Jehalelel.
from הָלַם (in the sense of hardness); a precious stone, probably onyx; diamond.
or יַהְצָה; or (feminine) יַהְצָה; from an unused root meaning to stamp; perhaps threshing-floor; Jahats or Jahtsah, a place East of the Jordan; Jahaz, Jahazah, Jahzah.
from יְהֹוָה and אָב; Jehovah-fathered; Joab, the name of three Israelites; Joab.
from יְהֹוָה and אָח; Jehovahbrothered; Joach, the name of four Israelites; Joah.
a form of יְהוֹאָחָז; Joachaz, the name of two Israelites; Jehoahaz, Joahaz.
from יְהֹוָה and אֵל; Jehovah (is his) God; Joel, the name of twelve Israelites; Joel.
or יֹאָשׁ; (2 Chronicles 24:1), a form of יְהוֹאָשׁ; Joash, the name of six Israelites; Joash.
perhaps a form of יוֹבָב, but more probably by erroneous transcription for יָשׁוּב; Job, an Israelite; Job.
from יָבַב; howler; Jobab, the name of two Israelites and of three foreigners; Jobab.

or יֹבֵל; apparently from יָבַל; the blast of a horn (from its continuous sound); specifically, the signal of the silver trumpets; hence, the instrument itself and the festival thus introduced; jubile, ram's horn, trumpet.
from יָבַל; a stream; river.
from יָבַל; stream; Jubal, an antediluvian; Jubal.
a form of יְהוֹזָבָד; Jozabad, the name of ten Israelites; Josabad, Jozabad.
from יְהֹוָה and זָכַר; Jehovah-remembered; Jozacar, an Israelite; Jozachar.
probably from יְהֹוָה and a variation of חָיָה; Jehovah-revived; Jocha, the name of two Israelites; Joha.
a form of יְהוֹחָנָן; Jochanan, the name of nine Israelites; Johanan.
a form of יְהוֹיָדָע; Jojada, the name of two Israelites; Jehoiada, Joiada.
a form of יְהוֹיָכִין; Jojakin, an Israelite king; Jehoiachin.
a form of יְהוֹיָקִים; Jojakim, an Israelite; Joiakim. Compare יוֹקִים.
a form of יְהוֹיָרִיב; Jojarib, the name of four Israelites; Joiarib.
from יְהֹוָה contracted and כָּבַד; Jehovah-gloried; Jokebed, the mother of Moses; Jochebed.
a form of יְהוּכַל; Jukal, an Israelite; Jucal.

from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, [phrase] always, [phrase] chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), [phrase] elder, [idiom] end, [phrase] evening, [phrase] (for) ever(-lasting, -more), [idiom] full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, [phrase] old, [phrase] outlived, [phrase] perpetually, presently, [phrase] remaineth, [idiom] required, season, [idiom] since, space, then, (process of) time, [phrase] as at other times, [phrase] in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), [idiom] whole ([phrase] age), (full) year(-ly), [phrase] younger.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יוֹם; a day; day (by day), time.
from יוֹם; daily; daily, (by, in the) day(-time).

probably from the same as יַיִן; effervescing (i.e. hot and active); Javan, the name of a son of Joktan, and of the race (Ionians, i.e. Greeks) descended from him, with their territory; also of a place in Arabia; Javan.
from the same as יַיִן; properly, dregs (as effervescing); hence, mud; mire, miry.
a form of יְהוֹנָדָב; Jonadab, the name of an Israelite and of a Rechabite; Jonadab.
probably from the same as יַיִן; a dove (apparently from the warmth of their mating); dove, pigeon.
xlit Yônâh corrected to Yôwnâh; the same as יוֹנָה; Jonah, an Israelite; Jonah.
patronymically from יָוֵן; a Jevanite, or descendant of Javan; Grecian.
active participle of יָנַק; a sucker; hence, a twig (of a tree felled and sprouting); tender plant.
feminine of יוֹנֵק; a sprout; (tender) branch, young twig.

from יוֹנָה and אֵלֶם and the plural of רָחוֹק; dove of (the) silence (i.e. dumb Israel) of (i.e. among) distances (i.e. strangers); the title of a ditty (used for a name of its melody); Jonath-elem-rechokim.
a form of יְהוֹנָתָן; Jonathan, the name of ten Israelites; Jonathan.
future of יָסַף; let him add (or perhaps simply active participle adding); Joseph, the name of seven Israelites; Joseph. Compare יְהוֹסֵף.
from active participle of יָסַף and יָהּ; Jah (is) adding; Josiphjah, an Israelite; Josiphiah.
perhaps feminine active participle of יַעַל; furthermore; Joelah, an Israelite; Joelah.
apparently the active participle of יָעַד; appointer; Joed, an Israelite; Joed.
from יְהֹוָה and עֵזֶר; Jehovah (is his) help; Joezer, an Israelite; Joezer.
from יְהֹוָה and עוּשׁ; Jehovahhastened; Joash, the name of two Israelites; Joash.
a form of יְהוֹצָדָק; Jotsadak, an Israelite; Jozadak.
a form of יוֹיָקִים; Jokim, an Israelite; Jokim.
active participle of יָרָה; sprinkling; hence, a sprinkling (or autumnal showers); first rain, former (rain).
from יָרָה; rainy; Jorah, an Israelite; Jorah.
from יָרָה; rainy; Jorai, an Israelite; Jorai.
a form of יְהוֹרָם; Joram, the name of three Israelites and one Syrian; Joram.
from שׁוּב and חֵסֵד; kindness will be returned; Jushab-Chesed, an Israelite; Jushab-hesed.
from יָשַׁב and יָהּ; Jehovah will cause to dwell; Josibjah, an Israelite; Josibiah.
probably a form of יוֹשַׁוְיָה; Joshah, an Israelite; Joshah.
from יְהֹוָה and שָׁוָה; Jehovah-set; Joshavjah, an Israelite; Joshaviah. Compare יוֹשָׁה.
a form of יְהוֹשָׁפָט; Joshaphat, an Israelite; Joshaphat.
from יְהֹוָה and תָּם; Jehovah (is) perfect; Jotham, the name of three Israelites; Jotham.
active participle of יָתַר; properly, redundant; hence, over and above, as adjective, noun, adverb or conjunction; better, more(-over), over, profit.
from an unused root (meaning to sprinkle) and אֵל; sprinkled of God; Jezavel, an Israelite; Jeziel (from the margin).
from the same as the first part of יְזַוְאֵל and יָהּ; sprinkled of Jah; Jizzijah, an Israelite; Jeziah.
from the same as זִיז; he will make prominent; Jaziz, an Israelite; Jaziz.
perhaps from an unused root (meaning to draw up); he will draw out; Jizliah, an Israelite; Jezliah.
or יְזַנְיָהוּ; probably for יַאֲזַנְיָה; Jezanjah, an Israelite; Jezaniah.
from an unused root mean to ooze; sweat, i.e. (by implication) a sweating dress; any thing that causeth sweat.
a variation for אֶזְרָחִי; a Jizrach (i.e. Ezrachite or Zarchite) or descendant of Zerach; Izrahite.
from זָרַח and יָהּ; Jah will shine; Jizrachjah, the name of two Israelites; Izrahiah, Jezrahiah.
from זָרַע and אֵל; God will sow; Jizreel, the name of two places in Palestine and of two Israelites; Jezreel.
patronymically from יִזְרְעֵאל; a Jizreelite or native of Jizreel; Jezreelite.
feminine of יִזְרְעֵאלִי; a Jezreelitess; Jezreelitess.
from חָבָה; hidden; Jechubbah, an Israelite; Jehubbah.
a primitive root; to be (or become) one; join, unite.
from יָחַד; properly, a unit, i.e. (adverb) unitedly; alike, at all (once), both, likewise, only, (al-) together, withal.
from יַחַד with pronominal suffix; his unity, i.e. (adverb) together; Jachdo, an Israelite; Jahdo.
from יַחַד and אֵל; unity of God; Jachdiel, an Israelite; Jahdiel.
from יַחַד and יָהּ; unity of Jah; Jechdijah, the name of two Israelites; Jehdeiah.
from חָזָה and אֵל; beheld of God; Jachaziel, the name of five Israelites; Jahaziel, Jahziel.
from חָזָה and יָהּ; Jah will behold; Jachzejah, an Israelite; Jahaziah.
from חָזַק and אֵל; God will strengthen; Jechezkel, the name of two Israelites; Ezekiel, Jehezekel.
or יְחִזְקִיָּהוּ; from יְרוּשָׁא and יָהּ; strengthened of Jah; Jechizkijah, the name of five Israelites; Hezekiah, Jehizkiah. Compare חִזְקִיָּה.
from the same as חֲזִיר; perhaps protection; Jachzerah, an Israelite; Jahzerah.
or (2 Chronicles 29:14) יְחַוְאֵל; from חָיָה and אֵל; God will live; Jechiel (or Jechavel), the name of eight Israelites; Jehiel.
patronymically from יְחִיאֵל; a Jechielite or descendant of Jechiel; Jehieli.
from יָחַד; properly, united, i.e. sole; by implication, beloved; also lonely; (feminine) the life (as not to be replaced); darling, desolate, only (child, son), solitary.
from חָיָה and יָהּ; Jah will live; Jechijah, an Israelite; Jehiah.
from יָחַל; expectant; should hope.
a primitive root; to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope; (cause to, have, make to) hope, be pained, stay, tarry, trust, wait.
from יָחַל and אֵל; expectant of God; Jachleel, an Israelite; Jahleel.
patronymically from יַחְלְאֵל; a Jachleelite or descendant of Jachleel; Jahleelites.
a primitive root; probably to be hot; figuratively, to conceive; get heat, be hot, conceive, be warm.
from חָמַר; a kind of deer; fallow deer.
probably from יָחַם; hot; Jachmai, an Israelite; Jahmai.
from an unused root meaning to take off the shoes; unsandalled; barefoot, being unshod.
from חָצָהlemma חָעָה ayin, corrected to חָצָה and אֵל; God will allot; Jachtseel, an Israelite; Jahzeel. Compare יַחְצִיאֵל.
patronymically from יַחְצְאֵל; a Jachtseelite (collectively) or descendants of Jachtseel; Jahzeelites.
from חָצָהlemma חָעָה ayin, corrected to חָצָה and אֵל; allotted of God; Jachtsiel, an Israelite; Jahziel. Compare יַחְצְאֵל.
a primitive root; to delay; tarry longer.
a primitive root; to sprout; used only as denominative from יַחַשׂ; to enroll by pedigree; (number after, number throughout the) genealogy (to be reckoned), be reckoned by genealogies.
from יָחַשׂ; a pedigree or family list (as growing spontaneously); genealogy.
from יָחַד; unity; Jachath, the name of four Israelites; Jahath.

a primitive root; to be (causative) make well, literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right); be accepted, amend, use aright, benefit, be (make) better, seem best, make cheerful, be comely, [phrase] be content, diligent(-ly), dress, earnestly, find favour, give, be glad, do (be, make) good(-ness), be (make) merry, please ([phrase] well), shew more (kindness), skilfully, [idiom] very small, surely, make sweet, thoroughly, tire, trim, very, be (can, deal, entreat, go, have) well (said, seen).
(Aramaic) corresponding to יָטַב; {to be (causative) make well, literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right)}; seem good.
from יָטַב; pleasantness; Jotbah, a place in Palestine; Jotbah.
from יׇטְבָה; Jotbathah, a place in the Desert; Jotbath, Jotbathah.
or יוּטָה; from נָטָה; extended; Juttah (or Jutah), a place in Palestine; Juttah.
probably from the same as טוּר; encircled (i.e. inclosed); Jetur, a son of Ishmael; Jetur.
from an unused root meaning to effervesce; wine (as fermented); by implication, intoxication; banqueting, wine, wine(-bibber).
by erroneous transcription for יָד; a hand or side; (way-) side.

a primitive root; to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict; appoint, argue, chasten, convince, correct(-ion), daysman, dispute, judge, maintain, plead, reason (together), rebuke, reprove(-r), surely, in any wise.
lemma יִכִין first vowel, corrected to יָכִין; from כּוּן; he (or it) will establish; Jakin, the name of three Israelites and of a temple pillar; Jachin.
patronymically from יָכִיןlemma יִכִין first vowel, corrected to יָכִין; a Jakinite (collectively) or descendants of Jakin; Jachinites.

or (fuller) יָכוֹל; a primitive root; to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might); be able, any at all (ways), attain, can (away with, (-not)), could, endure, might, overcome, have power, prevail, still, suffer.
(Aramaic) or יְכִיל; (Aramaic), to יָכֹל; {to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)}; be able, can, couldest, prevail.
and יְכׇלְיָהוּ; or (2 Chronicles 26:3) יְכִילְיָה; from יָכֹל and יָהּ; Jah will enable; Jekoljah or Jekiljah, an Israelitess; Jecholiah, Jecoliah.
and יְכׇנְיָהוּ; or (Jeremiah 27:20) יְכוֹנְיָה; from כּוּן and יָהּ; Jah will establish; Jekonjah, a Jewish king; Jeconiah. Compare כׇּנְיָהוּ.

a primitive root; to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage; bear, beget, birth(-day), born, (make to) bring forth (children, young), bring up, calve, child, come, be delivered (of a child), time of delivery, gender, hatch, labour, (do the office of a) midwife, declare pedigrees, be the son of, (woman in, woman that) travail(-eth, -ing woman).
from יָלַד; something born, i.e. a lad or offspring; boy, child, fruit, son, young man (one).
feminine of יֶלֶד; a lass; damsel, girl.
abstractly from יֶלֶד; boyhood (or girlhood); childhood, youth.
passive from יָלַד; born; born.
from לוּן; lodging; Jalon, an Israelite; Jalon.
from יָלַד; born; (home-) born, child, son.

a primitive root (compare הָלַךְ); to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses); [idiom] again, away, bear, bring, carry (away), come (away), depart, flow, [phrase] follow(-ing), get (away, hence, him), (cause to, made) go (away, -ing, -ne, one's way, out), grow, lead (forth), let down, march, prosper, [phrase] pursue, cause to run, spread, take away (-journey), vanish, (cause to) walk(-ing), wax, [idiom] be weak.
a primitive root; to howl (with a wailing tone) or yell (with a boisterous one); (make to) howl, be howling.
from יָלַל; a howl; howling.
feminine of יְלֵל; {a howl}; a howling.
a primitive root; to blurt or utter inconsiderately; devour.
from an unused root apparently meaning to stick or scrape; scurf or tetter; scabbed.
from an unused root meaning to lick up; a devourer; specifically, the young locust; cankerworm, caterpillar.
from לָקַט; a travelling pouch (as if for gleanings); scrip.

from an unused root meaning to roar; a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south; sea ([idiom] -faring man, (-shore)), south, west (-ern, side, -ward).

(Aramaic) corresponding to יָם; {a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south}; sea.
from the same as יוֹם; a warm spring; mule.
from יוֹם and אֵל; day of God; Jemuel, an Israelite; Jemuel.
perhaps from the same as יוֹם; properly, warm, i.e. affectionate; hence, dove (compare יוֹנָה); Jemimah, one of Job's daughters; Jemimah.
from יָמַן; the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south; [phrase] left-handed, right (hand, side), south.
the same as יָמִין; Jamin, the name of three Israelites; Jamin. See also בִּנְיָמִין.
for יָמִין; right; (on the) right (hand).
patronymically from יָמִין; a Jeminite (collectively) or descendants of Jamin; Jaminites. See also בֶּן־יְמִינִי.
or יִמְלָה; from מָלֵא; full; Jimla or Jimlah, an Israelite; Imla, Imlah.
from מָלַךְ; he will make king; Jamlek, an Israelite; Jamlech.

a primitive root; to be (physically) right (i.e. firm); but used only as denominative from יָמִין and transitive,; to be right-handed or take the right-hand side; go (turn) to (on, use) the right hand.
from יָמַן; prosperity (as betokened by the right hand); Jimnah, the name of two Israelites; also (with the article) of the posterity of one of them; Imna, Imnah, Jimnah, Jimnites.
from יָמַן; right (i.e. at the right hand); (on the) right (hand).
from מָנַע; he will restrain; Jimna, an Israelite; Imna.
a primitive root; to exchange; by implication, to change places; boast selves, change.
probably from יָמַר; interchange; Jimrah, an Israelite; Imrah.
a primitive root; to touch; feel.
a primitive root; to rage or be violent; by implication, to suppress, to maltreat; destroy, (thrust out by) oppress(-ing, -ion, -or), proud, vex, do violence.
from יָנַח; quiet; Janoach or Janochah, a place in Palestine; Janoah, Janohah.

a primitive root; to deposit; by implication, to allow to stay; bestow, cast down, lay (down, up), leave (off), let alone (remain), pacify, place, put, set (down), suffer, withdraw, withhold. (The Hiphil forms with the dagesh are here referred to, in accordance with the older grammarians; but if any distinction of the kind is to be made, these should rather be referred to נוּחַ, and the others here.)
from נוּם; asleep; Janim, a place in Palestine; Janum (from the margin).
from יָנַק; a sucker or sapling; young twig.
a primitive root; to suck; causatively, to give milk; milch, nurse(-ing mother), (give, make to) suck(-ing child, -ling).
or יַנְשׁוֹף; apparently from נָשַׁף; (compare נֶשֶׁף); an unclean (acquatic) bird; probably the heron (perhaps from its blowing cry, or because the nightheron is meant )); (great) owl.s

a primitive root; to set (literally or figuratively); intensively, to found; reflexively, to sit down together, i.e. settle, consult; appoint, take counsel, establish, (lay the, lay for a) found(-ation), instruct, lay, ordain, set, [idiom] sure.
from יָסַד; a foundation (figuratively, i.e. beginning); [idiom] began.
from יָסַד; a foundation (literally or figuratively); bottom, foundation, repairing
feminine of יְסֻד; a foundation; foundation.
from סוּר; departing; they that depart
from יָסַר; a reprover; instruct.
a primitive root; to pour (intransitive); be poured.
from an unused root meaning to watch; observant; Jiskah, sister of Lot; Iscah.
from סָמַךְ and יָהּ; Jah will sustain; Jismakjah, an Israelite; Ismachiah.

a primitive root; to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing); add, [idiom] again, [idiom] any more, [idiom] cease, [idiom] come more, [phrase] conceive again, continue, exceed, [idiom] further, [idiom] gather together, get more, give more-over, [idiom] henceforth, increase (more and more), join, [idiom] longer (bring, do, make, much, put), [idiom] (the, much, yet) more (and more), proceed (further), prolong, put, be (strong-) er, [idiom] yet, yield.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יָסַף; {to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)}; add.
a primitive root; to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct; bind, chasten, chastise, correct, instruct, punish, reform, reprove, sore, teach.
from יָעָה; a shovel; shovel.
from an unused root probably meaning to grieve; sorrowful; Jabets, the name of an Israelite, and also of a place in Palestine; Jabez.

a primitive root; to fix upon (by agreement or appointment); by implication, to meet (at a stated time), to summon (to trial), to direct (in a certain quarter or position), to engage (for marriage); agree,(maxke an) appoint(-ment, a time), assemble (selves), betroth, gather (selves, together), meet (together), set (a time).
from יָעַד; appointed; Jedi, an Israelite; Iddo (from the margin) See יִדּוֹ.
a primitive root; apparently; to brush aside; sweep away.
from יָעָה and אֵל; carried away of God; Jeuel, the name of four Israelites; Jehiel, Jeiel, Jeuel. Compare יְעִיאֵל.
from עוּץ; counsellor; Jeuts, an Israelite; Jeuz
a variation of יַעֲרֶשְׁיָה; a forest; wood.
apparently the passive participle of the same as יַעַר; wooded; Jaur, an Israelite; Jair(from the margin).
from עוּשׁ; hasty; Jeush, the name of an Edomite and of four Israelites; Jehush, Jeush. Compare יְעִישׁ.
a primitive root; to be bold or obstinate; fierce.
from יָעַז and אֵל; emboldened of God; Jaaziel, an Israelite; Jaaziel.
from יָעַז and יָהּ; emboldened of Jah; Jaazijah, an Israelite; Jaaziah.
lemma יַעֲזִיִר third vowel, corrected to יַעֲזֵיר; or יַעְזֵר; from עָזַר; helpful; Jaazer or Jazer, a place East of the Jordan; Jaazer, Jazer.
a primitive root; to clothe; cover.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יָעַץ; to counsel; reflexively, to consult; counsellor, consult together.
from יָעָה and אֵל; carried away of God; Jeiel, the name of six Israelites; Jeiel, Jehiel. Compare יְעוּאֵל.
from עוּשׁ; hasty; Jeish, the name of an Edomite and of a an Israelite; Jeush (from the margin). Compare יְעוּשׁ.
from the same as עָכָן; troublesome; Jakan, an Israelite; Jachan.
a primitive root; properly, to ascend; figuratively, to be valuable (objectively; useful, subjectively; benefited); [idiom] at all, set forward, can do good, (be, have) profit, (able).
from יַעַל; an ibex (as climbing); wild goat.
the same as יָעֵל; Jael, a Canaanite; Jael.
or יַעֲלָה; the same as יַעֲלָה or direct from יַעַל; Jaala or Jaalah, one of the Nethinim; Jaala, Jaalah.
feminine of יָעֵל; {an ibex (as climbing)}; roe.
from עָלַם; occult; Jalam, an Edomite; Jalam.

from an unused root meaning to pay attention; properly, heed; by implication, purpose (sake or account); used adverbially to indicate the reason or cause; because (that), forasmuch ([phrase] as), seeing then, [phrase] that, [phrase] wheras, [phrase] why.
from the same as יַעַן; the ostrich (probably from its answering cry; ostrich.
feminine of יָעֵן, and meaning the same; {the ostrich (probably from its answering cry}; [phrase] owl.
from the same as יָעֵן; responsive; Jaanai, an Israelite; Jaanai.
a primitive root; to tire (as if from wearisome flight); faint, cause to fly, (be) weary (self).
from יָעַף; fatigued; figuratively, exhausted; faint, weary.
from יָעַף; fatigue (adverb, utterly exhausted); swiftly.e
a primitive root; to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve; advertise, take advise, advise (well), consult, (give, take) counsel(-lor), determine, devise, guide, purpose.
from עָקַב; heel-catcher (i.e. supplanter); Jaakob, the Israelitish patriarch; Jacob.
from יַעֲקֹב; Jaakobah, an Israelite; Jaakobah.
from the same as עָקָן; Jaakan, an Idumaean; Jaakan. Compare בְּנֵי יַעֲקָן.
from an unused root probably meaning to thicken with verdure; a copse of bushes; hence, a forest; hence, honey in the comb (as hived in trees); (honey-) comb, forest, wood.
a form of יַעֲרָה; Jarah, an Israelite; Jarah.
feminine of יַעַר, and meaning the same; {a copse of bushes; hence, a forest; hence, honey in the comb (as hived in trees)}; (honey-) comb, forest.
from the plural of יַעַר and the masculine plural active participle of אָרַג; woods of weavers; Jaare-Oregim, an Israelite; Jaare-oregim.
plural of יַעַר; forests; Jearim, a place in Palestine; Jearim. Compare קִרְיַת יְעָרִים.
from an unused root of uncertain signification and יָהּ; Jaareshjah, an Israelite; Jaresiah.
from עָשָׂה; they will do; Jaasu, an Israelite; Jaasau.
from עָשָׂה and אֵל; made of God; Jaasiel, an Israelite; Jaasiel, Jasiel.
from פָּדָה and יָהּ; Jah will liberate; Jiphdejah, an Israelite; Iphedeiah.
a primitive root; properly, to be bright, i.e. (by implication) beautiful; be beautiful, be (make self) fair(-r), deck.
from יָפָה; beautiful (literally or figuratively); [phrase] beautiful, beauty, comely, fair(-est, one), [phrase] goodly, pleasant, well.
from יָפָה by reduplication; very beautiful; very fair.
xlit Yâphô corrected to Yâphôw; or יָפוֹא; (Ezra 3:7), from יָפָה; beautiful; Japho, a place in Palestine; Japha, Joppa.
a primitive root; properly, to breathe hard, i.e. (by implication) to sigh; bewail self.
from יָפַח; properly, puffing, i.e. (figuratively) meditating; such as breathe out.
from יָפָה; beauty; beauty.
from יָפַע; bright; Japhia, the name of a Canaanite, an Israelite, and a place in Palestine; Japhia.
from פָּלַט; he will deliver; Japhlet, an Israelite; Japhlet.
patronymically from יַפְלֵט; a Japhletite or descendant of Japhlet; Japhleti.
from פָּנָה; he will be prepared; Jephunneh, the name of two Israelites; Jephunneh.
a primitive root; to shine; be light, shew self, (cause to) shine (forth).
from יָפַע; splendor or (figuratively) beauty; brightness.
from פָּתָה; expansion; Jepheth, a son of Noah; also his posterity; Japheth.
from פָּתַח; he will open; Jiphtach, an Israelite; also a place in Palestine; Jephthah, Jiphtah.
from פָּתַח and אֵל; God will open; Jiphtach-el, a place in Palestine; Jiphthah-el.

a primitive root; to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.; [idiom] after, appear, [idiom] assuredly, bear out, [idiom] begotten, break out, bring forth (out, up), carry out, come (abroad, out, thereat, without), [phrase] be condemned, depart(-ing, -ure), draw forth, in the end, escape, exact, fail, fall (out), fetch forth (out), get away (forth, hence, out), (able to, cause to, let) go abroad (forth, on, out), going out, grow, have forth (out), issue out, lay (lie) out, lead out, pluck out, proceed, pull out, put away, be risen, [idiom] scarce, send with commandment, shoot forth, spread, spring out, stand out, [idiom] still, [idiom] surely, take forth (out), at any time, [idiom] to (and fro), utter.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יָצָא; {to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.}; finish.

a primitive root; to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue; present selves, remaining, resort, set (selves), (be able to, can, with-) stand (fast, forth, -ing, still, up).
lemma יְצב missing vowel, corrected to יְצַב; xlit yᵉtsêb corrected to yᵉtsab; (Aramaic) corresponding to יָצַב; to be firm; hence, to speak surely; truth.
a primitive root; to place permanently; establish, leave, make, present, put, set, stay.
from צָהַר; oil (as producing light); figuratively, anointing; [phrase] anointed oil.
the same as יִצְהָר; Jitshar, an Israelite; Izhar.
patronymically from יִצְהָר; a Jitsharite or descendant of Jitshar; Izeharites, Izharites.
passive participle of יַצַע; spread, i.e. a bed; (architecture) an extension, i.e. wing or lean-to (a single story or collectively); bed, chamber, couch.
from צָחַק; laughter (i.e. mochery); Jitschak (or Isaac), son of Abraham; Isaac. Compare יִשְׂחָק.
from the same as צַחַר; he will shine; Jitschar, an Israelite; and Zehoar (from the margin).
from יָצָא; issue, i.e. offspring; those that came forth.
(Aramaic) from יְצַבlemma יְצב missing vowel, corrected to יְצַבxlit yᵉtsêb corrected to yᵉtsab; fixed, sure; concretely, certainty; certain(-ty), true, truth.
a primitive root; to strew as a surface; make (one's) bed, [idiom] lie, spread.

a primitive root; properly, to pour out (transitive or intransitive); by implication, to melt or cast as metal; by extension, to place firmly, to stiffen or grow hard; cast, cleave fast, be (as) firm, grow, be hard, lay out, molten, overflow, pour (out), run out, set down, stedfast.
ytsukah; passive participle feminine of יָצַק; poured out, i.e. run into amould; when it was cast.
a primitive root; to press (intransitive), i.e. be narrow; figuratively, be in distress; be distressed, be narrow, be straitened (in straits), be vexed.

probably identical with יָצַר (through the squeezing into shape); (compare יַצַע); to mould into a form; especially as apotter; figuratively, to determine (i.e. form a resolution); [idiom] earthen, fashion, form, frame, make(-r), potter, purpose.
from יָצַר; a form; figuratively, conception (i.e. purpose); frame, thing framed, imagination, mind, work.
the same as יֵצֶר; Jetser, an Israelite; Jezer.
passive participle of יָצַר; structure, i.e. limb or part; member.ql
from יָצַר; formative; Jitsri, an Israelite; Isri.
; patronymically from יֵצֶר; a Jitsrite (collectively) or descendants of Jetser; Jezerites.
a primitive root; to burn or set on fire; figuratively, to desolate; burn (up), be desolate, set (on) fire (fire), kindle.

from an unused root meaning to excavate; a trough (as dug out); specifically, a wine-vat (whether the lower one, into which the juice drains; or the upper, in which the grapes are crushed); fats, presses, press-fat, wine(-press).
from קָבַץ and אֵל; God will gather; Jekabtseel, a place in Palestine; Jekabzeel. Compare קַבְצְאֵל.
a primitive root; to burn; (be) burn(-ing), [idiom] from the hearth, kindle.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יָקַד; {to burn}; burning.
(Aramaic) from יְקַד; a conflagration; burning.
from יָקַד and עַם; burning of (the) people; Jokdeam, a place in Palestine; Jokdeam.
from an unused root probably meaning to obey; obedient; Jakeh, a symbolical name (for Solomon); Jakeh.
from the same as יָקֶה; obedience; gathering, to obey.
from יָקַד; a burning; burning.
from קוּם; properly, standing (extant), i.e. by implication, a living thing; (living) substance.
from יָקֹשׁ; properly, entangling; hence, a snarer; fowler.
passive participle of יָקֹשׁ; properly, entangled, i.e. by implication (intransitively) a snare, or (transitive) a snarer; fowler, snare.
from the same as יָקֶה and אֵל; obedience of God; Jekuthiel, an Israelite; Jekuthiel.
from קָטֹן; he will be made little; Joktan, an Arabian patriarch; Joktan.
from קוּם; he will raise; Jakim, the name of two Israelites; Jakim. Compare יְהוֹיָקִים.
from יָקַר; precious; dear.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יַקִּיר; {precious}; noble, rare.
from קוּם and יָהּ; Jah will rise; Jekamjah, the name of two Israelites; Jekamiah. Compare יְהוֹיָקִים.
from קוּם and עַם; (the) people will rise; Jekamam, an Israelite; Jekameam. Compare יְהוֹיָקִים, יׇקְמְעָם.
from קוּם and עַם; (the) people will be raised; Jokmeam, a place in Palestine; Jokmeam. Compare יְקַמְעָם, יׇקְנְעָם.
from קוּן and עַם; (the) people will be lamented; Jokneam, a place in Palestine; Jokneam.

a primitive root; properly, to sever oneself, i.e. (by implication) to be dislocated; figuratively, to abandon; causatively, to impale (and thus allow to drop to pieces by rotting); be alienated, depart, hang (up), be out of joint.
a primitive root; to awake (intransitive); (be) awake(-d).
a primitive root; properly, apparently, to be heavy, i.e. (figuratively) valuable; causatively, to make rare (figuratively, to inhibit); be (make) precious, be prized, be set by, withdraw.
from יָקַר; value, i.e. (concretely) wealth; abstractly, costliness, dignity; honour, precious (things), price.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יְקָר; {value, i.e. (concretely) wealth; abstractly, costliness, dignity}; glory, honour.
from יָקַר; valuable (objectively or subjectively); brightness, clear, costly, excellent, fat, honourable women, precious, reputation.
a primitive root; to ensnare (literally or figuratively); fowler (lay a) snare.
from יָקֹשׁ; insidious; Jokshan, an Arabian patriarch; Jokshan.
probably from the same as יָקֶה and אֵל; veneration of God (compare יְקוּתִיאֵל); Joktheel, the name of a place in Palestine, and of one in Idumaea; Joktheel.

a primitive root; to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten; affright, be (make) afraid, dread(-ful), (put in) fear(-ful, -fully, -ing), (be had in) reverence(-end), [idiom] see, terrible (act, -ness, thing).
from יָרֵא; fearing; morally, reverent; afraid, fear (-ful).
feminine of יָרֵא; fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence; [idiom] dreadful, [idiom] exceedingly, fear(-fulness).
xlit Yirôwn corrected to Yirʼôwn; from יָרֵא; fearfulness; Jiron, a place in Palestine; Iron.
from יָרֵא and יָהּ; fearful of Jah; Jirijah, an Israelite; Irijah.
from רִיב; he will contend; Jareb, a symbolical name for Assyria; Jareb. Compare יָרִיב.
from רִיב and בַּעַל; Baal will contend; Jerubbaal, a symbolic name of Gideon; Jerubbaal.
from רִיב and עַם; (the) people will contend; Jarobam, the name of two Israelite kings; Jeroboam.
from רִיב and בֹּשֶׁת; shame (i.e. the idol) will contend; Jerubbesheth, a symbolic name for Gideon; Jerubbesheth.

a primitive root; to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications); [idiom] abundantly, bring down, carry down, cast down, (cause to) come(-ing) down, fall (down), get down, go(-ing) down(-ward), hang down, [idiom] indeed, let down, light (down), put down (off), (cause to, let) run down, sink, subdue, take down.
from יָרַד; a descent; Jered, the name of an antediluvian, and of an Israelite; Jared.
from יָרַד; a descender; Jarden, the principal river of Palestine; Jordan.

or (2 Chronicles 26:15) יָרָא; a primitive root; properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach; ([phrase]) archer, cast, direct, inform, instruct, lay, shew, shoot, teach(-er,-ing), through.
from יָרָה and אֵל; founded of God; Jeruel, a place in Palestine; Jeruel.
perhaps denominative from יָרֵחַ; (born at the) new moon; Jaroach, an Israelite; Jaroah.
from יָרָק; green, i.e. an herb; green thing.
or יְרוּשָׁה feminine passive participle of יָרַשׁ; possessed; Jerusha or Jerushah, as Israelitess; Jerusha, Jerushah.

rarely יְרוּשָׁלַיִם; a dual (in allusion to its two main hills (the true pointing, at least of the former reading, seems to be that of יְרוּשָׁלֵם)); probably from (the passive participle of) יָרָה and שָׁלַם; founded peaceful; Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine; Jerusalem.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם; {Jerusalem}; {Jerusalem}
from a unused root of uncertain signification; a lunation, i.e. month; month, moon.
the same as יֶרַח; Jerach, an Arabian patriarch; Jerah.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יֶרַח; a month; month.
from the same as יֶרַח; the moon; moon. Yrechow. See יְרִיחוֹ.
from רָחַם; compassionate; Jerocham, the name of seven or eight Israelites; Jeroham.
from רָחַם and אֵל; God will compassionate; Jerachmeel, the name of three Israelites; Jerahmeel.
patronymically from יְרַחְמְאֵל; a Jerachmeelite or descendant of Jerachmeel; Jerahmeelites.
probably of Egyptian origin; Jarcha, an Egyptian; Jarha.
a primitive root; to precipitate or hurl (rush) headlong; (intransitively) to be rash; be perverse, turn over.
from יָרָה and אֵל; thrown of God; Jeriel, an Israelite; Jeriel. Compare יְרוּאֵל.
from רִיב; literally he will contend; properly, adjective, contentious; used as noun, an adversary; that content(-eth), that strive.
the same as יָרִיב; Jarib, the name of three Israelites; Jarib.
from יָרִיב; contentious; Jeribai, an Israelite; Jeribai.
or יְרִיָּהוּ; from יָרָה and יָהּ; Jah will throw; Jerijah, an Israelite; Jeriah, Jerijah.
or יְרֵחוֹ; or variation (1 Kings 16:34) יְרִיחֹה; perhaps from יָרֵחַ; its month; or else from רוּחַ; fragrant; Jericho or Jerecho, a place in Palestine; Jericho.
or יְרֵימוֹת; or יְרֵמוֹת; feminine plural from רוּם; elevations; Jerimoth or Jeremoth, the name of twelve Israelites; Jermoth, Jerimoth, and Ramoth (from the margin).
from יָרַע; a hanging (as tremulous); curtain.
plural of יְרִיעָה; curtains; Jerioth, an Israelitess; Jerioth.
from an unused root meaning to be soft; the thigh (from its fleshy softness); by euphemistically the generative parts; figuratively, a shank, flank, side; [idiom] body, loins, shaft, side, thigh.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יְרֵכָה; a thigh; thigh.
feminine of יָרֵךְ; properly, the flank; but used only figuratively, the rear or recess; border, coast, part, quarter, side.
from רוּם; elevation; Jarmuth, the name of two places in Palestine; Jarmuth.
from רוּם; elevated; Jeremai, an Israelite; Jeremai.
or יִרְמְיָהוּ; from רוּם and יָהּ; Jah will rise; Jirmejah, the name of eight or nine Israelites; Jeremiah.
a primitive root; properly, to be broken up (with any violent action) i.e. (figuratively) to fear; be grevious (only Isaiah 15:4; the rest belong to רָעַע).
from רָפָא and אֵל; God will heal; Jirpeel, a place in Palestine; Irpeel.
a primitive root; to spit; [idiom] but, spit.
from יָרָק (in the sense of vacuity of color); properly, pallor, i.e. hence, the yellowish green of young and sickly vegetation; concretely, verdure, i.e. grass or vegetation; grass, green (thing).
from the same as יֶרֶק; properly, green; concretely, a vegetable; green, herbs.
from יֶרֶק; paleness, whether of persons (from fright), or of plants (from drought); greenish, yellow.
from רוּק and עַם; people will be poured forth; Jorkeam, a place in Palestine; Jorkeam.
from the same as יֶרֶק; yellowishness; greenish, yellow.

or יָרֵשׁ; a primitive root; to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin; cast out, consume, destroy, disinherit, dispossess, drive(-ing) out, enjoy, expel, [idiom] without fail, (give to, leave for) inherit(-ance, -or) [phrase] magistrate, be (make) poor, come to poverty, (give to, make to) possess, get (have) in (take) possession, seize upon, succeed, [idiom] utterly.
from יָרַשׁ; occupancy; possession.
from יָרַשׁ; something occupied; a conquest; also a patrimony; heritage, inheritance, possession.

perhaps from an unused root meaning to stand out, or exist; entity; used adverbially or as a copula for the substantive verb (הָיָה); there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection); (there) are, (he, it, shall, there, there may, there shall, there should) be, thou do, had, hast, (which) hath, (I, shalt, that) have, (he, it, there) is, substance, it (there) was, (there) were, ye will, thou wilt, wouldest.

a primitive root; properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry; (make to) abide(-ing), continue, (cause to, make to) dwell(-ing), ease self, endure, establish, [idiom] fail, habitation, haunt, (make to) inhabit(-ant), make to keep (house), lurking, [idiom] marry(-ing), (bring again to) place, remain, return, seat, set(-tle), (down-) sit(-down, still, -ting down, -ting (place) -uate), take, tarry.
from יָשַׁב and אָב; seat of (his) father; Jeshebab, an Israelite; Jeshebeab.
from the active participle of יָשַׁב and שֶׁבֶת, with a preposition and the article interposed; sitting in the seat; Joshebbash-Shebeth, an Israelite; that sat in the seat.
from יָשַׁב and נֹב, with a pronominal suffix and a preposition interposed; his dwelling (is) in Nob; Jishbo-be-Nob, a Philistine; Ishbi-benob (from the margin).
from שָׁבַח; he will praise; Jishbach, an Israelite; Ishbah.
patronymically from יָשׁוּב; a Jashubite, or descendant of Jashub; Jashubites.

from שׁוּב and לֶחֶם; returner of bread; Jashubi-Lechem, an Israelite; Jashubi-lehem. (Prob. the text should be pointed יֹשְׁבֵי לֶחֶם and rendered '(they were) inhabitants of Lechem,' i.e. of Bethlehem (by contraction). Compare לַחְמִי).
from שׁוּב and עַם; people will return; Jashobam, the name of two or three Israelites; Jashobeam.
from an unused root corresponding to שְׁבַק; he will leave; Jishbak, a son of Abraham; Ishbak.
from יָשַׁב and קָשֶׁה; a hard seat; Joshbekashah, an Israelite; Joshbekashah.
or יָשִׁיב; from שׁוּב; he will return; Jashub, the name of two Israelites; Jashub.
from שָׁוָה; he will level; Jishvah, an Israelite; Ishvah, Isvah.
from the same as יֶשַׁח and יָהּ; Jah will empty; Jeshochajah, an Israelite; Jeshoaiah.
from שָׁוָה; level; Jishvi, the name of two Israelites; Ishuai, Ishvi, Isui, Jesui.
patronymically from יִשְׁוִי; a Jishvite (collectively) or descendants of Jishvi; Jesuites.
for יְהוֹשׁוּעַ; he will save; Jeshua, the name of ten Israelites, also of a place in Palestine; Jeshua.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יֵשׁוּעַ; {Jeshua, the name of ten Israelites, also of a place in Palestine}; Jeshua.
feminine passive participle of יָשַׁע; something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity; deliverance, health, help(-ing), salvation, save, saving (health), welfare.
from an unused root meaning to gape (as the empty stomach); hunger; casting down.
from שַׁחֲצוֹם; he will laugh; Jischak, the heir of Abraham; Isaac. Compare יִצְחָק.
a primitive root; to extend; hold out.
by Aramaic אִישַׁי; from the same as יֵשׁ; extant; Jishai, David's father; Jesse.
or יִשִּׁיָּהוּ; from נָשָׁה and יָהּ; Jah will lend; Jishshijah, the name of five Israelites; Ishiah, Isshiah, Ishijah, Jesiah.
from שׂוּם and אֵל; God will place; Jesimael, an Israelite; Jesimael.
from יָשַׁם; desolation; let death seize (from the margin).
from יָשַׁם; a desolation; desert, Jeshimon, solitary, wilderness.
from יָשֵׁשׁ; an old man; (very) aged (man), ancient, very old.
from יָשִׁישׁ; aged; Jeshishai, an Israelite; Jeshishai.
a primitive root; to place; intransitively, to be placed; be put (set).
a primitive root; to lie waste; be desolate.
from יָשַׁם; desolate; Jishma, an Israelite; Ishma.
from שָׁמַע and אֵל; God will hear; Jishmael, the name of Abraham's oldest son, and of five Israelites; Ishmael.
patronymically from יִשְׁמָעֵאל; a Jishmaelite or descendant of Jishmael; Ishmaelite.
or יִשְׁמַעְיָהוּlemma יְשְׁמַעְיָהוּ first vowel, corrected to יִשְׁמַעְיָהוּ; from שָׁמַע and יָהּ; Jah will hear; Jishmajah, the name of two Israelites; Ishmaiah.
from שָׁמַר; preservative; Jishmerai, an Israelite; Ishmerai.
a primitive root; properly, to be slack or languid, i.e. (by implication) sleep (figuratively, to die); also to grow old, stale or inveterate; old (store), remain long, (make to) sleep.
from יָשֵׁן; sleepy; asleep, (one out of) sleep(-eth, -ing), slept.
the same as יָשֵׁן; Jashen, an Israelite; Jashen.
from יָשֵׁן; old; old.
feminine of יָשָׁן; Jeshanah, a place in Palestine; Jeshanah.

a primitive root; properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor; [idiom] at all, avenging, defend, deliver(-er), help, preserve, rescue, be safe, bring (having) salvation, save(-iour), get victory.
or יֵשַׁע; from יָשַׁע; liberty, deliverance, prosperity; safety, salvation, saving.
from יָשַׁע; saving; Jishi, the name of four Israelites; Ishi.
or יְשַׁעְיָהוּ; from יָשַׁע and יָהּ; Jah has saved; Jeshajah, the name of seven Israelites; Isaiah, Jesaiah, Jeshaiah.
from an unused root meaning to polish; a gem supposed to be jasper (from the resemblance in name); jasper.
perhaps from שָׁפָה; he will scratch; Jishpah, an Israelite; Ispah.
probably from the same as שָׁפָן; he will hide; Jishpan, an Israelite; Ishpan.

a primitive root; to be straight or even; figuratively, to be (causatively, to make) right, pleasant, prosperous; direct, fit, seem good (meet), [phrase] please (will), be (esteem, go) right (on), bring (look, make, take the) straight (way), be upright(-ly).
from יָשַׁר; the right; Jesher, an Israelite; Jesher.
from יָשַׁר; the right; equity, meet, right, upright(-ness).
from יָשַׁר; straight (literally or figuratively); convenient, equity, Jasher, just, meet(-est), [phrase] pleased well right(-eous), straight, (most) upright(-ly, -ness).
from שָׂרָה and אֵל; he will rule as God; Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity; Israel.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יִשְׂרָאֵל; {Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity}; Israel.
by variation from יָשָׁר and אֵל with directive enclitic; right towards God; Jesarelah, an Israelite; Jesharelah.
patronymically from יִשְׂרָאֵל; a Jisreelite or descendant of Jisrael; of Israel, Israelite.
feminine of יִשְׂרְאֵלִי; a Jisreelitess or female descendant of Jisrael; Israelitish.
feminine of יָשָׁר; rectitude; uprightness.
from יָשַׁר; upright; Jeshurun, a symbolic name for Israel; Jeshurun.
(strictly yis-saws-kawr'); from נָשָׂא and שָׂכָר; he will bring a reward; Jissaskar, a son of Jacob; Issachar.
from an unused root meaning to blanch; gray-haired, i.e. an aged man; stoop for age.
(Aramaic) corresponding to אֵת; a sign of the object of a verb; [phrase] whom.
xlit yᵉthiyb corrected to yᵉthib; (Aramaic) corresponding to יָשַׁב; to sit or dwell; dwell, (be) set, sit.
from an unused root meaning to pin through or fast; a peg; nail, paddle, pin, stake.
from an unused root meaning to be lonely; a bereaved person; fatherless (child), orphan.
passive participle of יָתַר; properly, what is left, i.e. (by implication) a gleaning; range.
from יָתַר; redundant; Jattir, a place in Palestine; Jattir.
(Aramaic) corresponding to יַתִּיר; preeminent; as an adverb, very; exceeding(-ly), excellent.
probably from תָּלָה; it will hang, i.e. be high; Jithlah, a place in Palestine; Jethlah.
from the same as יָתוֹם; orphanage; Jithmah, an Israelite; Ithmah.
from an unused root meaning to endure, and אֵל; continued of God; Jathniel, an Israelite; Jathniel.
lemma יְתְנָן first vowel, corrected to יִתְנָן; from the same as תַּנִּין; extensive; Jithnan, a place in Palestine; Ithnan.

a primitive root; to jut over or exceed; by implication, to excel; (intransitively) to remain or be left; causatively, to leave, cause to abound, preserve; excel, leave (a remnant), left behind, too much, make plenteous, preserve, (be, let) remain(-der, -ing, -nant), reserve, residue, rest.

from יָתַר; properly, an overhanging, i.e. (by implication) an excess, superiority, remainder; also a small rope (as hanging free); [phrase] abundant, cord, exceeding, excellancy(-ent), what they leave, that hath left, plentifully, remnant, residue, rest, string, with.
the same as יֶתֶר; Jether, the name of five or six Israelites and of one Midianite; Jether, Jethro. Compare יִתְרוֹ.
by variation for יִתְרָה; Jithra, an Israelite (or Ishmaelite); Ithra.
feminine of יֶתֶר; properly, excellence, i.e. (by implication) wealth; abundance, riches.
from יֶתֶר with pron. suffix; his excellence; Jethro, Moses' father-in-law; Jethro. Compare יֶתֶר.
from יָתַר; preeminence, gain; better, excellency(-leth), profit(-able).
patronymically from יֶתֶר; a Jithrite or descendant of Jether; Ithrite.
from יָתַר; excellent; Jithran, the name of an Edomite and of an Israelite; Ithran.
from יֶתֶר and עַם; excellence of people; Jithream, a son of David; Ithream.
feminine active participle of יָתַר; the lobe or flap of the liver (as if redundant or outhanging); caul.
of uncertain derivation; Jetheth, an Edomite; Jetheth. k
a primitive root; properly, to feel pain; by implication, to grieve; figuratively, to spoil; grieving, mar, have pain, make sad (sore), (be) sorrowful.
from כָּאַב; suffering (physical or mental), adversity; grief, pain, sorrow.
a primitive root; to despond; causatively, to deject; broken, be grieved, make sad.

or כָּבֵד; a primitive root; to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses); abounding with, more grievously afflict, boast, be chargeable, [idiom] be dim, glorify, be (make) glorious (things), glory, (very) great, be grievous, harden, be (make) heavy, be heavier, lay heavily, (bring to, come to, do, get, be had in) honour (self), (be) honourable (man), lade, [idiom] more be laid, make self many, nobles, prevail, promote (to honour), be rich, be (go) sore, stop.
from כָּבַד; weight, multitude, vehemence; grievousness, heavy, great number.
from כָּבַד; heavy; figuratively in a good sense (numerous) or in a bad sense (severe, difficult, stupid); (so) great, grievous, hard(-ened), (too) heavy(-ier), laden, much, slow, sore, thick.
the same as כָּבֵד; the liver (as the heaviest of the viscera); liver.
feminine of כָּבֵד; difficulty; [idiom] heavily.
a primitive root; to expire or (causatively) to extinguish (fire, light, anger); go (put) out, quench.
rarely כָּבֹד; from כָּבַד; properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness; glorious(-ly), glory, honour(-able).
irregular feminine passive participle of כָּבַד; weightiness, i.e. magnificence, wealth; carriage, all glorious, stately.
from the same as כֶּבֶל in the sense of limitation; sterile; Cabul, the name of two places in Palestine; Cabul.
from an unused root meaning to heap up; hilly; Cabon, a place in Palestine; Cabbon.
from כָּבַר in the original sense of plaiting; a matrass (of intertwined materials); pillow.
from כָּבַר; vast, whether in extent (figuratively, of power, mighty; of time, aged), or in number, many; [phrase] feeble, mighty, most, much, strong, valiant.
from an unused root meaning to twine or braid together; a fetter; fetter.
a primitive root; to trample; hence, to wash (properly, by stamping with the feet), whether literal (including the fulling process) or figurative; fuller, wash(-ing).
a primitive root; properly, to plait together, i.e. (figuratively) to augment (especially in number or quantity, to accumulate); in abundance, multiply.
from כָּבַר; properly, extent of time, i.e. a great while; hence, long ago, formerly, hitherto; already, (seeing that which), now.
the same as כְּבָר; length; Kebar, a river of Mesopotamia; Chebar. Compare חָבוֹר.
feminine of כְּבָר; properly, length, i.e. a measure (of uncertain dimension); [idiom] little.
from כָּבַר in its original sense; a sieve (as netted); sieve.
from an unused root meaning to dominate; a ram (just old enough to butt); lamb, sheep.
a primitive root; to tread down; hence, negatively, to disregard; positively, to conquer, subjugate, violate; bring into bondage, force, keep under, subdue, bring into subjection.
from כָּבַשׁ; a footstool (as trodden upon); footstool.
or כַּבְשָׂה; feminine of כֶּבֶשׂ; a ewe; (ewe) lamb.
from כָּבַשׁ; a smelting furnace (as reducing metals); furnace.
from an unused root meaning to deepen; properly, a pail; but generally of earthenware; a jar  for domestic purposes; barrel, pitcher.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to כָּזַב; false; lying.
from the same as כַּד in the sense of striking fire from a metal forged; a sparkling gem, probably the ruby; agate.
of foreign origin; Kedorlaomer, an early Persian king; Chedorlaomer.

from the prefix k and הוּא; properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now; also, here, + hitherto, like, on the other side, so (and much), such, on that manner, (on) this (manner, side, way, way and that way), + mean while, yonder.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כֹּה; {properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now}; hitherto.
a primitive root; to be weak, i.e. (figuratively) to despond (causatively, rebuke), or (of light, the eye) to grow dull; darken, be dim, fail, faint, restrain, [idiom] utterly.
from כָּהָה; feeble, obscure; somewhat dark, darkish, wax dim, heaviness, smoking.
feminine of כֵּהֶה; properly, a weakening; figuratively, alleviation, i.e. cure; healing.
(Aramaic) a root corresponding to and כּוּל; to be able; be able, could.

a primitive root, apparently meaning to mediate in religious services; but used only as denominative from כֹּהֵן; to officiate as a priest; figuratively, to put on regalia; deck, be (do the office of a, execute the, minister in the) priest('s office).
