active participle of כָּהַן; literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman); chief ruler, [idiom] own, priest, prince, principal officer.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כֹּהֵן; {one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)}; priest.
from כָּהַן; priesthood; priesthood, priest's office.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to לַהַג in the sense of piercing; a window (as a perforation); window.
of foreign derivation; Kub, a country near Egypt; Chub.
from an unused root meaning to be high or rounded; a helmet (as arched); helmet. Compare קוֹבַע.
a primitive root; properly, to prick or penetrate; hence, to blister (as smarting or eating into); burn.
from כָּוָה; a branding; burning.
probably from the same as כַּבּוֹן (in the sense of rolling) or כָּוָה (in the sense of blazing); a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince; star(-gazer).

a primitive root; properly, to keep in; hence, to measure; figuratively, to maintain (in various senses); (be able to, can) abide, bear, comprehend, contain, feed, forbearing, guide, hold(-ing in), nourish(-er), be present, make provision, receive, sustain, provide sustenance (victuals).
from an unused root meaning to store away; a jewel (probably gold beads); tablet.

a primitive root; properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous); certain(-ty), confirm, direct, faithfulness, fashion, fasten, firm, be fitted, be fixed, frame, be meet, ordain, order, perfect, (make) preparation, prepare (self), provide, make provision, (be, make) ready, right, set (aright, fast, forth), be stable, (e-) stablish, stand, tarry, [idiom] very deed.
probably from כּוּן; established; Kun, a place in Syria; Chun.
from כּוּן; something prepared, i.e. a sacrificial wafer; cake.
from כּוּן and יָהּ; Jah has sustained; Conanjah, the name of two Israelites; Conaniah, Cononiah. Compare כְּנַנְיָה.

from an unused root meaning to hold together; a cup (as a container), often figuratively, a lot (as if a potion); also some unclean bird, probably an owl (perhaps from the cup-like cavity of its eye); cup, (small) owl. Compare כִּיס.
from an unused root meaning properly, to dig through; a pot or furnace (as if excavated); furnace. Compare כִּיר.
from כּוּר and עָשָׁן; furnace of smoke; Cor-Ashan, a place in Palestine; Chorashan.
or (Ezra 1:1 (last time),2) כֹּרֶשׁ; from the Persians; Koresh (or Cyrus), the Persian king; Cyrus.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כּוֹרֶשׁ; {Koresh (or Cyrus), the Persian king}; Cyrus.
probably of foreign origin; Cush (or Ethiopia), the name of a son of Ham, and of his territory; also of an Israelite; Chush, Cush, Ethiopia.
patronymically from כּוּשׁ; a Cushite, or descendant of Cush; Cushi, Cushite, Ethiopian(-s).
the same as כּוּשִׁי; Cushi, the name of two Israelites; Cushi.
feminine of כּוּשִׁי; a Cushite woman; Ethiopian.
perhaps from כּוּשׁ; Cushan, a region of Arabia; Cushan.
apparently from כּוּשָׁן and the dual of רִשְׁעָה; Cushan of double wickedness; Cushan-Rishathajim, a Mesopotamian king; Chushan-rishathayim.
from כָּשֵׁר; prosperity; in plural freedom; [idiom] chain.
or (feminine) כּוּתָה; of foreign origin; Cuth or Cuthah, a province of Assyria; Cuth.
a primitive root; to lie (i.e. deceive), literally or figuratively; fail, (be found a, make a) liar, lie, lying, be in vain.
from כָּזַב; falsehood; literally (untruth) or figuratively (idol); deceitful, false, leasing, + liar, lie, lying.
from כָּזַב; fallacious; Cozeba, a place in Palestine; Choseba.
from כָּזַב; false; Cozbi, a Midianitess; Cozbi.
from כָּזַב; falsified; Kezib, a place in Palestine; Chezib.

or (Daniel 11:6) כּוֹחַ; from an unused root meaning to be firm; vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard; ability, able, chameleon, force, fruits, might, power(-ful), strength, substance, wealth.
a primitive root; to secrete, by act or word; hence (intensively) to destroy; conceal, cut down (off), desolate, hide.
a primitive root; to paint (with stibium); paint.
a primitive root; to be untrue, in word (to lie, feign, disown) or deed (to disappoint, fail, cringe); deceive, deny, dissemble, fail, deal falsely, be found liars, (be-) lie, lying, submit selves.
from כָּחַשׁ; literally a failure of flesh, i.e. emaciation; figuratively, hypocrisy; leanness, lies, lying.
from כָּחַשׁ; faithless; lying.
from כָּוָה; a brand or scar; burning.

a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet.
from a primitive root meaning to strike; a crushing; figuratively, calamity; destruction.
from the same as כִּיד (compare כַּדְכֹּד); properly, something struck off, i.e. a spark (as struck); spark.
from the same as כִּיד; (perhaps smaller than חֲנִיתlemma חֲניִת second vowel, corrected to חֲנִית); properly, something to strike with, i.e. a dart; lance, shield, spear, target.
the same as כִּידוֹן; Kidon, a place in Palestine; Chidon.
of uncertain derivation; perhaps tumult; battle.
from כּוּן; properly, a statue, i.e. idol; but used (by euphemism) forsome heathen deity (perhaps corresponding to Priapus or Baal-peor); Chiun.

or כִּיֹּר; from the same as כּוּר; properly, something round (as excavated or bored), i.e. a chafing-dish forcoals or a caldron forcooking; hence (from similarity of form) a washbowl; also (for the same reason) a pulpit or platform; hearth, laver, pan, scaffold.
or כֵּלַי; from כּוּל in the sense of withholding; niggardly; churl.
from an unused root meaning to clap or strike with noise; a club or sledge-hammer; hammer.
from the same as כּוּמָז; a cluster of stars, i.e. the Pleiades; Pleiades, seven stars.
a form for כּוֹס; a cup; also a bag formoney or weights; bag, cup, purse.
a form for כּוּר (only in the dual); a cooking range (consisting of two parallel stones, across which the boiler is set); ranges for pots.
from כָּשֵׁר; compare פֶּלֶךְ; literally a director, i.e. the spindle or shank of adistaff, by which it is twirled; spindle.
from כֹּה; just so, referring to the previous or following context; after that (this) manner, this matter, (even) so, in such a case, thus.

from כָּרַר; a circle, i.e. (by implication) a circumjacent tract or region, especially the Ghor or valley of the Jordan; also a (round) loaf; also a talent (or large [round] coin); loaf, morsel, piece, plain, talent.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כִּכָּר; a talent; talent.

or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever).

(Aramaic) corresponding to כֹּל; {properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)}; all, any, + (forasmuch) as, + be-(for this) cause, every, + no (manner, -ne), + there (where) -fore, + though, what (where, who) -soever, (the) whole.
a primitive root; to restrict, by act (hold back or in) or word (prohibit); finish, forbid, keep (back), refrain, restrain, retain, shut up, be stayed, withhold.
from כָּלָא; a prison; prison. Compare כִּלְאַיִם, כְּלִיא.
apparently from כָּלָא and אָב; restraint of (his) father; Kilab, an Israelite; Chileab.
dual of כֶּלֶא in the original sense of separation; two heterogeneities; divers seeds (-e kinds), mingled (seed).
from an unused root means. to yelp, or else to attack; a dog; hence (by euphemism) a male prostitute; dog.
perhaps a form of כֶּלֶב, or else from the same root in the sense of forcible; Caleb, the name of three Israelites; Caleb.
from כָּלֵב and אֶפְרָת; Caleb-Ephrathah, a place in Egypt (if the text is correct); Caleb-ephrathah.
probably by erroneous transcription for כָּלֵבִי; patronymically from כָּלֵב; a Calebite or descendant of Caleb; of the house of Caleb.

a primitive root; to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume); accomplish, cease, consume (away), determine, destroy (utterly), be (when... were) done, (be an) end (of), expire, (cause to) fail, faint, finish, fulfil, [idiom] fully, [idiom] have, leave (off), long, bring to pass, wholly reap, make clean riddance, spend, quite take away, waste.
from כָּלָה; pining; fail.
from כָּלָה; a completion; adverb, completely; also destruction; altogether, (be, utterly) consume(-d), consummation(-ption), was determined, (full, utter) end, riddance.
lemma כַּלָה missing dagesh, corrected to כַּלָּה; from כָּלַל; a bride (as if perfect); hence, a son's wife; bride, daughter-in-law, spouse.
xlit kᵉlûb corrected to kᵉlûwb; from the same as כֶּלֶב; a bird-trap (as furnished with a clap-stick or treadle to spring it); hence, a basket (as resembling a wicker cage); basket, cage.
the same as כְּלוּבxlit kᵉlûb corrected to kᵉlûwb; Kelub, the name of two Israelites; Chelub.
a form of כָּלֵב; Kelubai, an Israelite; Chelubai.
from כָּלָה; completed; Keluhai, an Israelite; Chelluh.
denominative passive participle from כַּלָּהlemma כַּלָה missing dagesh, corrected to כַּלָּה; bridehood (only in the plural); espousal.
from an unused root meaning to be complete; maturity; full (old) age.
the same as כֶּלַח; Kelach, a place in Assyria; Calah.
from כֹּל and חֹזֶה; every seer; Col-Chozeh, an Israelite; Col-hozeh.

from כָּלָה; something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon); armour(-bearer), artillery, bag, carriage, [phrase] furnish, furniture, instrument, jewel, that is made of, [idiom] one from another, that which pertaineth, pot, [phrase] psaltery, sack, stuff, thing, tool, vessel, ware, weapon, [phrase] whatsoever.
or כְּלוּא; from כְּלִי (compare כֶּלֶא); a prison; prison.
feminine of כְּלִי (only in the plural); a kidney (as an essential organ); figuratively, the mind (as the interior self); kidneys, reins.
a form of כִּלָּיוֹן; Kiljon, an Israelite; Chilion.
from כָּלָה; pining, destruction; consumption, failing.
from כָּלַל; complete; as noun, the whole (specifically, a sacrifice entirely consumed); as adverb, fully; all, every whit, flame, perfect(-ion), utterly, whole burnt offering (sacrifice), wholly.
from כּוּל; sustenance; Calcol, an Israelite; Calcol, Chalcol.
a primitive root; to complete; (make) perfect.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כָּלַל; to complete; finish, make (set) up.
from כָּלַל; complete; Kelal, an Israelite; Chelal.
a primitive root; properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult; be (make) ashamed, blush, be confounded, be put to confusion, hurt, reproach, (do, put to) shame.
of foreign derivation; Kilmad, a place apparently in the Assyrian empire; Chilmad.
from כָּלַם; disgrace; confusion, dishonour, reproach, shame.
from כְּלִמָּה; disgrace; shame.
or כַּלְנֵה; also כַּלְנוֹ; of foreign derivation; Calneh or Calno, a place in the Assyrian empire; Calneh, Calno. Compare כַּנֶּה.
a primitive root; to pine after; long.
from כָּמַהּ; pining; Kimham, an Israelite; Chimham.
or כָּמוֹ; (compare כֵּן); a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so; according to, (such) as (it were, well as), in comparison of, like (as, to, unto), thus, when, worth.
or (Jeremiah 48:7) כְּמִישׁ; from an unused root meaning to subdue; the powerful; Kemosh, the god of the Moabites; Chemosh.
from an unused root meaning to store up or preserve; 'cummin' (from its use as a condiment); cummin.
a primitive root; to store away, i.e. (figuratively) in the memory; lay up in store.
a primitive root; properly, to intertwine or contract, i.e. (by implication) to shrivel (as with heat); figuratively, to be deeply affected with passion (love or pity); be black, be kindled, yearn.
from כָּמַר; properly, an ascetic (as if shrunk with self-maceration), i.e. an idolatrous priest (only in plural); Chemarims (idolatrous) priests.
redupl. from כָּמַר; obscuration (as if from shrinkage of light, i.e. an eclipse (only in plural); blackness.

from כּוּן; properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles); [phrase] after that (this, -ward, -wards), as... as, [phrase] (for-) asmuch as yet, [phrase] be (for which) cause, [phrase] following, howbeit, in (the) like (manner, -wise), [idiom] the more, right, (even) so, state, straightway, such (thing), surely, [phrase] there (where) -fore, this, thus, true, well, [idiom] you.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כֵּן; so; thus.
the same as כֵּן, used as a noun; a stand, i.e. pedestal or station; base, estate, foot, office, place, well.
from כָּנַן in the sense of fastening; (from infixing its sting; used only in plural (and irregular in Exodus 8:17,18; Hebrews 13:14)); a gnat; lice, [idiom] manner.
a primitive root; to address by an additional name; hence, to eulogize; give flattering titles, surname (himself).
for כַּלְנֶה; Canneh, a place in Assyria; Canneh.
from כָּנַן; a plant (as set); [idiom] vineyard.
from a unused root meaning to twang; a harp; harp.
for יְכׇנְיָה; Conjah, an Israelite king; Coniah.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כְּמוֹ; so or thus; so, (in) this manner (sort), thus.
a primitive root; to set out, i.e. plant; [idiom] vineyard.
from כָּנַן; planted; Kenani, an Israelite; Chenani.
or כְּנַנְיָהוּ; from כָּנַן and יָהּ; Jah has planted; Kenanjah, an Israelite; Chenaniah.
a primitive root; to collect; hence, to enfold; gather (together), heap up, wrap self.
a primitive root; properly, to bend the knee; hence, to humiliate, vanquish; bring down (low), into subjection, under, humble (self), subdue.
from כָּנַע in the sense of folding (compare כָּנַס); a package; wares.
from כָּנַע; humiliated; Kenaan, a son a Ham; also the country inhabited by him; Canaan, merchant, traffick.
feminine of כְּנַעַן; Kenaanah, the name of two Israelites; Chenaanah.

patrial from כְּנַעַן; a Kenaanite or inhabitant of Kenaan; by implication, a pedlar (the Canaanites standing for their neighbors the Ishmaelites, who conducted mercantile caravans); Canaanite, merchant, trafficker.
a primitive root; properly, to project laterally, i.e. probably (reflexive) to withdraw; be removed.

from כָּנַף; an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle; [phrase] bird, border, corner, end, feather(-ed), [idiom] flying, [phrase] (one an-) other, overspreading, [idiom] quarters, skirt, [idiom] sort, uttermost part, wing(-ed).

or כִּנֶּרֶתlemma כִּנֶרֶת missing dagesh, corrected to כִּנֶּרֶת; respectively plural and singular feminine from the same as כִּנּוֹר; perhaps harp-shaped; Kinneroth or Kinnereth, a place in Palestine; Chinnereth, Chinneroth, Cinneroth.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כָּנַס; to assemble; gather together.
from כָּנָה; a colleague (as having the same title); companion.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כְּנָת; {a colleague (as having the same title)}; companion.
apparently a contraction for כִּסֵּא, but probably by erroneous transcription for נֵס; {a flag; also a sail; by implication, a flagstaff; generally a signal; figuratively, a token}; sworn.
or כֶּסֶה; apparently from כָּסָה; properly, fulness or the full moon, i.e. its festival; (time) appointed.
or כִּסֵּה; from כָּסָה; properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied); seat, stool, throne.
for כַּשְׂדִּי; {a Kasdite, or descendant of Kesed; by implication, a Chaldaean (as if so descended); also an astrologer (as if proverbial of that people}; Chaldean.

a primitive root; properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy); clad self, close, clothe, conceal, cover (self), (flee to) hide, overwhelm. Compare כָּשָׂה.
passive participle of כָּסָה; properly, covered, i.e. (as noun) a covering; covering.
from כָּסָה; a cover (garment); figuratively, a veiling; covering, raiment, vesture.
a primitive root; to cut off; cut down (up).
from כָּסַל; properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly; fool(-ish).
the same as כְּסִיל; any notable constellation; specifically Orion (as if a burly one); constellation, Orion.
the same as כְּסִיל; Kesil, a place in Palestine; Chesil.
from כְּסִיל; silliness; foolish.
a primitive root; properly, to be fat, i.e. (figuratively) silly; be foolish.

from כָּסַל; properly, fatness, i.e. by implication (literally) the loin (as the seat of the leaf fat) or (generally) the viscera; also (figuratively) silliness or (in a good sense) trust; confidence, flank, folly, hope, loin.
lemma כְּסִלָה first two vowels, corrected to כִּסְלָה; feminine of כֶּסֶל; in a good sense, trust; in a bad one, silliness; confidence, folly.
probably of foreign origin; Kisleu, the 9th Hebrew month; Chisleu.
from כָּסַל; hopeful; Kislon, an Israelite; Chislon.
from כָּסַל; fertile; Kesalon, a place in Palestine; Chesalon.
feminine plural of passive participle of כָּסַל; fattened; Kesulloth, a place in Palestine; Chesulloth.
a plural probably of foreign derivation; Casluchim, a people cognate to the Egyptians; Casluhim.
from the feminine plural of כֶּסֶל and תָּבוֹר; flanks of Tabor; Kisloth-Tabor, a place in Palestine; Chisloth-tabor.
a primitive root; to shear; [idiom] only, poll. Compare כִּרְסֵם.
from כָּסַם; spelt (from its bristliness as if just shorn); fitches, rie.
a primitive root; to estimate; make count.
a primitive root; properly, to become pale, i.e. (by implication) to pine after; also to fear; (have) desire, be greedy, long, sore.
from כָּסַף; silver (from its pale color); by implication, money; money, price, silver(-ling).
(Aramaic) corresponding to כֶּסֶף; {silver (from its pale color); by implication, money}; money, silver.
perhaps from כֶּסֶף; silvery; Casiphja, a place in Babylon; Casiphia.
from כָּסָה; a cushion or pillow (as covering a seat or bed); pillow.
(Aramaic) probably from כֵּן; now; now.
(Aramaic) or כְּעֶת; (Aramaic), feminine of כְּעַן; thus (only in the formula 'and so forth'); at such a time.
a primitive root; to trouble; by implication, to grieve, rage, be indignant; be angry, be grieved, take indignation, provoke (to anger, unto wrath), have sorrow, vex, be wroth.
or (in Job) כַּעַשׂ; from כַּעַס; vexation; anger, angry, grief, indignation, provocation, provoking, [idiom] sore, sorrow, spite, wrath.

from כָּפַף; the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power; branch, [phrase] foot, hand((-ful), -dle, (-led)), hollow, middle, palm, paw, power, sole, spoon.
from כָּפַף; a hollow rock; rock.
a primitive root; properly, to bend, i.e. (figuratively) to tame or subdue; pacify.
feminine of כַּף; a leaf of a palmtree; branch.
from כָּפַר; properly, a cover, i.e. (by implication) a tankard (or covered goblet); also white frost (as covering the ground); bason, hoar(-y) frost.
from an unused root meaning to connect; a girder; beam.
from כָּפַר; a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane); (young) lion, village. Compare כָּפָר.
feminine of כְּפִיר; the village (always with the art.); Kephirah, a place in Palestine; Chephirah.
a primitive root; to fold together; figuratively, to repeat; double.
from כָּפַל; a duplicate; double.
a primitive root; to bend; bend.
from כָּפַן; hunger (as making to stoop with emptiness and pain); famine.
a primitive root; to curve; bow down (self).

a primitive root; to cover (specifically with bitumen); figuratively, to expiate or condone, to placate or cancel; appease, make (an atonement, cleanse, disannul, forgive, be merciful, pacify, pardon, purge (away), put off, (make) reconcile(-liation).
from כָּפַר; a village (as protected by walls); village. Compare כְּפִיר.

from כָּפַר; properly, a cover, i.e. (literally) a village (as covered in); (specifically) bitumen (as used for coating), and the henna plant (as used for dyeing); figuratively, a redemption-price; bribe, camphire, pitch, ransom, satisfaction, sum of money, village.
from כָּפַר; expiation (only in plural); atonement.
from כָּפָר and עַמּוֹנִי, with the article interposed; village of the Ammonite; Kefar-ha-Ammoni, a place in Palestine; Chefarhaamonai.
from כָּפַר; a lid (used only of the cover of the sacred Ark); mercy seat.
a primitive root; to tread down; figuratively, to humiliate; cover.
(Aramaic) a root of uncertain correspondence; to fetter; bind.

or (Amos 9:1) כַּפְתּוֹר; probably from an unused root meaning to encircle; a chaplet; but used only in an architectonic sense, i.e. the capital of acolumn, or a wreath-like button or disk on the candelabrum; knop, (upper) lintel.
or (Amos 9:7) כַּפְתּוֹר; apparently the same as כַּפְתֹּר; Caphtor (i.e. a wreath-shaped island), the original seat of the Philistines; Caphtor.
patrial from כַּפְתֹּר; a Caphtorite (collectively) or native of Caphtor; Caphthorim, Caphtorim(-s).

from כָּרַר in the sense of plumpness; a ram (as full-grown and fat), including a battering-ram (as butting); hence, a meadow (as for sheep); also a pad or camel's saddle (as puffed out); captain, furniture, lamb, (large) pasture, ram. See also בֵּית כַּר, כָּרִי.
from the same as כּוּר; properly, a deep round vessel, i.e. (specifically) a cor or measure for things dry; cor, measure. Aramaic the same.
(Aramaic) probably corresponding to כָּרָה in the sense of piercing(figuratively); to grieve; be grieved.
from the same as כֶּבֶל; to gird or clothe; clothed.
(Aramaic) from a verb corresponding to that of כַּרְבֵּל; a mantle; hat.
a primitive root; properly, to dig; figuratively, to plot; generally, to bore or open; dig, [idiom] make (a banquet), open.
usually assigned as a primitive root, but probably only a special application of כָּרָה (through the common idea of planning implied in a bargain); to purchase; buy, prepare.
from כָּרָה; a purchase; provision.
feminine of כַּר; a meadow; cottage.
of uncertain derivation; a cherub or imaginary figure; cherub, (plural) cherubims.
the same as כְּרוּב; Kerub, a place in Babylon; Cherub.
(Aramaic) from כְּרַז; a herald; herald.
(Aramaic) probably of Greek origin; to proclaim; make a proclamation.
perhaps an abridged plural of כַּר in the sense of leader (of the flock); a life-guardsman; captains, Cherethites (from the margin).
from כָּרַת; a cut; Kerith, a brook of Palestine; Cherith.
from כָּרַת; a cutting (of the matrimonial bond), i.e. divorce; divorce(-ment).
expanded from the same as כַּבּוֹן; a rim or top margin; compass.
probably of foreign origin; the crocus; saffron.
of foreign derivation; Karkemish, a place in Syria; Carchemish.
of Persian origin; Karkas, a eunuch of Xerxes; Carcas.
from כָּרַר; a dromedary (from its rapid motion as if dancing); swift beast.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a garden or vineyard; vines, (increase of the) vineyard(-s), vintage. See also בֵּית הַכֶּרֶם.
active participle of an imaginary denominative from כֶּרֶם; a vinedresser; vine dresser (as one or two words).
from כֶּרֶם; gardener; Karmi, the name of three Israelites; Carmi.
patronymically from כַּרְמִי; a Karmite or descendant of Karmi; Carmites.
probably of foreign origin; carmine, a deep red; crimson.
from כֶּרֶם; a planted field (garden, orchard, vineyard or park); by implication, garden produce; full (green) ears (of corn), fruitful field (place), plentiful (field).
the same as כַּרְמֶל; Karmel, the name of a hill and of a town in Palestine; Carmel, fruitful (plentiful) field, (place).
patron from כַּרְמֶל; a Karmelite or inhabitant of Karmel (the town); Carmelite.
feminine of כַּרְמְלִי; a Karmelitess or female inhabitant of Karmel; Carmelitess.
of uncertain derivation; Keran, an aboriginal Idumaean; Cheran.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כִּסֵּא; a throne; throne.
from כָּסַם; to lay waste; waste.

a primitive root; to bend the knee; by implication, to sink, to prostrate; bow (down, self), bring down (low), cast down, couch, fall, feeble, kneeling, sink, smite (stoop) down, subdue, [idiom] very.
from כָּרַע; the leg (from the knee to the ankle) of men or locusts (only in the dual); leg.
of foreign origin; byssus or fine vegetable wool; green.
a primitive root; to dance (i.e. whirl); dance(-ing).
by variation from קָרַס; the paunch or belly (as swelling out); belly.
of foreign origin; Karshena, a courtier of Xerxes; Carshena.

a primitive root; to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces); be chewed, be con-(feder-) ate, covenant, cut (down, off), destroy, fail, feller, be freed, hew (down), make a league (covenant), [idiom] lose, perish, [idiom] utterly, [idiom] want.
passive participle feminine of כָּרַת; something cut, i.e. a hewn timber; beam.
probably from כָּרַת in the sense of executioner; (compare טַבָּח) (only collectively in the singular as plural); a Kerethite or life-guardsman; Cherethims, Cherethites.
apparently by transposition for כֶּבֶשׂ; a young sheep; lamb.
feminine of כֶּשֶׂב; a young ewe; lamb.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Kesed, a relative of Abraham; Chesed.

(occasionally with enclitic) כַּשְׂדִּימָה; towards the Kasdites into Chaldea), patronymically from כֶּשֶׂד (only in the plural); a Kasdite, or descendant of Kesed; by implication, a Chaldaean (as if so descended); also an astrologer (as if proverbial of that people; Chaldeans, Chaldees, inhabitants of Chaldea.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כַּשְׂדִּי; a Chaldaean or inhabitant of Chaldaea; by implication, a Magian or professional astrologer; Chaldean.
a primitive root; to grow fat (i.e. be covered with flesh); be covered. Compare כָּסָה.
from כָּשַׁל; properly, a feller, i.e. an axe; ax.

a primitive root; to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall; bereave (from the margin), cast down, be decayed, (cause to) fail, (cause, make to) fall (down, -ing), feeble, be (the) ruin(-ed, of), (be) overthrown, (cause to) stumble, [idiom] utterly, be weak.
from כָּשַׁל; properly, a tottering, i.e. ruin; fall.
a primitive root; properly, to whisper aspell, i.e. to inchant or practise magic; sorcerer, (use) witch(-craft).
from כָּשַׁף; magic; sorcery, witchcraft.
from כָּשַׁף; a magician; sorcerer.
a primitive root properly, to be straight or right; by implication, to be acceptable; also to succeed or prosper; direct, be right, prosper.
from כָּשֵׁר; success, advantage; equity, good, right.
a primitive root; to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe); describe, record, prescribe, subscribe, write(-ing, -ten).
(Aramaic) corresponding to כָּתַב; {to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)}; write(-ten).
from כָּתַב; something written, i.e. a writing, record or book; register, scripture, writing.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כָּתָב; {something written, i.e. a writing, record or book}; prescribing, writing(-ten).
from כָּתַב; a letter or other mark branded on the skin; [idiom] any (mark).

or כִּתִּיִּי; patrial from an unused name denoting Cyprus (only in the plural); a Kittite or Cypriote; hence, an islander in general, i.e. the Greeks or Romans on the shores opposite Palestine; Chittim, Kittim.
from כָּתַת; beaten, i.e. pure (oil); beaten.
from an unused root meaning to compact; a wall (as gathering inmates); wall.
(Aramaic) corresponding to כֹּתֶל; {a wall (as gathering inmates)}; wall.
lemma כְּתִלִישׁ first two vowels, corrected to כִּתְלִישׁ; from כֹּתֶל and אִישׁ; wall of a man; Kithlish, a place in Palestine; Kithlish.
a primitive root; properly, to carve or engrave, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe indelibly; mark.
from כָּתַם; properly, something carved out, i.e. ore; hence, gold (pure as originally mined); ((most) fine, pure) gold(-en wedge).
or כֻּתֹּנֶת; from an unused root meaning to cover (compare כָּתֵף); a shirt; coat, garment, robe.

from an unused root meaning to clothe; the shoulder (proper, i.e. upper end of the arm; as being the spot where the garments hang); figuratively, side-piece or lateral projection of anything; arm, corner, shoulder(-piece), side, undersetter.
a primitive root; to enclose; hence (in a friendly sense) to crown, (in a hostile one) to besiege; also to wait (as restraining oneself); beset round, compass about, be crowned inclose round, suffer.
from כָּתַר; properly, a circlet, i.e. a diadem; crown.
feminine active participle of כָּתַר; the capital of a column; chapiter.
a primitive root; to butt or pound; bray.
a primitive root; to bruise or violently strike; beat (down, to pieces), break in pieces, crushed, destroy, discomfit, smite, stamp. l

or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; [idiom] before, [phrase] or else, ere, [phrase] except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), ([idiom] as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, [phrase] surely, [phrase] as truly as, [phrase] of a truth, [phrase] verily, for want, [phrase] whether, without.
(Aramaic) or לָה; (Aramaic) (Daniel 4:32), corresponding to לֹא; {not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no;}; or even, neither, no(-ne, -r), (can-) not, as nothing, without.
or לוֹ דבַר; (Samuel 9:4,5), or לִדְבִר; (Joshua 13:26), (probably rather לֹדְבַר ); from לֹא and דֹּבֶר; pastureless; Lo-Debar, a place in Palestine; Debir, Lodebar.
a primitive root; to tire; (figuratively) to be (or make) disgusted; faint, grieve, lothe, (be, make) weary (selves).
from לָאָה; weary; Leah, a wife of Jacob; Leah.
a primitive root; to muffle; cover.
from לָאַט (or perhaps for active participle of לוּט); properly, muffled, i.e. silently; softly.
from the prepositional prefix and אֵל; (belonging) to God; Lael an Israelite; Lael.
xlit lᵉôm corrected to lᵉʼôm; or לְאוֹם; from an unused root meaning to gather; a community; nation, people.
plural of לְאֹם; communities; Leum mim, an Arabian; Leummim.
from לֹא and עַם with pronominal suffix; not my people; Lo-Ammi, the symbolic name of a son of Hosea; Lo-ammi.
from לֹא and רָחַם; not pitied; Lo-Ruchamah, the symbolic name of a son of Hosea; Lo-ruhamah.

a form of לֵבָב; the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything; [phrase] care for, comfortably, consent, [idiom] considered, courag(-eous), friend(-ly), ((broken-), (hard-), (merry-), (stiff-), (stout-), double) heart(-ed), [idiom] heed, [idiom] I, kindly, midst, mind(-ed), [idiom] regard(-ed), [idiom] themselves, [idiom] unawares, understanding, [idiom] well, willingly, wisdom.
(Aramaic) corresponding to לֵב; {the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything}; heart.
plural of לָבִיא; lionesses; Lebaoth, a place in Palestine; Lebaoth. See also בֵּית לְבָאוֹת.

a primitive root; properly, to be enclosed (as if with fat); by implication (as denominative from לֵבָב);  to unheart;  also as denominative from לָבִיבָה i.e.; (in a good sense) transport (with love), or (in a bad sense) stultify; to make cakes; make cakes, ravish, be wise.

from לָבַב; used also like לֵב; the heart (as the most interior organ); [phrase] bethink themselves, breast, comfortably, courage, ((faint), (tender-) heart(-ed), midst, mind, [idiom] unawares, understanding.
(Aramaic) corresponding to לֵבָב; {the heart (as the most interior organ);}; heart.
feminine of לֵב; the heart; heart.
for לֶהָבָה; flame; flame.
or לְבֹנָה; from לָבָן; frankincense (from its whiteness or perhaps that of its smoke); (frank-) incense.
the same as לְבוֹנָה; Lebonah, a place in Palestine; Lebonah.
or לְבֻשׁ; from לָבַשׁ; a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife; apparel, clothed with, clothing, garment, raiment, vestment, vesture.
(Aramaic) corresponding to לְבוּשׁ; {a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife}; garment.
a primitive root; to overthrow; intransposed, to fall; fall.

or (Ezekiel 19:2) לְבִיָּא; irregular masculine plural לְבָאִים; irregular feminine plural לְבָאוֹת; from an unused root meaning;  compare אֲרִי; to roar; a lion (properly, a lioness as the fiercer (although not a roarer;)); (great, old, stout) lion, lioness, young (lion).
or rather לְבִבָה; from לָבַב in its original sense of fatness (or perhaps of folding); a cake (either as fried or turned); cake.
a primitive root; also as denominative from לְבֵנָה; to be (or become) white;  to make bricks; make brick, be (made, make) white(-r).
or (Genesis 49:12) לָבֵן; from לָבַן; white; white.
the same as לָבָן; Laban, a Mesopotamian; also a place in the Desert; Laban.
or לְבָנָה; the same as לְבָנָה; Lebana or Lebanah, one of the Nethinim; Lebana, Lebanah.
from לָבַן; some sort of whitish tree, perhaps the storax; poplar.
from לָבַן; properly, whiteness, i.e. (by implication) transparency; paved.
the same as לִבְנֶה; Libnah, a place in the Desert and one in Palestine; Libnah.
from לָבַן; properly, (the) white, i.e. the moon; moon. See also לְבָנָא.
from לָבַן; a brick (from the whiteness of the clay); (altar of) brick, tile.
from לְבַב; (the) white mountain (from its snow); Lebanon, a mountain range in Palestine; Lebanon.
from לָבַן; white; Libni, an Israelite; Libni.
patronymically from לִבְנִי; a Libnite or descendants of Libni (collectively); Libnites.

or לָבֵשׁ; a primitive root; properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively; (in) apparel, arm, array (self), clothe (self), come upon, put (on, upon), wear.
(Aramaic) corresponding to לָבַשׁ; {properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively}; clothe.
from an unused root apparently meaning to deepen or hollow (like כַּד); a log or measure forliquids; log (of oil).
from an unused root of uncertain signification; Lod, a place in Palestine; Lod.
from an usused root meaning to gleam; a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon; blade, bright, flame, glittering.
or לַהֶבֶת; feminine of לַהַב, and meaning the same; {a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon}; flame(-ming), head (of a spear).
plural of לַהַב; flames; Lehabim, a son of Mizraim, and his descendants; Lehabim.
from an unused root meaning to be eager; intense mental application; study.
from an unused root meaning to glow (compare לַהַב) or else to be earnest (compare לַהַג); Lahad, an Israelite; Lahad.
a primitive root meaning properly, to burn, i.e. (by implication); to be rabid (figuratively, insane); also (from the exhaustion of frenzy) to languish; faint, mad.
a primitive root; properly, to lick, i.e. (by implication) to blaze; burn (up), set on fire, flaming, kindle.
from לָהַט; a blaze; also (from the idea of enwrapping) magic (as covert); flaming, enchantment.
a primitive root; properly, to burn in, i.e. (figuratively) to rankle; wound.
from the prepositional prefix meaning to or for and הֵן; popularly for if; hence, therefore; for them (by mistake for prepositional suffix).
xlit lâwhên corrected to lâhên; (Aramaic) corresponding to לָהֵן; therefore; also except; but, except, save, therefore, wherefore.
probably from an unused root meaning to gather; an assembly; company.
or לֻא; or לוּ; a conditional particle; if; by implication (interj. as a wish) would that!; if (haply), peradventure, I pray thee, though, I would, would God (that).

or לֻבִּי; (Daniel 11:43), partrial from a name probably derived from an unused root meaning to thirst, i.e. a dry region; apparently; a Libyan or inhabitant of interior Africa (only in plural); Lubim(-s), Libyans.
probably of foreign derivation; Lud, the name of two nations; Lud, Lydia.
or לוּדִיִּי; patrial from לוּד; a Ludite or inhabitants of Lud (only in plural); Ludim. Lydians.
a primitive root; properly, to twine, i.e. (by implication) to unite, to remain; also to borrow (as a form of obligation) or (caus.) to lend; abide with, borrow(-er), cleave, join (self), lend(-er).
a primitive root; (compare לָוָה, לוּט and לוּן); to turn aside , i.e. (literally) to depart, (figuratively) be perverse; depart, froward, perverse(-ness).
probably of foreign origin; some kind of nuttree, perhaps the almond; hazel.
probably from לוּז (as growing there); Luz, the name of two places in Palestine; Luz.
or לֻחַ; from a primitive root; probably meaning to glisten; a tablet (as polished), of stone, wood or metal; board, plate, table.
or לֻחוֹת; (Jeremiah 48:5), from the same as לוּחַ; floored; Luchith, a place East of the Jordan; Luhith.
active participle of לָחַשׁ; (the) enchanter; Lochesh, an Israelite; Hallohesh, Haloshesh (includ. the article).
a primitive root; to wrap up; cast, wrap.
from לוּט; a veil; covering.
the same as לוֹט; Lot, Abraham's nephew; Lot.
from לוֹט; covering; Lotan, an Idumaean; Lotan.
from לָוָה; attached; Levi, a son of Jacob; Levi. See also לֵוִי, לֵוִיִּי.
(Aramaic) corresponding to לִוְיָה; {something attached, i.e. a wreath}; Levite.
from לָוָה; something attached, i.e. a wreath; ornament.
or לֵוִי; patronymically from לֵוִי; a Levite or descendant of Levi; Leviite.

from לָוָה; a wreathed animal, i.e. a serpent (especially the crocodile or some other large sea-monster); figuratively, the constellation of the dragon; also as a symbol of Babylon; leviathan, mourning.
from an unused root meaning to fold back; a spiral step; winding stair. Compare לֻלָאָה.
or לוּלֵי; from לוּא and לֹא; if not; except, had not, if (...not), unless, were it not that.

or לִין; a primitive root; to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain); abide (all night), continue, dwell, endure, grudge, be left, lie all night, (cause to) lodge (all night, in, -ing, this night), (make to) murmur, remain, tarry (all night, that night).
a primitive root; to gulp; figuratively, to be rash; swallow down (up).

a primitive root; properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede; ambassador, have in derision, interpreter, make a mock, mocker, scorn(-er, -ful), teacher.
a primitive root; to knead; knead.
from לוּשׁ; kneading; Lush, a place in Palestine; Laish (from the margin). Compare לַיִשׁ.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to לָוָה; properly, adhesion, i.e. (as preposition) with; [idiom] thee.
from לוּז; perverseness; perverse.
from an unused root meaning to be new; fresh, i.e. unused or undried; green, moist.
from the same as לַח; freshness, i.e. vigor; natural force.
or לָחֻם; passive participle of לָחַם; properly, eaten, i.e. food; also flesh, i.e. body; while...is eating, flesh.
from an unused root meaning to be soft; the cheek (from its fleshiness); hence, the jaw-bone; cheek (bone), jaw (bone).
a form of לְחִי; Lechi, a place in Palestine; Lehi. Compare also רָמַת לֶחִי.
a primitive root; to lick; lick (up).
a primitive root; to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction); devour, eat, [idiom] ever, fight(-ing), overcome, prevail, (make) war(-ring).
from לָחַם; See also בֵּית לְעַפְרָה; food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it); (shew-) bread, [idiom] eat, food, fruit, loaf, meat, victuals.
(Aramaic) corresponding to לֶחֶם; {(for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)}; feast.
from לָחַם,; battle; war.
from לֶחֶם; foodful; (or perhaps erroneous transcription) for בֵּית הַלַּחְמִי; Lachmi, an Israelite; or rather probably a brief form; Lahmi. See also יָשֻׁבִי לֶחֶם.
probably by erroneous transcription for לַחְמָם; from לֶחֶם; food-like; Lachmam or Lachmas, a place in Palestine; Lahmam.
(Aramaic) from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a concubine; concubine.
a primitive root; properly, to press, i.e. (figuratively) to distress; afflict, crush, force, hold fast, oppress(-or), thrust self.
from לָחַץ; distress; affliction, oppression.
a primitive root; to whisper; by implication, to mumble aspell (as a magician); charmer, whisper (together).
from לָחַשׁ; properly, a whisper, i.e. by implication, (in a good sense) a private prayer, (in a bad one) an incantation; concretely, an amulet; charmed, earring, enchantment, orator, prayer.
a form of לָאט or else participle from לוּט; properly, covered, i.e. secret; by implication, incantation; also secrecy or (adverb) covertly; enchantment, privily, secretly, softly.
probably from לוּט; a gum (from its sticky nature), probably ladanum; myrrh.
from an unused root meaning to hide; a kind of lizard (from its covert habits); lizard.
masculine plural of passive participle of לָטַשׁ; hammered (i.e. oppressed) ones; Letushim, an Arabian tribe; Letushim.
a primitive root; properly, to hammer out (an edge), i.e. to sharpen; instructer, sharp(-en), whet.
a form of לִוְיָה; a wreath; addition.
or (Isaiah 21:11) לֵיל; also לַיְלָה; from the same as לוּל; properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity; (mid-)night (season).
(Aramaic) corresponding to לָאֵל; {Lael an Israelite}; night.
from לַיִל; a night spectre; screech owl.
from לוּשׁ in the sense of crushing; a lion (from his destructive blows); (old) lion.
the same as לַיִשׁ; Laish, the name of two places in Palestine; Laish. Compare לוּשׁ.

a primitive root; to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere; [idiom] at all, catch (self), be frozen, be holden, stick together, take.
from לָכַד; something to capture with, i.e. a noose; being taken.
from יָלַךְ; a journey; Lekah, a place in Palestine; Lecah.
xlit Lâchîysh corrected to Lâkîysh; from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Lakish, a place in Palestine; Lachish.
from the same as לוּל; a loop; loop.
a primitive root; properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive); (un-) accustomed, [idiom] diligently, expert, instruct, learn, skilful, teach(-er, -ing).
a prolonged and separable form of the prepositional prefix; to or for; at, for, to, upon.
or לְמוֹאֵל; from לְמוֹ and אֵל; (belonging) to God; Lemuel or Lemoel, a symbolic name of Solomon; Lemuel.
or לִמֻּד; from לָמַד; instructed; accustomed, disciple, learned, taught, used.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Lemek, the name of two antediluvian patriarchs; Lamech.
from לוּעַ; the gullet; throat.
a primitive root; to deride; mock.
a primitive root; to deride; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to speak unintelligibly; have in derision, laugh (to scorn), mock (on), stammering.
from לָעַג; derision, scoffing; derision, scorn (-ing).
from לָעַג; a buffoon; also a foreigner; mocker, stammering.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Ladah, an Israelite; Laadah.
from the same as לַעְדָּה; Ladan, the name of two Israelites; Laadan.
a primitive root; to speak in a foreign tongue; strange language.
a primitive root; to swallow greedily; causatively, to feed; feed.
from an unused root supposed to mean to curse; wormwood (regarded as poisonous, and therefore accursed); hemlock, wormwood.
or לַפִּד; from an unused root probably meaning to shine; a flambeau, lamp or flame; (fire-) brand, (burning) lamp, lightning, torch.
feminine plural of לַפִּיד; Lappidoth, the husband of Deborah; Lappidoth.
from the prepositional prefix (to or for) and פָּנִים; anterior; before.
a primitive root; properly, to bend, i.e. (by implication) to clasp; also (reflexively) to turn around or aside; take hold, turn aside (self).
from לוּץ; derision; scornful(-ning).
a primitive root; to deride; scorn.
from an unused root thought to mean to stop up by a barricade; perhaps fortification; Lakkum, a place in Palestine; Lakum.

a primitive root; to take (in the widest variety of applications); accept, bring, buy, carry away, drawn, fetch, get, infold, [idiom] many, mingle, place, receive(-ing), reserve, seize, send for, take (away, -ing, up), use, win.

from לָקַח; properly, something received, i.e. (mentally) instruction (whether on the part of the teacher or hearer); also (in an active and sinister sense) inveiglement; doctrine, learning, fair speech.
from לָקַח; learned; Likchi, an Israelite; Likhi.
a primitive root; properly, to pick up, i.e. (generally) to gather; specifically, to glean; gather (up), glean.
from לָקַט; the gleaning; gleaning.
a primitive root; to lick or lap; lap, lick.
a primitive root; to gather the after crop; gather.
from לָקַשׁ; the after crop; latter growth.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; apparently juice, i.e.; (figuratively) vigor; also a sweet or fat cake; fresh, moisture.

or לָשֹׁן; also (in plural) feminine לְשֹׁנָה; from לָשַׁן; the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water); [phrase] babbler, bay, [phrase] evil speaker, language, talker, tongue, wedge.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a room in a building (whether for storage, eating, or lodging); chamber, parlour. Compare נִשְׁכָּה.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a gem, perhaps the jacinth; ligure.
the same as לֶשֶׁם; Leshem, a place in Palestine; Leshem.
a primitive root; properly, to lick; but used only as a denominative from לָשׁוֹן; to wag the tongue, i.e. to calumniate; accuse, slander.
(Aramaic) corresponding to לָשׁוֹן; speech, i.e. a nation; language.
from an unused root thought to mean to break through; a boiling spring; Lesha, a place probably East of the Jordan; Lasha.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a measure for things dry; half homer. m
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָה; (as indefinitely) that; [phrase] what.
from אָבַס; a granary; storehouse.

from the same as אוּד; properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated); diligently, especially, exceeding(-ly), far, fast, good, great(-ly), [idiom] louder and louder, might(-ily, -y), (so) much, quickly, (so) sore, utterly, very ([phrase] much, sore), well.
or מֵאיָה; properly, a primitive numeral; a hundred; also as a multiplicative and a fraction; hundred((-fold), -th), [phrase] sixscore.
the same as מֵאָה; Meah, a tower in Jerusalem; Meah.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מֵאָה; properly, a primitive numeral; a hundred; also as a multiplicative and a fraction}; hundred.
from אָוָה; a desire; desire.
usually מוּם; as if passive participle from an unused root probably meaning; to stain; a blemish (physically or morally); blemish, blot, spot.
apparently a form of מאוּם; properly, a speck or point, i.e. (by implication) something; with negative, nothing; fault, [phrase] no(-ught), ought, somewhat, any (no-)thing.
from מָאַס; refuse; refuse.

or מָאֹר; also (in plural) feminine מְאוֹרָה; or מְאֹרָה; from אוֹר; properly, a luminous body or luminary, i.e. (abstractly) light (as an element); figuratively, brightness, i.e.cheerfulness; specifically, a chandelier; bright, light.
feminine passive participle of אוֹר; something lighted, i.e. an aperture; by implication, a crevice or hole (of a serpent); den.
from אָזַן; (only in the dual) a pair of scales; balances.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מֹאזֵן; {(only in the dual) a pair of scales}; balances.
from אָכַל; an eatable (includ. provender, flesh and fruit); food, fruit, (bake-)meat(-s), victual.
from אָכַל; something to eat with,i.e. a knife; knife.
from אָכַל; something eaten (by fire), i.e. fuel; fuel.
from אָמַץ; strength, i.e. (plural) resources; force.
from אָמַר; something (authoritatively) said, i.e. an edict; commandment, decree.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מַאֲמַר; {something (authoritatively) said, i.e. an edict}; appointment, word.
(Aramaic) probably from a root corresponding to אָנָה in the sense of an inclosure by sides; a utensil; vessel.
a primitive root; to refuse; refuse, [idiom] utterly.
from מָאֵן; unwilling; refuse.
from מָאֵן; refractory; refuse.

a primitive root; to spurn; also (intransitively) to disappear; abhor, cast away (off), contemn, despise, disdain, (become) loathe(some), melt away, refuse, reject, reprobate, [idiom] utterly, vile person.
from אָפָה; something baked, i.e. a batch; baken.
from the same as אָפֵל; something opaque; darkness.
lemma מַאֲפֵלְיָה second vowel, corrected to מַאְפֵלְיָה; prolonged feminine of מַאֲפֵל; opaqueness; darkness.
a primitive root; to be bitter or (causatively) to embitter, i.e. be painful; fretting, picking.
from אָרַב; an ambuscade; lie in ambush, ambushment, lurking place, lying in wait.
from אָרַר; an execration; curse.
from בָּדַל; a separation, i.e. (concretely) a separate place; separate.

from בּוֹא; (with or without שֶׁמֶשׁ); an entrance (the place or the act); specifically sunset or the west; also (adverb with preposition) towards; by which came, as cometh, in coming, as men enter into, entering, entrance into, entry, where goeth, going down, [phrase] westward. Compare מוֹבָא.
feminine of מָבוֹא; a haven; entry.
from בּוּךְ; perplexity; perplexity.
from יָבַל in the sense of flowing; a deluge; flood.
from בִּין; instructing; taught.
from בּוּס; a trampling; treading (trodden) down (under foot).
from נָבַע; a fountain; fountain, spring.
from the same as בּוּקָה; emptiness; void.
from בָּחַר; select, i.e. well fortified; choice.
from בָּחַר; select, i.e. best; choice(-st), chosen.
the same as מִבְחָר; Mibchar, an Israelite; Mibhar.
or מֶבָּט; from נָבַט; something expected, i.e. (abstractly) expectation; expectation.
from בָּטָא; a rash utterance (hasty vow); (that which...) uttered (out of).
from בָּטַח; properly, a refuge, i.e. (objective) security, or (subjective) assurance; confidence, hope, sure, trust.
from בָּלַג; desistance (or rather desolation); comfort self.
from בָּנָה; a building; frame.
from בָּנָה; built up; Mebunnai, an Israelite; Mebunnai.
also (in plural) feminine (Daniel 11:l5) מִבְצָרָה; from בָּצַר; a fortification, castle, or fortified city; figuratively, a defender; (de-, most) fenced, fortress, (most) strong (hold).
the same as מִבְצָר; Mibtsar, an Idumaean; Mibzar.
from בָּרַח; a refugee; fugitive.
from בּוּשׁ; (plural) the (male) pudenda; secrets.
from the same as בֶּשֶׂם; fragrant; Mibsam, the name of an Ishmaelite and of an Israelite; Mibsam.
from בָּשַׁל; a cooking hearth; boiling-place.
from the same as גָּבִישׁ; stiffening; Magbish, an Israelite, or a place in Palestine; Magbish.
from גָּבַל; a border; end.
from the same as גִּבְעָה; a cap (as hemispherical); bonnet.
from an unused root probably meaning to be eminent; properly, a distinguished thing; hence something valuable, as aproduct or fruit; pleasant, precious fruit (thing).
(Zechariah אַבְדָן) or מְגִדּוֹ; from גָּדַד; rendezvous; Megiddon or Megiddo, a place in Palestine; Megiddo, Megiddon.
or מִגְדֹּל; probably of Egyptian origin; Migdol, a place in Egypt; Migdol, tower.
from מֶגֶד and אֵל; preciousness of God; Magdiel, an Idumaean; Magdiel.

also (in plural) feminine מִגְדָּלָה; from גָּדַל; a tower (from its size or height); by analogy, a rostrum; figuratively, a (pyramidal) bed of flowers; castle, flower, tower. Compare the names following.
from מִגְדָּל and אֵל; tower of God; Migdal-El, a place in Palestine; Migdal-el.
from מִגְדָּל and גַּד; tower of Fortune; Migdal-Gad, a place in Palestine; Migdal-gad.
from מִגְדָּל and עֵדֶר; tower of a flock; Migdal-Eder, a place in Palestine; Migdal-eder, tower of the flock.
from the same as מֶגֶד; preciousness, i.e. a gem; precious thing, present.
from גּוֹג; Magog, a son of Japheth; also a barbarous northern region; Magog.
or (Lamentations 2:22) מָגוּר; from גּוּר in the sense of fearing; a fright (objective or subjective); fear, terror. Compare מָגוֹר מִסָּבִיב.
or מָגֻר; from גּוּר in the sense of lodging; a temporary abode; by extension, a permanent residence; dwelling, pilgrimage, where sojourn, be a stranger. Compare מָגוֹר.
feminine of מָגוֹר; affright; fear.
feminine of מָגוֹר or of מָגוּר; a fright; also a granary; barn, fear.
from מָגוֹר and סָבִיב with the preposition inserted; affright from around; Magor-mis-Sabib, a symbolic name of Pashur; Magormissabib.
from גָּזַר; a cutting implement, i.e. a blade; axe.
from an unused root meaning to reap; a sickle; sickle.
from גָּלַל; a roll; roll, volume.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מְגִלָּה; {a roll}; roll.
from the same as גַּם; properly, accumulation, i.e. impulse or direction; sup up.
a denominative from מָגֵן; properly, to shield; encompass with; figuratively, to rescue, to hand safely over (i.e. surrender); deliver.

also (in plural) feminine מְגִנָּה; from גָּנַן; a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile; [idiom] armed, buckler, defence, ruler, [phrase] scale, shield.
from מָגַן; a covering (in a bad sense), i.e. blindness or obduracy; sorrow. See also מָגֵן.
from גָּעַר; reproof (i.e. curse); rebuke.
from נָגַף; a pestilence; by analogy, defeat; ([idiom] be) plague(-d), slaughter, stroke.
apparently from גּוּף or נָגַף and עָשׁ; exterminator of (the) moth; Magpiash, an Israelite; Magpiash.
a primitive root; to yield up; intensively, to precipitate; cast down, terror.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָגַר; to overthrow; destroy.
from גָּרַר; a saw; axe, saw.
from מָגַר; precipice; Migron, a place in Palestine; Migron.
from גָּרַע; a ledge or offset; narrowed rest.
from גָּרַף; something thrown off (by the spade), i.e. a clod; clod.

also (in plural) feminine (Ezekiel 27:28) מִגְרָשָׁה; from גָּרַשׁ; a suburb (i.e. open country whither flocks are driven from pasture); hence, the area around abuilding, or the margin of the sea; cast out, suburb.
or מֵד; from מָדַד; properly, extent, i.e. height; also a measure; by implication, a vesture (as measured); also a carpet; armour, clothes, garment, judgment, measure, raiment, stature.
(Aramaic) from דְּבַח; a sacrificial altar; altar.
from דָבַר in the sense of driving; a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs); desert, south, speech, wilderness.
a primitive root; properly, to stretch; by implication, to measure (as if by stretching a line); figuratively, to be extended; measure, mete, stretch self.
from נָדַד; flight; be gone.

feminine of מַד; properly, extension, i.e. height or breadth; also a measure (including its standard); hence a portion (as measured) or a vestment; specifically, tribute (as measured); garment, measure(-ing, meteyard, piece, size, (great) stature, tribute, wide.
(Aramaic) or מִנְדָּה; (Aramaic), corresponding to מִדָּה; tribute in money; toll, tribute.
perhaps from the equivalent of דְּהַב; goldmaking, i.e. exactness; golden city.
from an unused root meaning to stretch; properly, extent, i.e. measure; by implication, a dress (as measured); garment.
from דָּוָה; sickness; disease.
from נָדַח; seduction; cause of banishment.
from דִּין; a contest or quarrel; brawling, contention(-ous), discord, strife. Compare מִדְיָן, מְדָן.
from the same as מֶדֶו; extensiveness, i.e. height; stature.
the same as מָדוֹן; Madon, a place in Palestine; Madon.
or מַדֻּעַ; from מָה and the passive participle of יָדַע; what (is) known?; i.e. (by implication) (adverbially) why?; how, wherefore, why.
(Aramaic) or מְדֹר; (Aramaic), or מְדָר; (Aramaic), from דּוּר; a dwelling; dwelling.
or מְדֻרָה; from דּוּר in the sense of accumulation; a pile of fuel; pile (for fire).
from דָּחָה; overthrow; ruin.
from דָּחַף; a push, i.e. ruin; overthrow.
of foreign derivation; Madai, a country of central Asia; Madai, Medes, Media.
patrial from מָדַי; a Madian or native of Madai; Mede.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָדַי; {Madai, a country of central Asia}; Mede(-s).
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָדַי; {a Madian or native of Madai}; Median.
from מָה and דַּי; what (is) enough, i.e. sufficiently; sufficiently.
a variation for מָדוֹן; {a contest or quarrel}; brawling, contention(-ous).
the same as מִדְיָן; Midjan, a son of Abraham; also his country and (collectively) his descendants; Midian, Midianite.
a variation for מִדְיָן; {Midjan, a son of Abraham; also his country and (collectively) his descendants}; Middin.
from דִּין; properly, a judgeship, i.e. jurisdiction; by implication, a district (as ruled by a judge); generally, a region; ([idiom] every) province.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מְדִינָה; {properly, a judgeship, i.e. jurisdiction; by implication, a district (as ruled by a judge); generally, a region}; province.
patronymical or patrial from מִדְיָן; a Midjanite or descendant (native) of Midjan; Midianite. Compare מְדָנִי.
from דּוּךְ; a mortar; mortar.
from the same as דֹּמֶן; dunghill; Madmen, a place in Palestine; Madmen.
feminine from the same as דֹּמֶן; a dunghill; dunghill.
the same as מַדְמֵנָה; Madmenah, a place in Palestine; Madmenah.
a variation for מַדְמֵנָה; Madmannah, a place in Palestine; Madmannah.
a form of מָדוֹן; {a contest or quarrel}; discord, strife.
the same as מְדָן; Medan, a son of Abraham; Medan.
a variation of מִדְיָנִי; {a Midjanite or descendant (native) of Midjan}; Midianite.
or מַדַּע; from יָדַע; intelligence or consciousness; knowledge, science, thought.
from דָּקַר; a wound; piercing.
from an unused root meaning to step; properly, a step; by implication, a steep or inaccessible place; stair, steep place.
from דָּרַךְ; a treading, i.e. a place for stepping on; (foot-) breadth.
from דָּרַשׁ; properly, an investigation, i.e. (by implication) a treatise or elaborate compilation; story.
from דּוּשׁ; a threshing, i.e. (concretely and figuratively) down-trodden people; threshing.
xlit Mᵉdâthâ corrected to Mᵉdâthâʼ; of Persian origin; Medatha, the father of Haman; Hammedatha (including the article).

or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why.

(Aramaic) corresponding to מָה; {properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what}; how great (mighty), that which, what(-soever), why.
apparently a denominative from מָה; properly, to question or hesitate, i.e. (by implication) to be reluctant; delay, linger, stay selves, tarry.
from הוּם; confusion or uproar; destruction, discomfiture, trouble, tumult, vexation, vexed.
of Persian origin; Mehuman, a eunuch of Xerxes; Mehuman.
from יָטַב (augmented) and אֵל; bettered of God; Mehetabel, the name of an Edomitish man and woman; Mehetabeel, Mehetabel.
or מָהִר; from מָהַר; quick; hence, skilful; diligent, hasty, ready.
a primitive root; properly, to cut down or reduce, i.e. by implication, to adulterate; mixed.
from הָלַךְ; a walking (plural collectively), i.e. access; place to walk.
from הָלַךְ; a walk, i.e. a passage or a distance; journey, walk.
from הָלַל; fame; praise.
from מַהֲלָל and אֵל; praise of God; Mahalalel, the name of an antediluvian patriarch and of an Israelite; Mahalaleel.
from הָלַם; a blow; stripe, stroke.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; perhaps an abyss; deep pit.
from הָפַךְ; a destruction; when...overthrew, overthrow(-n).
from הָפַךְ; a wrench, i.e. the stocks; prison, stocks.

a primitive root; properly, to be liquid or flow easily, i.e. (by implication); to hurry (in a good or a bad sense); often used (with another verb) adverbially, promptly; be carried headlong, fearful, (cause to make, in, make) haste(-n, -ily), (be) hasty, (fetch, make ready) [idiom] quickly, rash, [idiom] shortly, (be so) [idiom] soon, make speed, [idiom] speedily, [idiom] straightway, [idiom] suddenly, swift.
a primitive root (perhaps rather the same as מָהַר through the idea of readiness in assent); to bargain (for a wife), i.e. to wed; endow, [idiom] surely.
from מָהַר; properly, hurrying; hence (adverbially) in ahurry; hasteth, hastily, at once, quickly, soon, speedily, suddenly.
from מָהַר; a price (for a wife); dowry.
feminine of מַהֵר; properly, a hurry; hence (adverbially) promptly; hastily, quickly, shortly, soon, make (with) speed(-ily), swiftly.
from מָהַר; hasty; Maharai, an Israelite; Maharai.
from מַהֵר and שָׁלָל and חוּשׁ and בַּז; hasting (is he (the enemy) to the) booty, swift (to the) prey; Maher-Shalal-Chash-Baz; the symbolical name of the son of Isaiah; Maher-sha-lal-bash-baz.
from הָתַל; a delusion; deceit.
from a prolonged form of the prepositional prefix m-and אָב; from (her (the mother's)) father; Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants; Moab.
feminine מוֹאָבִיָּה; or מוֹאָבִיתxlit Môwâbîyth corrected to Môwʼâbîyth; patronymical from מוֹאָב; a Moabite or Moabitess, i.e. a descendant from Moab; (woman) of Moab, Moabite(-ish, -ss).
by transp. for מָבוֹא; an entrance; coming.
a primitive root; to melt, i.e. literally (to soften, flow down, disappear), or figuratively (to fear, faint); consume, dissolve, (be) faint(-hearted), melt (away), make soft.
a primitive root; to shake; measure.
or rather מֹדָע; from יָדַע; an acquaintance; kinswoman.
from יָדַע; acquaintance; kindred.

a primitive root; to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall; be carried, cast, be out of course, be fallen in decay, [idiom] exceedingly, fall(-ing down), be (re-) moved, be ready, shake, slide, slip.
from מוֹט; a wavering, i.e. fall; by implication, a pole (as shaking); hence, a yoke (as essentially a bent pole); bar, be moved, staff, yoke.
feminine of מוֹט; a pole; by implication, an ox-bow; hence, a yoke (either literal or figurative); bands, heavy, staves, yoke.
a primitive root; to become thin, i.e. (figuratively) be impoverished; be (waxen) poor(-er).

a primitive root; to cut short, i.e. curtail (specifically the prepuce, i.e. to circumcise); by implication, to blunt; figuratively, to destroy; circumcise(-ing), selves), cut down (in pieces), destroy, [idiom] must needs.

or מוֹל; (Deuteronomy 1:1), or מוֹאל; (Nehemiah 12:38), or מֻל; (Numbers 22:5), from מוּל; properly, abrupt, i.e. a precipice; by implication, the front; used only adverbially (with prepositional prefix) opposite; (over) against, before, (fore-) front, from, (God-) ward, toward, with.
from יָלַד; birth; Moladah, a place in Palestine; Moladah.
from יָלַד; nativity (plural birth-place); by implication, lineage, native country; also offspring, family; begotten, born, issue, kindred, native(-ity).
from מוּל; circumcision; circumcision.
from יָלַד; genitor; Molid, an Israelite; Molid.
from סָבַב; a turn, i.e. circuit (of a building); winding about.
or מֻסַבָּה; feminine of מוּסָב; a reversal, i.e. the backside (of a gem), fold (of a double-leaved door), transmutation (of a name); being changed, inclosed, be set, turning.
from יָסַד; a foundation; foundation.
from יָסַד; a foundation; foundation.
feminine of מוּסָד; a foundation; figuratively, an appointment; foundation, grounded. Compare מְיֻסָּדָה.
or מֹסָדָה; feminine of מוֹסָד; a foundation; foundation.
also (in plural) feminine מוֹסֵרָה; or מֹסְרָה; from יָסַר; properly, chastisement, i.e. (by implication) a halter; figuratively, restraint; band, bond.
from יָסַר; properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint; bond, chastening(-eth), chastisement, check, correction, discipline, doctrine, instruction, rebuke.
or (plural) מֹסְרוֹת feminine of מוֹסֵר; correction or corrections; Moserah or Moseroth, a place in the Desert; Mosera, Moseroth.

or מֹעֵד; or (feminine) מוֹעָדָה; (2 Chronicles 8:13), from יָעַד; properly, an appointment, i.e. a fixed time or season; specifically, a festival; conventionally ayear; by implication, an assembly (as convened for a definite purpose); technically the congregation; by extension, the place of meeting; also a signal (as appointed beforehand); appointed (sign, time), (place of, solemn) assembly, congregation, (set, solemn) feast, (appointed, due) season, solemn(-ity), synogogue, (set) time (appointed).
from יָעַד; (as in מוֹעֵד); properly, an assembly  figuratively, a troop; appointed time.
from יָעַד; an appointed place, i.e. asylum; appointed.
from מוֹעָד and יָהּ; assembly of Jah; Moadjah, an Israelite; Moadiah. Compare מַעֲדְיָה.
feminine passive participle of מָעַד; properly, made to slip, i.e. dislocated; out of joint.
from עוּף; properly, covered, i.e. dark; abstractly, obscurity, i.e. distress; dimness.
from יָעַץ; a purpose; counsel, device.
from עוּק; pressure, i.e. (figuratively) distress; affliction.
(Jeremiah 48:21) or מֵיפַעַת; or מֵפַעַת; from יָפַע; illuminative; Mophaath or Mephaath, a place in Palestine; Mephaath.
or מֹפֵת; from יָפָה in the sense of conspicuousness; a miracle; by implication, a token or omen; miracle, sign, wonder(-ed at).
a primitive root; to press, i.e. (figuratively) to oppress; extortioner.

or מֹצָאxlit môtsâ corrected to môtsâʼ; from יָצָא; a going forth, i.e. (the act) an egress, or (the place) an exit; hence, a source or product; specifically, dawn, the rising of the sun (the East), exportation, utterance, a gate, a fountain, a mine, a meadow (as producing grass); brought out, bud, that which came out, east, going forth, goings out, that which (thing that) is gone out, outgoing, proceeded out, spring, vein, (water-) course (springs).
the same as מוֹצָא; Motsa, the name of two Israelites; Moza.
feminine of מוֹצָא; (marg.; compare צוֹאָה); a family descent; also a sewer; draught house; going forth.
or מוּצָק; from יָצַק; narrowness; figuratively, distress; anguish, is straitened, straitness.
from עָגִיל; properly, fusion, i.e. literally, a casting (of metal); figuratively, a mass (of clay); casting, hardness.
or מֻצָקָה; from יָצַק; properly, something poured out, i.e. a casting (of metal); by implication, a tube (as cast); when it was cast, pipe.
a primitive root; to jeer, i.e. (intens.) blaspheme; be corrupt.
from יָקַד; a fire or fuel; abstractly, a conflagration; burning, hearth.
feminine of מוֹקֵד; fuel; burning.
or מֹקֵשׁ; from יָקֹשׁ; a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose); be ensnared, gin, (is) snare(-d), trap.
a primitive root; to alter; by implication, to barter, to dispose of; [idiom] at all, (ex-) change, remove.
or מֹרָא; or מוֹרָהxlit môrâh corrected to môwrâh; (Psalm 9:20), from יָרֵא; fear; by implication, a fearful thing or deed; dread, (that ought to be) fear(-ed), terribleness, terror.
or מֹרַג; from an unused root meaning to triturate; a threshing sledge; threshing instrument.
from יָרַד; a descent; as architecture, an ornamental appendage, perhaps a festoon; going down, steep place, thin work.
from יָרָה; (see יוֹרֶה); an archer; also teacher or teaching; also the early rain; (early) rain.
or מֹרֶה; the same as מוֹרֶה; Moreh, a Canaanite; also a hill (perhaps named from him); Moreh.
from מוּר in the sense of shearing; a razor; razor.
from יָרַט; obstinate, i.e. independent; peeled.
or מֹרִיָּה; from רָאָה and יָהּ; seen of Jah; Morijah, a hill in Palestine; Moriah.
from יָרַשׁ; a possession; figuratively, delight; possession, thought.
feminine of מוֹרָשׁ; a possession; heritage, inheritance, possession.
from יָרַשׁ and גַּת; possession of Gath; Moresheth-Gath, a place in Palestine; Moresheth-gath.
xlit Morashtîy corrected to Môwrashtîy; patrial from מוֹרֶשֶׁת גַּת; a Morashtite or inhabitant of Moresheth-Gath; Morashthite.
a primitive root; to touch; feel, handle.

a primitive root (perhaps rather the same as מוּשׁ through the idea of receding by contact); to withdraw (both literally and figuratively, whether intransitive or transitive); cease, depart, go back, remove, take away.

or מֹשָׁב; from יָשַׁב; a seat; figuratively, a site; abstractly, a session; by extension an abode (the place or the time); by implication, population; assembly, dwell in, dwelling(-place), wherein (that) dwelt (in), inhabited place, seat, sitting, situation, sojourning.
or מֻשִּׁי; from מוּשׁ; sensitive; Mushi, a Levite; Mushi.
patronymical from מוּשִׁי; a Mushite (collectively) or descendants of Mushi; Mushites.
act participle feminine of מָשַׁךְ; something drawing, i.e. (figuratively) a cord; band.
from יָשַׁע; deliverance; salvation.

a primitive root; to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill; [idiom] at all, [idiom] crying, (be) dead (body, man, one), (put to, worthy of) death, destroy(-er), (cause to, be like to, must) die, kill, necro(-mancer), [idiom] must needs, slay, [idiom] surely, [idiom] very suddenly, [idiom] in (no) wise.
(Psalm אֲבִירָם or מוּת לַבֵּן; from מוּת and בֵּן with the preposition and article interposed; 'To die for the son', probably the title of a popular song; death, Muthlabben.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָוֶת; death; death.
from מוּת; death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin; (be) dead(-ly), death, die(-d).
from יָתַר; literally gain; figuratively, superiority; plenteousness, preeminence, profit.
from זָבַח; an altar; altar.
from an unused root meaning to mingle (water with wine); tempered wine; liquor.
from an unused root meaning to suck out; exhausted; burnt.
probably from an unused root meaning to faint with fear; terror; Mizzah, an Edomite; Mizzah.
probably from an unused root meaning to gather in; a granary; garner.
or מְזֻזָה; from the same as זִיז; a door-post (as prominent); (door, side) post.
from זוּן; food; meat, victual.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָזוֹן; {food}; meat.
from זוּר in the sense of turning aside from truth; treachery, i.e. a plot; wound.
or מָזֹר; from זוּר in the sense of binding up; a bandage, i.e. remedy; hence, a sore (as needing a compress); bound up, wound.
or מֵזַח; from זָחַח; a belt (as movable); girdle, strength.
or (feminine) מִזְלָגָה; from an unused root meaning to draw up; a fork; fleshhook.
apparently from נָזַל in the sense of raining; a constellation, i.e. Zodiacal sign (perhaps as affecting the weather); planet. Compare מַזָּרָה.
from זָמַם; a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity); (wicked) device, discretion, intent, witty invention, lewdness, mischievous (device), thought, wickedly.
from זָמַר; properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes; psalm.
from זָמַר; a pruningknife; pruning-hook.
from זָמַר; a tweezer (only in the plural); snuffers.
from the same as זְעֵירxlit zeʻêyr corrected to zᵉʻêyr; fewness; by implication, as superl. diminutiveness; few, [idiom] very.
from זָרָה; a winnowing shovel (as scattering the chaff); fan.
apparently from זָרָה; properly, a scatterer, i.e. the north wind (as dispersing clouds; only in plural); north.
apparently from נָזַר in the sense of distinction; some noted constellation (only in the plural), perhaps collectively, the zodiac; Mazzoroth. Compare מַזָּלָה.
from זָרַח; sunrise, i.e. the east; east (side, -ward), (sun-) rising (of the sun).
from זָרַע; a planted field; thing sown.
from זָרַק; a bowl (as if for sprinkling); bason, bowl.
from מָחָה in the sense of greasing; fat; figuratively, rich; fatling (one).
from the same as מֵחַ; fat, i.e. marrow; marrow.
a primitive root; to rub or strike the hands together (in exultation); clap.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָחָא; to strike in pieces; also to arrest; specifically to impale; hang, smite, stay.
or מַחֲבֹא; from חָבָא; a refuge; hiding (lurking) place.
from חָבַר; a junction, i.e. seam or sewed piece; coupling.
from חָבַר; a joiner, i.e. brace or cramp; coupling, joining.
from the same as חָבֵת; a pan for baking in; pan.
from חָגַר; a girdle; girding.

a primitive root; properly, to stroke or rub; by implication, to erase; also to smooth (as if with oil), i.e. grease or make fat; also to touch, i.e. reach to; abolish, blot out, destroy, full of marrow, put out, reach unto, [idiom] utterly, wipe (away, out).
from חוּג; an instrument for marking a circle, i.e. compasses; compass.
from an unused root meaning to enclose; a harbor (as shut in by the shore); haven.
or מְחִיּיָאֵל; from מָחָה and אֵל; smitten of God; Mechujael or Mechijael, an antediluvian patriarch; Mehujael.
apparently a patrial, but from an unknown place (in the plural only for a singular); a Machavite or inhabitant of some place named Machaveh; Mahavite.
from חוּל; a (round) dance; dance(-cing).
the same as מָחוֹל; dancing; Machol, an Israelite; Mahol.
from חָזָה; a vision; vision.
from חָזָה; a window; light.
feminine plural from חָזָה; visions; Machazioth, an Israelite; Mahazioth.
from מָחָה; a stroke, i.e. battering-ram; engines.
from חוּד; junction; Mechida, one of the Nethinim; Mehida.
from חָיָה; preservation of life; hence, sustenance; also the live flesh, i.e. the quick; preserve life, quick, recover selves, reviving, sustenance, victuals.
from an unused root meaning to buy; price, payment, wages; gain, hire, price, sold, worth.
the same as מְחִיר; price; Mechir, an Israelite; Mehir.
from חָלָה; sickness; Machlah, the name apparently of two Israelitesses; Mahlah.
or (feminine) מַחֲלָה; from חָלָה; sickness; disease, infirmity, sickness.
xlit mᵉchôwlâh corrected to mᵉchôlâh; feminine of מָחוֹל; a dance; company, dances(-cing).
from חָלַל; a cavern (as if excavated); cave.
from חָלָה; sick; Machlon, an Israelite; Mahlon.
from חָלָה; sick; Machli, the name of two Israelites; Mahli.
patronymical from מַחְלִי; a Machlite or (collectively) descendants of Machli; Mahlites.
from חָלָה; a disease; disease.
from חָלַף; a (sacrificial) knife (as gliding through the flesh); knife.
from חָלַף; a ringlet of hair (as gliding over each other); lock.
from חָלַץ; a mantle (as easily drawn off); changeable suit of apparel, change of raiment.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מַחֲלֹקֶת; a section (of the Levites); course.
from חָלַק; a section (of Levites, people or soldiers); company, course, division, portion. See also סֶלַע הַמַּחְלְקוֹת.
from חָלָה; sickness; 'Machalath', probably the title (initial word) of a popular song; Mahalath.
the same as מַחֲלַת; sickness; Machalath, the name of an Ishmaelitess and of an Israelitess; Mahalath.
patrial from אָבֵל מְחוֹלָה; a Mecholathite or inhabitant of Abel-Mecholah; Mecholathite.
a denominative from חֶמְאָה; something buttery (i.e. unctuous and pleasant), as (figuratively) flattery; [idiom] than butter.
from חָמַד; delightful; hence, a delight, i.e. object of affection or desire; beloved, desire, goodly, lovely, pleasant (thing).
or מַחְמוּד; from חָמַד; desired; hence, a valuable; pleasant thing.
from חָמַל; (by paronomasia with מַחְמָד) delight; properly, sympathy; pitieth.

from חָנָה; an encampment (of travellers or troops); hence, an army, whether literal (of soldiers) or figurative (of dancers, angels, cattle, locusts, stars; or even the sacred courts); army, band, battle, camp, company, drove, host, tents.
from מַחֲנֶה and דָּן; camp of Dan; Machaneh-Dan, a place in Palestine; Mahaneh-dan.
dual of מַחֲנֶה; double camp; Machanajim, a place in Palestine; Mahanaim.
from חָנַק; choking; strangling.
or מַחְסֶה; from חָסָה; a shelter (literally or figuratively); hope, (place of) refuge, shelter, trust.
from חָסַם; a muzzle; bridle.
or מַחְסֹר; from חָסֵר; deficiency; hence, impoverishment; lack, need, penury, poor, poverty, want.
from מַחֲסֶה and יָהּ; refuge of (i.e. in) Jah; Machsejah, an Israelite; Maaseiah.
a primitive root; to dash asunder; by implication, to crush, smash or violently plunge; figuratively, to subdue or destroy; dip, pierce (through), smite (through), strike through, wound.
from מָחַץ; a contusion; stroke.
from חָצַב; properly, a hewing; concretely, a quarry; hewed(-n).
from חָצָהlemma חָעָה ayin, corrected to חָצָה; a halving; half.
from חָצָהlemma חָעָה ayin, corrected to חָצָה; a halving or the middle; half (so much), mid(-day).
a primitive root; to crush; smite off.
from חָקַר; properly, scrutinized, i.e. (by implication) a recess; deep place.
probably from אָחַר; properly, deferred, i.e. the morrow; usually (adverbially) tomorrow; indefinitely, hereafter; time to come, tomorrow.
from the same as חֶרֶא; a sink; draught house.
from חָרַשׁ; probably a pick-axe; mattock.
from חָרַשׁ; probably a hoe; share.
or מׇחֳרָתָם; (1 Samuel 30:17), feminine from the same as מָחָר; the morrow or (adverbially) tomorrow; morrow, next day.

or מַחֲשֶׁבֶת; from חָשַׁב; a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice); cunning (work), curious work, device(-sed), imagination, invented, means, purpose, thought.
from חָשַׁךְ; darkness; concretely, a dark place; dark(-ness, place).
from חָשַׂף; a peeling; made appear.
probably from מָחָה; erasure; Machath, the name of two Israelites; Mahath.
from חָתָה; properly, a dissolution; concretely, a ruin, or (abstractly) consternation; destruction, dismaying, ruin, terror.
the same as מְחִתָּה in the sense of removal; a pan for live coals; censer, firepan, snuffdish.
from חָתַר; a burglary; figuratively, unexpected examination; breaking up, secret search.
(Aramaic) or מְטָה; (Aramaic), apparently corresponding to מָצָא in the intransitive sense of being found present; to arrive, extend or happen; come, reach.
apparently a denominative from טִיט; a broom (as removing dirt (compare English 'to dust', i.e. remove dust)); besom.
from טָבַח; slaughter; slaughter.

or (feminine) מַטָּה; from נָטָה; a branch (as extending); figuratively, a tribe; also a rod, whether for chastising (figuratively, correction), ruling (a sceptre), throwing (a lance), or walking (a staff; figuratively, a support of life, e.g. bread); rod, staff, tribe.
from עָוַר with directive enclitic appended; downward, below or beneath; often adverbially with or without prefixes; beneath, down(-ward), less, very low, under(-neath).
from נָטָה; a bed (as extended) forsleeping or eating; by analogy, a sofa, litter or bier; bed(-chamber), bier.
from נָטָה; a stretching, i.e. distortion (figuratively, iniquity); perverseness.
from נָטָה; expansion; stretching out.
from טָוָה; something spun; spun.
from טוּל in the sense of hammering out; an iron bar (as forged); bar.
or מַטְמֹן; or מַטְמֻן; from טָמַן; a secret storehouse; hence, a secreted valuable (buried); generally money; hidden riches, (hid) treasure(-s).
from נָטַע; something planted, i.e. the place (a garden or vineyard), or the thing (a plant, figuratively or men); by implication, the act, planting; plant(-ation, -ing).
or (feminine) מַטְעַמָּה; from טָעַם; a delicacy; dainty (meat), savoury meat.
from טָפַח; a wide cloak (for a woman); vail, wimple.
a primitive root; to rain; (cause to) rain (upon).
from מָטַר; rain; rain.
