or מַטָּרָה; from נָטַר; a jail (as a guard-house); also an aim (as being closely watched); mark, prison.
from טָרַד; propulsive; Matred, an Edomitess; Matred.
from מָטַר; rainy; Matri, an Israelite; Matri.

an interrogative pronoun of persons, as מָה is of things,; who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix; any (man), [idiom] he, [idiom] him, [phrase] O that! what, which, who(-m, -se, -soever), [phrase] would to God.
from מַיִם and דֹּבֶא; water of quiet; Medeba, a place in Palestine; Medeba.
from יָדַד in the sense of loving; affectionate; Medad, an Israelite; Medad.
from מַיִם and יֵרָקוֹן with the art. interposed; water of the yellowness; Me-haj-Jarkon, a place in Palestine; Me-jarkon.
from מַיִם and זָהָב, water of gold; Me-Zahab, an Edomite; Mezahab.
from יָטַב; the best part; best.
a variation for מִיכָה; Mica, the name of two Israelites; Micha.
from מִי and (the prefix derivative from) כִּי and אֵל; who (is) like God?; Mikael, the name of an archangel and of nine Israelites; Michael.
an abbreviated form of מִיכָיָה; Micah, the name of seven Israelites; Micah, Micaiah, Michah.
a contr. for מִיכָיְהוּ; Mikehu, an Israelite prophet; Micaiah (2 Chronicles 18:8).
from מִי and (the prefix derivative from) כִּי and יָהּ; who (is) like Jah?; Micajah, the name of two Israelites; Micah, Michaiah. Compare מִיכָה.
or מִכָיְהוּ; (Jeremiah 36:11), abbreviated form for מִיכָיָהוּ; Mikajah, the name of three Israelites; Micah, Micaiah, Michaiah.
for מִיכָיָה; Mikajah, the name of an Israelite and an Israelitess; Michaiah.
from יָכֹל; properly, a container, i.e. a streamlet; brook.
apparently the same as מִיכָל; revulet; Mikal, Saul's daughter; Michal.
dual of a primitive noun (but used in a singular sense); water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen; [phrase] piss, wasting, water(-ing, (-course, -flood, -spring)).
a form for מִנְיָמִין; Mijamin, the name of three Israelites; Miamin, Mijamin.
from an unused root meaning to portion out; a sort, i.e. species; kind. Compare מִן.
properly, feminine passive participle of יָסַד; something founded, i.e. a foundation; foundation.
from סָכַךְ; a portico (as covered); covert.
from מוּץ; pressure; churning, forcing, wringing.
from מוּשׁ; departure; Mesha, a place in Arabia; also an Israelite; Mesha.
from מִי and אֵל with the abbreviated form insep. relatively (see אֲשֶׁר) interposed; who (is) what God (is) ?; Mishael, the name of three Israelites; Mishael.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מִישָׁאֵל; Mishael, an Israelite; Mishael.

or מִישֹׁר; from יָשַׁר; a level, i.e. a plain (often used (with the article prefix) as a proper name of certain districts); figuratively, concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) justice (sometimes adverbially, justly); equity, even place, plain, right(-eously), (made) straight, uprightness.
borrowed from מֵישַׁךְ; Meshak, an Israelite; Meshak.
(Aramaic) of foreign origin and doubtful significance; name of מִישָׁאֵל; Meshak, the Babylonian; Meshak.
from יָשַׁע; safety; Mesha, an Israelite; Mesha.
a variation for מֵישָׁע; safety; Mesha, a Moabite; Mesha.

from יָשַׁר; evenness, i.e. (figuratively) prosperity or concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) rectitude (only in plural with singular sense; often adverbially); agreement, aright, that are equal, equity, (things that are) right(-eously, things), sweetly, upright(-ly, -ness).
from יָתַר; (compare יֶתֶר); a cord (of a tent); or the string (of a bow); cord, string.
sometimes מַכְאוֹב; also (feminine Isaiah 53:3) מַכְאֹבָה; from כָּאַב; anguish or (figuratively) affliction; grief, pain, sorrow.
transitive participle of כָּבַר; plenty; abundance.
from the same as כַּבּוֹן; knoll; Macbena, a place in Palestine settled by him; Machbenah.
patrial from מַכְבֵּנָא; a Macbannite or native of Macbena; Machbanai.
from כָּבַר in the sense of covering (compare כְּבָרָה); a grate; grate.
from כָּבַר in the sense of covering; (compare מַכְבֵּר); a cloth (as netted); thick cloth.

or (masculine) מַכֶּה; (plural only) from נָכָה; a blow (in 2 Chronicles 2:10, of the flail); by implication,; a wound; figuratively, carnage, also pestilence; beaten, blow, plague, slaughter, smote, [idiom] sore, stripe, stroke, wound(-ed).
from כָּוָה; a burn; that burneth, burning.
from כּוּן; properly, a fixture, i.e. a basis; generally a place, especially as an abode; foundation, habitation, (dwelling-, settled) place.
or מְכֹנָה; feminine of מָכוֹן; a pedestal, also a spot; base.
or מְכֹרָה; from the same as כּוּר in the sense of dipping; origin (as if a mine); birth, habitation, nativity.
probably from מוּךְ; pining; Maki, an Israelite; Machi.
from מָכַר; salesman; Makir, an Israelite; Machir.
patronymical from מָכִיר; a Makirite or descendant of Makir; of Machir.
a primitive root; to tumble (in ruins); figuratively, to perish; be brought low, decay.
or מִכְלָה; from כָּלָא; a pen (for flocks); (sheep-)fold. Compare מִכְלָה.
from כָּלָה; completion (in plural concrete adverbial, wholly); perfect. Compare מִכְלָאָה.
from כָּלַל; perfection (i.e. concrete adverbial, splendidly); most gorgeously, all sorts.
from כָּלַל; perfection (of beauty); perfection.
from כָּלַל; something perfect, i.e. a splendid garment; all sorts.
from אָכַל; nourishment; food.
from the same as כַּמֹּן in the sense of hiding; treasure (as hidden); treasure.
(Ezra 2:2 or מִכְמָשׁ; or מִכְמַשׁ; (Nehemiah 11:31), from כָּמַס; hidden; Mikmas or Mikmash, a place in Palestine; Mikmas, Mikmash.
or מִכְמֹר; from כָּמַר in the sense of blackening by heat; a (hunter's) net (as dark from concealment); net.
or מִכְמֹרֶת; feminine of מַכְמָר; a (fisher's) net; drag, net.
apparently from an unused root meaning to hide; concealment; Mikmethath, a place in Palestine; Michmethath.
from מָה and נָדַב with a particle interposed; what (is) like (a) liberal (man) ?; Maknadbai, an Israelite; Machnadebai.
the same as מְכוֹנָה; a base; Mekonah, a place in Palestine; Mekonah.
the same as מְכוֹנָה; a spot; base.
from כָּמַס in the sense of hiding; (only in dual) drawers (from concealing the private parts); breeches.
probably from an unused root meaning to enumerate; an assessment (as based upon a census); tribute.
from כָּסָה; a covering, i.e. weatherboarding; covering.
feminine of מֶכֶס; an enumeration; by implication, a valuation; number, worth.
from כָּסָה; a covering, i.e. garment; specifically, a coverlet (for a bed), an awning (from the sun); also the omentum (as covering the intestines); clothing, to cover, that which covereth.
from כָּפַל; a fold; Makpelah, a place in Palestine; Machpelah.
a primitive root; to sell, literally (as merchandise, a daughter in marriage, into slavery), or figuratively (to surrender); [idiom] at all, sell (away, -er, self).
from מָכַר; merchandise; also value; pay, price, ware.
from נָכַר; an acquaintance; acquaintance.
from כָּרָה; a pit (for salt); (salt-) pit.
probably from the same as כּוּר in the sense of stabbing; a sword; habitation.
from מָכַר; salesman; Mikri, an Israelite; Michri.
patrial from an unused name (the same as מְכֵרָה) of a place in Palestine; a Mekerathite, or inhabitant of Mekerah; Mecherathite.

or מִכְשֹׁל; masculine from כָּשַׁל; a stumbling-block, literally or figuratively (obstacle, enticement (specifically an idol), scruple); caused to fall, offence, [idiom] (no-) thing offered, ruin, stumbling-block.
feminine from כָּשַׁל; a stumbling-block, but only figuratively (fall, enticement (idol)); ruin, stumbling-block.
from כָּתַב; a thing written, the characters, or a document (letter, copy, edict, poem); writing.
from כָּתַת; a fracture; bursting.
from כָּתַם; an engraving, i.e. (techn.) a poem; Michtam.
from כָּתַשׁ; a mortar; by analogy, a socket (of a tooth); hollow place, mortar.
the same as מַכְתֵּשׁ; dell; the Maktesh, a place in Jerusalem; Maktesh.

or מָלָא; (Esther 7:5), a primitive root; to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively); accomplish, confirm, [phrase] consecrate, be at an end, be expired, be fenced, fill, fulfil, (be, become, [idiom] draw, give in, go) full(-ly, -ly set, tale), (over-) flow, fulness, furnish, gather (selves, together), presume, replenish, satisfy, set, space, take a (hand-) full, [phrase] have wholly.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָלֵא; to fill; fill, be full.

from מָלֵא; full (literally or figuratively) or filling (literally); also (concretely) fulness; adverbially, fully; [idiom] she that was with child, fill(-ed, -ed with), full(-ly), multitude, as is worth.

rarely מְלוֹא; or מְלוֹ; (Ezekiel [41:8), from מָלֵא; fulness (literally or figuratively); [idiom] all along, [idiom] all that is (there-) in, fill, ([idiom] that whereof...was) full, fulness, (hand-) full, multitude.
from מָלֵא; a fulfilling (only in plural), i.e. (literally) a setting (of gems), or (technically) consecration (also concretely, a dedicatory sacrifice); consecration, be set.
feminine of מָלֵא; something fulfilled, i.e. abundance (of produce); (first of ripe) fruit, fulness.
feminine of מִלֻּא; a filling, i.e. setting (of gems); enclosing, setting.
from an unused root meaning to despatch as a deputy; a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher); ambassador, angel, king, messenger.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מֲלְאָךְ; an angel; angel.

from the same as מֲלְאָךְ; properly, deputyship, i.e. ministry; generally, employment (never servile) or work (abstractly or concretely); also property (as the result of labor); business, [phrase] cattle, [phrase] industrious, occupation, ([phrase] -pied), [phrase] officer, thing (made), use, (manner of) work((-man), -manship).
from the same as מֲלְאָךְ; a message; message.
xlit Malʻâkîy corrected to Malʼâkîy; from the same as מֲלְאָךְ; ministrative; Malaki, a prophet; Malachi.
from מָלֵא; fulness, i.e. (concretely) a plump socket (of the eye); [idiom] fitly.
or מַלְבֻּשׁ; from לָבַשׁ; a garment, or (collectively) clothing; apparel, raiment, vestment.
from לָבַן (denominative); a brickkiln; brickkiln.

from מָלַל (plural masculine as if from מִלֶּה; a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic; [phrase] answer, by-word, matter, any thing (what) to say, to speak(-ing), speak, talking, word.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מִלָּה; a word, command, discourse, or subject; commandment, matter, thing. word.
or מִלֹּא; (2 Kings 12:20), from מָלֵא; a rampart (as filled in), i.e. the citadel; Millo. See also בֵּית מִלּוֹא.
lemma מַלוּחַ missing dagesh, corrected to מַלּוּחַ; from מָלַח; sea-purslain (from its saltness); mallows.
or מַלּוּכִי; (Nehemiah 12:14), from מָלַךְ; remnant; Malluk, the name of five Israelites; Malluch, Melichu (from the margin).
feminine passive participle of מָלַךְ; something ruled, i.e. a realm; kingsom, king's, [idiom] royal.
from לוּן; a lodgment, i.e. caravanserai or encampment; inn, place where...lodge, lodging (place).
feminine from לוּן; a hut, a hammock; cottage, lodge.
apparently from מָלַל; I have talked (i.e. loquacious); Mallothi, an Israelite; Mallothi.

a primitive root; also as denominative from מֶלַח; properly, to rub to pieces or pulverize; intransitively, to disappear as dust; to salt whether internally (to season with salt) or externally (to rub with salt); [idiom] at all, salt, season, temper together, vanish away.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָלַח; to eat salt, i.e. (generally) subsist; [phrase] have maintenance.
(Aramaic) from מְלַח; salt; [phrase] maintenance, salt.
from מָלַח; properly, powder, i.e. (specifically) salt (as easily pulverized and dissolved); salt(-pit).
from מָלַח in its original sense; a rag or old garment; rotten rag.
from מָלַח in its second. sense; a sailor (as following 'the salt'); mariner.
from מָלַח (in its denominative sense); understood as land (אֶרֶץ); properly, salted (i.e. land), i.e. a desert; barren land(-ness), salt (land).
from לָחַם (in the sense of fighting); a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare); battle, fight(-ing), war(-rior).

a primitive root; properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks; deliver (self), escape, lay, leap out, let alone, let go, preserve, save, [idiom] speedily, [idiom] surely.
from מָלַט,; cement (from its plastic smoothness); clay.
from מֶלֶט and יָהּ; (whom) Jah has delivered; Melatjah, a Gibeonite; Melatiah.
from מְלַל (in the sense of cropping (compare מוּל)); a head of grain (as cut off); ear.
from לוּץ; an aphorism; also a satire; interpretation, taunting.

a primitive root; to reign; inceptively, to ascend the throne; causatively, to induct into royalty; hence (by implication) to take counsel; consult, [idiom] indeed, be (make, set a, set up) king, be (make) queen, (begin to, make to) reign(-ing), rule, [idiom] surely.
from מָלַךְ; a king; king, royal.
the same as מֶלֶךְ; king; Melek, the name of two Israelites; Melech, Hammelech (by including the article).
(Aramaic) corresponding to מֶלֶךְ; a king; king, royal.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to מָלַךְ in the sense of consultation; advice; counsel.
from מָלַךְ; Molek (i.e. king), the chief deity of the Ammonites; Molech. Compare מַלְכָּם.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מַלְכָּה; a queen; queen.
from לָכַד; a snare; trap.
a form of מַלְכָּה; queen; Milcah, the name of a Hebrewess and of an Israelite; Milcah.
feminine of מֶלֶךְ; a queen; queen.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מַלְכוּת; dominion (abstractly or concretely); kingdom, kingly, realm, reign.
or מַלְכֻת; or (in plural) מַלְכֻיָּה; from מָלַךְ; a rule; concretely, a dominion; empire, kingdom, realm, reign, royal.
from מֶלֶךְ and אֵל; king of (i.e. appointed by) God; Malkiel, an Israelite; Malchiel.
patronymical from מַלְכִּיאֵל; a Malkielite or descendant of Malkiel; Malchielite.

or מַלְכִּיָּהוּlemma מַלְכִּיָהוּ missing dagesh, corrected to מַלְכִּיָּהוּ; (Jeremiah [38:6), from מֶלֶךְ and יָהּ; king of (i.e. appointed by) Jah; Malkijah, the name of ten Israelites; Malchiah, Malchijah.
from מֶלֶךְ and צֶדֶק; king of right; Malki-Tsedek, an early king in Palestine; Melchizedek.
from מֶלֶךְ and רוּם; king of a high one (i.e. of exaltation); Malkiram, an Israelite; Malchiram.
from מֶלֶךְ and שׁוּעַ; king of wealth; Malkishua, an Israelite; Malchishua.
or מִלְכּוֹם; from מֶלֶךְ for מֹלֶךְ; Malcam or Milcom, the national idol of the Ammonites; Malcham, Milcom.
from מָלַךְ; a queen; queen.
feminine active participle of מָלַךְ; queen; Moleketh, an Israelitess; Hammoleketh (including the article).
a primitive root; to speak (mostly poetical) or say; say, speak, utter.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָלַל; to speak; say, speak(-ing).
from מָלַל; talkative; Milalai, an Israelite; Milalai.
from לָמַד; a goad for oxen; goad.
a primitive root; to be smooth, i.e. (figuratively) pleasant; be sweet.
of Persian derivation; the butler or other officer in the Babylonian court; Melzar.
a primitive root; to crack a joint; by implication, to wring the neck of afowl (without separating it); wring off.
from לָקַח; transitively (in dual) the jaws (as taking food); intransitively, spoil (and captives) (as taken); booty, jaws, prey.
from לָקַשׁ; (compare לֶקֶשׁ); the spring rain; figuratively, eloquence; latter rain.
or מַלְקָח; from לָקַח; (only in dual) tweezers; snuffers, tongs.
from an unused root meaning to spread out; a wardrobe (i.e. room where clothing is spread); vestry.
transp. for מְתַלְּעָה; a grinder, i.e. back tooth; great tooth.
from מָגַר (in the sense of depositing); a granary; barn.
from מָדַד; a measure; measure.
or (transp.) מוֹמֻכָן; (Esther 1:16), of Persian derivation; Memucan or Momucan, a Persian satrap; Memucan.
from מוּת; a mortal disease; concretely, a corpse; death.
from an unused root meaning to alienate; a mongrel, i.e. born of aJewish father and aheathen mother; bastard.
from מָכַר; merchandise; abstractly, a selling; [idiom] ought, (that which cometh of) sale, that which...sold, ware.
feminine of מִמְכָּר; a sale; [phrase] sold as.
from מָלַךְ; dominion, i.e. (abstractly) the estate (rule) or (concretely) the country (realm); kingdom, king's, reign, royal.
a form of מַמְלָכָה and equiv. to it; {dominion, i.e. (abstractly) the estate (rule) or (concretely) the country (realm)}; kingdom, reign.
from מָסַךְ; mixture, i.e. (specifically) wine mixed (with water or spices); drink-offering, mixed wine.
from an unused root meaning to grieve; sorrow; bitterness.
from מָרָא(in the sense of vigor); lusty; Mamre, an Amorite; Mamre.
from מָרַר; a bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) calamity; bitterness.
from מָשַׁח, in the sense of expansion; outspread (i.e. with outstretched wings); anointed.
from מָשַׁל; a ruler or (abstractly) rule; dominion, that ruled.
feminine of מִמְשָׁל; rule; also (concretely in plural) a realm or a ruler; dominion, government, power, to rule.
from the same as מֶשֶׁק; a possession; breeding.
from מָתַק; something sweet (literally or figuratively); (most) sweet.
from מָה; literally a whatness (so to speak), i.e. manna (so called from the question about it); manna.
(Aramaic) from מָה; who or what (properly, interrogatively, hence, also indefinitely and relatively); what, who(-msoever, [phrase] -so).

or מִנִּי; or מִנֵּי; (constructive plural) (Isaiah 30:11); for מֵן; properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses; above, after, among, at, because of, by (reason of), from (among), in, [idiom] neither, [idiom] nor, (out) of, over, since, [idiom] then, through, [idiom] whether, with.

(Aramaic) corresponding to מִן; {properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of}; according, after, [phrase] because, [phrase] before, by, for, from, [idiom] him, [idiom] more than, (out) of, part, since, [idiom] these, to, upon, [phrase] when.

from an unused root meaning to apportion; a part; hence,; a musical chord (as parted into strings); in (the same) (Psalm 68:23), stringed instrument (Psalm 150:4), whereby (Psalm 45:8 (defective plural)).
(Aramaic) or מְנָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to מָנָה; to count, appoint; number, ordain, set.
xlit menêʼ corrected to mᵉnêʼ; (Aramaic) passive participle of מְנָא; numbered; Mene.
from נָגַן; a satire; music.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מַדָּע; wisdom or intelligence; knowledge, reason, understanding.
a primitive root; properly, to weigh out; by implication, to allot or constitute officially; also to enumerate or enroll; appoint, count, number, prepare, set, tell.
from מָנָה; properly, a fixed weight or measured amount, i.e. (techn.) a maneh or mina; maneh, pound.
from מָנָה; properly, something weighed out, i.e. (figuratively) a portion of time, i.e. an instance; time.
from מָנָה; properly, something weighed out, i.e. (generally) a division; specifically (of food) a ration; also a lot; such things as belonged, part, portion.
from נָהַג; the driving (of a chariot); driving.
from נָהַר; properly, a channel or fissure, i.e. (by implication) a cavern; den.
from נוּד; a nodding or toss (of the head in derision); shaking.
from נוּחַ; quiet, i.e. (concretely) a settled spot, or (figuratively) a home; (place of) rest.
the same as מָנוֹחַ; rest; Manoach, an Israelite; Manoah.

or מְנֻחָה; feminine of מָנוֹחַ; repose or (adverbially) peacefully; figuratively, consolation (specifically, matrimony); hence (concretely) an abode; comfortable, ease, quiet, rest(-ing place), still.
from נוּן; a continuator, i.e. heir; son.
from נוּס; a retreat (literally or figuratively); abstractly, a fleeing; [idiom] apace, escape, way to flee, flight, refuge.
or מְנֻסָה; feminine of מָנוֹס; retreat; fleeing, flight.
from נִיר; a yoke (properly, for plowing), i.e. the frame of aloom; beam.
or מְנֹרָה; feminine of מָנוֹר (in the original sense of נִיר); a chandelier; candlestick.
from נָזַר; a prince; crowned.

from an unused root meaning to apportion, i.e. bestow; a donation; euphemistically, tribute; specifically a sacrificial offering (usually bloodless and voluntary); gift, oblation, (meat) offering, present, sacrifice.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מִנְחָה; a sacrificial offering; oblation, meat offering.
from נָחַם; comforter; Menachem, an Israelite; Menahem.
from נוּחַ; rest; Manachath, the name of an Edomite and of a place in Moab; Manahath.
from מָנָה; the Apportioner, i.e. Fate (as an idol); number.
of foreign derivation; Minni, an Armenian province; Minni.
from מִן and יָמִין; from (the) right hand; Minjamin, the name of two Israelites; Miniamin. Compare מִיָּמִן.
(Aramaic) from מְנָא; enumeration; number.
from the same as מֵן; enumeration; Minnith, a place East of the Jordan; Minnith.
from נָלָה; completion, i.e. (in produce) wealth; perfection.
a primitive root; to debar (negatively or positively) from benefit or injury; deny, keep (back), refrain, restrain, withhold.
or מַנְעֻל; from נָעַל; a bolt; lock.
xlit manʻâl corrected to minʻâl; from נָעַל; a bolt; shoe.
from נָעֵם; a delicacy; dainty.
from נוּעַ; a sistrum (so called from its rattling sound); cornet.
from נָקָה; a sacrificial basin (for holding blood); bowl.
from נָשָׁה; causing to forget; Menashsheh, a grandson of Jacob, also the tribe descended from him, and its territory; Manasseh.
from מְנַשֶּׁה; a Menashshite or descendant of Menashsheh; of Manasseh, Manassites.
from מָנָה; an allotment (by courtesy, law or providence); portion.
or מִס; from מָסַס; properly, a burden (as causing to faint), i.e. a tax in the form of forced labor; discomfited, levy, task(-master), tribute(-tary).
from מָסַס; fainting, i.e. (figuratively) disconsolate; is afflicted.
plural masculine מְסִבִּים; or feminine מְסִבּוֹת; from סָבַב; a divan (as enclosing the room); abstractly (adverbial) around; that compass about, (place) round about, at table.
from סָגַר; a fastener, i.e. (of a person) a smith, (of a thing) a prison; prison, smith.
from סָגַר; something enclosing, i.e. a margin (of a region, of a panel); concretely, a stronghold; border, close place, hole.
from יָסַד; a foundation; foundation.
from the same as סֶדֶר; a colonnade or internal portico (from its rows of pillars); porch.
a primitive root; to dissolve; make to consume away, (make to) melt, water.
from מָסַס (in the sense of flowing); abundance, i.e. (adverbially) liberally; tribute.
from נָסָה; a testing, of men (judicial) or of God (querulous); temptation, trial.
the same as מַסָּה; Massah, a place in the Desert; Massah.
apparently from an unused root meaning to cover; a veil; vail.
for מְשׂוּכָה; a hedge; thorn hedge.
from נָסַח in the sense of staving off; a cordon, (adverbially) or (as a) military barrier; broken down.
from סָחַר; trade; traffic.
a primitive root; to mix, especially wine (with spices); mingle.
from מָסַךְ; a mixture, i.e. of wine with spices; mixture.
from סָכַךְ; a cover, i.e. veil; covering, curtain, hanging.
from סָכַךְ; a covering, i.e. garniture; covering.

from נָסַךְ; properly, a pouring over, i.e. fusion of metal (especially a cast image); by implication, a libation, i.e. league; concretely a coverlet (as if poured out); covering, molten (image), vail.
from סִכְלוּת; indigent; poor (man).
by transp. from כָּנַס; a magazine; store(-house), treasure.
from מִסְכֵּן; indigence; scarceness.
from נָסַךְ in the sense of spreading out; something expanded, i.e. the warp in aloom (as stretched out to receive the woof); web.
from סָלַל; a thoroughfare (as turnpiked), literally or figuratively; specifically a viaduct, a staircase; causeway, course, highway, path, terrace.
from סָלַל; a thoroughfare (as turnpiked); highway.
or מִסְמֵר; also (feminine) מַסְמְרָה; or מִסְמְרָה; or even מַשְׂמְרָה; (Ecclesiastes 12:11), from סָמַר; a peg (as bristling from the surface); nail.
a primitive root; to liquefy; figuratively, to waste (with disease), to faint (with fatigue, fear or grief); discourage, faint, be loosed, melt (away), refuse, [idiom] utterly.
from נָסַע; a departure (from striking the tents), i.e. march (not necessarily a single day's travel); by implication, a station (or point of departure); journey(-ing).
from נָסַע in the sense of projecting; a missile (spear or arrow); also a quarry (whence stones are, as it were, ejected); before it was brought, dart.
' from סָעַד; a balustrade (for stairs); pillar.
from סָפַד; a lamentation; lamentation, one mourneth, mourning, wailing.
from an unused root meaning to collect; fodder; provender.
from סָפַח; a veil (as spread out); kerchief.
from סָפַח; scruf (as spreading over the surface); scab.

from סָפַר; a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration; [phrase] abundance, account, [idiom] all, [idiom] few, (in-) finite, (certain) number(-ed), tale, telling, [phrase] time.
the same as מֶלְקָח; number; Mispar, an Israelite; Mizpar. Compare מִסְפֶּרֶת.
feminine of מַלְכוּ; enumeration; Mispereth, an Israelite; Mispereth. Compare מֶלְתָּחָה.
a primitive root; to sunder, i.e. (transitively) set apart, or (reflex.) apostatize; commit, deliver.
from יָסַר; admonition; instruction.
from אָסַר; a band; bond.
from סָתַר; a refuge; covert.
from סָתַר; properly, a hider, i.e. (abstractly) a hiding, i.e. aversion; hid.
from סָתַר; properly, a concealer, i.e. a covert; secret(-ly, place).
from עָבַד; an act; work.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מַעְבָּד; an act; work.
from עָבָה; properly, compact (part of soil), i.e. loam; clay.
or feminine מַעֲבָרָה; from עָבַר; a crossing-place (of a river, a ford; of a mountain, a pass); abstractly, a transit, i.e. (figuratively) overwhelming; ford, place where...pass, passage.
or feminine מַעְגָּלָה; from the same as עָגֹל; a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular); going, path, trench, way(-side).
a primitive root; to waver; make to shake, slide, slip.
from עָדָה; ornamental; Maadai, an Israelite; Maadai.
from עָדָה and יָהּ; ornament of Jah; Maadjah, an Israelite; Maadiah. Compare מוֹעַדְיָה.
or (feminine) מַעֲדַנָּה; from עָדַן; a delicacy or (abstractly) pleasure (adverbially, cheerfully); dainty, delicately, delight.
by transitive from עָנַד; a bond, i.e. group; influence.
from עֲדַר; a (weeding) hoe; mattock.
(Aramaic) or מְעָא; (Aramaic), corresponding to מֵעֶהxlit mêʻâh corrected to mêʻeh; only in plural the bowels; belly.

xlit mêʻâh corrected to mêʻeh; from an unused root probably meaning to be soft; used only in plural the intestines, or (collectively) the abdomen, figuratively, sympathy; by implication, a vest; by extension the stomach, the uterus (or of men, the seat of generation), the heart (figuratively); belly, bowels, [idiom] heart, womb.
feminine of מֵעֶהxlit mêʻâh corrected to mêʻeh; the belly, i.e. (figuratively) interior; gravel.
from עוּג; also with לָעֵג a table-buffoon, i.e.; a cake of bread; parasite; cake, feast.
(also מָעוּז ); or מָעֹז (also מָעֻז; from עָזַז; a fortified place; figuratively, a defence; force, fort(-ress), rock, strength(-en), ([idiom] most) strong (hold).
from מָעַךְ; oppressed; Maok, a Philistine; Maoch.

or מָעִין; (1 Chronicles 4:41), from the same as עוֹנָה; an abode, of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a retreat (asylum); den, dwelling((-) place), habitation.
the same as מָעוֹן; a residence; Maon, the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine; Maon, Maonites. Compare בֵּית בַּעַל מְעוֹן, מְעוּנִיlemma מְעוּנָי third vowel, corrected to מְעוּנִי.

or מְעֹנָה; feminine of מָעוֹן, and meaning the same; {an abode, of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a retreat (asylum)}; den, habitation, (dwelling) place, refuge.
lemma מְעוּנָי third vowel, corrected to מְעוּנִי; or מְעִינִי; probably patrial from מָעוֹן; a Meunite, or inhabitant of Maon (only in plural); Mehunim(-s), Meunim.
plural of מְעוֹנָה; habitative; Meonothai, an Israelite; Meonothai.
from עוּף in the sense of covering with shade (compare מוּעָף); darkness; dimness.
from עוּר; nakedness, i.e. (in plural) the pudenda; nakedness.
or מַעַזְיָהוּ; probably from עוּז (in the sense of protection) and יָהּ; rescue of Jah; Maazjah, the name of two Israelites; Maaziah.

a primitive root; properly, to pare off, i.e. lessen; intransitively, to be (or causatively, to make) small or few (or figuratively, ineffective); suffer to decrease, diminish, (be, [idiom] borrow a, give, make) few (in number, -ness), gather least (little), be (seem) little, ([idiom] give the) less, be minished, bring to nothing.
or מְעָט; from מָעַט; a little or few (often adverbial or compar.); almost (some, very) few(-er, -est), lightly, little (while), (very) small (matter, thing), some, soon, [idiom] very.
passive adjective of מָעַט; thinned (as to the edge), i.e. sharp; wrapped up.
from עָטָה; a vestment; garment.
from עָטַף; a cloak; mantle.
from עָוָה; (compare עִי); a pile of rubbish (as contorted), i.e. a ruin; heap.
xlit Mâʻai corrected to Mâʻay; probably from מֵעֶהxlit mêʻâh corrected to mêʻeh; sympathetic; Maai, an Israelite; Maai.
from מָעַל in the sense of covering; a robe (i.e. upper and outer garment); cloke, coat, mantle, robe.

or מַעְיְנוֹ; (Psalm 114:8), or (feminine) מַעְיָנָה; from עַיִן (as a denominative in the sense of a spring); a fountain (also collectively), figuratively, a source (of satisfaction); fountain, spring, well.
a primitive root; to press, i.e. to pierce, emasculate, handle; bruised, stuck, be pressed.

or מַעֲכָת; (Joshua 13:13), from מָעַךְ; depression; Maakah (or Maakath), the name of a place in Syria, also of a Mesopotamian, of three Israelites, and of four Israelitesses and one Syrian woman; Maachah, Maachathites. See also בֵּית מַעֲכָה.
patrial from מַעֲכָה; a Maakathite, or inhabitant of Maakah; Maachathite.
a primitive root; properly, to cover up; used only figuratively, to act covertly, i.e. treacherously; transgress, (commit, do a) trespass(-ing).
from מָעַל; treachery, i.e. sin; falsehood, grievously, sore, transgression, trespass, [idiom] very.

from עָלָה; properly, the upper part, used only adverbially with prefix upward, above, overhead, from the top, etc.; above, exceeding(-ly), forward, on ([idiom] very) high, over, up(-on, -ward), very.
(Aramaic) from עֲלַל; (only in plural as singular) the setting (of the sun); going down.
from עָלָה; a raising (of the hands); lifting up.

from עָלָה; an elevation, i.e. (concretely) acclivity or platform; abstractly (the relation or state) a rise or (figuratively) priority; ascent, before, chiefest, cliff, that goeth up, going up, hill, mounting up, stairs.

feminine of מַעֲלֶה; elevation, i.e. the act (literally, a journey to a higher place, figuratively, a thought arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a step or grademark, figuratively, a superiority of station); specifically a climactic progression (in certain Psalms); things that come up, (high) degree, deal, go up, stair, step, story.
from מַעֲלֶה and (the plural of) עַקְרָב; Steep of Scorpions, a place in the Desert; Maaleh-accrabim, the ascent (going up) of Akrabbim.
from עָלַל; an act (good or bad); doing, endeavour, invention, work.
from עָמַד; (figuratively) a position; attendance, office, place, state.
from עָמַד; literally a foothold; standing.
from עָמַס; burdensomeness; burdensome.
from עָמַק; a deep; deep, depth.

from עָנָה; properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that; because of, to the end (intent) that, for (to,... 's sake), [phrase] lest, that, to.
from עָנָה; a reply (favorable or contradictory); answer, [idiom] himself.
from עָנָה, in the sense of depression or tilling; a furrow; [phrase] acre, furrow.
from עָצָה; closure; Maats, an Israelite; Maaz.
from עָצַב; anguish; sorrow.
from an unused root meaning to hew; an axe; ax, tongs.
from עָצָר; objectively, a hindrance; restraint.
from עָצָר; subjectively, control; rule.
from an unused root meaning to repress; a parapet; battlement.
from עָקַשׁ; a crook (in a road); crooked thing.
from עָרָה; a nude place, i.e. (literally) the pudenda, or (figuratively) a vacant space; nakedness, proportion.
from עָרַב, in the sense of trading; traffic; by implication, mercantile goods; market, merchandise.
or (feminine) מַעֲרָבָה; from עָרַב, in the sense of shading; the west (as a region of the evening sun); west.
from עָרָה; a nude place, i.e. a common; meadows.
feminine of מַעֲרֶה; an open spot; army (from the margin).
from עוּר; a cavern (as dark); cave, den, hole.
the same as מְעָרָה; cave; Mearah, a place in Palestine; Mearah.
from עָרַךְ; an arrangement, i.e. (figuratively) mental disposition; preparation.
feminine of מַעֲרָךְ; an arrangement; concretely, a pile; specifically a military array; army, fight, be set in order, ordered place, rank, row.
from עָרַךְ; an arrangement, i.e. (concretely) a pile (of loaves); row, shewbread.
from עָרַם, in the sense of stripping; bare; naked.
from עָרַץ; violence; terror.
a form of מַעֲרָה; waste; Maarath, a place in Palestine; Maarath.

from עָשָׂה; an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property; act, art, [phrase] bakemeat, business, deed, do(-ing), labor, thing made, ware of making, occupation, thing offered, operation, possession, [idiom] well, (handy-, needle-, net-) work(ing, -manship), wrought.
xlit Maʻsay corrected to Maʻăsay; from עָשָׂה; operative; Maasai, an Israelite; Maasiai.
or מַעֲשֵׂיָהוּ; from מַעֲשֶׂה and יָהּ; work of Jah; Maasejah, the name of sixteen Israelites; Maaseiah.
from עָשַׁק; oppression; oppression, [idiom] oppressor.
or מַעֲשַׂר; and (in plural) feminine מַעַשְׂרָה; from עָשָׂר; a tenth; especially a tithe; tenth (part), tithe(-ing).
of Egyptian origin; Moph, the capital of Lower Egypt; Memphis. Compare נֹף.
from פָּגַע; an object of attack; mark.
from נָפַח; a breathing out (of life), i.e. expiring; giving up.
from נָפַח; the bellows (i.e. blower) of aforge; bellows.
or מְפִבֹשֶׁת; probably from פָּאָה and בֹּשֶׁת; dispeller of shame (i.e. of Baal); Mephibosheth, the name of two Israelites; Mephibosheth.
a plural apparently from נוּף; wavings; Muppim, an Israelite; Muppim. Compare שֻׁפִּים.
from פּוּץ; a breaker, i.e. mallet; maul.
from נָפַל; a falling off, i.e. chaff; also something pendulous, i.e. a flap; flake, refuse.
from פָּלָא; a miracle; wondrous work.
from פָּלַג; a classification; division.
or מַפֵּלָה; from נָפַל; something fallen, i.e. a ruin; ruin(-ous).
from פָּלַט; an escape; escape.
from פָּלַץ; a terror, i.e. an idol; idol.
from an unused root meaning to balance; a poising; balancing.
from נָפַל; fall, i.e. decadence; concretely, a ruin; specifically a carcase; carcase, fall, ruin.
or (feminine) מִפְעָלָה; from פָּעַל; a performance; work.
from נָפַץ; a smiting to pieces; slaughter.
from נָפַץ; a smiter, i.e. a war club; battle ax.
from פָּקַד; an appointment, i.e. mandate; concretely, a designated spot; specifically, a census; appointed place, commandment, number.
the same as מִפְקָד; assignment; Miphkad, the name of a gate in Jerusalem; Miphkad.
from פָּרַץlemma פּרַץ missing vowel, corrected to פָּרַץ; a break (in the shore), i.e. a haven; breach.
xlit miphreketh corrected to miphreqeth; from פָּרַק; properly, a fracture, i.e. joint (vertebrae) of the neck; neck.
from פָּרַשׂ; an expansion; that which...spreadest forth, spreading.
from פָּשַׂע; a stride, i.e. (by euphemism) the crotch; buttocks.
from פָּתַח; an opener, i.e. a key; key.
from פָּתַח; an aperture, i.e. (figuratively) utterance; opening.
from the same as פֶּתֶן; a stretcher, i.e. a sill; threshold.
or מוֹץ; (Zephaniah 2:2), from מוּץ; chaff (as pressed out, i.e. winnowed or (rather) threshed loose); chaff.

a primitive root; properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present; [phrase] be able, befall, being, catch, [idiom] certainly, (cause to) come (on, to, to hand), deliver, be enough (cause to) find(-ing, occasion, out), get (hold upon), [idiom] have (here), be here, hit, be left, light (up-) on, meet (with), [idiom] occasion serve, (be) present, ready, speed, suffice, take hold on.
from נָצַב; a fixed spot; figuratively, an office, a military post; garrison, station, place where...stood.
from נָצַב; a station, i.e. military post; mount.
or מִצָּבָה; feminine of מַצָּב; a military guard; army, garrison.
feminine (causatively) participle of נָצַב; something stationed, i.e. a column or (memorial stone); by analogy, an idol; garrison, (standing) image, pillar.
apparently from מָצָא and יָהּ; found of Jah; Metsobajah, a place in Palestine; Mesobaite.
from נָצַב; something stationary, i.e. a monumental stone; also the stock of atree; pillar, substance.
or מְצָד; or (feminine) מְצָדָה; from צוּד; a fastness (as a covert of ambush); castle, fort, (strong) hold, munition.
a primitive root; to suck out; by implication, to drain, to squeeze out; suck, wring (out).
active participle feminine of מָצָה; drained; Motsah, a place in Palestine; Mozah.

from מָצַץ in the sense of greedily devouring for sweetness; properly, sweetness; concretely, sweet (i.e. not soured or bittered with yeast); specifically, an unfermented cake or loaf, or (elliptically) the festival of Passover (because no leaven was then used); unleaved (bread, cake), without leaven.
from נָצָה; a quarrel; contention, debate, strife.
from צָהַל; a whinnying (through impatience for battle or lust); neighing.
or (feminine) מְצוֹדָה; or מצֹדָה; from צוּד; also (by interchange for מְצַד); a net (for capturing animals or fishes);  afastness or (beseiging) tower; bulwark, hold, munition, net, snare.
or (feminine) מְצוּדָה; or מְצֻדָה; for מָצוֹד; a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness; castle, defense, fort(-ress), (strong) hold, be hunted, net, snare, strong place.
from צָוָה; a command, whether human or divine (collectively, the Law); (which was) commanded(-ment), law, ordinance, precept.
or מְצֹלָה; also מְצוּלָה; or מְצֻלָה; from the same as צוּלָה; a deep place (of water or mud); bottom, deep, depth.
from צוּק; a narrow place, i.e. (abstractly and figuratively) confinement or disability; anguish, distress, straitness.
or מָצֻק; from צוּק; something narrow, i.e. a column or hilltop; pillar, situate.
or מְצֻקָה; feminine of מָצוּק; narrowness, i.e. (figuratively) trouble; anguish, distress.

or מָצוּר; from צוּר; something hemming in, i.e. (objectively) a mound (of besiegers), (abstractly) a siege, (figuratively) distress; or (subjectively) a fastness; besieged, bulwark, defence, fenced, fortress, siege, strong (hold), tower.
the same as מָצוֹר in the sense of a limit; Egypt (as the border of Palestine); besieged places, defense, fortified.

or מְצֻרָה; feminine of מָצוֹר; a hemming in, i.e. (objectively) a mound (of siege), or (subjectively) a rampart (of protection), (abstractly) fortification; fenced (city, fort, munition, strong hold.
from נָצָה; a quarrel; that contended.
from an unused root meaning to be clear, i.e. conspicuous; the forehead (as open and prominent); brow, forehead, [phrase] impudent.
from the same as מֵצַח; a shinpiece of armor (as prominent), only plural; greaves.
from צָלַל; a tinkler, i.e. a bell; bell.
from צָלַל; shade; bottom.
from צָלַל; (only dual) double tinklers, i.e. cymbals; cymbals.
from צָנַף; a tiara, i.e. official turban (of a king or high priest); diadem, mitre.
from יַצַע; a couch; bed.
from צָעַד; a step; figuratively, companionship; going, step.
feminine of מִצְעָר; properly, littleness; concretely, diminutive; little.
from צָעַר; petty (in size or number); adverbially, a short (time); little one (while), small.
the same as מִצְעָר; Mitsar, a peak of Lebanon; Mizar.
from צָפָה; an observatory, especially formilitary purposes; watch tower.
the same as מִצְפֶּה; Mitspeh, the name of five places in Palestine; Mizpeh, watch tower. Compare מִצְפָּה.
feminine of מִצְפֶּה; Mitspah, the name of two places in Palestine; Mitspah. (This seems rather to be only an orthographic variation of מִצְפֶּה when 'in pause'.)
from צָפַן; a secret (place or thing, perhaps, treasure); hidden thing.
a primitive root; to suck; milk.
from קֵבָה; something tight, i.e. (figuratively) trouble; distress, pain, strait.
from מִצְרַיִם; a Mitsrite, or inhabitant of Mitsrajim; Egyptian, of Egypt.
dual of מָצוֹר; Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt; Egypt, Egyptians, Mizraim.
from צָרַף; a crucible; fining pot.
from מָקַק; properly, a melting, i.e. putridity; rottenness, stink.
from נָקַב; properly, a perforatrix, i.e. a hammer (as piercing); hammer.
from נָקַב; properly, a perforator, i.e. a hammer (as piercing); also (intransitively) a perforation, i.e. a quarry; hammer, hole.
from the same as נָקֹד in the denominative sense of herding (compare נֹקֵד); fold; Makkedah, a place in Palestine; Makkedah.
or מִקְּדָשׁ; (Exodus 15:17), from קָדַשׁ; a consecrated thing or place, especially, a palace, sanctuary (whether of Jehovah or of idols) or asylum; chapel, hallowed part, holy place, sanctuary.
or (feminine) מַקְהֵלָה; from קָהַל; an assembly; congregation.
plural of מַקְהֵל (feminine); assemblies; Makheloth, a place in the Desert; Makheloth.

or מִקְוֵה; (1 Kings 10:28), or מִקְוֵאlemma מִּקְוֵא extra dagesh, corrected to מִקְוֵא; (2 Chronicles 1:16), from קָוָה; something waited for, i.e. confidence (objective or subjective); also a collection, i.e. (of water) a pond, or (of men and horses) a caravan or drove; abiding, gathering together, hope, linen yarn, plenty (of water), pool.
feminine of מִקְוֶה; a collection, i.e. (of water) a reservoir; ditch.

or מָקֹם; also (feminine) מְקוֹמָה; or מְקֹמָה; from קוּם; properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind); country, [idiom] home, [idiom] open, place, room, space, [idiom] whither(-soever).

or מָקֹר; from קוּר; properly, something dug, i.e. a (general) source (of water, even when naturally flowing; also of tears, blood (by euphemism, of the female pudenda); figuratively, of happiness, wisdom, progeny); fountain, issue, spring, well(-spring).
from לָקַח; reception; taking.
from לָקַח; something received, i.e. merchandise (purchased); ware.
from קָטַר; something to fume (incense) on i.e. a hearth place; to burn...upon.
feminine of מִקְטָר; something to fume (incense) in, i.e. a coal-pan; censer.
or (feminine) מַקְּלָה; from an unused root meaning apparently to germinate; a shoot, i.e. stick (with leaves on, or for walking, striking, guiding, divining); rod, (hand-)staff.
(or perhaps mik-kel-ohth') plural of (feminine) מַקֵּל; rods; Mikloth, a place in the Desert; Mikloth.
from קָלַט in the sense of taking in; an asylum (as a receptacle); refuge.
from קָלַע; a sculpture (probably in bas-relief); carved (figure), carving, graving.
from קָנָה; something bought, i.e. property, but only livestock; abstractly, acquisition; cattle, flock, herd, possession, purchase, substance.
feminine of מִקְנֶה; properly, a buying, i.e. acquisition; concretely, a piece of property (land or living); also the sum paid; (he that is) bought, possession, piece, purchase.
from מִקְנֶה and יָהּ; possession of Jah; Miknejah, an Israelite; Mikneiah.
from קָסַם; an augury; divination.
from קָצַץ; end; Makats, a place in Palestine; Makaz.
or מַקְצֹעַ; or (feminine) מַקְצֹעָה; from קָצַע in the denominative sense of bending; an angle or recess; corner, turning.
from קָצַע; a scraper, i.e. a carving chisel; plane.
from קָצַע in the denominative sense of bending; an angle; corner.
' a primitive root; to melt; figuratively, to flow, dwindle, vanish; consume away, be corrupt, dissolve, pine away.
from קָרָא; something called out, i.e. a public meeting (the act, the persons, or the place); also a rehearsal; assembly, calling, convocation, reading.
from קָרָה; something met with, i.e. an accident or fortune; something befallen, befalleth, chance, event, hap(-peneth).
from קָרָה; properly, something meeting, i.e. a frame (of timbers); building.
from the same as קַר; a cooling off; [idiom] summer.
from קָשָׁה in the sense of knotting up round and hard; something turned (rounded), i.e. a curl (of tresses); [idiom] well (set) hair.
feminine of מִקְשֶׁה; rounded work, i.e. moulded by hammering (repousse); beaten (out of one piece, work), upright, whole piece.
denominative from קִשֻּׁא; literally a cucumbered field, i.e. a cucumber patch; garden of cucumbers.

or (feminine) מָרָה; from מָרַר; bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly; [phrase] angry, bitter(-ly, -ness), chafed, discontented, [idiom] great, heavy.
from מָרַר in its original sense of distillation; a drop; drop.
or מוֹר; from מָרַר; myrrh (as distilling in drops, and also as bitter); myrrh.
a primitive root; to rebel; hence (through the idea of maltreating) to whip, i.e. lash (self with wings, as the ostrich in running); be filthy, lift up self.
for מַר feminine; bitter; Mara, a symbolic name of Naomi; Mara.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to מָרָא in the sense of domineering; a master; lord, Lord.
of foreign derivation; Merodak-Baladan, a Babylonian king; Merodach-baladan. Compare מְרֹדָךְ.

from רָאָה; a view (the act of seeing); also an appearance (the thing seen), whether (real) a shape (especially if handsome, comeliness; often plural the looks), or (mental) a vision; [idiom] apparently, appearance(-reth), [idiom] as soon as beautiful(-ly), countenance, fair, favoured, form, goodly, to look (up) on (to), look(-eth), pattern, to see, seem, sight, visage, vision.
feminine of מַרְאֶה; a vision; also (causatively) a mirror; looking glass, vision.
apparently feminine passive causative participle of רָאָה; something conspicuous, i.e. the craw of abird (from its prominence); crop.
denominative from רֹאשׁ; properly, headship, i.e. (plural for collective) dominion; principality.
or מַרֵשָׁה; formed like מַרְאָשָׁה; summit; Mareshah, the name of two Israelites and of a place in Palestine; Mareshah.
formed like מַרְאָשָׁה; properly, a headpiece, i.e. (plural for adverbial) at (or as) the head-rest (or pillow); bolster, head, pillow. Compare מַרְגְלָה.
from רָבַב; increase; Merab, a daughter of Saul; Merab.
from רָבַד; a coverlet; covering of tapestry.
from רָבָה; properly, increasing; as noun, greatness, or (adverbially) greatly; great, increase.
from רָבָה; abundance, i.e. a great quantity; much.
from רָבָה; a multitude; also offspring; specifically interest (on capital); greatest part, greatness, increase, multitude.
from רָבַץ; a reclining place, i.e. fold (for flocks); couching place, place to lie down.
from an unused root meaning to tie up; a stall (for cattle); [idiom] fat(-ted), stall.
from רָגַע; a resting place; rest.
denominative from רֶגֶל; (plural for collective) a footpiece, i.e. (adverbially) at the foot, or (direct.) the foot itself; feet. Compare מְרַאֲשָׁה.
from רָגַם; a stone-heap; sling.
from רָגַע; rest; refreshing.
a primitive root; to rebel; rebel(-lious).
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to מָרַד; rebellion; rebellion.
from מָרַד; rebellion; rebellion.
the same as מֶרֶד; Mered, an Israelite; Mered.
(Aramaic) from the same as מְרַד; rebellious; rebellious.
from מָרַד; rebelliousness; [idiom] rebellious.
of foreign derivation; Merodak, a Babylonian idol; Merodach. Compare מְרֹאדַךְ בַּלְאָדָן.
of foreign derivation; Mordecai, an Israelite; Mordecai.
from רָדַף; persecuted; persecuted.

a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) bitter (or unpleasant); (figuratively) to rebel (or resist; causatively, to provoke); bitter, change, be disobedient, disobey, grievously, provocation, provoke(-ing), (be) rebel (against, -lious).
the same as מַר feminine; bitter; Marah, a place in the Desert; Marah.
from מָרַר; bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) trouble; grief.
lemma מָרָה missing dagesh, corrected to מׇרָּה; a form of מֹרָה; trouble; bitterness.
from רוּד in the sense of maltreatment; an outcast; (abstractly) destitution; cast out, misery.
of uncertain derivation; Meroz, a place in Palestine; Meroz.
from מָרַח; bruised, i.e. emasculated; broken.

from רוּם; altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft); (far) above, dignity, haughty, height, (most, on) high (one, place), loftily, upward.
formed like מָרוֹם; height; Merom, a lake in Palestine; Merom.
from רוּץ; a run (the trial of speed); race.
or מְרֻצָה; feminine of מֵרוֹץ; a race (the act), whether the manner or the progress; course, running. Compare מְרֻצָה.
from מָרַק; properly, rubbed; but used abstractly, a rubbing (with perfumery); purification.
plural of מַר feminine; bitter springs; Maroth, a place in Palestine; Maroth.
from an unused root meaning to scream; a cry, i.e. (of job), a revel; banquet.
formed like מִרְזַח; a cry, i.e. (of grief) a lamentation; mourning.
a primitive root; properly, to soften by rubbing or pressure; hence (medicinally) to apply as an emollient; lay for a plaister.
from רָחַב; enlargement, either literally (an open space, usually in a good sense), or figuratively (liberty); breadth, large place (room).
; from רָחַק; remoteness, i.e. (concretely) a distant place; often (adverbially) from afar; (a-, dwell in, very) far (country, off). See also בֵּית הַמֶּרְחָק.
from רָחַשׁ; a stewpan; fryingpan.
a primitive root; to polish; by implication, to make bald (the head), to gall (the shoulder); also, to sharpen; bright, furbish, (have his) hair (be) fallen off, peeled, pluck off (hair).
(Aramaic) corresponding to מָרַט; to pull off; be plucked.
from מָרָה; bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) rebellion; concretely, bitter, or rebellious; bitter, (most) rebel(-lion, -lious).
from מָרָא in the sense of grossness, through the idea of domineering (compare מָרֵא); stall-fed; often (as noun) a beeve; fat (fed) beast (cattle, -ling).
from רִיב and בַּעַל; quarreller of Baal, Merib-Baal, an epithet of Gideon; Merib-baal. Compare מְרִי בַעַל.
from רִיב; quarrel; provocation, strife.
the same as מְרִיבָה; Meribah, the name of two places in the Desert; Meribah.
from מְרִי and בַּעַל; rebellion of (i.e. against) Baal; Meri-Baal, an epithet of Gideon; Meri-baal. Compare מְרִיב בַּעַל.
from מָרָה; rebellion; Merajah, an Israelite; Meraiah. Compare יִמְרָה.
plural of מְרָיָה; rebellious; Merajoth, the name of two Israelites; Meraioth.
from מְרִי; rebelliously; Mirjam, the name of two Israelitesses; Miriam.
from מָרַר; bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) grief; bitterness.
from מָרַר; bitter, i.e. poisonous; bitter.
perhaps from רָכַךְ; softness, i.e. (figuratively) fear; faintness.
from רָכַב; a chariot; also a seat (in a vehicle); chariot, covering, saddle.
feminine of מֶרְכָּב; a chariot; chariot. See also בֵּית הַמַּרְכָּבוֹת.
from רָכַל; a mart; merchandise.
from רָמָה in the sense of deceiving; fraud; craft, deceit(-ful, -fully), false, feigned, guile, subtilly, treachery.
the same as מִרְמָה; Mirmah, an Israelite; Mirma.
plural from רוּם; heights; Meremoth, the name of two Israelites; Meremoth.
from רָמַס; abasement (the act or the thing); tread (down) -ing, (to be) trodden (down) under foot.
patrial from an unused noun; a Meronothite, or inhabitant of some (otherwise unknown) Meronoth.; Meronothite.
of foreign derivation; Meres, a Persian; Meres.
of foreign derivation; Marsena, a Persian; Marsena.
from רָעַע; used as (abstract) noun, wickedness; do mischief.
from רָעָה in the sense of companionship; a friend; companion, friend.
from רָעָה in the sense of feeding; pasture (the place or the act); also the haunt of wild animals; feeding place, pasture.
from רָעָה in the sense of feeding; pasturage; concretely, a flock; flock, pasture.
from רָעַל; perhaps, earthquake; Maralah, a place in Palestine; Maralah.

from רָפָא; properly, curative, i.e. literally (concretely) a medicine, or (abstractly) a cure; figuratively (concretely) deliverance, or (abstractly) placidity; (in-)cure(-able), healing(-lth), remedy, sound, wholesome, yielding.
from רָפַשׂ; muddled water; that which...have fouled.
a primitive root; properly, to press, i.e. (figuratively) to be pungent or vehement; to irritate; embolden, be forcible, grievous, sore.
from רָצַץ; oppression; violence. See also מְרוּצָה.
from רָצַע; an awl; aul.
from רָצַף; a pavement; pavement.
a primitive root; to polish; by implication, to sharpen; also to rinse; bright, furbish, scour.
from מָרַק; soup (as if a rinsing); broth. See also פָּרָק.
from רָקַח; a spicy herb; [idiom] sweet.
feminine of מֶרְקָח; abstractly, a seasoning (with spicery); concretely, an unguentkettle (for preparing spiced oil); pot of ointment, [idiom] well.
from רָקַח; an aromatic unguent; also an unguent-pot; prepared by the apothecaries' art, compound, ointment.

a primitive root; properly, to trickle (see מַר); but used only as a denominative from מַר; to be (causatively, make) bitter (literally or figuratively); (be, be in, deal, have, make) bitter(-ly, -ness), be moved with choler, (be, have sorely, it) grieved(-eth), provoke, vex.
or מְרוֹר; from מָרַר; a bitter herb; bitter(-ness).
from מָרַר; bile (from its bitterness); gall.
or מְרוֹרָה; from מָרַר; properly, bitterness; concretely, a bitter thing; specifically bile; also venom (of a serpent); bitter (thing), gall.
from מָרַר; bitter; Merari, an Israelite; Merari. See also מְרָרִי.
from מְרָרִי; a Merarite (collectively), or decendants of Merari; Merarites.
from רָשַׁע; a female wicked doer; wicked woman.
dual of מַר feminine; double bitterness; Merathajim, an epithet of Babylon; Merathaim.
of foreign derivation; Mash, a son of Aram, and the people descended from him; Mash.
of foreign derivation; Mesha, a place in Arabia; Mesha.

from נָשָׂא; a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire; burden, carry away, prophecy, [idiom] they set, song, tribute.
the same as מַשָּׂא; burden; Massa, a son of Ishmael; Massa.
from נָשָׁה; a loan; by implication, interest on adebt; exaction, usury.
from נָשָׂא; partiality (as a lifting up); respect.
from שָׁאַב; a trough for cattle to drink from; place of drawing water.
from נָשָׂא; a conflagration (from the rising of smoke); burden.
feminine of מַשָּׁא; a loan; [idiom] any(-thing), debt.
from נָשָׁא; dissimulation; deceit.
from שָׁאַל; request; Mishal, a place in Palestine; Mishal, Misheal. Compare מָשָׁל.
from שָׁאַל; a request; desire, petition.
from שָׁאַר in the original sense of swelling; a kneading-trough (in which the dough rises); kneading trough, store.

from נָשָׂא; properly, (abstractly) a raising (as of the hands in prayer), or rising (of flame); figuratively, an utterance; concretely, a beacon (as raised); a present (as taken), mess, or tribute; figuratively, a reproach (as a burden); burden, collection, sign of fire, (great) flame, gift, lifting up, mess, oblation, reward.
from שָׁבַץ; a brocade; by analogy, a (reticulated) setting of agem; ouch, wrought.
from שָׁבַר; the orifice of the womb (from which the fetus breaks forth); birth, breaking forth.
from שָׁבַר; a breaker (of the sea); billow, wave.
from שָׁבַת; cessation, i.e. destruction; sabbath.
from שָׂגַב; properly, a cliff (or other lofty or inaccessible place); abstractly, altitude; figuratively, a refuge; defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab; Misgab.
from שָׁגָה; an error; oversight.
a primitive root; to pull out (literally or figuratively); draw(out).
from מָשָׁה; drawing out (of the water), i.e. rescued; Mosheh, the Israelite lawgiver; Moses.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מֹשֶׁה; {Mosheh, the Israelite lawgiver}; Moses.
from נָשָׁה; a debt; [phrase] creditor.
or מְשֹׁאָה; from the same as שׁוֹא; (a) ruin, abstractly (the act) or concretely (the wreck); desolation, waste.
or מַשֻּׁאָה; for מְשׁוֹאָה; ruin; desolation, destruction.
from שׁוּב; returned; Meshobab, an Israelite; Meshobab.
or מְשֻׁבָה; from שׁוּב; apostasy; backsliding, turning away.
lemma מְשׁוּגָּה extra dagesh, corrected to מְשׁוּגָה; from an unused root meaning to stray; mistake; error.
or מִשּׁוֹט; from שׁוּט; an oar; oar.
or מְשֻׂכָה; from שׂוּךְ; a hedge; hedge.
from an unused root meaning to plunder; spoilation; spoil.
from an unused root meaning to rasp; a saw; saw.
from an unused root meaning apparently to divide; a measure (for liquids); measure.
from שׂוּשׂ; delight, concretely (the cause or object) or abstractly (the feeling); joy, mirth, rejoice.
a primitive root; to rub with oil, i.e. to anoint; by implication, to consecrate; also to paint; anoint, paint.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to מָשַׁח; oil; oil.
or מׇשְׁחָה; from מָשַׁח; unction (the act); by implication, a consecratory gift; (to be) anointed(-ing), ointment.
from שָׁחַת; destructive, i.e. (as noun) destruction, literally (specifically a snare) or figuratively (corruption); corruption, (to) destroy(-ing), destruction, trap, [idiom] utterly.
from שַׁחֲצוֹם; a laughing-stock; scorn.
from שָׁחַר in the sense of day breaking; dawn; morning.
for מַשְׁחִית; destruction; destroying.
or מׇשְׁחָת; from שָׁחַת; disfigurement; corruption, marred.
or מִשְׁטַח; from שָׁטַח; a spreading-place; (to) spread (forth, -ing, upon).
from the same as שֹׁטֵט; enmity; hatred.
from שֹׁטֵר; jurisdiction; dominion.
from מָשָׁה; silk (as drawn from the cocoon); silk.
from an equiv. to שְׁזַב and אֵל; delivered of God; Meshezabel, an Israelite; Meshezabeel.
from מָשַׁח; anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah; anointed, Messiah.

a primitive root; to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.); draw (along, out), continue, defer, extend, forbear, [idiom] give, handle, make (pro-, sound) long, [idiom] sow, scatter, stretch out.
from מָשַׁךְ; a sowing; also a possession; precious, price.
the same in form as מֶשֶׁךְ, but probably of foreign derivation; Meshek, a son of Japheth, and the people descended from him; Mesech, Meshech.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מִשְׁכָּב; a bed; bed.
from שָׁכַב; a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse; bed(-chamber), couch, lieth (lying) with.
from שָׂכַל; instructive, i.e. a didactic poem; Maschil.
from the same as שֵׂכוּ; a figure (carved on stone, the wall, or any object); figuratively, imagination; conceit, image(-ry), picture, [idiom] wish.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מִשְׁכָּן; residence; habitation.

from שָׁכַן; a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls); dwelleth, dwelling (place), habitation, tabernacle, tent.
from שָׂכַר; wages or a reward; reward, wages.
a primitive root; to rule; (have, make to have) dominion, governor, [idiom] indeed, reign, (bear, cause to, have) rule(-ing, -r), have power.

denominative from מָשָׁל; to liken, i.e. (transitively) to use figurative language (an allegory, adage, song or the like); intransitively, to resemble; be(-come) like, compare, use (as a) proverb, speak (in proverbs), utter.

apparently from מָשַׁל in some original sense of superiority in mental action; properly, a pithy maxim, usually of metaphorical nature; hence, a simile (as an adage, poem, discourse); byword, like, parable, proverb.
for מִשְׁאָל; Mashal, a place in Palestine; Mashal.
xlit mᵉshôwl corrected to mᵉshôl; from מָשַׁל; a satire; byword.
(1) from מָשַׁל; (2) from מָשַׁל; empire; a parallel; dominion, like.

or מִשְׁלֹחַ; also מִשְׁלָח; from שָׁלַח; a sending out, i.e. (abstractly) presentation (favorable), or seizure (unfavorable); also (concretely) a place of dismissal, or a business to be discharged; to lay, to put, sending (forth), to set.
feminine of מִשְׁלוֹחַ; a mission, i.e. (abstractly and favorable) release, or (concretely and unfavorable) an army; discharge, sending.
from שָׁלַם; allied; Meshullam, the name of seventeen Israelites; Meshullam.
plural from שָׁלַם; reconciliations; Meshillemoth, an Israelite; Meshillemoth. Compare מְשִׁלֵּמִית.
or מְשֶׁלֶמְיָהוּ; from שָׁלַם and יָהּ; ally of Jah; Meshelemjah, an Israelite; Meshelemiah.
from שָׁלַם; reconciliation; Meshillemith, an Israelite; Meshillemith. Compare מְשִׁלֵּמוֹת.
feminine of מְשֻׁלָּם; Meshullemeth, an Israelitess; Meshullemeth.
from שָׁמֵם; a waste or amazement; astonishment, desolate.
from שָׁמַן; fat, i.e. (literally and abstractly) fatness; but usually (figuratively and concretely) a rich dish, a fertile field, a robust man; fat (one, -ness, -test, -test place).
from שָׁמַן; fatness; Mashmannah, an Israelite; Mishmannah.
from שָׁמַע; a report; hearing.
the same as מִשְׁמָע; Mishma, the name of a son of Ishmael, and of an Israelite; Mishma.
feminine of מִשְׁמָע; audience, i.e. the royal court; also obedience, i.e. (concretely) a subject; bidding, guard, obey.
from שָׁמַר; a guard (the man, the post or the prison); a deposit (figuratively); also (as observed) a usage (abstractly), or an example (concretely); diligence, guard, office, prison, ward, watch.
for מַסְמֵר fem.; a peg; nail.

feminine of מִשְׁמָר; watch, i.e. the act (custody), or (concretely) the sentry, the post; objectively preservation, or (concretely) safe; figuratively observance, i.e. (abstractly) duty or (objectively) a usage or party; charge, keep, or to be kept, office, ordinace, safeguard, ward, watch.

from שָׁנָה; properly, a repetition, i.e. a duplicate (copy of a document), or a double (in amount); by implication, a second (in order, rank, age, quality or location); college, copy, double, fatlings, next, second (order), twice as much.
from שָׁסַס; plunder; booty, spoil.
from the same as שֹׁעַל; a hollow, i.e. a narrow passage; path.
probably from שָׁעָה; inspection; to supple.
apparently from שָׁעָה; inspection; Misham, an Israelite; Misham.
or מִשְׁעָן; from שָׁעַן; a support (concretely), i.e. (figuratively) a protector or sustenance; stay.
or מִשְׁעֶנֶת; feminine of מִשְׁעֵן; support (abstractly), i.e. (figuratively) sustenance or (concretely) a walking-stick; staff.
from סָפַח; slaughter; oppression.
from שָׁפָה (compare שִׁפְחָה); a family, i.e. circle of relatives; figuratively, a class (of persons), a species (of animals) or sort (of things); by extension a tribe or people; family, kind(-red).

from שָׁפַט; properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style; [phrase] adversary, ceremony, charge, [idiom] crime, custom, desert, determination, discretion, disposing, due, fashion, form, to be judged, judgment, just(-ice, -ly), (manner of) law(-ful), manner, measure, (due) order, ordinance, right, sentence, usest, [idiom] worthy, [phrase] wrong.
from שָׁפָה; a stall for cattle (only dual); burden, sheepfold.
from an unused root meaning to hold; possession; [phrase] steward.
from שָׁקַק; a traversing, i.e. rapid motion; running to and fro.

from שָׁקָה; properly, causing to drink, i.e. a butler; by implication (intransitively), drink (itself); figuratively, a well-watered region; butler(-ship), cupbearer, drink(-ing), fat pasture, watered.
from שָׁקַל; weight; weight.
from שָׁקַף in its original sense of overhanging; a lintel; lintel.
from שָׁקַל; weight (numerically estimated); hence, weighing (the act); (full) weight.
or מִשְׁקֹלֶת; feminine of מִשְׁקָל or מַשְׁקוֹף; a weight, i.e. a plummet (with line attached); plummet.
from שָׁקַע; a settling place (of water), i.e. a pond; deep.
from שָׂרָה; empire; government.
from שָׁרָה in the sense of loosening; maceration, i.e. steeped juice; liquor.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to שָׁרַק; a (musical) pipe (from its whistling sound); flute.
patrial from an unused noun from an unused root; probably meaning to stretch out; extension; a Mishraite, or inhabitant (collectively) of Mishra; Mishraites.
from שָׂרַף; combustion, i.e. cremation (of a corpse), or calcination (of lime); burning.
from the plural of מִשְׂרָפָה and מַיִם; burnings of water; Misrephoth-Majim, a place in Palestine; Misrephoth-mayim.
a form for שׂוֹרֵק used denominatively; vineyard; Masrekah, a place in Idumaea; Masrekah.
apparently from an unused root meaning to perforate, i.e. hollow out; a pan; pan.
a primitive root; to feel of; by implication, to grope; feel, grope, search.
from שָׁתָה; drink, by implication, drinking (the act); also (by implication) a banquet or (generally) feast; banquet, drank, drink, feast((-ed), -ing).
(Aramaic) corresponding to מִשְׁתֶּה; a banquet; banquet.
from the same as מָתַי; properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural); [phrase] few, [idiom] friends, men, persons, [idiom] small.
denominative from תֶּבֶן; straw in the heap; straw.
from an unused root meaning to curb; a bit; bit, bridle.
from מֶתֶג and אַמָּה with the art. interposed; bit of the metropolis; Metheg-ha-Ammah, an epithet of Gath; Metheg-ammah.
or מָתוּק; from מָתַק; sweet; sweet(-er, -ness).
from מַת and אֵל, with the relative interposed; man who (is) of God; Methusael, an antediluvian patriarch; Methusael.
from מַת and שֶׁלַח; man of a dart; Methushelach, an antediluvian patriarch; Methuselah.
a primitive root; to stretch out; spread out.
from an unused root meaning to extend; properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative); long, when.
or מַתְכֻנֶת; from תָּכַן in the transferred sense of measuring; proportion (in size, number or ingredients); composition, measure, state, tale.
from מָה and תְּלָאָה; what a trouble!; what a weariness.
contr. from יָלַע; properly, a biter, i.e. a tooth; cheek (jaw) tooth, jaw.
from תָּמַם; wholesomeness; also (adverb) completely; men (by reading מַת), soundness.
from an unused root meaning to be slender; properly, the waist or small of the back; only in plural the loins; [phrase] greyhound, loins, side.
from נָתַן; a present; gift, to give, reward.
the same as מַתָּן; Mattan, the name of a priest of Baal, and of an Israelite; Mattan.
(Aramaic) corresponding to מַתָּנָה; {a present; specifically (in a good sense), a sacrificial offering, (in a bad sense) a bribe}; gift.
feminine of מַתָּן; a present; specifically (in a good sense), a sacrificial offering, (in a bad sense) a bribe; gift.
the same as מַתָּנָה; Mattanah, a place in the Desert; Mattanah.
probably patrial from an unused noun meaning slenderness; a Mithnite, or inhabitant of Methen; Mithnite.
from מַתָּן; liberal; Mattenai, the name of three Israelites; Mattenai.
or מַתַּנְיָהוּ; from מַתָּן and יָהּ; gift of Jah; Mattanjah, the name of ten Israelites; Mattaniah.
from נָשָׂא; (used as abstractly) supreme exaltation; exalted.
a primitive root; to suck, by implication, to relish, or (intransitively) be sweet; be (made, [idiom] take) sweet.
from מָתַק; figuratively, pleasantness (of discourse); sweetness.
from מָתַק; sweetness; sweetness.
from מָתַק; a dainty, i.e. (generally) food; feed sweetly.
feminine of מֹתֶק; sweetness; Mithkah, a place in the Desert; Mithcah.
of Persian origin; Mithredath, the name of two Persians; Mithredath.
feminine of מַתָּן abbreviated form; a present; gift.
for מַתִּתְיָה; gift of Jah; Mattattah, an Israelite; Mattathah.
or מַתִּתְיָהוּ; from מַתָּת and יָהּ; gift of Jah; Mattithjah, the name of four Israelites; Mattithiah. n

a primitive particle of incitement and entreaty, which may usually be rendered; 'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction; I beseech (pray) thee (you), go to, now, oh.
apparently from נוּא in the sense of harshness from refusal; properly, tough, i.e. uncooked (flesh); raw.
of Egyptian origin; No (i.e. Thebes), the capital of Upper Egypt; No. Compare אָמוֹן.
or נאוֹדlemma נֹאוד vowel, corrected to נאוֹדxlit nôʼwd corrected to nʼôwd; also (feminine) נֹאדָה; from an unused root of uncertain signification; a (skin or leather) bag (for fluids); bottle.
a primitive root; properly, to be at home, i.e. (by implication) to be pleasant (or suitable), i.e. beautiful; be beautiful, become, be comely.
from נָאָה; a home; figuratively, a pasture; habitation, house, pasture, pleasant place.
from נָאָה or נָוֶה; suitable, or beautiful; becometh, comely, seemly.
a primitive root; properly, to whisper, i.e. (by implication) to utter as aoracle; say.
from נָאַם; an oracle; (hath) said, saith.
a primitive root; to commit adultery; figuratively, to apostatize; adulterer(-ess), commit(-ing) adultery, woman that breaketh wedlock.
from נָאַף; adultery; adultery.
from נָאַף; adultery; adultery.
a primitive root; in Ecclesiastes 12:5, by interchange for נוּץ, to bloom; to scorn; abhor, (give occasion to) blaspheme, contemn, despise, flourish, [idiom] great, provoke.
or נֶאָצָה; from נָאַץ; scorn; blasphemy.
a primitive root; to groan; groan.
from נָאַק; a groan; groaning.
a primitive root; to reject; abhor, make void.
the same as נוֹב; fruit; Nob, a place in Palestine; Nob.
a primitive root; to prophesy, i.e. speak (or sing) by inspiration (in prediction or simple discourse); prophesy(-ing), make self a prophet.

(Aramaic) corresponding to נָבָא; {to prophesy, i.e. speak (or sing) by inspiration (in prediction or simple discourse) to prophesy, i.e. speak (or sing) by inspiration (in prediction or simple discourse)}; prophesy.
a primitive root; to pierce; to be hollow, or (figuratively) foolish; hollow, vain.
probably of foreign derivation; Nebo, the name of a Babylonian deity, also of a mountain in Moab, and of a place in Palestine; Nebo.
from נָבָא; a prediction (spoken or written); prophecy.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נְבוּאָה; inspired teaching; prophesying.
xlit Nᵉbûwzarădân corrected to Nᵉbûwzarʼădân; of foreign origin; Nebuzaradan, a Babylonian general; Nebuzaradan.

or נְבֻּכַדְנֶאצַּר; (2 Kings 24:1,10), or נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר; (Esther 2:6; Daniel 1:18), or נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר; or נְבוּכַדְרֶאצּוֹר; (Ezra 2:1; Jeremiah 49:28), or foreign derivation; Nebukadnetstsar (or -retstsar, or -retstsor), king of Babylon; Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuchadrezzar.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר; {Nebukadnetstsar (or -retstsar, or -retstsor), king of Babylon}; Nebuchadnezzar.
of foreign derivation; Nebushazban, Nebuchadnezzar's chief eunuch; Nebushazban.
feminine plural from the same as נֹב; fruits; Naboth, an Israelite; Naboth.
(Aramaic) of uncertain derivation; a largess; reward.
a primitive root; to bark (as a dog); bark.
from נָבַח; a bark; Nobach, the name of an Israelite, and of a place East of the Jordan; Nobah.
of foreign origin; Nibchaz, a deity of the Avites; Nibhaz.
a primitive root; to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care; (cause to) behold, consider, look (down), regard, have respect, see.
from נָבַט; regard; Nebat, the father of Jeroboam I; Nebat.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָבִיא; a prophet; prophet.
from נָבָא; a prophet or (generally) inspired man; prophecy, that prophesy, prophet.
feminine of נָבִיא; a prophetess or (generally) inspired woman; by implication, a poetess; by association a prophet's wife; prophetess.
or נְבָיֹת; feminine plural from נוּב; fruitfulnesses; Nebajoth, a son of Ismael, and the country settled by him; Nebaioth, Nebajoth.
from an unused root meaning to burst forth; a fountain; spring.

a primitive root; to wilt; generally, to fall away, fail, faint; figuratively, to be foolish or (morally) wicked; causatively, to despise, disgrace; disgrace, dishounour, lightly esteem, fade (away, -ing), fall (down, -ling, off), do foolishly, come to nought, [idiom] surely, make vile, wither.

or נֵבֶל; from נָבֵל; a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form); bottle, pitcher, psaltery, vessel, viol.
from נָבֵל; stupid; wicked (especially impious); fool(-ish, -ish man, -ish woman), vile person.
the same as נָבָל; dolt; Nabal, an Israelite; Nabal.

from נָבֵל; a flabby thing, i.e. a carcase or carrion (human or bestial, often collectively); figuratively, an idol; (dead) body, (dead) carcase, dead of itself, which died, (beast) that (which) dieth of itself.
feminine of נָבָל; foolishness, i.e. (morally) wickedness; concretely, a crime; by extension, punishment; folly, vile, villany.
from נָבָל; properly, disgrace, i.e. the (female) pudenda; lewdness.
apparently from נָבָל and לָט; foolish secrecy; Neballat, a place in Palestine; Neballat.
a primitive root; to gush forth; figuratively, to utter (good or bad words); specifically, to emit (a foul odor); belch out, flowing, pour out, send forth, utter (abundantly).
(Aramaic) from an unused root meaning to shine; a light; plural (collectively) a chandelier; candlestick.
of uncertain derivation; Nibshan, a place in Palestine; Nibshan.

from an unused root meaning to be parched; the south (from its drought); specifically, the Negeb or southern district of Judah, occasionally, Egypt (as south to Palestine); south (country, side, -ward).

a primitive root; properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise; bewray, [idiom] certainly, certify, declare(-ing), denounce, expound, [idiom] fully, messenger, plainly, profess, rehearse, report, shew (forth), speak, [idiom] surely, tell, utter.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָגַד; to flow (through the idea of clearing the way); issue.

from נָגַד; a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before; about, (over) against, [idiom] aloof, [idiom] far (off), [idiom] from, over, presence, [idiom] other side, sight, [idiom] to view.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נֶגֶד; opposite; toward.
a primitive root; to glitter; causatively, to illuminate; (en-) lighten, (cause to) shine.
from נָגַהּ; brilliancy (literally or figuratively); bright(-ness), light, (clear) shining.
the same as נֹגַהּ; Nogah, a son of David; Nogah.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נֹגַהּ; dawn; morning.
feminine of נֹגַהּ; splendor; brightness.
a primitive root; to butt with the horns; figuratively, to war against; gore, push (down, -ing).
from נָגַח; butting, i.e. vicious; used (wont) to push.

or נָגִד; from נָגַד; a commander (as occupying the front), civil, military or religious; generally (abstractly, plural), honorable themes; captain, chief, excellent thing, (chief) governor, leader, noble, prince, (chief) ruler.

or נְגִינַת; (Psalm 61:title), from נָגַן; properly, instrumental music; by implication, a stringed instrument; by extension, a poem set to music; specifically, an epigram; stringed instrument, musick, Neginoth (plural), song.

a primitive root; properly, to thrum, i.e. beat atune with the fingers; expectation. to play on astringed instrument; hence (generally), to make music; player on instruments, sing to the stringed instruments, melody, ministrel, play(-er, -ing).

a primitive root; properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.); beat, ([idiom] be able to) bring (down), cast, come (nigh), draw near (nigh), get up, happen, join, near, plague, reach (up), smite, strike, touch.
from נָגַע; a blow (figuratively, infliction); also (by implication) a spot (concretely, a leprous person or dress); plague, sore, stricken, stripe, stroke, wound.
a primitive root; to push, gore, defeat, stub (the toe), inflict (a disease); beat, dash, hurt, plague, slay, smite (down), strike, stumble, [idiom] surely, put to the worse.
from נָגַף; a trip (of the foot); figuratively, an infliction (of disease); plague, stumbling.
a primitive root; to flow; figuratively, to stretch out; causatively, to pour out or down; figuratively, to deliver over; fall, flow away, pour down (out), run, shed, spilt, trickle down.
a primitive root; to drive (an animal, a workman, a debtor, an army); by implication, to tax, harass, tyrannize; distress, driver, exact(-or), oppress(-or), [idiom] raiser of taxes, taskmaster.

a primitive root; to be or come (causatively, bring) near (for any purpose); euphemistically, to lie with a woman; as an enemy, to attack; religious to worship; causatively, to present; figuratively, to adduce an argument; by reversal, to stand back; (make to) approach (nigh), bring (forth, hither, near), (cause to) come (hither, near, nigh), give place, go hard (up), (be, draw, go) near (nigh), offer, overtake, present, put, stand.
from נוּד in the sense of piling up; a mound, i.e. wave; heap.
a primitive root; to impel; hence, to volunteer (as a soldier), to present spontaneously; offer freely, be (give, make, offer self) willing(-ly).
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָדַב; be (or give) liberal(-ly); (be minded of...own) freewill (offering), offer freely (willingly).
from נָדַב; liberal; Nadab, the name of four Israelites; Nadab.

from נָדַב; properly (abstractly) spontaneity, or (adjectively) spontaneous; also (concretely) a spontaneous or (by inference, in plural) abundant gift; free(-will) offering, freely, plentiful, voluntary(-ily, offering), willing(-ly), offering).
from נָדַב and יָהּ; largess of Jah; Nedabjah, an Israelite; Nedabiah.
(Aramaic) from a root meaning to stick; a layer (of building materials); row.

a primitive root; properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away; chase (away), [idiom] could not, depart, flee ([idiom] apace, away), (re-) move, thrust away, wander (abroad, -er, -ing).
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָדַד; to depart; go from.
passive participle of נָדַד; properly, tossed; abstractly, a rolling (on the bed); tossing to and fro.
or נָדָא; (2 Kings 17:21), a primitive root; properly, to toss; figuratively, to exclude, i.e. banish, postpone, prohibit; cast out, drive, put far away.
from נָדָה in the sense of freely flinging money; a bounty (for prostitution); gifts.

from נָדַד; properly, rejection; by implication, impurity, especially personal (menstruation) or moral (idolatry, incest); [idiom] far, filthiness, [idiom] flowers, menstruous (woman), put apart, [idiom] removed (woman), separation, set apart, unclean(-ness, thing, with filthiness).

a primitive root; to push off; used in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (to expel, mislead, strike, inflict, etc.); banish, bring, cast down (out), chase, compel, draw away, drive (away, out, quite), fetch a stroke, force, go away, outcast, thrust away (out), withdraw.
from נָדַב; properly, voluntary, i.e. generous; hence, magnanimous; as noun, a grandee (sometimes a tyrant); free, liberal (things), noble, prince, willing (hearted).
feminine of נָדִיב; properly, nobility, i.e. reputation; soul.
probably from an unused root meaning to give; a present (for prostitution); gift.
of uncertain derivation; a sheath (of a sword); sheath.
(Aramaic) from the same as נָדָן; a sheath; figuratively, the body (as the receptacle of the soul); body.
a primitive root; to shove asunder, i.e. disperse; drive (away, to and fro), thrust down, shaken, tossed to and fro.
a primitive root; to promise (pos., to do or give something to God); (make a) vow.
or נֵדֶר; from נָדַר; a promise (to God); also (concretely) a thing promised; vow(-ed).
