from an unused root meaning to lament; lamentation; wailing.

a primitive root; to drive forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. lead, carry away; reflexively, to proceed (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the panting induced by effort), to sigh; acquaint, bring (away), carry away, drive (away), lead (away, forth), (be) guide, lead (away, forth).
a primitive root; to groan, i.e. bewail; hence (through the idea of crying aloud), to assemble (as if on proclamation); lament, wail.
from נָהָה; an elegy; lamentation, wailing.
feminine of נְהִי; lamentation; doleful.
(Aramaic) or נְהִירוּ; (Aramaic), from the same as נְהָרָה; illumination, i.e. (figuratively) wisdom; light.
a primitive root; properly, to run with asparkle, i.e. flow; hence (transitively), to conduct, and (by inference) to protect, sustain; carry, feed, guide, lead (gently, on).
or נַהֲלֹל; the same as נַהֲלֹל; Nahalal or Nahalol, a place in Palestine; Nahalal, Nahallal, Nahalol.
from נָהַל; pasture; bush.
a primitive root; to growl; mourn, roar(-ing).
from נָהַם; a snarl; roaring.
feminine of נַהַם; snarling; disquietness, roaring.
a primitive root; to bray (as an ass), scream (from hunger); bray.
a primitive root; to sparkle, i.e. (figuratively) be cheerful; hence (from the sheen of a running stream) to flow, i.e. (figuratively) assemble; flow (together), be lightened.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to נָהַר; a river, especially the Euphrates; river, stream.
from נָהַר; a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity; flood, river.
from נָהַר in its original sense; daylight; light.
a primitive root; to refuse, forbid, dissuade, or neutralize; break, disallow, discourage, make of none effect.
a primitive root; to germinate, i.e. (figuratively) to (causatively, make) flourish; also (of words), to utter; bring forth (fruit), make cheerful, increase.
or נֵיב; from נוּב; produce, literally or figuratively; fruit.
from נוֹב; fruitful; Nobai, an Israelite; Nebai (from the margin).

a primitive root; to nod, i.e. waver; figuratively, to wander, flee, disappear; also (from shaking the head in sympathy), to console, deplore, or (from tossing the head in scorn) taunt; bemoan, flee, get, mourn, make to move, take pity, remove, shake, skip for joy, be sorry, vagabond, way, wandering.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָוֶה; to flee; get away.
lemma נוֹדּ extra dagesh, corrected to נוֹד; (only defective נֹד ); from נוּד; exile; wandering.
the same as נוֹדlemma נוֹדּ extra dagesh, corrected to נוֹד; vagrancy; Nod, the land of Cain; Nod.
from נָדַב; noble; Nodab, an Arab tribe; Nodab.
a primitive root; (compare נָוֶה); to rest (as at home); causatively (through the implied idea of beauty ), to celebrate (with praises); keept at home, prepare an habitation.

or (feminine) נָוָה; from נָוָה; (adjectively) at home; hence (by implication of satisfaction) lovely; also (noun) a home, of God (temple), men (residence), flocks (pasture), or wild animals (den); comely, dwelling (place), fold, habitation, pleasant place, sheepcote, stable, tarried.

a primitive root; to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.); cease, be confederate, lay, let down, (be) quiet, remain, (cause to, be at, give, have, make to) rest, set down. Compare יָנִים.
or נוֹחַ; from נוּחַ; quiet; rest(-ed, -ing place).
feminine of נוּחַ; quietude; Nochah, an Israelite; Nohah.
to quake; be moved.
from נָוָה; residence; Navith, a place in Palestine; Naioth (from the margin).
(Aramaic) or נְוָלִי; (Aramaic), from an unused root probably meaning to be foul; a sink; dunghill.
a primitive root; to slumber (from drowsiness); sleep, slumber.
from נוּם; sleepiness; drowsiness.
a primitive root; to resprout, i.e. propagate by shoots; figuratively, to be perpetual; be continued.
or נוֹן; (1 Chronicles 7:27), from נוּן; perpetuity,; Nun or Non, the father of Joshua; Non, Nun.

a primitive root; to flit, i.e. vanish away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver); [idiom] abate, away, be displayed, (make to) flee (away, -ing), put to flight, [idiom] hide, lift up a standard.

a primitive root; to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined); continually, fugitive, [idiom] make, to (go) up and down, be gone away, (be) move(-able, -d), be promoted, reel, remove, scatter, set, shake, sift, stagger, to and fro, be vagabond, wag, (make) wander (up and down).
from יָעַד and יָהּ; convened of Jah; Noadjah, the name of an Israelite, and a false prophetess; Noadiah.

a primitive root; to quiver (i.e. vibrate up and down, or rock to and fro); used in a great variety of applications (including sprinkling, beckoning, rubbing, bastinadoing, sawing, waving, etc.); lift up, move, offer, perfume, send, shake, sift, strike, wave.
from נוּף; elevation; situation. Compare נֹף.
a primitive root; properly, to flash; hence, to blossom (from the brilliancy of color); also, to fly away (from the quickness of motion); flee away, bud (forth).
or נֹצָה; feminine active participle of נָצָה in the sense of flying; a pinion (or wing feather); often (collectively) plumage; feather(-s), ostrich.
a primitive root; to suckle; nurse.
(Aramaic) from an unused root (corresponding to that of נִיר) meaning to shine; fire; fiery, fire.
a primitive root; to be sick, i.e. (figuratively) distressed; be full of heaviness.
a primitive root; to spirt, i.e. besprinkle (especially in expiation); sprinkle.
from זוּד; something boiled, i.e. soup; pottage.

or נָזִר; from נָזַר; separate, i.e. consecrated (as prince, a Nazirite); hence (figuratively from the latter) an unpruned vine (like an unshorn Nazirite); Nazarite (by a false alliteration with Nazareth), separate(-d), vine undressed.
a primitive root; to drip, or shed by trickling; distil, drop, flood, (cause to) flow(-ing), gush out, melt, pour (down), running water, stream.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a nose-ring; earring, jewel.
(Aramaic) corresponding to the root of נֵזֶק; to suffer (causatively, inflict) loss; have (en-) damage, hurt(-ful).
from an unused root meaning to injure; loss; damage.

a primitive root; to hold aloof, i.e. (intransitivey) abstain (from food and drink, from impurity, and even from divine worship (i.e. apostatize)); specifically, to set apart (to sacred purposes), i.e. devote; consecrate, separate(-ing, self).

or נֵזֶר; from נָזַר; properly, something set apart, i.e. (abstractly) dedication (of a priet or Nazirite); hence (concretely) unshorn locks; also (by implication) a chaplet (especially of royalty); consecration, crown, hair, separation.
the same as נוּחַ; rest; Noach, the patriarch of the flood; Noah.
from חָבָה; occult; Nachbi, an Israelite; Nakbi.
a primitive root; to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists); bestow, bring, govern, guide, lead (forth), put, straiten.
from נָחַם; comforted; Nechum, an Israelite; Nehum.
or נִחֻם; from נָחַם; properly, consoled; abstractly, solace; comfort(-able), repenting.
from נָחַם; comfortable; Nachum, an Israelite prophet; Nahum.
from the same as נַחַר; snorer; Nochor, the name of the grandfather and a brother of Abraham; Nahor.

apparently passive participle of נָחַשׁ (perhaps in the sense of ringing), i.e. bell-metal; or from the red color of the throat of a serpent (נָחָשׁ, as denominative) when hissing); coppery, i.e. (figuratively) hard; of brass.
or נְחֻשָׁה; feminine of נָחוּשׁ; copper; brass, steel. Compare נָחָשׁ.
probably denominative from חָלִיל; a flute; (plural) Nehiloth.
from the same as נַחַר; a nostril; (dual) nostrils.

a primitive root; to inherit (as a (figurative) mode of descent), or (generally) to occupy; causatively, to bequeath, or (generally) distribute, instate; divide, have (inheritance), take as a heritage, (cause to, give to, make to) inherit, (distribute for, divide (for, for an, by), give for, have, leave for, take (for)) inheritance, (have in, cause to, be made to) possess(-ion).

or (feminine) נַחְלָה; (Psalm 124:4), or נַחֲלָה; (Ezekiel 47:19; Ezekiel 48:28), from נָחַל in its original sense; a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine); brook, flood, river, stream, valley.

from נָחַל (in its usual sense); properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion; heritage, to inherit, inheritance, possession. Compare נַחַל.
from נַחַל and אֵל; valley of God; Nachaliel, a place in the Desert; Nahaliel.
apparently a patronymic from an unused name (apparently passive participle of חָלַם); dreamed; a Nechelamite, or descendant of Nechlam; Nehelamite.

a primitive root; properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself); comfort (self), ease (one's self), repent(-er,-ing, self).
from נָחַם; consolation; Nacham, an Israelite; Naham.
from נָחַם; ruefulness, i.e. desistance; repentance.
from נָחַם; consolation; comfort.
from נָחַם and יָהּ; consolation of Jah; Nechemjah, the name of three Israelites; Nehemiah.
from נָחַם; consolatory; Nachamani, an Israelite; Nahamani.
for אֲנַחְנוּ; we; we.
a primitive root; to be urgent; require haste.
and (feminine) נַחֲרָה; from an unused root meaning to snort or snore; a snorting; nostrils, snorting.
or נַחְרַי; from the same as נַחַר; snorer; Nacharai or Nachrai, an Israelite; Naharai, Nahari.

a primitive root; properly, to hiss, i.e. whisper a (magic) spell; generally, to prognosticate; [idiom] certainly, divine, enchanter, (use) [idiom] enchantment, learn by experience, [idiom] indeed, diligently observe.
from נָחַשׁ; an incantation or augury; enchantment.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נְחוּשָׁה; copper; brass.
from נָחַשׁ; a snake (from its hiss); serpent.
the same as נָחָשׁ; Nachash, the name of two persons apparently non-Israelite; Nahash.
from נָחַשׁ; enchanter; Nachshon, an Israelite; Naashon, Nahshon.

for נְחוּשָׁה; copper, hence, something made of that metal, i.e. coin, a fetter; figuratively, base (as compared with gold or silver); brasen, brass, chain, copper, fetter (of brass), filthiness, steel.
from נְחֹשֶׁת; copper; Nechushta, an Israelitess; Nehushta.
from נְחֹשֶׁת; something made of copper, i.e. the copper serpent of the Desert; Nehushtan.
a primitive root; to sink, i.e. descend; causatively, to press or lead down; be broken, (cause to) come down, enter, go down, press sore, settle, stick fast.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָחַת; to descend; causatively, to bring away, deposit, depose; carry, come down, depose, lay up, place.
from נְחַת; also (intransitively; perhaps from נוּחַ); a descent, i.e. imposition, unfavorable (punishment) or favorable (food); restfulness; lighting down, quiet(-ness), to rest, be set on.
the same as נַחַת; quiet; Nachath, the name of an Edomite and of two Israelites; Nahath.
from נָחַת; descending; come down.

a primitive root; to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application; [phrase] afternoon, apply, bow (down, -ing), carry aside, decline, deliver, extend, go down, be gone, incline, intend, lay, let down, offer, outstretched, overthrown, pervert, pitch, prolong, put away, shew, spread (out), stretch (forth, out), take (aside), turn (aside, away), wrest, cause to yield.
from נָטַל; laden; that bear.
from נָטַף; a pendant for the ears (especially of pearls); chain, collar.
from נָטַשׁ; a tendril (as an offshoot); battlement, branch, plant.
a primitive root; to lift; by implication, to impose; bear, offer, take up.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָטַל; to raise; take up.
; from נָטַל; a burden; weighty.
a primitive root; properly, to strike in, i.e. fix; specifically, to plant (literally or figuratively); fastened, plant(-er).
from נָטַע; a plant; collectively, a plantation; abstractly, a planting; plant.
xlit nâṭîaʻ corrected to nâṭîyaʻ; from נָטַע; a plant; plant.
plural of נֶטַע; Netaim, a place in Palestine; plants.
a primitive root; to ooze, i.e. distil gradually; by implication, to fall in drops; figuratively, to speak by inspiration; drop(-ping), prophesy(-et).
from נָטַף; a drop; specifically, an aromatic gum (probably stacte); drop, stacte.
from נָטַף; distillation; Netophah, a place in Palestine; Netophah.
patronymic from נְטֹפָה; a Netophathite, or inhabitant of Netophah; Netophathite.
a primitive root; to guard; figuratively, to cherish (anger); bear grudge, keep(-er), reserve.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָטַר; to retain; keep.

a primitive root; properly, to pound, i.e. smite; by implication (as if beating out, and thus expanding) to disperse; also, to thrust off, down, out or upon (inclusively, reject, let alone, permit, remit, etc.); cast off, drawn, let fall, forsake, join (battle), leave (off), lie still, loose, spread (self) abroad, stretch out, suffer.
a doubtful word; apparently from נָהָה; lamentation; wailing.
from נוּד; motion (of the lips in speech); moving.
feminine of נִיד; removal, i.e. exile; removed.
or נִיחֹחַ; from נוּחַ; properly, restful, i.e. pleasant; abstractly, delight; sweet (odour).
(Aramaic) or נִיחֹחַ; (shorter) (Aramaic), corresponding to נִיחוֹחַ; pleasure; sweet odour (savour).
from נוּן; progeny; son.
of foreign origin; Nineveh, the capital of Assyria; Nineveh.
from נוּס; fugitive; that fleeth.
probably of foreign origin; Nisan, the first month of the Jewish sacred year; Nisan.
from נָצַץ; a spark; spark.
a root probably identical with that of נִיר, through the idea of the gleam of a fresh furrow; to till the soil; break up.
or נִר; from נִיר; properly, plowing, i.e. (concretely) freshly plowed land; fallow ground, plowing, tillage.

or נִר; also נֵיר; or נֵר; or (feminine) נֵרָה; from a primitive root (see נִיר; נוּר) properly, meaning to glisten; a lamp (i.e. the burner) or light (literally or figuratively); candle, lamp, light.
a primitive root; to smite, i.e. drive away; be viler.
or נָכָא; from נָכָא; smitten, i.e. (figuratively) afflicted; broken, stricken, wounded.
from נָכֵא; properly, a smiting, i.e. (concretely) an aromatic gum (perhaps styrax) (as powdered); spicery(-ces).
from an unused root meaning to propagate; offspring; nephew, son's son.

a primitive root; to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively); beat, cast forth, clap, give (wounds), [idiom] go forward, [idiom] indeed, kill, make (slaughter), murderer, punish, slaughter, slay(-er, -ing), smite(-r, -ing), strike, be stricken, (give) stripes, [idiom] surely, wound.
from נָכָה; a smiter, i.e. (figuratively) traducer; abject.
; smitten, i.e. (literally) maimed, or (figuratively) dejected; contrite, lame.
probably of Egyptian origin; Neko, an Egyptian king; Necho. Compare פַּרְעֹה נְכֹה.
from כּוּן; prepared; Nakon, probably an Israelite; Nachon.
from an unused root meaning to be straightforward; properly, the fore part; used adverbially, opposite; before, over against.
from the same as נֵכַח; properly, the front part; used adverbially (especially with preposition), opposite, in front of, forward, in behalf of; (over) against, before, direct(-ly), for, right (on).
from the same as נֵכַח; straightforward, i.e. (figuratively), equitable, correct, or (abstractly), integrity; plain, right, uprightness.
feminine of נָכֹחַ; properly, straightforwardness, i.e. (figuratively) integrity, or (concretely) a truth; equity, right (thing), uprightness.
a primitive root; to defraud, i.e. act treacherously; beguile, conspire, deceiver, deal subtilly.
from נָכַל; deceit; wile.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נֶכֶס; {treasure}; goods.
from an unused root meaning to accumulate; treasure; riches, wealth.

a primitive root; properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning); acknowledge, [idiom] could, deliver, discern, dissemble, estrange, feign self to be another, know, take knowledge (notice), perceive, regard, (have) respect, behave (make) self strange(-ly).
or נֹכֶר; from נָכַר; something strange, i.e. unexpected calamity; strange.
' from נָכַר; foreign, or (concretely) a foreigner, or (abstractly) heathendom; alien, strange ([phrase] -er).
from נֶכֶר (second form); strange, in a variety of degrees and applications (foreign, non-relative, adulterous, different, wonderful); alien, foreigner, outlandish, strange(-r, woman).
probably for נְכֹאת; spicery, i.e. (generally) valuables; precious things.
apparently a primitive root; to complete; make an end.
from בָּזָה,; despised; vile.
apparently for יְמוּאֵל; Nemuel, the name of two Israelites; Nemuel.
from נְמוּאֵל; a Nemuelite, or descendant of Nemuel; Nemuelite.
a primitive root; to become clipped or (specifically) circumcised; (branch to) be cut down (off), circumcise.
feminine from נָמַל; an ant (probably from its almost bisected form); ant.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָמֵר; {a leopard (from its stripes)}; leopard.
from an unused root meaning properly, to filtrate, i.e. be limpid (comp נִמְרָה and נִמְרִים); and thus to spot or stain as if by dripping; a leopard (from its stripes); leopard.
from the same as נָמֵר; clear water; Nimrah, a place East of the Jordan; Nimrah. See also בֵּית נִמְרָה, נִמְרִים.
or נִמְרֹד; probably of foreign origin; Nimrod, a son of Cush; Nimrod.
plural of a masculine corresponding to נִמְרָה; clear waters; Nimrim, a place East of the Jordan; Nimrim. Compare בֵּית נִמְרָה.
probably from מָשָׁה; extricated; Nimshi, the (grand-) father of Jehu; Nimshi.
from נָסַס; a flag; also a sail; by implication, a flagstaff; generally a signal; figuratively, a token; banner, pole, sail, (en-) sign, standard.
feminine participle passive of סָבַב; properly, an environment, i.e. circumstance or turn of affairs; cause.
a primitive root; to retreat; departing away, remove, take (hold), turn away.
a primitive root; to test; by implication, to attempt; adventure, assay, prove, tempt, try.
a primitive root; to tear away; destroy, pluck, root.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָסַח; {to tear away}; pull down.
from נָסַךְ; properly, something poured out, i.e. a libation; also a molten image; by implication, a prince (as anointed); drink offering, duke, prince(-ipal).
a primitive root; to pour out, especially a libation, or to cast (metal); by analogy, to anoint aking; cover, melt, offer, (cause to) pour (out), set (up).
a primitive root (probably identical with נָסַךְ through the idea of fusion); to interweave, i.e. (figuratively) to overspread; that is spread.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָסַךְ; to pour out a libation; offer.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נֶסֶךְ; a libation; drink offering.
or נֵסֶךְ; from נָסַךְ; a libation; also a cast idol; cover, drink offering, molten image.
a primitive root; to wane, i.e. be sick; faint.

a primitive root; to gleam from afar, i.e. to be conspicuous as a signal; or rather perhaps a denominative from נֵס (and identical with נָסַס, through the idea of a flag as fluttering in the wind); to raise a beacon; lift up as an ensign.

a primitive root; properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney; cause to blow, bring, get, (make to) go (away, forth, forward, onward, out), (take) journey, march, remove, set aside (forward), [idiom] still, be on his (go their) way.
a primitive root; to go up; ascend.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָסַק; {to go up}; take up.
lemma נְסִרֹךְ first vowel, corrected to נִסְרֹךְ; of foreign origin; Nisrok, a Babylonian idol; Nisroch.
from נוּעַ; motion; Neah, a place in Palestine; Neah.
from נוּעַ; movement; Noah, an Israelitess; Noah.

or נָעֻר; and (feminine) נְעֻרָה; properly, passive participle from נַעַר as denominative; (only in plural collectively or emphatic form) youth, the state (juvenility) or the persons (young people); childhood, youth.
from נוּעַ and אֵל; moved of God; Neiel, a place in Palestine; Neiel.
from נָעֵם; delightful (objective or subjective, literal or figurative); pleasant(-ure), sweet.
a primitive root; also denominative from נַעַל; properly, to fasten up, i.e. with abar or cord; hence, to sandal, i.e. furnish with slippers; bolt, inclose, lock, shoe, shut up.

or (feminine) נַעֲלָה; from נָעַל; properly, a sandal tongue; by extension a sandal or slipper (sometimes as a symbol of occupancy, a refusal to marry, or of something valueless); dryshod, (pair of) shoe((-latchet), -s).
a primitive root; to be agreeable (literally or figuratively); pass in beauty, be delight, be pleasant, be sweet.
from נָעֵם; pleasure; Naam, an Israelite; Naam.
from נָעֵם; agreeableness, i.e. delight, suitableness, splendor or grace; beauty, pleasant(-ness).
feminine of נַעַם; pleasantness; Naamah, the name of an antediluvian woman, of an Ammonitess, and of a place in Palestine; Naamah.
patronymic from נַעֲמָן; a Naamanite, or descendant of Naaman (collectively); Naamites.
from נֹעַם; pleasant; Noomi, an Israelitess; Naomi.
from נָעֵם; pleasantness (plural as concrete); pleasant.
the same as נַעֲמָן; Naaman, the name of an Israelite and of a Damascene; Naaman.
patrial from a place corresponding in name (but not identical) with נַעֲמָה; a Naamathite, or inhabitant of Naamah; Naamathite.
from an unused root meaning to prick; probably a brier; by implication, a thicket of thorny bushes; thorn.
a primitive root; to growl; yell.

a primitive root (probably identical with נָעַר, through the idea of the rustling of mane, which usually accompanies the lion's roar); to tumble about; shake (off, out, self), overthrow, toss up and down.

from נָעַר; (concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age); babe, boy, child, damsel (from the margin), lad, servant, young (man).
from נָעַר in its derivative sense of tossing about; a wanderer; young one.
from נָעַר; (compare נַעַר); (abstractly) boyhood; child, youth.
feminine of נַעַר; a girl (from infancy to adolescence); damsel, maid(-en), young (woman).
the same as נַעֲרָה; Naarah, the name of an Israelitess, and of a place in Palestine; Naarah, Naarath.
from נַעַר; youthful; Naarai, an Israelite; Naarai.
from נַעַר and יָהּ; servant of Jah; Nearjah, the name of two Israelites; Neariah.
from נַעַר; juvenile; Naaran, a place in Palestine; Naaran.
from נָעַר; something shaken out, i.e. tow (as the refuse of flax); tow.
a variation of מֹף; Noph, the capital of Upper Egypt; Noph.
from an unused root probably meaning to spring forth; a sprout; Nepheg, the name of two Israelites; Nepheg.
from נוּף in the sense of lifting; a height; also a sieve; border, coast, region, sieve.
for נְפִיסִים; Nephushesim, a Temple-servant; Nephisesim (from the margin).

a primitive root; to puff, in various applications (literally, to inflate, blow hard, scatter, kindle, expire; figuratively, to disesteem); blow, breath, give up, cause to lose (life), seething, snuff.
from נָפַח; a gust; Nophach, a place in Moab; Nophah.
or נְפִל; from נָפַל; properly, a feller, i.e. a bully or tyrant; giant.
plural from an unused root meaning to scatter; expansions; Nephisim, a Temple-servant; Nephusim (from the margin).
from נָפַשׁ; refreshed; Naphish, a son of Ishmael, and his posterity; Naphish.
from an unused root meaning to glisten; shining; a gem, probably the garnet; emerald.

a primitive root; to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative); be accepted, cast (down, self, (lots), out), cease, die, divide (by lot), (let) fail, (cause to, let, make, ready to) fall (away, down, -en, -ing), fell(-ing), fugitive, have (inheritance), inferior, be judged (by mistake for פָּלַל), lay (along), (cause to) lie down, light (down), be ([idiom] hast) lost, lying, overthrow, overwhelm, perish, present(-ed, -ing), (make to) rot, slay, smite out, [idiom] surely, throw down.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָפַל; {to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)}; fall (down), have occasion.
or נֵפֶל; from נָפַל; something fallen, i.e. an abortion; untimely birth.
a primitive root; to dash to pieces, or scatter; be beaten in sunder, break (in pieces), broken, dash (in pieces), cause to be discharged, dispersed, be overspread, scatter.
from נָפַץ; a storm (as dispersing); scattering.
(Aramaic) a primitive root; to issue; causatively, to bring out; come (go, take) forth (out).
(Aramaic) from נְפַק; an outgo, i.e. expense; expense.
a primitive root; to breathe; passively, to be breathed upon , i.e. (figuratively) refreshed (as if by a current of air); (be) refresh selves (-ed).

from נָפַשׁ; properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental); any, appetite, beast, body, breath, creature, [idiom] dead(-ly), desire, [idiom] (dis-) contented, [idiom] fish, ghost, [phrase] greedy, he, heart(-y), (hath, [idiom] jeopardy of) life ([idiom] in jeopardy), lust, man, me, mind, mortally, one, own, person, pleasure, (her-, him-, my-, thy-) self, them (your) -selves, [phrase] slay, soul, [phrase] tablet, they, thing, ([idiom] she) will, [idiom] would have it.
for נָפָה; a height; country.
from נוּף in the sense of shaking to pieces; a dripping i.e. of honey (from the comb); honeycomb.
from פָּתַח; opened, i.e. a spring; Nephtoach, a place in Palestine; Neptoah.
from פָּתַל; properly, wrestled; but used (in the plural) transitively, a struggle; wrestling.
plural of foreign origin,; Naphtuchim, an Egyptian tribe; Naptuhim.
from פָּתַל; my wrestling; Naphtali, a son of Jacob, with the tribe descended from him, and its territory; Naphtali.
from נָצַץ; a flower (from its brilliancy); also a hawk (from it flashing speed); blossom, hawk.
a primitive root; to go away; flee.

a primitive root; to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively); appointed, deputy, erect, establish, [idiom] Huzzah (by mistake for a proper name), lay, officer, pillar, present, rear up, set (over, up), settle, sharpen, establish, (make to) stand(-ing, still, up, upright), best state.
passive participle of נָצַב; fixed, i.e. a handle; haft.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to נָצַב; fixedness, i.e. firmness; strength.

a primitive root; properly, to go forth, i.e. (by implication) to be expelled, and (consequently) desolate; causatively, to lay waste; also (specifically), to quarrel; be laid waste, runinous, strive (together).
feminine of נֵץ; a blossom; flower.

a primitive root;  also as denominative from נֶצַח; properly, to glitter from afar, i.e. to be eminent (as a superintendent, especially of the Temple services and its music); to be permanent; excel, chief musician (singer), oversee(-r), set forward.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָצַח; to become chief; be preferred.

or נֵצַח; from נָצַח; properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view); alway(-s), constantly, end, ([phrase] n-) ever(more), perpetual, strength, victory.
probably identical with נֶצַח, through the idea of brilliancy of color; juice of the grape (as blood red); blood, strength.
or נְצִב; from נָצַב; something stationary, i.e. a prefect, a military post, a statue; garrison, officer, pillar.
the same as נְצִיב; station; Netsib, a place in Palestine; Nezib.
from נָצַח; conspicuous; Netsiach, a Temple-servant; Neziah.
from נָצַר; properly, conservative; but used passively, delivered; preserved.

a primitive root; to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense; [idiom] at all, defend, deliver (self), escape, [idiom] without fail, part, pluck, preserve, recover, rescue, rid, save, spoil, strip, [idiom] surely, take (out).
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָצַל; to extricate; deliver, rescue.
from נֵץ; a blossom; flower.
a primitive root; to glare, i.e. be bright-colored; sparkle.

a primitive root; to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.); besieged, hidden thing, keep(-er, -ing), monument, observe, preserve(-r), subtil, watcher(-man).
from נָצַר in the sense of greenness as a striking color; a shoot; figuratively, a descendant; branch.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to נָקָה; clean; pure.

a primitive root; to puncture, literally (to perforate, with more or less violence) or figuratively (to specify, designate, libel); appoint, blaspheme, bore, curse, express, with holes, name, pierce, strike through.
a bezel (for a gem); pipe.
the same as נֶקֶב; dell; Nekeb, a place in Palestine; Nekeb.
from נָקַב; female (from the sexual form); female.
from an unused root meaning to mark (by puncturing or branding); spotted; speckled.
active participle from the same as נָקֹד; a spotter (of sheep or cattle), i.e. the owner or tender (who thus marks them); herdman, sheepmaster.
from the same as נָקֹד; a crumb (as broken to spots); also a biscuit (as pricked); cracknel, mouldy.
feminine of נָקֹד; a boss; stud.

a primitive root; to be (or make) clean (literally or figuratively); by implication (in an adverse sense) to be bare, i.e. extirpated; acquit [idiom] at all, [idiom] altogether, be blameless, cleanse, (be) clear(-ing), cut off, be desolate, be free, be (hold) guiltless, be (hold) innocent, [idiom] by no means, be quit, be (leave) unpunished, [idiom] utterly, [idiom] wholly.
feminine of נָקֹד (in the figurative sense of marked); distinction; Nekoda, a Temple-servant; Nekoda.
a primitive root; to loathe; weary.
or נָקִיא; (Joel 4:19; Jonah [1:14), from נָקָה; innocent; blameless, clean, clear, exempted, free, guiltless, innocent, quit.
or נִקָּיֹן; from נָקָה; clearness (literally or figuratively); cleanness, innocency.
from an unused root meaning to bore; a cleft; hole.
a primitive root; to grudge, i.e. avenge or punish; avenge(-r, self), punish, revenge (self), [idiom] surely, take vengeance.
from נָקַם; revenge; [phrase] avenged, quarrel, vengeance.
feminine of נָקָם; avengement, whether the act of the passion; [phrase] avenge, revenge(-ing), vengeance.
a primitive root; to feel aversion; be alienated.

a primitive root; to strike with more or less violence (beat, fell, corrode); by implication (of attack) to knock together, i.e. surround or circulate; compass (about, -ing), cut down, destroy, go round (about), inclose, round.
from נָקַף; a threshing (of olives); shaking.
from נָקַף; probably a rope (as encircling); rent.
a primitive root; to bore (penetrate, quarry); dig, pick out, pierce, put (thrust) out.
from נָקַר, a fissure; {to bore (penetrate, quarry)}; cleft, clift.
a primitive root; to entrap (with a noose), literally or figuratively; catch (lay a) snare.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָקַשׁ; used in the sense of נָקַף; to knock; smote.
the same as נִיר; lamp; Ner, an Israelite; Ner.
of foreign origin; Nergal, a Cuthite deity; Nergal.
from נֵרְגַּל and שַׁרְאֶצֶר; Nergal-Sharetser, the name of two Babylonians; Nergal-sharezer.
from an unused root meaning to roll to pieces; a slanderer; talebearer, whisperer.
of foreign origin; nard, an aromatic; spikenard.
or נֵרִיָּהוּ; from נִיר and יָהּ; light of Jah; Nerijah, an Israelite; Neriah.

or נָסָה; (Psalm 4:6 (אֲבַד)), a primitive root; to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative; accept, advance, arise, (able to, (armor), suffer to) bear(-er, up), bring (forth), burn, carry (away), cast, contain, desire, ease, exact, exalt (self), extol, fetch, forgive, furnish, further, give, go on, help, high, hold up, honorable ([phrase] man), lade, lay, lift (self) up, lofty, marry, magnify, [idiom] needs, obtain, pardon, raise (up), receive, regard, respect, set (up), spare, stir up, [phrase] swear, take (away, up), [idiom] utterly, wear, yield.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָשָׂא; {to lift}; carry away, make insurrection, take.
a primitive root; to lead astray, i.e. (mentally) to delude, or (morally) to seduce; beguile, deceive, [idiom] greatly, [idiom] utterly.
a primitive root (perhaps identical with נָשָׁא, through the idea of imposition); to lend on interest; by implication, to dun fordebt; [idiom] debt, exact, giver of usury.
passive participle feminine of נָשָׂא; something taken, i.e. a present; gift.
a primitive root; to blow; by implication, to disperse; (cause to) blow, drive away.
a primitive root; to reach (literally or figuratively); ability, be able, attain (unto), (be able to, can) get, lay at, put, reach, remove, wax rich, [idiom] surely, (over-) take (hold of, on, upon).
a primitive root; to forget; figuratively, to neglect; causatively, to remit, remove; forget, deprive, exact.

a primitive root (rather identical with נָשָׁה, in the sense of נָשָׁא); to lend or (by reciprocity) borrow on security or interest; creditor, exact, extortioner, lend, usurer, lend on (taker on) usury.
from נָשָׁה, in the sense of failure; rheumatic or crippled (from the incident to Jacob); which shrank.
or rather, נְשֻׂאָה; feminine. passive participle of נָשָׂא; something borne, i.e. a load; carriage.
from נָשָׁה; a debt; debt.
or נָשִׂא; from נָשָׂא; properly, an exalted one, i.e. a king or sheik; also a rising mist; captain, chief, cloud, governor, prince, ruler, vapour.
from נָשָׁה; oblivion; forgetfulness.
(Aramaic) irregular plural feminine of אֱנָשׁ; {a man}; women.
from נָשַׁק; a kiss; kiss.
a primitive root; to strike with a sting (as a serpent); figuratively, to oppress with interest on a loan; bite, lend upon usury.
from נָשַׁךְ; interest on a debt; usury.
for לִשְׁכָּה; a cell; chamber.
a primitive root; to pluck off, i.e. divest, eject or drop; cast (out), drive, loose, put off (out), slip.
a primitive root; properly, to blow away, i.e. destroy; destroy.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נְשָׁמָה; vital breath; breath.
from נָשַׁם; a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal; blast, (that) breath(-eth), inspiration, soul, spirit.
a primitive root; to breeze, i.e. blow up fresh (as the wind); blow.
from נָשַׁף; properly, a breeze, i.e. (by implication) dusk (when the evening breeze prevails); dark, dawning of the day (morning), night, twilight.
a primitive root; to catch fire; burn, kindle.

a primitive root (identical with נָשַׂק, through the idea of fastening up; compare חָזַק, חָשַׁק); to kiss, literally or figuratively (touch); also (as a mode of attachment), to equip with weapons; armed (men), rule, kiss, that touched.
or נֵשֶׁק; from נָשַׁק; military equipment, i.e. (collectively) arms (offensive or defensive), or (concretely) an arsenal; armed men, armour(-y), battle, harness, weapon.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נֶשֶׁר; an eagle; eagle.
from an unused root meaning to lacerate; the eagle (or other large bird of prey); eagle.
a primitive root; properly, to eliminate, i.e. (intransitively) to dry up; fail.
probably of Persian origin; an epistle; letter.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נִשְׁתְּוָן; {an epistle}; letter.
a primitive root; to dismember; cut (in pieces), divide, hew in pieces.
from נָתַח; a fragment; part, piece.
or (feminine) נְתִיבָה; or נְתִבָה; (Jeremiah 6:16), from an unused root meaning to tramp; a (beaten) track; path(-way), [idiom] travel(-ler), way.
or נָתוּן (Ezra 8:17), (the proper form as passive participle), from נָתַן; one given, i.e. (in the plural only); the Nethinim, or Temple-servants (as given to that duty); Nethinims.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָתִין; {the Nethinim, or Temple-servants (as given to that duty)}; Nethinims.
a primitive root; to flow forth (literally or figuratively); by implication, to liquify; drop, gather (together), melt, pour (forth, out).

a primitive root; to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.); add, apply, appoint, ascribe, assign, [idiom] avenge, [idiom] be (healed), bestow, bring (forth, hither), cast, cause, charge, come, commit, consider, count, [phrase] cry, deliver (up), direct, distribute, do, [idiom] doubtless, [idiom] without fail, fasten, frame, [idiom] get, give (forth, over, up), grant, hang (up), [idiom] have, [idiom] indeed, lay (unto charge, up), (give) leave, lend, let (out), [phrase] lie, lift up, make, [phrase] O that, occupy, offer, ordain, pay, perform, place, pour, print, [idiom] pull, put (forth), recompense, render, requite, restore, send (out), set (forth), shew, shoot forth (up), [phrase] sing, [phrase] slander, strike, (sub-) mit, suffer, [idiom] surely, [idiom] take, thrust, trade, turn, utter, [phrase] weep, [phrase] willingly, [phrase] withdraw, [phrase] would (to) God, yield.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָתַן; give; bestow, give pay.
from נָתַן; given; Nathan, the name of five Israelites; Nathan.
xlit Nᵉthanêʼl corrected to Nᵉthanʼêl; from נָתַן and אֵל; given of God; Nethanel, the name of ten Israelites; Nethaneel.
or נְתַנְיָהוּ; from נָתַן and יָהּ; given of Jah; Nethanjah, the name of four Israelites; Nethaniah.
from נָתַן and מֶלֶךְ; given of (the) king; Nethan-Melek, an Israelite; Nathanmelech.
a primitive root; to tear up; mar.
for נָתַץ; to tear out; break.
a primitive root; to tear down; beat down, break down (out), cast down, destroy, overthrow, pull down, throw down.
a primitive root; to tear off; break (off), burst, draw (away), lift up, pluck (away, off), pull (out), root out.
from נָתַק; scurf; (dry) scall.
a primitive root; to jump, i.e. be violently agitated; causatively, to terrify, shake off, untie; drive asunder, leap, (let) loose, [idiom] make, move, undo.
(Aramaic) corresponding to נָתַר; {to jump, i.e. be violently agitated; causatively, to terrify, shake off, untie}; shake off.
from נָתַר; mineral potash (so called from effervescing with acid); nitre.
a primitive root; to tear away; destroy, forsake, pluck (out, up, by the roots), pull up, root out (up), [idiom] utterly. s
from an unused root meaning to define; a seah, or certain measure (as determinative) forgrain; measure.
from סָאַן; perhaps a military boot (as aprotection from mud; battle.
a primitive root; to be miry; used only as denominative from סְאוֹן; to shoe, i.e. (active participle) a soldier shod; warrior.
lemma סַאסְאָה missing dagesh, corrected to סַאסְּאָה; for סְאָה; measurement, i.e. moderation; measure.
a primitive root; to quaff to satiety, i.e. become tipsy; drunkard, fill self, Sabean, (wine-) bibber.
of foreign origin; Seba, a son of Cush, and the country settled by him; Seba.
from סָבָא; potation, concretely (wine), or abstractly (carousal); drink, drunken, wine.
patrial from סְבָא; a Sebaite, or inhabitant of Seba; Sabean.

a primitive root; to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively; bring, cast, fetch, lead, make, walk, [idiom] whirl, [idiom] round about, be about on every side, apply, avoid, beset (about), besiege, bring again, carry (about), change, cause to come about, [idiom] circuit, (fetch a) compass (about, round), drive, environ, [idiom] on every side, beset (close, come, compass, go, stand) round about, inclose, remove, return, set, sit down, turn (self) (about, aside, away, back).
from סָבַב; a (providential) turn (of affairs); cause.
or (feminine) סְבִיבָה; from סָבַב; (as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around; (place, round) about, circuit, compass, on every side.
a primitive root; to entwine; fold together, wrap.
from סָבַךְ; a copse; thicket.
from סָבַךְ,; a copse; thick(-et).
(Aramaic) or שַׂבְּכָא; (Aramaic), from a root corresponding to סָבַךְ; a lyre; sackbut.
from סָבַךְ; copse-like; Sibbecai, an Israelite; Sibbecai, Sibbechai.
a primitive root; to carry (literally or figuratively), or (reflexively) be burdensome; specifically, to be gravid; bear, be a burden, carry, strong to labour.
(Aramaic) corresponding to סָבַל; to erect; strongly laid.
from סָבַל; a load (literally or figuratively); burden, charge.
(only in the form סֻבָּל; from סָבַל; a load (figuratively); burden.
from סָבַל; a porter; (to bear, bearer of) burden(-s).
from סֵבֶל; porterage; burden.
for שִׁבֹּל; an ear of grain; Sibboleth.
(Aramaic) a primitive root; to bear in mind, i.e. hope; think.
dual from a root corresponding to סְבַר; double hope; Sibrajim, a place in Syria; Sibraim.
or סַבְתָּה; probably of foreign derivation; Sabta or Sabtah, the name of a son of Cush, and the country occupied by his posterity; Sabta, Sabtah.
probably of foreign derivation; Sabteca, the name of a son of Cush, and the region settled by him; Sabtecha, Sabtechah.
a primitive root; to prostrate oneself (in homage); fall down.
(Aramaic) corresponding to סָגַד; {to prostrate oneself (in homage)}; worship.
from סָגַר; properly, shut up, i.e. the breast (as enclosing the heart); also gold (as generally shut up safely); caul, gold.
feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to shut up; wealth (as closely shut up); jewel, peculiar (treasure), proper good, special.
(Aramaic) corresponding to סָגָן; {a prefect of aprovince}; governor.
from an unused root meaning to superintend; a prefect of a province; prince, ruler.
a primitive root; to shut up; figuratively, to surrender; close up, deliver (up), give over (up), inclose, [idiom] pure, repair, shut (in, self, out, up, up together), stop, [idiom] straitly.
(Aramaic) corresponding to סָגַר; {to shut up; figuratively, to surrender}; shut up.
probably from סָגַר in the sense of sweeping away; a pouring rain; very rainy.
from an unused root meaning to estop; the stocks; stocks.
from an unused root meaning to envelop; a wrapper, i.e. shirt; fine linen, sheet.
from an unused root meaning to scorch; burnt (i.e. volcanic or bituminous) district; Sedom, a place near the Dead Sea; Sodom.
from an unused root meaning to arrange; order; order.
from an unused root meaning to be round; roundness; round.
from the same as סַהַר; a dungeon (as surrounded by walls); prison.
of foreign derivation; So, an Egyptian king; So.
a primitive root; properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize); backslider, drive, go back, turn (away, back).
a primitive root (probably rather identical with סוּג through the idea of shrinking from a hedge; compare שׂוּג); to hem in, i.e. bind; set about.
from סָגַר; an inclosure, i.e. cage (for an animal); ward.
from יָסַד; a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret; assembly, consel, inward, secret (counsel).
from סוֹד; a confidant; Sodi, an Israelite; Sodi.
from an unused root meaning to wipe away; sweeping; Suach, an Israelite; Suah.
from the same as סוּחַ; something swept away, i.e. filth; torn.
from שׂוּט; roving; Sotai, one of the Nethinim; Sotai.
a primitive root; properly, to smear over (with oil), i.e. anoint; anoint (self), [idiom] at all.
(Aramaic) or סוּמְפֹּנְיָה; (Aramaic), or סִיפֹנְיָא; (Daniel 3:10) (Aramaic), of Greek origin; a bagpipe (with a double pipe); dulcimer.
(rather to be written סְוֵנָה; for סְוֵן; i.e to Seven); of Egyptian derivation; Seven, a place in Upper Egypt; Syene.
or סֻס; from an unused root meaning to skip (properly, for joy); a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight); crane, horse (-back, -hoof). Compare פָּרָשׁ.
feminine of סוּס; a mare; company of horses.
from סוּס; horse-like; Susi, an Israelite; Susi.
a primitive root; to snatch away, i.e. terminate; consume, have an end, perish, [idiom] be utterly.
(Aramaic) corresponding to סוּף; to come to an end; consume, fulfill.
probably of Egyptian origin; a reed, especially the papyrus; flag, Red (sea), weed. Compare סוּף.
for סוּף (by ellipsis of יָם); the Reed (Sea); Red Sea.
from סוּף; a termination; conclusion, end, hinder participle
(Aramaic) corresponding to סוֹף; {a termination}; end.
from סוּף; a hurricane; Red Sea, storm, tempest, whirlwind, Red sea.

or שׂוּר; (Hosea 9:12), a primitive root; to turn off (literal or figurative); be(-head), bring, call back, decline, depart, eschew, get (you), go (aside), [idiom] grievous, lay away (by), leave undone, be past, pluck away, put (away, down), rebel, remove (to and fro), revolt, [idiom] be sour, take (away, off), turn (aside, away, in), withdraw, be without.
probably passive participle of סוּר; turned off, i.e. deteriorated; degenerate.
the same as סוּר; Sur, a gate of the temple; Sur.
perhaps denominative from שַׁיִת; properly, to prick, i.e. (figuratively) stimulate; by implication, to seduce; entice, move, persuade, provoke, remove, set on, stir up, take away.
probably from the same root as מַסְוֶה; covering, i.e. clothing; clothes.
a primitive root; to trail along; draw (out), tear.
from סָחַב; a rag; cast clout.
a primitive root; to sweep away; scrape.
from סָחָה; refuse (as swept off); offscouring.
a primitive root; to scrape off; sweep (away).
a primitive root; to travel round (specifically as a pedlar); intensively, to palpitate; go about, merchant(-man), occupy with, pant, trade, traffick.
from סָחַר; profit (from trade); merchandise.
from סָחַר; an emporium; abstractly, profit (from trade); mart, merchandise.
from סָחַר; traffic; merchandise.
properly, active participle feminine of סָחַר; something surrounding the person, i.e. a shield; buckler.
similar to סֹחֵרָה; probably a (black) tile (or tessara) forlaying borders with; black marble.
or סוּג; (Ezekiel 22:18), from סוּג in the sense of refuse; scoria; dross.
probably of Persian origin; Sivan, the third Hebrew month; Sivan.
or סִיחֹן; from the same as סוּחַ; tempestuous; Sichon, an Amoritish king; Sihon.
of uncertain derivation; Sin the name of an Egyptian town and (probably) desert adjoining; Sin.
from an otherwise unknown name of a man; a Sinite, or descendant of one of the sons of Canaan; Sinite.
of uncertain derivation; Sinai, mountain of Arabia; Sinai.
plural of an otherwise unknown name; Sinim, a distant Oriental region; Sinim.
of uncertain derivation; Sisera, the name of a Canaanitish king and of one of the Nethinim; Sisera.
or סִיעֲהָא; from an unused root meaning to converse; congregation; Sia or Siaha, one of the Nethinim; Sia, Siaha.

or (feminine) סִירָה; or סִרָה; (Jeremiah 52:18), from a primitive root meaning to boil up; a pot; also a thorn (as springing up rapidly); by implication, a hook; caldron, fishhook, pan, (wash-)pot, thorn.
from סָכַךְ; properly, a thicket of men, i.e. a crowd; multitude.
from סָכַךְ; a hut (as of entwined boughs); also a lair; covert, den, pavilion, tabernacle.
feminine of סֹךְ; a hut or lair; booth, cottage, covert, pavilion, tabernacle, tent.
feminine of סָךְ; an (idolatrous) booth; tabernacle.
or סֻכֹּת; plural of סֻכָּה; booths; Succoth, the name of a place in Egypt and of three in Palestine; Succoth.
from סֻכּוֹת and the (irregular) plural of בַּת; booths of (the) daughters; brothels, i.e. idoalatrous tents forimpure purpose; Succothbenoth.
patrial from an unknown name (perhaps סֹךְ); a Sukkite, or inhabitant of some place near Egypt (i.e. hut-dwellers); Sukkiims.

or שָׂכַךְ; (Exodus 33:22), a primitive root; properly, to entwine as ascreen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect; cover, defence, defend, hedge in, join together, set, shut up.
from סָכַךְ; inclosure; Secacah, a place in Palestine; Secacah.
for כָּסַל; to be silly; do (make, play the, turn into) fool(-ish, -ishly, -ishness).
from סָכַל; silliness; concretely and collectively, dolts; folly.
from סָכַל; silly; fool(-ish), sottish.
or שִׂכְלוּת; (Ecclesiastes 1:17), from סָכַל; silliness; folly, foolishness.
a primitive root; to be familiar with; by implication, to minister to, be serviceable to, be customary; acquaint (self), be advantage, [idiom] ever, (be, (un-)) profit(-able), treasurer, be wont.
probably a denominative from שַׂכִּין; properly, to cut, i.e. damage; also to grow (causatively, make) poor; endanger, impoverish.
a primitive root; to shut up; by implication, to surrender; stop, give over. See also סָגַר, שָׂכַר.
a primitive root to be silent; by implication, to observe quietly; take heed.
from סָלַל; properly, a willow twig (as pendulous), i.e. an osier; but only as woven into abasket; basket.
a primitive root; to suspend in a balance, i.e. weigh; compare.
from סָלַל; an embankment; Silla, a place in Jerusalem; Silla.
a primitive root; probably to leap (with joy), i.e. exult; harden self.
from סָלַד; exultation; Seled, an Israelite; Seled.
a primitive root; to hang up, i.e. weigh, or (figuratively) contemn; tread down (under foot), value.
from סָלָה; suspension (of music), i.e. pause; Selah.
or סַלּוּא; or סָלוּא; or סַלַּי; from סָלָה; weighed; Sallu or Sallai, the name of two Israelites; Sallai, Sallu, Salu.
or סַלּוֹן; from סָלָה; a prickle (as if pendulous); brier, thorn.
a primitive root; to forgive; forgive, pardon, spare.
from סָלַח; placable; ready to forgive.
from סָלַח; pardon; forgiveness, pardon.
from an unused root. meaning to walk; walking; Salcah, a place East of the Jordan; Salcah, Salchah.
a primitive root; to mound up (especially a turnpike); figurative, to exalt; reflexively, to oppose (as by a dam); cast up, exalt (self), extol, make plain, raise up.
or סוֹלְלָה; active participle feminine of סָלַל, but used passively; a military mound, i.e. rampart of besiegers; bank, mount.
from סָלַל; a stair-case; ladder.
from סָלָה; a twig (as pendulous); basket.
from an unused root meaning to be lofty; a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress); (ragged) rock, stone(-ny), strong hold.
the same as סֶלַע; Sela, the rock-city of Idumaea; rock, Sela(-h).
from סֶלַע and the plural of מַחֲלֹקֶת with the article interposed; rock of the divisions; Sela-ham-Machlekoth, a place in Palestine; Sela-hammalekoth.
apparently from the same as סֶלַע in the sense of crushing as with a rock, i.e. consuming; a kind of locust (from its destructiveness); bald locust.
a primitive root; properly, to wrench, i.e. (figuratively) to subvert; overthrow, pervert.
from סָלַף; distortion, i.e. (figuratively) viciousness; perverseness.
(Aramaic) a primitive root; to ascend; come (up).
from an unused root meaning to strip; flour (as chipped off); (fine) flour, meal.
from an unused root meaning to smell sweet; an aroma; sweet (spice).
of foreign origin; Samgar-Nebo, a Babylonian general; Samgar-nebo.
of uncertain derivation; a vine blossom; used also adverbially, abloom; tender grape.

a primitive root; to prop (literally or figuratively); reflexively, to lean upon or take hold of (in a favorable or unfavorable sense); bear up, establish, (up-) hold, lay, lean, lie hard, put, rest self, set self, stand fast, stay (self), sustain.
from סָמַךְ and יָהּ; supported of Jah; Semakjah, an Israelite; Semachiah.
or סֵמֶל; from an unused root meaning to resemble; a likeness; figure, idol, image.
a primitive root; to designate; appointed.
a primitive root; to be erect, i.e. bristle as hair; stand up, tremble.
from סָמַר; bristling, i.e. shaggy; rough.
from an unused root meaning to prick; thorny; Senaah, a place in Palestine; Senaah, Hassenaah (with the article).
of foreign origin; Sanballat, a Persian satrap of Samaria; Sanballat.
from an unused root meaning to prick; a bramble; bush.
the same as סְנֶה; thorn; Seneh, a crag in Palestine; Seneh.
or סְנֻאָה from the same as סְנָאָה; pointed; (used with the article as a proper name) Senuah, the name of two Israelites; Hasenuah (including the art), Senuah.
of uncertain derivation; (in plural) blindness; blindness.
of foreign origin; Sancherib, an Assyrian king; Sennacherib.
from an unused root meaning to be pointed; a twig (as tapering); bough.
feminine of a form of סַנְסִן; a bough; Sansannah, a place in Palestine; Sansannah.
of uncertain derivation; a fin (collectively); fins.
from the same as סוּס; a moth (from the agility of the fly); moth.
of uncertain derivation; Sismai, an Israelite; Sisamai.
a primitive root; to suport (mostly figurative); comfort, establish, hold up, refresh self, strengthen, be upholden.
(Aramaic) corresponding to סָעַד; to aid; helping.
a primitive root; to rush; storm.
from סָעַף; a fissure (of rocks); also a bough (as subdivided); (outmost) branch, clift, top.
a primitive root; properly, to divide up; but used only as denominative from סָעִיף,; to disbranch (a tree); top.
or שָׂעִף; from סָעַף; divided (in mind), i.e. (abstractly) a sentiment; opinion.
from סָעַף; divided (in mind), i.e. (concretely) a skeptic; thought.
feminine of סָעִיף; a twig; bough, branch. Compare סַרְעַפָּה.

a primitive root; to rush upon; by implication, to toss (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); be (toss with) tempest(-uous), be sore, troubled, come out as a (drive with the, scatter with a) whirlwind.
or (feminine) סְעָרָה; from סָעַר; a hurricane; storm(-y), tempest, whirlwind.
from סָפַף, in its original sense of containing; a vestibule (as a limit); also a dish (for holding blood or wine); bason, bowl, cup, door (post), gate, post, threshold.
the same as סַף; Saph, a Philistine; Saph. Compare סִפַּי.
a primitive root; properly, to tear the hair and beat the breasts (as Orientals do in grief); generally to lament; by implication, to wail; lament, mourn(-er), wail.

a primitive root; properly, to scrape (literally, to shave; but usually figuratively) together (i.e. to accumulate or increase) or away (i.e. to scatter, remove, or ruin; intransitively, to perish); add, augment, consume, destroy, heap, join, perish, put.
or שָׂפַח; (Isaiah 3:17), a primitive root; properly, to scrape out, but in certain peculiar senses (of removal or association); abiding, gather together, cleave, smite with the scab.
from סָפַח; the mange (as making the hair fall off); scab.
from סַף; bason-like; Sippai, a Philistine; Sippai. Compare סַף.
from סָפַח; something (spontaneously) falling off, i.e. a self-sown crop; figuratively, a freshet; (such) things as (which) grow (of themselves), which groweth of its own accord (itself).
from סָפַן; a (sea-going) vessel (as ceiled with a deck); ship.
from סָפַר; a gem (perhaps used for scratching other substances), probably the sapphire; sapphire.
from an unused root meaning to depress; a basin (as deepened out); bowl, dish.
a primitive root; to hide by covering; specifically, to roof (passive participle as noun, a roof) or wainscot; figuratively, to reserve; cieled, cover, seated.
from סָפַן; a wainscot; cieling.
a primitive root; properly, to snatch away, i.e. terminate; but used only as denominative from סַף (in the sense of a vestibule),; to wait at the threshold; be a doorkeeper.

or שָׂפַק; (1 Kings 20:10; Job 27:23; Isaiah 2:6), a primitive root; to clap the hands (in token of compact, derision, grief, indignation, or punishment); by implication of satisfaction, to be enough; by implication of excess, to vomit; clap, smite, strike, suffice, wallow.
or שֶׂפֶק; (Job 20:22; Job 36:18), from סָפַק; chastisement; also satiety; stroke, sufficiency.

a primitive root; properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate; commune, (ac-) count; declare, number, [phrase] penknife, reckon, scribe, shew forth, speak, talk, tell (out), writer.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to סָפַר; a book; book, roll.
from סָפַר; a census; numbering.
the same as סְפָר; Sephar, a place in Arabia; Sephar.

or (feminine) סִפְרָה; (Psalm 56:8 (אֲבֵדָה)), from סָפַר; properly, writing (the art or a document); by implication, a book; bill, book, evidence, [idiom] learn(-ed) (-ing), letter, register, scroll.
(Aramaic) from the same as סְפַר; a scribe (secular or sacred); scribe.
of foreign derivation; Sepharad, a region of Assyria; Sepharad.
from סָפַר; a numeration; number.
patrial from סְפַרְוַיִם; a Sepharvite or inhabitant of Sepharvain; Sepharvite.
(dual); Sepharvites;
feminine active participle of סָפַר; a scribe (properly, female); Sophereth, a temple servant; Sophereth.
a primitive root; properly, to be weighty; but used only in the sense of lapidation or its contrary (as if a delapidation); (cast, gather out, throw) stone(-s), [idiom] surely.
contracted from סָרַר; peevish; heavy, sad.
from an unused root meaning to sting; a thistle; brier.
(Aramaic) of uncertain derivation; a cloak; coat.
of foreign derivation; Sargon, an Assyrian king; Sargon.
from a primitive root meaning to tremble; trembling; Sered, an Israelite; Sered.
patron from סֶרֶד; a Seredite (collectively) or descendants of Sered; Sardites.
from סוּר; departure; Sirah, a cistern so-called; Sirah. See also סִיר.
from סוּר; apostasy, crime; figuratively, remission; [idiom] continual, rebellion, revolt(-ed), turn away, wrong.
a primitive root; to extend (even to excess); exceeding, hand, spread, stretch self, banish.
from סָרַח; a redundancy; remnant.
for שִׁרְיוֹן; a coat of mail; brigandine.

or סָרִס; from an unused root meaning to castrate; a eunuch; by implication, valet (especially of the female apartments), and thus, a minister of state; chamberlain, eunuch, officer. Compare רַב־סָרִיס.
(Aramaic) of foreign origin; an emir; president.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; an axle; figuratively, a peer; lord, plate.
for סְעַפָּה; a twig; bough.
a primitive root; to cremate, i.e. to be (near) of kin (such being privileged to kindle the pyre); burn.
from סָרַף; a nettle (as stinging like a burn); brier.
a primitive root; to turn away, i.e. (morally) be refractory; [idiom] away, backsliding, rebellious, revolter(-ing), slide back, stubborn, withdrew.
from an unused root meaning to hide; winter (as the dark season); winter.
from סָתַר; hidden; Sethur, an Israelite; Sethur.
or שָׂתַם; (Numbers 24:15), a primitive root; to stop up; by implication, to repair; figuratively, to keep secret; closed up, hidden, secret, shut out (up), stop.
a primitive root; to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively; be absent, keep close, conceal, hide (self), (keep) secret, [idiom] surely.
(Aramaic) corresponding to סָתַר; to conceal; figuratively, to demolish; destroy, secret thing.

or (feminine) סִתְרָה; (Deuteronomy [32:38), from סָתַר; a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense); backbiting, covering, covert, [idiom] disguise(-th), hiding place, privily, protection, secret(-ly, place).
from סֵתֶר; protective; Sithri, an Israelite,; Zithri. [

(masculine and feminine); from עוּב; properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse; clay, (thick) cloud, [idiom] thick, thicket. Compare עֲבִי.
or עֹב; from an unused root meaning to cover; properly, equivalent to עָב; but used only as an architectural term,; an architrave (as shading the pillars); thick (beam, plant).

a primitive root; to work (in any sense); by implication, to serve, till, (causatively) enslave, etc.; [idiom] be, keep in bondage, be bondmen, bond-service, compel, do, dress, ear, execute, [phrase] husbandman, keep, labour(-ing man, bring to pass, (cause to, make to) serve(-ing, self), (be, become) servant(-s), do (use) service, till(-er), transgress (from margin), (set a) work, be wrought, worshipper,
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָבַד; to do, make, prepare, keep, etc.; [idiom] cut, do, execute, go on, make, move, work.
(Aramaic) from עֲבַד; a servant; servant.
from עָבַד; a servant; [idiom] bondage, bondman, (bond-) servant, (man-) servant.
the same as עֶבֶד; Ebed, the name of two Israelites; Ebed.
from עָבַד; a deed; work.
from עָבַד; work; Abda, the name of two Israelites; Abda
from the active participle of עָבַד and אֱדֹם; worker of Edom; Obed-Edom, the name of five Israelites; Obed-edom.
from עָבַד and אֵל; serving God; Abdeel, an Israelite; Abdeel. Compare עַבְדִיאֵל.
or עֲבוֹדָה; from עָבַד; work of any kind; act, bondage, [phrase] bondservant, effect, labour, ministering(-try), office, service(-ile, -itude), tillage, use, work, [idiom] wrought.
passive participle of עָבַד; something wrought, i.e. (concretely) service; household, store of servants.
from עָבַד; servitude; Abdon, the name of a place in Palestine and of four Israelites; Abdon. Compare עֶבְרֹן.
from עָבַד; servitude; bondage.
from עָבַד; serviceable; Abdi, the name of two Israelites; Abdi.
from עֶבֶד and אֵל; servant of God; Abdiel, an Israelite; Abdiel. Compare עַבְדְּאֵל.
or עֹבַדְיָהוּ; active participle of עָבַד and יָהּ; serving Jah; Obadjah, the name of thirteen Israelites; Obadiah.
from עֶבֶד and מֶלֶךְ; servant of a king; Ebed-Melek, a eunuch of Zedekeah; Ebed-melech.
the same as עֲבֵד נְגוֹא; Abed-Nego, the Babylonian name of one of Daniel's companions; Abed-nego.
(Aramaic) of foreign origin; Abed-Nego, the name of Azariah; Abed-nego.
a primitive root; to be dense; be (grow) thick(-er).
or עֲבֹט; from עָבַט; a pawn; pledge.
or עָבֻר; passive participle of עָבַר; properly, crossed, i.e. (abstractly) transit; used only adverbially, on account of, in order that; because of, for (...'s sake), (intent) that, to.
the same as עָבוּר; passed, i.e. kept over; used only of stored grain; old corn.
a primitive root; to pawn; causatively, to lend (on security); figuratively, to entangle; borrow, break (ranks), fetch (a pledge), lend, [idiom] surely.
from עָבַט; something pledged, i.e. (collectively) pawned goods; thick clay (by a false etym.).
or עֳבִי]; from עָבָה; density, i.e. depth or width; thick(-ness). Compare עָב.
(Aramaic) from עֲבַד; labor or business; affairs, service, work.

a primitive root; to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation); alienate, alter, [idiom] at all, beyond, bring (over, through), carry over, (over-) come (on, over), conduct (over), convey over, current, deliver, do away, enter, escape, fail, gender, get over, (make) go (away, beyond, by, forth, his way, in, on, over, through), have away (more), lay, meddle, overrun, make partition, (cause to, give, make to, over) pass(-age, along, away, beyond, by, -enger, on, out, over, through), (cause to, make) [phrase] proclaim(-amation), perish, provoke to anger, put away, rage, [phrase] raiser of taxes, remove, send over, set apart, [phrase] shave, cause to (make) sound, [idiom] speedily, [idiom] sweet smelling, take (away), (make to) transgress(-or), translate, turn away, (way-) faring man, be wrath.

(Aramaic) corresponding to עֵבֶר; {properly, a region across; but used only adverbially (with or without a preposition) on the opposite side (especially of the Jordan; ususally meaning the east)}; beyond, this side.

from עָבַר; properly, a region across; but used only adverbially (with or without a preposition) on the opposite side (especially of the Jordan; ususally meaning the east); [idiom] against, beyond, by, [idiom] from, over, passage, quarter, (other, this) side, straight.
the same as עֵבֶר; Eber, the name of two patriarchs and four Israelites; Eber, Heber.
feminine of עֵבֶר; an outburst of passion; anger, rage, wrath.
from עָבַר; a crossing-place; ferry, plain (from the margin).
patronymic from עֵבֵר; an Eberite (i.e. Hebrew) or descendant of Eber; Hebrew(-ess, woman).
the same as עִבְרִי; Ibri, an Israelite; Ibri.
xlit ʻĂbârîm corrected to ʻĂbârîym; plural of עֵבֶר; regions beyond; Abarim, a place in Palestine; Abarim, passages.
from עֵבֶר; transitional; Ebron, a place in Palestine; Hebron. Perhaps a clerical error for עַבְדוֹן.
feminine of עֶבְרֹן; Ebronah, place in the Desert; Ebronah.
a primitive root; to dry up; be rotten.
a primitive root; to interlace, i.e. (figuratively) to pervert; wrap up.
or עָבוֹת; from עָבַת; intwined, i.e. dense; thick.
or עֲבוֹת; or (feminine) עֲבֹתָה; the same as עָבֹת; something intwined, i.e. a string, wreath or foliage; band, cord, rope, thick bough (branch), wreathen (chain).
a primitive root; to breathe after, i.e. to love (sensually); dote, lover.
from עֲגַב; love (concretely), i.e. amative words; much love, very lovely.
from עֲגַב; love (abstractly), i.e. amorousness; inordinate love.
from עוּג; an ash-cake (as round); cake (upon the hearth).
passive part (but with active sense) of an unused root meaning to twitter; probably the swallow; swallow.
from the same as עָגֹל; something round, i.e. a ring (for the ears); earring.
from the same as עָגֹל; a (male) calf (as frisking round), especially one nearly grown (i.e. a steer); bullock, calf.
or עָגוֹל; from an unused root meaning to revolve,; circular; round.
feminine of עֵגֶל; a (female) calf, especially one nearly grown (i.e. a heifer); calf, cow, heifer.
the same as עֶגְלָה; Eglah, a wife of David; Eglah.
from the same as עָגֹל; something revolving, i.e. a wheeled vehicle; cart, chariot, wagon
from עֵגֶל; vituline; Eglon, the name of a place in Palestine and of a Moabitish king; Eglon.
a primitive root; to be sad; grieve.
a primitive root; to debar, i.e. from marriage; stay.

from עָדָה; properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition); eternity, ever(-lasting, -more), old, perpetually, [phrase] world without end.

properly, the same as עַד (used as a preposition, adverb or conjunction; especially with a preposition); as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with); against, and, as, at, before, by (that), even (to), for(-asmuch as), (hither-) to, [phrase] how long, into, as long (much) as, (so) that, till, toward, until, when, while, ([phrase] as) yet.

(Aramaic) corresponding to עַד; {as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)}; [idiom] and, at, for, (hither-) to, on till, (un-) to, until, within.
the same as עַד in the sense of the aim of an attack; booty; prey.
contracted from עוּד; concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince; witness.
from an unused root meaning to set a period (compare עָדָה, עוּד); the menstrual flux (as periodical); by implication (in plural) soiling; filthy.

(Aramaic) or עֲדָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to עָדָה; {to advance, i.e. pass on or continue; causatively, to remove; specifically, to bedeck (i.e. bring an ornament upon)}; alter, depart, pass (away), remove, take (away).
a primitive root; to advance, i.e. pass on or continue; causatively, to remove; specifically, to bedeck (i.e. bring an ornament upon); adorn, deck (self), pass by, take away.
from עָדָה; ornament; Adah, the name of two women; Adah.

feminine of עֵד in the original sense of fixture; a stated assemblage (specifically, a concourse, or generally, a family or crowd); assembly, company, congregation, multitude, people, swarm. Compare עֵדָה.
feminine of עֵד in its techn. sense; testimony; testimony, witness. Compare עֵדָה.
or עִדּוֹא; or עִדִּיא; from עָדָה; timely; Iddo (or Iddi), the name of five Israelites; Iddo. Compare יִדּוֹ, יֶעְדִּי.
feminine of עֵד; testimony; testimony, witness.
from עָדָה in the sense of trappings; finery; generally an outfit; specifically, a headstall; [idiom] excellent, mouth, ornament.
from עֲדִי and אֵל; ornament of God; Adiel, the name of three Israelites; Adiel.
or עֲדָיָהוּ; from עָדָה and יָהּ; Jah has adorned; Adajah, the name of eight Israelites; Adaiah.
from עָדַן; voluptuous; given to pleasures.
the same as עָדִין; Adin, the name of two Israelites; Adin.
from עָדִין; effeminacy; Adina, an Israelite; Adina.
probably from עָדִין in the original sense of slender (i.e. a spear); his spear; Adino.
dual of a feminine of עַד; double prey; Adithajim, a place in Palestine; Adithaim.
probably from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Adlai, an Israelite; Adlai.
probably from the passive participle of the same as עַדְלַי; Adullam, a place in Palestine; Adullam.
patrial from עֲדֻלָּם; an Adullamite or native of Adullam; Adullamite.
a primitive root; to be soft or pleasant; figuratively and reflexively, to live voluptuously; delight self.
or עֲדֶנָּה; from עַד and הֵן; till now; yet.
from עָדַן; pleasure; Eden, a place in Mesopotamia; Eden.
or (feminine) עֶדְנָה; from עָדַן; pleasure; delicate, delight, pleasure. See also בֵּית עֵדֶן.
the same as עֵדֶן (masculine); Eden, the region of Adam's home; Eden.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of עֵד; a set time; technically, a year; time.
from עָדַן; pleasure; Adna, the name of two Israelites; Adna.
from עָדַן; pleasure; Adnah, the name of two Israelites; Adnah.
from עֵדָה; festival; Adadah, a place in Palestine; Adadah.
a primitive root; to be (causatively, have) redundant; be more, odd number, be (have) over (and above), overplus, remain.
a primitive root; to arrange as a battle, a vineyard (to hoe); hence, to muster and so to miss (or find wanting); dig, fail, keep (rank), lack.
from עֲדַר; an arrangement (i.e. drove); Eder, an Israelite; Ader.
from עֲדַר; an arrangement, i.e. muster (of animals); drove, flock, herd.
the same as עֵדֶר; Eder, the name of an Israelite and of two places in Palestine; Edar, Eder.
from עֵדֶר and אֵל; flock of God; Adriel, an Israelite; Adriel.
from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a lentil; lentile.
a primitive root; to be dense or dark, i.e. to becloud; cover with a cloud.
active participle of עָבַד; serving; Obed, the name of five Israelites; Obed.
of foreign derivation; Obal, a son of Joktan; Obal.
a primitive root; properly, to gyrate; but used only as a denominative from עֻגָּה,; to bake (round cakes on the hearth); bake.
probably from עוּג; round; Og, a king of Bashan; Og.
or עֻגָּב; from עֲגַב in the original sense of breathing; a reed-instrument of music; organ.

a primitive root; to duplicate or repeat; by implication, to protest, testify (as by reiteration); intensively, to encompass, restore (as a sort of reduplication); admonish, charge, earnestly, lift up, protest, call (take) to record, relieve, rob, solemnly, stand upright, testify, give warning, (bear, call to, give, take to) witness.

or עֹד; from עוּד; properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more; again, [idiom] all life long, at all, besides, but, else, further(-more), henceforth, (any) longer, (any) more(-over), [idiom] once, since, (be) still, when, (good, the) while (having being), (as, because, whether, while) yet (within).
(Aramaic) corresponding to עוֹד; {properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more}; while.
or עֹדֵד; from עוּד; reiteration; Oded, the name of two Israelites; Oded.
a primitive root; to crook, literally or figuratively; do amiss, bow down, make crooked, commit iniquity, pervert, (do) perverse(-ly), trouble, [idiom] turn, do wickedly, do wrong.
intensive from עָוָה abbreviated; overthrow; [idiom] overturn.
or עַוָּא; (2 Kings 17:24), for עַוָּה; Ivvah or Avva, a region of Assyria; Ava, Ivah.
a primitive root; to be strong; causatively, to stregthen, i.e. (figuratively) to save (by flight); gather (self, self to flee), retire.
patrial from עִוָּה; an Avvite or native of Avvah (only plural); Avims, Avites.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to עָוָה; perverseness; iniquity.
from עוּל; a babe; young child, little one.
from עֲוַל; perverse (morally); ungodly.
plural of עַוִּי; Avvim (as inhabited by Avvites), a place in Palestine (with the article prefix); Avim.
or perhaps (עַיּוֹת (as if plural of עַי) (עַיוּת; from עָוָה; ruin; Avvith (or Avvoth), a place in Palestine; Avith.
a primitive root; to suckle, i.e. give milk; milch, (ewe great) with young.
from עוּל; a babe; sucking child, infant.
a primitive root; to distort (morally); deal unjustly, unrighteous.
or עָוֶל; and (feminine) עַוְלָה; or עוֹלָה; or עֹלָה; from עֲוַל; (moral) evil; iniquity, perverseness, unjust(-ly), unrighteousness(-ly); wicked(-ness).
intensive from עֲוַל; evil (morally); unjust, unrighteous, wicked.
or עֹלָל; from עוּל; a suckling; babe, (young) child, infant, little one.

or עֹלָם; from עָלַם; properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always; alway(-s), ancient (time), any more, continuance, eternal, (for, (n-)) ever(-lasting, -more, of old), lasting, long (time), (of) old (time), perpetual, at any time, (beginning of the) world ([phrase] without end). Compare נֶצַח, עַד.
denominative from עַיִן; to watch (with jealosy); eye.
or עָווֹן; (2 Kings 7:9; Psalm 51:5 (אֲבַד)), from עָוָה; perversity, i.e. (moral) evil; fault, iniquity, mischeif, punishment (of iniquity), sin.
from an unused root apparently meaning to dwell together; sexual (cohabitation); duty of marriage.
from עָוָה; perversity; [idiom] perverse.

a primitive root; to cover (with wings or obscurity); hence (as denominative from עוֹף); to fly; also (by implication of dimness) to faint (from the darkness of swooning); brandish, be (wax) faint, flee away, fly (away), [idiom] set, shine forth, weary.
from עוּף; a bird (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively; bird, that flieth, flying, fowl.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עוֹף; {a bird (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively}; fowl.
or עֹפֶרֶת; feminine participle active of עָפַר; lead (from its dusty color); lead.
from עוֹף; birdlike; Ephai, an Israelite; Ephai (from margin).
a primitive root; to consult; take advice ((counsel) together).
apparently from עוּץ; consultation; Uts, a son of Aram, also a Seirite, and the regions settled by them.; Uz.
a primitive root; to pack; be pressed.
a primitive root (rather identical with through the idea of opening the eyes); to wake (literally or figuratively); (a-) wake(-n, up), lift up (self), [idiom] master, raise (up), stir up (self).
a primitive root; to (be) bare; be made naked.
(Aramaic); chaff (as the naked husk); chaff.
from עוּר; skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather; hide, leather, skin.
a primitive root (rather denominatively from עוֹר through the idea of a film over the eyes); to blind; blind, put out. See also עַיִר.
intensive from עָוַר; blind (literally or figuratively); blind (men, people).
and (feminine) עַוֶּרֶת; from עִוֵּר; blindness; blind(-ness).
a primitive root; to hasten; assemble self.
for עוּשׁ; to hasten, i.e. succor; speak in season.
a primitive root; to wrest; bow self, (make) crooked., falsifying, overthrow, deal perversely, pervert, subvert, turn upside down.
from עָוַת; oppression; wrong.
from עוּת; succoring; Uthai, the name of two Israelites; Uthai.
from עָזַז; strong, vehement, harsh; fierce, [phrase] greedy, mighty, power, roughly, strong.
from עָזַז; a she-goat (as strong), but masculine in plural (which also is used elliptically for goat's hair); (she) goat, kid.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עֵז; {a she-goat (as strong), but masculine in plural (which also is used elliptically for goat's hair)}; goat.
or (fully) עוֹז; from עָזַז; strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise); boldness, loud, might, power, strength, strong.
or עֻזָּה; feminine of עֹז; strength; Uzza or Uzzah, the name of five Israelites; Uzza, Uzzah.
from עֵז and אָזַל; goat of departure; the scapegoat; scapegoat.
a primitive root; to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.; commit self, fail, forsake, fortify, help, leave (destitute, off), refuse, [idiom] surely.
from עָזַב in the sense of letting go (for a price, i.e. selling); trade, i.e. the place (mart) or the payment (revenue); fair, ware.
from עַז and the root of בּוּקָה; stern depopulator; Azbuk, an Israelite; Azbuk.
from עַז and גָּד; stern troop; Azgad, an Israelite; Azgad.
feminine of עַז; strong; Azzah, a place in Palestine; Azzah, Gaza.
feminine passive participle of עָזַב; desertion (of inhabitants); forsaking.
the same as עֲזוּבָה; Azubah, the name of two Israelitesses; Azubah.
from עָזַז; forcibleness; might, strength.
from עָזַז; forcible; collectively and concretely, an army; power, strong.
or עַזֻּר; from עָזַר; helpful; Azzur, the name of three Israelites; Azur, Azzur.
a primitive root; to be stout (literally or figuratively); harden, impudent, prevail, strengthen (self), be strong.
from עָזַז; strong; Azaz, an Israelite; Azaz.
from עָזַז and יָהּ; Jah has strengthened; Azazjah, the name of three Israelites; Azaziah.
from עָזַז; forceful; Uzzi, the name of six Israelites; Uzzi.
perhaps for עֻזִּיָּה; Uzzija, an Israelite; Uzzia.
from עוּז and אֵל; strengthened of God; Aziel, an Israelite; Aziel. Compare יַעֲזִיאֵל.
from עֹז and אֵל; strength of God; Uzziel, the name of six Israelites; Uzziel.
patronymically from עֻזִּיאֵל; an Uzzielite (collectively) or descendants of Uzziel; Uzzielites.
or עֻזִּיָּהוּ; from עֹז and יָהּ; strength of Jah; Uzzijah, the name of five Israelites; Uzziah.
from עוּז; strengthfulness; Aziza, an Israelite; Aziza.
from עַז and מָוֶת; strong one of death; Azmaveth, the name of three Israelites and of a place in Palestine; Azmaveth. See also בֵּית עַזְמָוֶת.
from עַז; strong one; Azzan, an Israelite; Azzan.
probably feminine of עֹז; probably the sea-eagle (from its strength); ospray.
a primitive root; to grub over; fence about.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to עָזַק; a signet-ring (as engraved); signet.
from עָזַק; tilled; Azekah, a place in Palestine; Azekah.
a primitive root; to surround, i.e. protect or aid; help, succour.
from עָזַר; help; Ezer, the name of two Israelites; Ezer. Compare עֵזֶר.
from עָזַר; aid; help.
the same as עֵזֶר; Ezer, the name of four Israelites; Ezer. Compare עֶזֶר.
a variation of עֶזְרָה; Ezra, an Israelite; Ezra.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עֶזְרָא; Ezra, an Israelite; Ezra.
from עָזַר and אֵל; God has helped; Azarel, the name of five Israelites; Azarael, Azareel.
or עֶזְרָת; (Psalm 60:11 (13); Psalm 108:12 (13)), feminine of עֵזֶר; aid; help(-ed, -er).
the same as עֶזְרָה; Ezrah, an Israelite; Ezrah.
from עָזַר in its original meaning of surrounding; an inclosure; also a border; court, settle.
from עֵזֶר; helpful; Ezri, an Israelite; Ezri.
from עֵזֶר and אֵל; help of God; Azriel, the name of three Israelites; Azriel.
or עֲזַרְיָהוּ; from עָזַר and יָהּ; Jah has helped; Azarjah, the name of nineteen Israelites; Azariah.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עֲזַרְיָה; Azarjah, one of Daniel's companions; Azariah.
from עֵזֶר and active participle of קוּם; help of an enemy; Azrikam, the name of four Israelites; Azrikam.
patrial from עַזָּה; an Azzathite or inhabitant of Azzah; Gazathite, Gazite.
from עִיט (contracted) in the sense of swooping, i.e. side-long stroke; a stylus or marking stick; pen.
(Aramaic) from יְעַט; prudence; counsel.
a primitive root; to wrap, i.e. cover, veil, cloth, or roll; array self, be clad, (put a) cover (-ing, self), fill, put on, [idiom] surely, turn aside.
from an unused root meaning apparently to contain; a receptacle (for milk, i.e. pail; figuratively, breast); breast.
lemma עֵטִישָׁה first vowel, corrected to עֲטִישָׁה; from an unused root meaning to sneeze; sneezing; sneezing.
of uncertain derivation; a bat; bat.
a primitive root; to shroud, i.e. clothe (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of darkness) to languish; cover (over), fail, faint, feebler, hide self, be overwhelmed, swoon.
a primitive root; to encircle (for attack or protection); especially to crown (literally or figuratively); compass, crown.
from עָטַר; a crown; crown.
the same as עֲטָרָה; Atarah, an Israelitess; Atarah.
