or עֲטָרֹת; plural of עֲטָרָה; Ataroth, the name (thus simply) of two places in Palestine; Ataroth.
from the same as עֲטָרוֹת and אַדָּר; crowns of Addar; Atroth-Addar, a place in Palestine; Ataroth-adar(-addar).
from the same as עֲטָרוֹת and בַּיִת and יוֹאָב; crowns of the house of Joab; Atroth-beth-Joab, a place in Palestine; Ataroth the house of Joab.
from the same as עֲטָרוֹת and a name otherwise unused (being from the same as שָׂפַן) meaning hidden; crowns of Shophan; Atroth-Shophan, a place in Palestine; Atroth, Shophan (as if two places).
from עָוָה; a ruin (as if overturned); heap.
or (feminine) עַיָּא; (Nehemiah 11:31), or עַיָּת; (Isaiah 10:28), for עִי; Ai, Aja or Ajath, a place in Palestine; Ai, Aija, Aijath, Hai.
perhaps from an unused root probably meaning to be bald; bare; Ebal, a mountain of Palestine; Ebal.
from עִי; ruin; Ijon, a place in Palestine; Ijon.
a primitive root; to swoop down upon (literally or figuratively); fly, rail.
from עִיט; a hawk or other bird of prey; bird, fowl, ravenous (bird).
from עַיִט; hawk-ground; Etam, a place in Palestine; Etam.
from the plural of עִי and the plural of the active participle of עָבַר with the article interposed; ruins of the passers; Ije-ha-Abarim, a place near Palestine; Ije-abarim.
plural of עִי; ruins; Ijim, a place in the Desert.; Iim.

for עוֹלָם; {concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always}; ever.
from עָלָה; elevated; Ilai, an Israelite; Ilai.
or עוֹלָם; (Ezra 10:2; Jeremiah 49:36), probably from עָלַם; hidden, i.e. distant; Elam, a son of Shem and his descendants, with their country; also of six Israelites; Elam.
of doubtful origin and authenticity; probably meaning strength; mighty.

probably a primitive word; an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape); affliction, outward appearance, [phrase] before, [phrase] think best, colour, conceit, [phrase] be content, countenance, [phrase] displease, eye((-brow), (-d), -sight), face, [phrase] favour, fountain, furrow (from the margin), [idiom] him, [phrase] humble, knowledge, look, ([phrase] well), [idiom] me, open(-ly), [phrase] (not) please, presence, [phrase] regard, resemblance, sight, [idiom] thee, [idiom] them, [phrase] think, [idiom] us, well, [idiom] you(-rselves).
(Aramaic) corresponding to עַיִן; an eye; eye.
the same as עַיִן; fountain; Ajin, the name (thus simply) of two places in Palestine; Ain.
from עַיִן and גְּדִי; fountain of a kid; En-Gedi, a place in Palestine; En-gedi.
from עַיִן and the plural of גַּן; fountain of gardens; En-Gannim, a place in Palestine; En-gannim.
lemma עֵין־דּאֹר second vowel, corrected to עֵין־דֹּאר; or עֵין דּוֹר; or עֵין־דֹּר; from עַיִן and דּוֹר; fountain of dwelling; En-Dor, a place in Palestine; En-dor.
from עַיִן and the active participle of קָרָא; fountain of One calling; En-hak-Kore, a place near Palestine; En-hakhore.
from עַיִן and the feminine of a derivative from חָדַד; fountain of sharpness; En-Chaddah, a place in Palestine; En-haddah.
from עַיִן and the same as חָצוֹר; fountain of a village; En-Chatsor, a place in Palestine; En-hazor.
from עַיִן and a derivative of חָרַד; fountain of trembling; En-Charod, a place in Palestine; well of Harod.
or עֵינָם; dual of עַיִן; double fountain; Enajim or Enam, a place in Palestine; Enaim, openly (Genesis 38:21).
from עַיִן and מִשְׁפָּט; fountain of judgment; En-Mishpat, a place near Palestine; En-mishpat.
from עַיִן; having eyes; Enan, an Israelite; Enan. Compare חֲצַר עֵינָן.
עַיִן and the dual of עֵגֶל; fountain of two calves; En-Eglajim, a place in Palestine; En-eglaim.
from עַיִן and the active participle of רָגַל; fountain of a traveller; En-Rogel, a place near Jerusalem; En-rogel.
from עַיִן and רִמּוֹן; fountain of a pomegranate; En-Rimmon, a place in Palestine; En-rimmon.
from עַיִן and שֶׁמֶשׁ; fountain of the sun; En-Shemesh, a place in Palestine; Enshemesh.
from עַיִן and the plural of תַּן; fountain of jackals; En-Tannim, a pool near Jerusalem; dragon well.
from עַיִן and תַּפּוּחַ; fountain of an apple-tree; En-Tappuach, a place in Palestine; En-tappuah.
a primitive root; to languish; be wearied.
from עָיֵף; languid; faint, thirsty, weary.
feminine from עוּף; obscurity (as if from covering); darkness.
the same as עֵיפָה; Ephah, the name of a son of Midian, and of the region settled by him; also of an Israelite and of an Israelitess; Ephah.

or (in the plural) עָר; or עָיַר; (Judges 10:4), from עוּר; a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post); Ai (from margin), city, court (from margin), town.
the same as עִיר; Ir, an Israelite; Ir.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to עוּר; a watcher, i.e. an angel (as guardian); watcher.
from עוּר in the sense of raising (i.e. bearing a burden); properly, a young ass (as just broken to a load); hence an ass-colt; (ass) colt, foal, young ass.
from עוּר; wakefulness; Ira, the name of three Israelites; Ira.
from the same as עֲרָד; fugitive; Irad, an antediluvian; Irad.
from עִיר and מֶלַח with the article of substance interp.; city of (the) salt; Irham-Melach, a place near Palestine; the city of salt.
from עִיר and the plural of תָּמָר with the article interpolated; city of the palmtrees; Ir-hat-Temarim, a place in Palestine; the city of palmtrees.
from עִיר; a citizen; Iru, an Israelite; Iru.
from עִיר; urbane; Iri, an Israelite; Iri.
from עִיר; city-wise; Iram, an Idumaean; Iram.
or עֵרֹם; from עָרַם; nudity; naked(-ness).
from עִיר and נָחָשׁ; city of a serpent; Ir-Nachash, a place in Palestine; Irnahash.
from עִיר and שֶׁמֶשׁ; city of the sun; Ir-Shemesh, a place in Palestine; Irshemesh.
or עָשׁ; from עוּשׁ; the constellation of the Great Bear (perhaps from its migration through the heavens); Arcturus.
probably for עַכְבָּר; Akbor, the name of an Idumaean and of two Israelites; Achbor.
probably from an unused root in the literal sense of entangling; a spider (as weaving a network); spider.
probably from the same as עַכָּבִישׁ in the secondary sense of attacking; a mouse (as nibbling); mouse.
apparently from an unused root meaning to hem in; Akko (from its situation on a bay); Accho.
from עָכַר; troubled; Akor, the name of a place in Palestine; Achor.
from an unused root meaning to trouble; troublesome; Akan, an Israelite; Achan. Compare עָכָר.
a primitive root; properly, to tie, specifically, with fetters; but used only as denominative from עֶכֶס; to put on anklets; make a tinkling ornament.
from עָכַס; a fetter; hence, an anklet; stocks, tinkling ornament.
feminine of עֶכֶס; anklet; Aksah, an Israelitess; Achsah.
a primitive root; properly, to roil water; figuratively, to disturb or affict; trouble, stir.
from עָכַר; troublesome; Akar, an Israelite; Achar. Compare עָכָן.
from עָכַר; muddler; Okran, an Israelite; Ocran.
probably from an unused root meaning to coil; an asp (from lurking coiled up); adder.
from עָלָה; properly, the top; specifically, the highest (i.e. God); also (adverb) aloft, to Jehovah; above, high, most High.

properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, [idiom] as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, [idiom] both and, by (reason of), [idiom] had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, [idiom] with.

(Aramaic) corresponding to עַל; {above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications}; about, against, concerning, for, (there-) fore, from, in, [idiom] more, of, (there-, up-) on, (in-) to, [phrase] why with.
or עוֹל; from עָלַל; a yoke (as imposed on the neck), literally or figuratively; yoke.
(Aramaic) from עַל; above; over.
feminine of עֹל; burden; Ulla, an Israelite; Ulla.
from an unused root meaning to stutter; stuttering; stammerer.

a primitive root; to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative; arise (up), (cause to) ascend up, at once, break (the day) (up), bring (up), (cause to) burn, carry up, cast up, [phrase] shew, climb (up), (cause to, make to) come (up), cut off, dawn, depart, exalt, excel, fall, fetch up, get up, (make to) go (away, up); grow (over) increase, lay, leap, levy, lift (self) up, light, (make) up, [idiom] mention, mount up, offer, make to pay, [phrase] perfect, prefer, put (on), raise, recover, restore, (make to) rise (up), scale, set (up), shoot forth (up), (begin to) spring (up), stir up, take away (up), work.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עֹלָה; a holocaust; burnt offering.
from עָלָה; a leaf (as coming up on a tree); collectively, foliage; branch, leaf.

or עוֹלָה; feminine active participle of עָלָה; a step or (collectively, stairs, as ascending); usually a holocaust (as going up in smoke); ascent, burnt offering (sacrifice), go up to. See also עֶוֶל.
(Aramaic) feminine from a root corresponding to עָלָה; a pretext (as arising artificially); occasion.
for עֶוֶל; moral perverseness; iniquity.
or עַליָה; the same as עַלְוָה; Alvah or Aljah, an Idumaean; Aliah, Alvah.
passive participle of עָלַם in the denominative sense of עֶלֶם; (only in plural as abstract) adolescence; figuratively, vigor; youth.
or עַלְיָן; from עָלָה; lofty; Alvan or Aljan, an Idumaean; Alian, Alvan.
feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to suck; the leech; horse-leech.
a primitive root; to jump for joy, i.e. exult; be joyful, rejoice, triumph.
from עָלַז; exultant; that rejoiceth.
feminine from an unused root meaning to cover; dusk; dark, twilight.
from עָלָה; a pestle (as lifted); pestle.
from עָלָה; lofty; Eli, an Israelite highpriest; Eli.
from עָלָה; high; i.e. comparative; upper.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עִלִּי; supreme (i.e. God); (most) high.
feminine from עָלָה; something lofty, i.e. a stair-way; also a second-story room (or even one on the roof); figuratively, the sky; ascent, (upper) chamber, going up, loft, parlour.
from עָלָה; an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme; (Most, on) high(-er, -est), upper(-most).
(Aramaic) corresponding to עֶלְיוֹן; the Supreme; Most high.
from עָלַז; exultant; joyous, (that) rejoice(-ing)
from עָלַל in the sense of completing; probably a crucible (as working over the metal); furnace.

or עֲלִלָה; from עָלַל in the sense of effecting; an exploit (of God), or a performance (of man, often in a bad sense); by implication, an opportunity; act(-ion), deed, doing, invention, occasion, work.
for עֲלִילָה; (miraculous) execution; work.
from עָלַץ; exultation; rejoicing.
from עָלָה; a second-story room; chamber. Compare עֲלִיָּה.

a primitive root; to effect thoroughly; specifically, to glean (also figuratively); by implication (in a bad sense) to overdo, i.e. maltreat, be saucy to, pain, impose (also literal); abuse, affect, [idiom] child, defile, do, glean, mock, practise, thoroughly, work (wonderfully).
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָלַל (in the sense of thrusting oneself in),; to enter; causatively, to introduce; bring in, come in, go in.
feminine active participle of עָלַל; only in plural gleanings; by extension gleaning-time; (gleaning) (of the) grapes, grapegleanings.
a primitive root; to veil from sight, i.e. conceal (literally or figuratively); [idiom] any ways, blind, dissembler, hide (self), secret (thing).
(Aramaic) corresponding to עוֹלָם; remote time, i.e. the future or past indefinitely; often adverb, forever; for (n-)ever (lasting), old.
from עָלַם; (compare עַלְמָה); properly, something kept out of sight, i.e. a lad; young man, stripling.
feminine of עֶלֶם; a lass (as veiled or private); damsel, maid, virgin.
from עָלַם; hidden; See also עַלְמֹן דִּבְלָתָיְמָה.; Almon, a place in Palestine;
plural of עַלְמָה; properly, girls, i.e. the soprano or female voice, perhaps falsetto; Alamoth.
(Aramaic) patrial from a name corresponding to עֵילָם contracted; an Elamite or inhabitant of Elam; Elamite.
from the same as עַלְמוֹן and the dual of הֻיְּדָה (compare בֵּית דִּבְלָתַיִם) with enclitic of direction; Almon towards Diblathajim; Almon-Diblathajemah, a place in Moab; Almondilathaim.
from עָלַם; a covering; Alemeth, the name of a place in Palestine and of two Israelites; Alameth, Alemeth.
a primitive root; to leap for joy, i.e. exult, wave joyously; [idiom] peacock, rejoice, solace self.
a primitive root; to sip up; suck up.
(Aramaic) corresponding to צֵלָע; a rib; rib.
a primitive root; to veil or cover; figuratively, to be languid; faint, overlaid, wrap self.
from עָלַף; an envelope, i.e. (figuratively) mourning; fainted.
a primitive root; to jump for joy, i.e. exult; be joyful, rejoice, triumph.
from עָמַם; a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock; folk, men, nation, people.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עַם; {a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock}; people.

from עָמַם; adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English); accompanying, against, and, as ([idiom] long as), before, beside, by (reason of), for all, from (among, between), in, like, more than, of, (un-) to, with(-al).

(Aramaic) corresponding to עִם; {adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)}; by, from, like, to(-ward), with.

a primitive root; to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive); abide (behind), appoint, arise, cease, confirm, continue, dwell, be employed, endure, establish, leave, make, ordain, be (over), place, (be) present (self), raise up, remain, repair, [phrase] serve, set (forth, over, -tle, up), (make to, make to be at a, with-) stand (by, fast, firm, still, up), (be at a) stay (up), tarry.
for מָעַד; to shake; be at a stand.
from עָמַד; a spot (as being fixed); place, ([phrase] where) stood, upright.
prolonged for עִם; along with; against, by, from, [phrase] me, [phrase] mine, of, [phrase] that I take, unto, upon, with(-in.)
from עָמַד; a station, i.e. domicile; standing.
from עָמַם; conjunction, i.e. society; mostly adverb or preposition (with prepositional prefix), near, beside, along with; (over) against, at, beside, hard by, in points.
the same as עֻמָּה; association; Ummah, a place in Palestine; Ummah.
or עַמֻּד; from עָמַד; a column (as standing); also a stand, i.e. platform; [idiom] apiece, pillar.
from עַם; tribal, i.e. inbred; Ammon, a son of Lot; also his posterity and their country; Ammon, Ammonites.
patronymically from עַמּוֹן; an Ammonite or (the adjective) Ammonitish; Ammonite(-s).
feminine of עַמּוֹנִי; an Ammonitess; Ammonite(-ss).
from עָמַס; burdensome; Amos, an Israelite prophet; Amos.
from עָמַק; deep; Amok, an Israelite; Amok.
from עַם and אֵל; people of God; Ammiel, the name of three or four Israelites; Ammiel.
from עַם and הוֹד; people of splendor; Ammihud, the name of three Israelites; Ammihud.
from עַם and זָבַד; people of endowment; Ammizabad, an Israelite; Ammizabad.
from עַם and חוּר; people of nobility; Ammichur, a Syrian prince; Ammihud (from the margin).
from עַם and נָדַב; people of liberality; Amminadab, the name of four Israelites; Amminadab.
from עַם and נָדִיב; my people (is) liberal; Ammi-Nadib, probably an Israelite; Amminadib.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָמֵק; profound, i.e. unsearchable; deep.
from עָמַר; a bunch of grain; handful, sheaf.
from עַם and שַׁדַּי; people of (the) Almighty; Ammishaddai, an Israelite; Ammishaddai.
from a primitive root meaning to associate; companionship; hence (concretely) a comrade or kindred man; another, fellow, neighbour.
a primitive root; to toil, i.e. work severely and with irksomeness; (take) labour (in).

from עָמַל; toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind; grievance(-vousness), iniquity, labour, mischief, miserable(-sery), pain(-ful), perverseness, sorrow, toil, travail, trouble, wearisome, wickedness.
the same as עָמָל; Amal, an Israelite; Amal.
from עָמַל; toiling; concretely, a laborer; figuratively, sorrowful; that laboureth, that is a misery, had taken (labour), wicked, workman.
probably of foreign origin; Amalek, a descendant of Esau; also his posterity and their country; Amalek.
patronymically from עֲמָלֵק; an Amalekite (or collectively the Amalekites) or descendants of Amalek; Amalekite(-s).
a primitive root; to associate; by implication, to overshadow (by huddling together); become dim, hide.
from עִם and with a pronominal suffix inserted; with us (is) God; Immanuel, a type name of Isaiah's son; Immanuel.
or עָמַשׂ; a primitive root; to load, i.e. impose aburden (or figuratively, infliction); be borne, (heavy) burden (self), lade, load, put.
from עָמַס and יָהּ; Jah has loaded; Amasjah, an Israelite; Amasiah.
from עַם and עַד; people of time; Amad, a place in Palestine; Amad.
a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) deep (literally or figuratively); (be, have, make, seek) deep(-ly), depth, be profound.
from עָמַק; a vale (i.e. broad depression); dale, vale, valley (often used as a part of proper names). See also בֵּית הָעֵמֶק.
from עָמַק; depth; depth.
from עָמַק; deep (literally or figuratively); deeper, depth, strange.
from עָמַק; deep (literally or figuratively); ([idiom] exceeding) deep (thing).
a primitive root; properly, apparently to heap; figuratively, to chastise (as if piling blows); specifically (as denominative from עֹמֶר); to gather grain; bind sheaves, make merchandise of.
(Aramaic) corresponding to צֶמֶר; wool; wool.
from עָמַר; properly, a heap, i.e. a sheaf; also an omer, as a dry measure; omer, sheaf.
from עָמַר; a (ruined) heap; Amorah, a place in Palestine; Gomorrah.
from עָמַר; heaping; Omri, an Israelite; Omri.
probably from עַם and רוּם; high people; Amram, the name of two Israelites; Amram.
from עַמְרָם; an Amramite or descendant of Amram; Amramite.
from עָמַס; burden; Amasa, the name of two Israelites; Amasa.
from עָמַס; burdensome; Amasai, the name of three Israelites; Amasai.
probably from עָמַס; burdensome; Amashsay, an Israelite; Amashai.
from the same as עֵנָב; fruit; Anab, a place in Palestine; Anab.
from an unused root probably meaning to bear fruit; a grape; (ripe) grape, wine.
a primitive root; to be soft or pliable, i.e. (figuratively) effeminate or luxurious; delicate(-ness), (have) delight (self), sport self.
from עָנַג; luxury; delight, pleasant.
from עָנַג; luxurious; delicate.
a primitive root; to lace fast; bind, tie.

a primitive root; properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce; give account, afflict (by mistake for עָנָה), (cause to, give) answer, bring low (by mistake for עָנָה), cry, hear, Leannoth, lift up, say, [idiom] scholar, (give a) shout, sing (together by course), speak, testify, utter, (bear) witness. See also בֵּית עֲנוֹת, בֵּית עֲנָת.

a primitive root (possibly rather identical with עָנָה through the idea of looking down or browbeating); to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows); abase self, afflict(-ion, self), answer (by mistake for עָנָה), chasten self, deal hardly with, defile, exercise, force, gentleness, humble (self), hurt, ravish, sing (by mistake for עָנָה), speak (by mistake for עָנָה), submit self, weaken, [idiom] in any wise.

(Aramaic) corresponding to עָנָה; {properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce}; answer, speak.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָנָה; {to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows)}; poor.
probably from עָנָה; an answer; Anah, the name of two Edomites and one Edomitess; Anah.
or (by intermixture with עָנִי) עָנָיו; from עָנָה; depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly); humble, lowly, meek, poor. Compare עָנִי.
passive participle from the same as עֵנָב; borne (as fruit); Anub, an Israelite; Anub.
feminine of עָנָו; mildness (royal); also (concretely) oppressed; gentleness, meekness.
from עָנָו; condescension, human and subjective (modesty), or divine and objective (clemency); gentleness, humility, meekness.
from עָנָה; affliction; affliction.
from עָנָה; depression, i.e. misery; afflicted(-ion), trouble.

from עָנָה; (practically the same as עָנָו, although the margin constantly disputes this, making עָנָו subjective and objective); depressed, in mind or circumstances; afflicted, humble, lowly, needy, poor.
from עָנָה; afflicted; Unni, the name of two Israelites; Unni.
from עָנָה; Jah has answered; Anajah, the name of two Israelites; Anaiah.
for plural of עַיִן; fountains; Anim, a place in Palestine; Anim.
from עָנָה; ado, i.e. (generally) employment or (specifically) an affair; business, travail.
from the dual of עַיִן; two fountains; Anem, a place in Palestine; Anem.
xlit ʻĂnâmîm corrected to ʻĂnâmîym; as if plural of some Egyptian word; Anamim, a son of Mizraim and his descendants, with their country; Anamim.
of foreign origin; Anammelek, an Assyrian deity; Anammelech.

a primitive root; to cover; used only as a denominative from עָנָן, to cloud over; figuratively, to act covertly, i.e. practise magic; [idiom] bring, enchanter, Meonemin, observe(-r of) times, soothsayer, sorcerer.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָנָן; {a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud}; cloud.
from עָנַן; a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud; cloud(-y).
the same as עָנָן; cloud; Anan, an Israelite; Anan.
feminine of עָנָן; cloudiness; cloud.
from עָנָן; cloudy; Anani, an Israelite; Anani.
from עָנַן and יָהּ; Jah has covered; Ananjah, the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine; Ananiah.
(Aramaic) or עֶנֶף; (Aramaic), corresponding to עָנָף; {a twig (as covering the limbs)}; bough, branch.
from an unused root meaning to cover; a twig (as covering the limbs); bough, branch.
from the same as עָנָף; branching; full of branches.

a primitive root; properly, to choke; used only as denominative from עָנָק,; to collar, i.e. adorn with anecklace; figuratively, to fit out with supplies; compass about as a chain, furnish, liberally.
from עָנַק; a necklace (as if strangling); chain.
the same as עָנָק; Anak, a Canaanite; Anak.
patronymically from עָנָק; an Anakite or descendant of Anak; Anakim.
probably for נַעַר; Aner, a Amorite, also a place in Palestine; Aner.
a primitive root; properly, to urge; by implication, to inflict apenalty, specifically, to fine; amerce, condemn, punish, [idiom] surely.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עֹנֶשׁ; a mulct; confiscation.
from עָנַשׁ; a fine; punishment, tribute.
from עָנָה; answer; Anath, an Israelite; Anath.
plural of עֲנָת; Anathoth, the name of two Israelites, also of a place in Pal; Anathoth.
or עַנְּתוֹתִי; patrial from עֲנָתוֹת; a Antothite or inhabitant of Anathoth; of Anathoth, Anethothite, Anetothite, Antothite.
from the same as עֲנָתוֹת and יָהּ; answers of Jah; Anthothijah, an Israelite; Antothijah.
from עָסַס; must or fresh grape-juice (as just trodden out); juice, new (sweet) wine.
a primitive root; to squeeze out juice; figuratively, to trample; tread down.
from an unused root meaning to cover; a bough (as covering the tree); branch.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עֳפֶא; a twig; bough, i.e. (collectively) foliage; leaves.
a primitive root; to swell; figuratively, be elated; be lifted up, presume.
from עָפַל; a tumor; also a mound, i.e. fortress; emerod, fort, strong hold, tower.
the same as עֹפֶל; Ophel, a ridge in Jerusalem; Ophel.
from an unused noun (denoting a place in Palestine; from an unused root of uncertain meaning); an Ophnite (collectively) or inhabitants of Ophen; Ophni.
from עוּף; an eyelash (as fluttering); figuratively, morning ray; dawning, eye-lid.
; a primitive root; meaning either to be gray or perhaps rather to pulverize; used only as denominative from עָפָר,; to be dust; cast (dust).
probably a variation of עֹפֶר; gazelle; Epher, the name of an Arabian and of two Israelites; Epher.
from עָפַר; a fawn (from the dusty color); young roe (hart).
from עָפַר; dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud; ashes, dust, earth, ground, morter, powder, rubbish.
feminine of עֹפֶר; female fawn; Ophrah, the name of an Israelite and of two places in Palestine; Ophrah.
from the same as עֵפֶר; fawn-like; Ephron, the name of a Canaanite and of two places in Palestine; Ephron, Ephrain (from the margin).
from עָצָה; a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks); [phrase] carpenter, gallows, helve, [phrase] pine, plank, staff, stalk, stick, stock, timber, tree, wood.
a primitive root; properly, to carve, i.e. fabricate or fashion; hence (in a bad sense) to worry, pain or anger; displease, grieve, hurt, make, be sorry, vex, worship, wrest.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָצַב; to afflict; lamentable.
from עָצַב; an earthen vessel; usually (painful) toil; also a pang (whether of body or mind); grievous, idol, labor, sorrow.
a variation of עֶצֶב; an idol (as fashioned); also pain (bodily or mental); idol, sorrow, [idiom] wicked.
from עָצַב; an (idolatrous) image; idol, image.
from עָצַב; a (hired) workman; labour.
from עָצַב; worrisomeness, i.e. labor or pain; sorrow, toil.
from עָצַב; a idol; also, a pain or wound; sorrow, wound.
a primitive root; properly, to fasten (or make firm), i.e. to close (the eyes); shut.
from עָצָה; the spine (as giving firmness to the body); backbone.
feminine of עֵץ; timber; trees.
from יָעַץ; advice; by implication, plan; also prudence; advice, advisement, counsel(l-(or)), purpose.
or עָצֻם; passive participle of עָצַם; powerful (specifically, a paw); by implication, numerous; [phrase] feeble, great, mighty, must, strong.
from עָצֶה and גֶּבֶר; backbone-like of a man; Etsjon-Geber, a place on the Red Sea; Ezion-geber.
a primitive root; to lean idly, i.e. to be indolent or slack; be slothful.
from עָצַל; indolent; slothful, sluggard.
feminine of עָצֵל; (as abstractly) indolence; slothfulness.
from עָצַל; indolence; idleness.

a primitive root; also denominatively (from עֶצֶם); to bind fast, i.e. close (the eyes); intransitively, to be (causatively, make) powerful or numerous; to crunch the bones; break the bones, close, be great, be increased, be (wax) mighty(-ier), be more, shut, be(-come, make) strong(-er).
from עָצַם; a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame; body, bone, [idiom] life, (self-) same, strength, [idiom] very.
the same as עֶצֶם; bone; Etsem, a place in Palestine; Azem, Ezem.
from עָצַם; power; hence, body; might, strong, substance.
feminine of עֹצֶם; powerfulness; by extension, numerousness; abundance, strength.
feminine of עָצוּם; a bulwark, i.e. (figuratively) argument; strong.
or עַצְמֹן; from עֶצֶם; bone-like; Atsmon, a place near Palestine; Azmon.
from an unused root meaning to be sharp or strong; a spear; Eznite (from the margin).

a primitive root; to inclose; by analogy, to hold back; also to maintain, rule, assemble; [idiom] be able, close up, detain, fast, keep (self close, still), prevail, recover, refrain, [idiom] reign, restrain, retain, shut (up), slack, stay, stop, withhold (self).
from עָצָר; restraint; [phrase] magistrate.
from עָצָר; closure; also constraint; [idiom] barren, oppression, [idiom] prison.
or עֲצֶרֶת; from עָצָר; an assembly, especially on afestival or holiday; (solemn) assembly (meeting).

a primitive root; properly, to swell out or up; used only as denominative from עָקֵב,; to seize by the heel; figuratively, to circumvent (as if tripping up the heels); also to restrain (as if holding by the heel); take by the heel, stay, supplant, [idiom] utterly.

from עָקַב in the sense of עָקֵב; a heel, i.e. (figuratively) the last of anything (used adverbially, for ever); also result, i.e. compensation; and so (adverb with preposition or relatively) on account of; [idiom] because, by, end, for, if, reward.
or (feminine) עִקְּבָה; from עָקַב; a heel (as protuberant); hence, a track; figuratively, the rear (of an army); heel, (horse-) hoof, last, lier in wait (by mistake for עָקֵב), (foot-) step.
from עָקַב in its denominative sense; a lier in wait; heel (by mistake for עָקֵב).
from עָקַב; in the original sense, a knoll (as swelling up); in the denominative sense; (transitive) fraudulent or (intransitive) tracked; crooked, deceitful, polluted.
feminine of an unused form from עָקַב meaning a trick; trickery; subtilty.
a primitive root; to tie with thongs; bind.
from עָקַד; striped (with bands); ring straked.
from עוּק; constraint; oppression.
from עָקַב; insidious; Akkub, the name of five Israelites; Akkub.
a primitive root; to wrest; wrong.
from עָקַל; winding; by(-way), crooked way.
from עָקַל; tortuous; crooked.
from an unused root meaning to twist; tortuous; Akan, an Idummaean; Akan. Compare יַעֲקָן.
a primitive root; to pluck up (especially by the roots); specifically, to hamstring; figuratively, to exterminate; dig down, hough, pluck up, root up.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָקַר; {to pluck up (especially by the roots); specifically, to hamstring; figuratively, to exterminate}; pluck up by the roots.
from עָקַר; figuratively, a transplanted person, i.e. naturalized citizen; stock.
the same as עֵקֶר; Eker, an Israelite; Eker.
from עָקַר; sterile (as if extirpated in the generative organs); ([idiom] male or female) barren (woman).
(Aramaic) from עֲקַר; a stock; stump.
of uncertain derivation; a scorpion; figuratively, a scourge or knotted whip; scorpion.
from עָקַר; eradication; Ekron, a place in Palestine; Ekron.
or עֶקְרֹנִי; patrial from עֶקְרוֹן; an Ekronite or inhabitant of Ekron; Ekronite.
a primitive root; to knot or distort; figuratively, to pervert (act or declare perverse); make crooked, (prove, that is) perverse(-rt).
from עָקַשׁ; distorted; hence, false; crooked, froward, perverse.
the same as עִקֵּשׁ; perverse; Ikkesh, an Israelite; Ikkesh.
from עִקֵּשׁ; perversity; [idiom] froward.
the same as עִיר; a city; Ar, a place in Moab; Ar.
from עוּר; a foe (as watchful for mischief); enemy.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָר; {a foe (as watchful for mischief)}; enemy.
from עוּר; watchful; Er, the name of two Israelites; Er.

a primitive root; to braid, i.e. intermix; technically, to traffic (as if by barter); also or give to be security (as a kind of exchange); engage, (inter-) meddle (with), mingle (self), mortgage, occupy, give pledges, be(-come, put in) surety, undertake.
a primitive root (rather identical with עָרַב through the idea of close association); to be agreeable; be pleasant(-ing), take pleasure in, be sweet.
a primitive root (rather identical with עָרַב through the idea of covering with a texture); to grow dusky at sundown; be darkened, (toward) evening.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָרַב; to commingle; mingle (self), mix.
or עֲרַב; from עָרַב in the figurative sense of sterility; Arab (i.e. Arabia), a country East of Palestine; Arabia.
from עָרַב; dusk; [phrase] day, even(-ing, tide), night.
or עֶרֶב; (1 Kings 10:15), (with the article [prefix), from עָרַב; the web (or transverse threads of cloth); also a mixture, (or mongrel race); Arabia, mingled people, mixed (multitude), woof.
from עָרַב; a willow (from the use of osiers as wattles); willow.
from עָרֵב; pleasant; sweet.
from עָרַב; a mosquito (from its swarming); divers sorts of flies, swarm.
or עוֹרֵב; from עָרַב; a raven (from its dusky hue); raven.
or עוֹרֵב; the same as עֹרֵב; Oreb, the name of a Midianite and of the cliff near the Jordan; Oreb.

from עָרַב (in the sense of sterility); a desert; especially (with the article prefix) the (generally) sterile valley of the Jordan and its continuation to the Red Sea; Arabah, champaign, desert, evening, heaven, plain, wilderness. See also בֵּית הָעֲרָבָה.
feminine passive participle of עֲנַמֶּלֶךְ in the sense of a bargain or exchange; something given as security, i.e. (literally) a token (of safety) or (metaphorically) a bondsman; pledge, surety.
from עָרַב (in the sense of exchange); a pawn (given as security); pledge.
or עַרְבִי; patrial from עֲרָב; an Arabian or inhabitant of Arab (i.e. Arabia); Arabian.
patrial from בֵּית הָעֲרָבָה; an Arbathite or inhabitant of (Beth-) Arabah; Arbahite.
a primitive root; to long for; cry, pant.
from an unused root meaning to sequester itself; fugitive; Arad, the name of a place near Palestine, also of a Canaanite and an Israelite; Arad.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָרוֹד; an onager; wild ass.
a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) bare; hence, to empty, pour out, demolish; leave destitute, discover, empty, make naked, pour (out), rase, spread self, uncover.
feminine from עָרָה; a naked (i.e. level) plot; paper reed.
or עֲרֻגָה; feminine passive participle of עָרַג; something piled up (as if (figuratively) raised by mental aspiration), i.e. a paterre; bed, furrow.
from the same as עֲרָד; an onager (from his lonesome habits); wild ass.
from עָרָה; nudity, literally (especially the pudenda) or figuratively (disgrace, blemish); nakedness, shame, unclean(-ness).
(Aramaic) corresponding to עֶרְוָה; nakedness, i.e. (figuratively) impoverishment; dishonor.
or עָרֹם; from עָרַם (in its original sense); nude, either partially or totally; naked.
passive participle of עָרַם; cunning (usually in a bad sense); crafty, prudent, subtil.
or עַרְעָר; from עָרַר reduplicated; a juniper (from its nudity of situation); health.
or עֲרֹעֵר; or עַרְעוֹר; the same as עֲרוֹעֵר; nudity of situation; Aroer, the name of three places in or near Palestine; Aroer.
passive participle of עָרַץ; feared, i.e. (concretely) a horrible place or chasm; cliffs.
from עוּר; watchful; Eri, an Israelite; Eri.
patronymically of עֵרִי; a Erite (collectively) or descendants of Eri; Erites.
for עֶרְוָה; nudity; bare, naked, [idiom] quite.
from an unused root meaning to comminute; meal; dough.
from עָרַף; the sky (as dropping at the horizon); heaven.
from עָרַץ; fearful, i.e. powerful or tyrannical; mighty, oppressor, in great power, strong, terrible, violent.
from עָרַר; bare, i.e. destitute (of children); childless.

a primitive root; to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications); put (set) (the battle, self) in array, compare, direct, equal, esteem, estimate, expert (in war), furnish, handle, join (battle), ordain, (lay, put, reckon up, set) (in) order, prepare, tax, value.
from עָרַךְ; a pile, equipment, estimate; equal, estimation, (things that are set in) order, price, proportion, [idiom] set at, suit, taxation, [idiom] valuest.

a primitive root; properly, to strip; but used as denominative from עָרֵל; to expose or remove the prepuce, whether literal (to go naked) or figurative (to refrain from using); count uncircumcised, foreskin to be uncovered.
from עָרֵל; properly, exposed, i.e. projecting loose (as to the prepuce); used only technically,; uncircumcised (i.e. still having the prepuce uncurtailed); uncircumcised (person).
feminine of עָרֵל; the prepuce; foreskin, [phrase] uncircumcised.

a primitive root; properly, to be (or make) bare; but used only in the derivative sense (through the idea perhaps of smoothness) to be cunning (usually in a bad sense); [idiom] very, beware, take crafty (counsel), be prudent, deal subtilly.
a primitive root; to pile up; gather together.
from עָרַם; a stratagem; craftiness.
(Jeremiah 50:26) or (feminine) עֲרֵמָה; from עָרַם; a heap; specifically, a sheaf; heap (of corn), sheaf.
feminine of עֹרֶם; trickery; or (in a good sense) discretion; guile, prudence, subtilty, wilily, wisdom.
probably from עָרַם; the plane tree (from its smooth and shed bark); chestnut tree.
probably from עוּר; watchful; Eran, an Israelite; Eran.
patronymically from עֵרָן; an Eranite or descendant (collectively) of Eran; Eranites.
from עָרַר; naked, i.e. (figuratively) poor; destitute. See also עֲרוֹעֵר.
patronymically from עֲרוֹעֵר; an Aroerite or inhabitant of Aroer; Aroerite.
a primitive root; to droop; hence, to drip; drop (down).

a primitive root (identical with through the idea of sloping); properly, to bend downward; but used only as a denominative from עֹרֶף,; to break the neck; hence (figuratively) to destroy; that is beheaded, break down, break (cut off, strike off) neck.
from עָרַף; the nape or back of the neck (as declining); hence, the back generally (whether literal or figurative); back ((stiff-) neck((-ed).
feminine of עֹרֶף; mane; Orpah, a Moabites; Orpah.
probably from עָרַף; gloom (as of a lowering sky); (gross, thick) dark (cloud, -ness).
a primitive root; to awe or (intransitive) to dread; hence, to harass; be affrighted (afraid, dread, feared, terrified), break, dread, fear, oppress, prevail, shake terribly.
a primitive root; to gnaw, i.e. (figuratively) eat (by hyberbole); also (participle) a pain; fleeing, sinew.
patrial from an unused name meaning a tush; an Arkite or inhabitant of Erek; Arkite.
a primitive root; to bare; figuratively, to demolish; make bare, break, raise up (perhaps by clerical error for raze), [idiom] utterly.
from an unused root meaning perhaps to arch; a couch (properly, with a canopy); bed(-stead), couch.
from עָשֵׁשׁ; a moth; moth. See also עַיִשׁ.
from an unused root meaning to glisten (or be green); grass (or any tender shoot); grass, herb.

a primitive root; to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application; accomplish, advance, appoint, apt, be at, become, bear, bestow, bring forth, bruise, be busy, [idiom] certainly, have the charge of, commit, deal (with), deck, [phrase] displease, do, (ready) dress(-ed), (put in) execute(-ion), exercise, fashion, [phrase] feast, (fight-) ing man, [phrase] finish, fit, fly, follow, fulfill, furnish, gather, get, go about, govern, grant, great, [phrase] hinder, hold (a feast), [idiom] indeed, [phrase] be industrious, [phrase] journey, keep, labour, maintain, make, be meet, observe, be occupied, offer, [phrase] officer, pare, bring (come) to pass, perform, pracise, prepare, procure, provide, put, requite, [idiom] sacrifice, serve, set, shew, [idiom] sin, spend, [idiom] surely, take, [idiom] thoroughly, trim, [idiom] very, [phrase] vex, be (warr-) ior, work(-man), yield, use.
from עָשָׂה and אֵל; God has made; Asahel, the name of four Israelites; Asahel.
apparently a form of the passive participle of עָשָׂה in the original sense of handling; rough (i.e. sensibly felt); Esav, a son of Isaac, including his posterity; Esau.
from עָשַׁק; oppressive (as noun, a tyrant); oppressor.
or עָשֻׁק; passive participle of עָשַׁק; used in plural masculine as abstractly, tyranny; oppressed(-ion). (Doubtful.)
or עָשֹׂר; from עֶשֶׂר; ten; by abbreviated form ten strings, and so a decachord; (instrument of) ten (strings, -th).
from עָשַׁת; shining, i.e. polished; bright.
for עָשׁוֹת; bright; Ashvath, an Israelite; Ashvath.
from עָשָׂה and אֵל; made of God; Asiel, an Israelite; Asiel.
from עָשָׂה and יָהּ; Jah has made; Asajah, the name of three or four Israelites; Asaiah.
from עָשַׁר; rich, whether literal or figurative (noble); rich (man).
from עֶשֶׂר; tenth; by abbreviation, tenth month or (feminine) part; tenth (part).
a primitive root; to smoke, whether literal or figurative; be angry (be on a) smoke.
from עָשַׁן; smoky; smoking.
from עָשַׁן; smoke, literally or figuratively (vapor, dust, anger); smoke(-ing).
the same as עָשָׁן; Ashan, a place in Palestine; Ashan.
a primitive root (identical with עָשַׁק); to press upon, i.e. quarrel; strive with.
from עָשַׂק; strife; Esek.
a primitive root (compare עָשַׂק); to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow; get deceitfully, deceive, defraud, drink up, (use) oppress(-ion), -or), do violence (wrong).
from עָשַׁק; oppression; Eshek, an Israelite; Eshek.
from עָשַׁק; injury, fraud, (subjectively) distress, (concretely) unjust gain; cruelly, extortion, oppression, thing (deceitfully gotten).
feminine of עֹשֶׁק; anguish; oppressed.
masculine of term עֲשָׂרָה; from עָשַׂר; ten (as an accumulation to the extent of the digits); ten, (fif-, seven-) teen.
(Aramaic) masculine עֲשְׂרָה (Aramaic); corresponding to עֶשֶׂר; ten; ten, [phrase] twelve.

a primitive root (identical with עָשַׁר); to accumulate; but used only as denominative from עֶשֶׂר; to tithe, i.e. to take or give atenth; [idiom] surely, give (take) the tenth, (have, take) tithe(-ing, -s), [idiom] truly.
a primitive root; properly, to accumulate; chiefly (specifically) to grow (causatively, make) rich; be(-come, en-, make, make self, wax) rich, make (1 Kings 22:48 marg). See עָשָׂר.
from עָשַׁר; wealth; [idiom] far (richer), riches.

for עֶשֶׂר; ten (only in combination), i.e. -teen; also (ordinal) -teenth; (eigh-, fif-, four-, nine-, seven-, six-, thir-) teen(-th), [phrase] eleven(-th), [phrase] sixscore thousand, [phrase] twelve(-th).
or עִשָּׂרֹן; from עֶשֶׂר; (fractional) a tenth part; tenth deal.
from עֶשֶׂר; twenty; also (ordinal) twentieth; (six-) score, twenty(-ieth).
(Aramaic) corresponding to עֶשְׂרִים; {twenty; also (ordinal) twentieth}; twenty.
a primitive root; probably to shrink, i.e. fail; be consumed.
a primitive root; probably to be sleek, i.e. glossy; hence (through the idea of polishing) to excogitate (as if forming in the mind); shine, think.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָשַׁת; to purpose; think.
from עָשַׁת; a fabric; bright.
from עָשַׁת; cogitation; thought.
apparently masculine plural construction of עֶשֶׁת in the sense of an afterthought (used only in connection with עָשָׂר in lieu of אֶחָד); eleven or (ordinal) eleventh; [phrase] eleven(-th).
from עָשַׁת; thinking; thought.
probably from עָשַׁר; increase; flock.
or עַשְׁתָּרֹת; plural of עַשְׁתְּרָה; Ashtaroth, the name of a Sidonian deity, and of a place East of the Jordan; Asharoth, Astaroth. See also בֵּית עַשְׁתָּרוֹת, עַשְׁתֹּרֶת, עַשְׁתְּרֹת קַרְנַיִם.
probably for עַשְׁתְּרָה; Ashtoreth, the Phoenician goddess of love (and increase); Ashtoreth.
patrial from עַשְׁתָּרוֹת; an Ashterathite or inhabitant of Ashtaroth; Ashterathite.
from עַשְׁתָּרוֹת and the dual of קֶרֶן; Ashtaroth of (the) double horns (a symbol of the deity); Ashteroth-Karnaim, a place East of the Jordan; Ashtoreth Karnaim.

from עַד; time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.; [phrase] after, (al-) ways, [idiom] certain, [phrase] continually, [phrase] evening, long, (due) season, so (long) as, (even-, evening-, noon-) tide, (meal-), what) time, when.
a primitive root; to prepare; make fit, be ready to become.
from עֵת; at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive; henceforth, now, straightway, this time, whereas.
passive participle of עָתַד; prepared; ready.
or עַתֻּד; from עָתַד; prepared, i.e. full grown; spoken only (in plural) of he-goats, or (figuratively) leaders of the people; chief one, (he) goat, ram.
from עֵת; timely; fit.
for עִתִּי; Attai, the name of three Israelites; Attai.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עָתִיד; prepared; ready.
from עָתַד; prepared; by implication, skilful; feminine plural the future; also treasure; things that shall come, ready, treasures.
from עוּת and יָהּ; Jah has helped; Athajah, an Israelite; Athaiah.
from עָתַק; properly, antique, i.e. venerable or splendid; durable.
from עָתַק; removed, i.e. weaned; also antique; ancient, drawn.
(Aramaic) corresponding to עַתִּיק; venerable; ancient.
from an unused root meaning to sojourn; lodging; Athak, a place in Palestine; Athach.
from an unused root meaning to compress; constringent; Athlai, an Israelite; Athlai.
or עֲתַלְיָהוּ; from the same as עַתְלַי and יָהּ; Jah has constrained; Athaljah, the name of an Israelitess and two Israelites; Athaliah.
a primitive root; probably to glow, i.e. (figuratively) be desolated; be darkened.
from an unused root meaning to force; forcible; Othni, an Israelite; Othni.
from the same as עׇתְנִי and אֵל; force of God; Othniel, an Israelite; Othniel.
a primitive root; to remove (intransitive or transitive) figuratively, to grow old; specifically, to transcribe; copy out, leave off, become (wax) old, remove.
from עָתַק; antique, i.e. valued; durable.
from עָתַק in the sense of license; impudent; arrogancy, grievous (hard) things, stiff.
from עֵת and קַיָּם; time of a judge; Eth-Katsin, a place in Palestine; Ittahkazin (by including directive enclitic).
a primitive root (rather denominative from עֶתֶר); to burn incense in worship, i.e. intercede (reciprocally, listen to prayer); intreat, (make) pray(-er).
a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) abundant; deceitful, multiply.
from עָתַר; abundance; Ether, a place in Palestine; Ether.
from עָתַר; also compare עָתַר; incense (as increasing to a volume of smoke); hence  a worshipper; suppliant, thick.
from עָתַר; copiousness; abundance. p
a primitive root; to puff, i.e. blow away; scatter into corners.
feminine of פֹּה; properly, mouth in a figurative sense, i.e. direction, region, extremity; corner, end, quarter, side.

a primitive root; also denominative from פְּאֹרָה,; to gleam, i.e. (causatively) embellish; figuratively, to boast; also to explain (i.e. make clear) oneself; to shake a tree; beautify, boast self, go over the boughs, glorify (self), glory, vaunt self.
from פָּאַר; an embellishment, i.e. fancy head-dress; beauty, bonnet, goodly, ornament, tire.
or פֹּרָאה; or פֻּארָה; from פָּאַר; properly, ornamentation, i.e. (plural) foliage (including the limbs) as bright green; bough, branch, sprig.
from פָּאַר; properly, illuminated, i.e. a glow; as noun, a flush (of anxiety); blackness.
from פָּאַר; ornamental; Paran, a desert of Arabia; Paran.
from an unused root meaning to be torpid, i.e.; crude; an unripe fig; green figuratively
or פִּגֻּל; from an unused root meaning to stink; properly, fetid, i.e. (figuratively) unclean (ceremonially); abominable(-tion, thing).

a primitive root; to impinge, by accident or violence, or (figuratively) by importunity; come (betwixt), cause to entreat, fall (upon), make intercession, intercessor, intreat, lay, light (upon), meet (together), pray, reach, run.
from פָּגַע; impact (casual); chance, occurent.
from פֶּגַע and אֵל; accident of God; Pagiel, an Israelite; Pagiel.
a primitive root; to relax, i.e. become exhausted; be faint.
from פָּגַר; a carcase (as limp), whether of man or beast; figuratively, an idolatrous image; carcase, corpse, dead body.
a primitive root; to come in contact with, whether by accident or violence; figuratively, to concur; meet (with, together).
a primitive root; to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve; [idiom] at all, deliver, [idiom] by any means, ransom, (that are to be, let be) redeem(-ed), rescue, [idiom] surely.
from פָּדָה and אֵל; God has ransomed; Pedahel, an Israelite; Pedahel.
from פָּדָה and צוּר; a rock (i.e. God) has ransomed; Pedahtsur, an Israelite; Pedahzur.
passive participle of פָּדָה. ransomed (and so occurring under פָּדָה); as abstractly (in plural masculine) a ransom; (that are) to be (that were) redeemed.
from פָּדָה; ransom; Padon, one of the Nethinim.; Padon.
or פְּדֻת; from קֵדְמָהlemma קדְמָה missing vowel, corrected to קֵדְמָה; distinction; also deliverance; division, redeem, redemption.
or פְּדָיָהוּ; from פָּדָה and יָהּ; Jah has ransomed; Pedajah, the name of six Israelites; Pedaiah.
or פִּדְיֹם; also פִּדְיוֹן; or פִּדְיֹן; from פָּדָה; a ransom; ransom, that were redeemed, redemption.
from an unused root meaning to extend; a plateau; or פַּדַּן אֲרָם; from the same and אֲרָם; the table-land of Aram; Paddan or Paddan-Aram, a region of Syria; Padan, Padan-aram.
a primitive root; to retrieve; deliver.
from an unused root meaning to be greasy; suet; fat.

from פָּאָה; the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to; accord(-ing as, -ing to), after, appointment, assent, collar, command(-ment), [idiom] eat, edge, end, entry, [phrase] file, hole, [idiom] in, mind, mouth, part, portion, [idiom] (should) say(-ing), sentence, skirt, sound, speech, [idiom] spoken, talk, tenor, [idiom] to, [phrase] two-edged, wish, word.

or פֹּא; (Job 38:11), or פּוֹ; probably from a primitive inseparable particle 'p' (of demonstrative force) and הוּא; this place (French ici), i.e. here or hence; here, hither, the one (other, this, that) side.
or פֻּוָּה; from פָּאָה; a blast; Puah or Puvvah, the name of two Israelites; Phuvah, Pua, Puah.
a primitive root; to be sluggish; cease, be feeble, faint, be slacked.
from פּוּג; intermission; rest.
a primitive root; to puff, i.e. blow with the breath or air; hence, to fan (as a breeze), to utter, to kindle (a fire), to scoff; blow (upon), break, puff, bring into a snare, speak, utter.
of foreign origin; Put, a son of Ham, also the name of his descendants or their region, and of a Persian tribe; Phut, Put.
from an unused root (probably meaning to disparage) and אֵל; contempt of God; Putiel, an Israelite; Putiel.
of Egyptian derivation; Potiphar, an Egyptian; Potiphar.
of Egyptian derivation; Poti-Phera, an Egyptian; Poti-pherah.
from an unused root meaning to paint; dye (specifically, stibium for the eyes); fair colours, glistering, paint(-ed) (-ing).
lemma פוֹל missing dagesh, corrected to פּוֹל; from an unused root meaning to be thick; a bean (as plump); beans.
of foreign origin; Pul, the name of an Assyrian king and of an Ethiopian tribe; Pul.
a primitive root meaning to turn, i.e.; be perplexed; be distracted.
patronymically from an unused name meaning a turn; a Punite (collectively) or descendants of an unknown Pun; Punites.
from פּוּן; perplexity; Punon, a place in the Desert; Punon.
from an unused root meaning to glitter; brilliancy; Puah, an Israelitess; Puah.

a primitive root; to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse); break (dash, shake) in (to) pieces, cast (abroad), disperse (selves), drive, retire, scatter (abroad), spread abroad.
a primitive root; to waver; stumble, move.

a primitive root (identical with פּוּק through the idea of dropping out; compare נְפַק); to issue, i.e. furnish; causatively, to secure; figuratively, to succeed; afford, draw out, further, get, obtain.
from פּוּק; a stumbling-block; grief.
a primitive root; to crush; break, bring to nought, [idiom] utterly take.
also (plural) פּוּרִים; or פֻּרִים; from פּוּר; a lot (as by means of a broken piece); Pur, Purim.
from פּוּר; a wine-press (as crushing the grapes); winepress.
of Persian origin; Poratha, a son of Haman; Poratha.
a primitive root; to spread; figuratively, act proudly; grow up, be grown fat, spread selves, be scattered.
patronymically from an unused name meaning a hinge; a Puthite (collectively) or descendants of an unknown Puth; Puhites (as if from פּוּאָה).
from פָּזַז; pure (gold); hence, gold itself (as refined); fine (pure) gold.
a primitive root; to refine (gold); best (gold).
a primitive root (identical with פָּזַז); to solidify (as if by refining); also to spring (as if separating the limbs); leap, be made strong.
a primitive root; to scatter, whether in enmity or bounty; disperse, scatter (abroad).
from פָּחַח; a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina); gin, (thin) plate, snare.
a primitive root; to be startled (by a sudden alarm); hence, to fear in general; be afraid, stand in awe, (be in) fear, make to shake.
from פָּחַד; a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling); dread(-ful), fear, (thing) great (fear, -ly feared), terror.
the same as פַּחַד; a testicle (as a cause of shame akin to fear); stone.
feminine of פַּחַד; alarm (i.e. awe); fear.
of foreign origin; a prefect (of a city or small district); captain, deputy, governor.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פֶּחָה; {a prefect (of a city or small district)}; captain, governor.
a primitive root; to bubble up or froth (as boiling water), i.e. (figuratively) to be unimportant; light.
from פָּחַז; ebullition, i.e. froth (figuratively, lust); unstable.
from פָּחַז; frivolity; lightness.
a primitive root; to batter out; but used only as denominative from פַּח,; to spread a net; be snared.
perhaps from an unused root probably meaning to be black; a coal, whether charred or live; coals.
(Aramaic) from an unused root probably meaning to fashion; a potter; potter.
probably from an unused root apparently meaning to dig; a pit, especially forcatching animals; hole, pit, snare.
from פַּחַת and מוֹאָב; pit of Moab; Pachath-Moab, an Israelite; Pahathmoab.
from the same as פַּחַת; a hole (by mildew in a garment); fret inward.
of foreign derivation; a gem, probably the topaz; topaz.
passive participle of פָּטַר; opened, i.e. (as noun) a bud; open.
from פָּטַר; open, i.e. unoccupied; free.
intensively from an unused root meaning to pound; a hammer; hammer.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of פַּטִּישׁ; a gown (as if hammered out wide); hose.
a primitive root; to cleave or burst through, i.e. (causatively) to emit, whether literal or figurative (gape); dismiss, free, let (shoot) out, slip away.
or פִּטְרָה; from פָּטַר; a fissure, i.e. (concretely) firstling (as opening the matrix); firstling, openeth, such as open.
of Egyptian origin; Pi-Beseth, a place in Egypt; Pi-beseth.
from an unused root probably meaning to pierce; (figuratively) misfortune; destruction, ruin.
or פִּיָּה; feminine of פֶּה; an edge; (two-) edge(-d).

lemma פִּי הַחִרֹת yod, corrected to פִּי הַחִירֹת; xlit Pi corrected to Pîy; from פֶּה and the feminine plural of a noun (from the same root as חוֹר), with the article interpolated; mouth of the gorges; Pi-ha-Chiroth, a place in Egypt; Pi-hahiroth. (In Numbers 14:19 without Pi-.)
from פּוּחַ; a powder (as easily puffed away), i.e. ashes or dust; ashes.
apparently from פֶּה and כֹּל; mouth of all; Picol, a Philistine; Phichol.
or פִּלֶגֶשׁ; of uncertain derivation; a concubine; also (masculine) a paramour; concubine, paramour.
probably from an unused root meaning to be plump; obesity; collops.
apparently from פֶּה and a variation of נָחָשׁ; mouth of a serpent; Pinechas, the name of three Israelites; Phinehas.
probably the same as פּוּנֹן; Pinon, an Idumaean; Pinon.
for פֵּיָה; an edge or tooth; tooth, [idiom] two-edged.
from פּוּק; a tottering; smite together.
from פּוּשׁ; dispersive; Pishon, a river of Eden; Pison.
probably from the same as פֹּת; expansive; Pithon, an Israelite; Pithon.
from פָּכָה; a flask (from which a liquid may flow); box, vial.
a primitive root; to pour; run out.

from the active participle (of the same form as the first word) feminine of an unused root (meaning to entrap) and plural of צְבִי; trap of gazelles; Pokereth-Tsebajim, one of the 'servants of Solomon'; Pochereth of Zebaim.

a primitive root; properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful; accomplish, (arise...too, be too) hard, hidden, things too high, (be, do, do a, shew) marvelous(-ly, -els, things, work), miracles, perform, separate, make singular, (be, great, make) wonderful(-ers, -ly, things, works), wondrous (things, works, -ly).
from פָּלָא; a miracle; marvellous thing, wonder(-ful, -fully).
or פָּלִיא; from פָּלָא; remarkable; secret, wonderful.
patronymically from פַּלּוּא; a Palluite (collectively) or descendants of Pallu; Palluites.
a primitive root; to split (literally or figuratively); divide.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פָּלַג; {to split (literally or figuratively)}; divided.
(Aramaic) from פְּלַג; a half; dividing.
from פָּלַג; a rill (i.e. small channel of water, as in irrigation); river, stream.
the same as פֶּלֶג; earthquake; Peleg, a son of Shem; Peleg.
from פָּלַג; a runlet, i.e. gully; division, river.
from פָּלַג; a section; division.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פְּלֻגָּה; {a section}; division.
lemma פְלָדָה missing dagesh, corrected to פְּלָדָה; from an unused root meaning to divide; a cleaver, i.e. iron armature (of a chariot); torch.
of uncertain derivation; Pildash, a relative of Abraham; Pildash.
a primitive root; to distinguish (literally or figuratively); put a difference, show marvellous, separate, set apart, sever, make wonderfully.
from פָּלָה; distinguished; Pallu, an Israelite; Pallu, Phallu.
patronymically from an unused name (from פָּלָה) meaning separate; a Pelonite or inhabitant of an unknown Palon; Pelonite.
a primitive root; to slice, i.e. break open or pierce; bring forth, cleave, cut, shred, strike through.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פָּלַח; to serve or worship; minister, serve.
from פָּלַח; a slice; piece.
from פֶּלַח; slicing; Pilcha, an Israelite; Pilcha.
(Aramaic) from פְּלַח; worship; service.
a primitive root; to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver; calve, carry away safe, deliver, (cause to) escape.
from פָּלַט; escape; Pelet, the name of two Israelites; Pelet. See also בֵּית פֶּלֶט.
from פָּלַט; escape; deliverance, escape.
from פָּלַט; delivered; Palti, the name of two Israelites; Palti, Phalti.
patronymically from פַּלְטִי; a Paltite or descendant of Palti; Paltite.
for פַּלְטִי; Piltai, an Israelite; Piltai.
from the same as פֶּלֶט and אֵל; deliverance of God; Paltiel, the name of two Israelites; Paltiel, Phaltiel.
or פְּלַטְיָהוּ; from פָּלַט and יָהּ; Jah has delivered; Pelatjah, the name of four Israelites; Pelatiah.
or פְּלָאיָה; from פָּלָא and יָהּ; Jah has distinguished; Pelajah, the name of three Israelites; Pelaiah.
or פָּלֵיט; or פָּלֵט; from פָּלַט; a refugee; (that have) escape(-d, -th), fugitive.
or פְּלֵטָה; feminine of פָּלִיט; deliverance; concretely, an escaped portion; deliverance, (that is) escape(-d), remnant.
from פָּלַל; a magistrate; judge.
feminine of פָּלִיל; justice; judgment.
from פָּלִיל; judicial; judge.
feminine of פְּלִילִי; judicature; judgment.
from an unused root meaning to be round; a circuit (i.e. district); also a spindle (as whirled); hence, a crutch; (di-) staff, participle
a primitive root; to judge (officially or mentally); by extension, to intercede, pray; intreat, judge(-ment), (make) pray(-er, -ing), make supplication.
from פָּלַל; judge; Palal, an Israelite; Palal.
from פָּלַל and יָהּ; Jah has judged; Pelaljah, an Israelite; Pelaliah.
probably for פְּלֹנִי; a certain one, i.e. so-and-so; certain.
from פָּלָה; such a one, i.e. a specified person; such.
a primitive root; properly, to roll flat, i.e. prepare (a road); also to revolve, i.e. weigh (mentally); make, ponder, weigh.
from פָּלַס; a balance; scales, weight.
a primitive root; properly, perhaps to rend, i.e. (by implication) to quiver; tremble.
from פָּלַץ; affright; fearfulness, horror, trembling.
a primitive root; to roll (in dust); roll (wallow) self.
from פָּלַשׁ; rolling, i.e. migratory; Pelesheth, a region of Syria; Palestina, Palestine, Philistia, Philistines.
patrial from פְּלֶשֶׁת; a Pelishtite or inhabitant of Pelesheth; Philistine.
from an unused root meaning to flee; swiftness; Peleth, the name of two Israelites; Peleth.
from the same form as פֶּלֶת; a courier (collectively) or official messenger; Pelethites.
(Aramaic) probably for פֶּה; the mouth (literally or figuratively); mouth.
from an unused root meaning to turn; an angle (of a street or wall); corner.
from פָּנָה; properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest; (lest) (peradventure), that...not.
of uncertain derivation; probably pastry; Pannag.

a primitive root; to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.; appear, at (even-) tide, behold, cast out, come on, [idiom] corner, dawning, empty, go away, lie, look, mark, pass away, prepare, regard, (have) respect (to), (re-) turn (aside, away, back, face, self), [idiom] right (early).
feminine of פֵּן; an angle; by implication, a pinnacle; figuratively, a chieftain; bulwark, chief, corner, stay, tower.
or (more properly,) פְּנִיאֵל; from פָּנָה and אֵל; face of God; Penuel or Peniel, a place East of Jordan; also (as Penuel) the name of two Israelites; Peniel, Penuel.

plural (but always as singular) of an unused noun פָּנֶה; from פָּנָה); the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.); [phrase] accept, a-(be-) fore(-time), against, anger, [idiom] as (long as), at, [phrase] battle, [phrase] because (of), [phrase] beseech, countenance, edge, [phrase] employ, endure, [phrase] enquire, face, favour, fear of, for, forefront(-part), form(-er time, -ward), from, front, heaviness, [idiom] him(-self), [phrase] honourable, [phrase] impudent, [phrase] in, it, look(-eth) (-s), [idiom] me, [phrase] meet, [idiom] more than, mouth, of, off, (of) old (time), [idiom] on, open, [phrase] out of, over against, the partial, person, [phrase] please, presence, propect, was purposed, by reason of, [phrase] regard, right forth, [phrase] serve, [idiom] shewbread, sight, state, straight, [phrase] street, [idiom] thee, [idiom] them(-selves), through ([phrase] -out), till, time(-s) past, (un-) to(-ward), [phrase] upon, upside ([phrase] down), with(-in, [phrase] -stand), [idiom] ye, [idiom] you.
from פָּנִים with directive enclitic; faceward, i.e. indoors; (with-) in(-ner part, -ward).
from פָּנִים; interior; (with-) in(-ner, -ward).
or פָּנִי; from the same as פֵּן; probably a pearl (as round); ruby.
probably feminine from פָּנִין contr.; Peninnah, an Israelitess; Peninnah.
a primitive root; to enervate; bring up.

from פָּסַס; properly, the palm (of the hand) or sole (of the foot) (compare פַּס); by implication (plural); a long and sleeved tunic (perhaps simply a wide one; from the original sense of the root, i.e. of many breadths); (divers) colours.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to פָּסַס; the palm (of the hand, as being spread out); participle
a primitive root; to cut up, i.e. (figuratively) contemplate; consider.
from פָּסַג; a cleft; Pisgah, a Mountain East of Jordan; Pisgah.
from פַּס and the plural of דָּם; palm (i.e. dell) of bloodshed; Pas-Dammim, a place in Palestine; Pas-dammim. Compare אֶפֶס דַּמִּים.
from פָּסַס; expansion, i.e. abundance; handful.
a primitive root; to hop, i.e. (figuratively) skip over (or spare); by implication, to hesitate; also (literally) to limp, to dance; halt, become lame, leap, pass over.
from פָּסַח; a pretermission, i.e. exemption; used only techically of the Jewish Passover (the festival or the victim); passover (offering).
from פָּסַח; limping; Paseach, the name of two Israelites; Paseah, Phaseah.
from פָּסַח; lame; lame.
from פָּסַל; an idol; carved (graven) image, quarry.
from an unused root meaning to divide; divider; Pasak, an Israelite; Pasach.
a primitive root; to carve, whether wood or stone; grave, hew.
lemma פֶסֶל missing dagesh, corrected to פֶּסֶל; from פָּסַל; an idol; carved (graven) image.
lemma פִּסַנְטֵרִין first vowel, corrected to פְּסַנְטֵרִין; (Aramaic) or פְּסַנְתֵּרִין; a transliteration of the Greek,; psalterion; a lyre; psaltery.
a primitive root; probably to disperse, i.e. (intransitive) disappear; cease.
perhaps from פָּסַס; dispersion; Pispah, an Israelite; Pispah.
a primitive root; to scream; cry.
or פָּעִי; from פָּעָה; screaming; Pau or Pai, a place in Edom; Pai, Pau.
from פָּעַר; a gap; also בַּעַל פְּעוֹר); Peor, a mountain East of Jordan; Baal Peor,  (for a deity worshipped there; Peor. See also בֵּית פְּעוֹר.
a primitive root; to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise; commit, (evil-) do(-er), make(-r), ordain, work(-er).
from פָּעַל; an act or work (concretely); act, deed, do, getting, maker, work.
feminine passive participle of פָּעַל; (abstractly) work; labour, reward, wages, work.
xlit Pᵉullʻthay corrected to Pᵉʻullᵉthay; from פְּעֻלָּה; laborious; Peullethai, an Israelite; Peulthai.
a primitive root; to tap, i.e. beat regularly; hence (generally) to impel or agitate; move, trouble.

or (feminine) פַּעֲמָה; from פָּעַם; a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow); anvil, corner, foot(-step), going, (hundred-) fold, [idiom] now, (this) [phrase] once, order, rank, step, [phrase] thrice, (often-), second, this, two) time(-s), twice, wheel.
from פַּעַם; a bell (as struck); bell.
a primitive root; to yawn, i.e. open wide (literally or figuratively); gape, open (wide).
from פָּעַר; yawning; Paarai, an Israelite; Paarai.
a primitive root; to rend, i.e. open (especially the mouth); deliver, gape, open, rid, utter.
a primitive root; to break out (in joyful sound); break (forth, forth into joy), make a loud noise.
from פָּצַר; bluntness; [phrase] file.
a primitive root; to peel; pill.
from פָּצַל; a peeling; strake.
a primitive root; to rend (by earthquake); break.
a primitive root; to split, i.e. wound; wound.
from פָּצַע; a wound; wound(-ing).
from an unused root meaning to dissever; dispersive; Pitstsets, a priest; Apses (including the article).
a primitive root; to peck at, i.e. (figuratively) stun or dull; press, urge, stubbornness.

a primitive root; to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.; appoint, [idiom] at all, avenge, bestow, (appoint to have the, give a) charge, commit, count, deliver to keep, be empty, enjoin, go see, hurt, do judgment, lack, lay up, look, make, [idiom] by any means, miss, number, officer, (make) overseer, have (the) oversight, punish, reckon, (call to) remember(-brance), set (over), sum, [idiom] surely, visit, want.

feminine passive participle of פָּקַד; visitation (in many senses, chiefly official); account, (that have the) charge, custody, that which...laid up, numbers, office(-r), ordering, oversight, [phrase] prison, reckoning, visitation.
from פָּקַד; a deposit; that which was delivered (to keep), store.
from פָּקִיד; supervision; ward.
from פָּקַד; punishment; Pekod, a symbolic name for Babylon; Pekod.
or פִּקֻּד; from פָּקַד; properly, appointed, i.e. a mandate (of God; plural only, collectively, for the Law); commandment, precept, statute.
a primitive root; to open (the senses, especially the eyes); figuratively, to be observant; open.
from פָּקַח; watch; Pekach, an Israelite king; Pekah.
from פָּקַח; clear-sighted; figuratively, intelligent; seeing, wise.
from פָּקַח and יָהּ; Jah has observed; Pekachjah, an Israelite king; Pekahiah.
from פָּקַח redoubled; opening (of a dungeon), i.e. jail-delivery (figuratively, salvation for sin); opening of the prison.
from פָּקַד; a superintendent (civil, military or religious); which had the charge, governor, office, overseer, (that) was set.
from an unused root meaning to burst; only used as an architectural term of an ornament similar to פַּקֻּעָה,; a semi-globe; knop.
from the same as פֶּקַע; the wild cucumber (from splitting open to shed its seeds); gourd.
or פָּר; from פָּרַר; a bullock (apparently as breaking forth in wild strength, or perhaps as dividing the hoof); ([phrase] young) bull(-ock), calf, ox.
a primitive root; to bear fruit; be fruitful.
or פֶּרֶה; (Jeremiah 2:24), from פָּרָא in the secondary sense of running wild; the onager; wild (ass).
from פֶּרֶא; wildly; Piram, a Canaanite; Piram.
or פַּרְוָר; of foreign origin; Parbar or Parvar, a quarter of Jerusalem; Parbar, suburb.
a primitive root; to break through, i.e. spread or separate (oneself); disperse, divide, be out of joint, part, scatter (abroad), separate (self), sever self, stretch, sunder.
from פָּרַד; a mule (perhaps from his lonely habits); mule.
feminine of פֶּרֶד; a she-mule; mule.
feminine passive participle of פָּרַד; something separated, i.e. a kernel; seed.
of foreign origin; a park; forest, orchard.
a primitive root; to bear fruit (literally or figuratively); bear, bring forth (fruit), (be, cause to be, make) fruitful, grow, increase.
feminine of פַּר; a heifer; cow, heifer, kine.
the same as פָּרָה; Parah, a place in Palestine; Parah.
from פּוּר; a hole (as broken, i.e. dug); [phrase] mole. Compare חֲפֹר.
for פְּאֹרָה; foliage; Purah, an Israelite; Phurah.
or פְּרִידָא; from פָּרַד; dispersion; Peruda or Perida, one of 'Solomon's servants'; Perida, Peruda.
passive participle of פָּרַח; blossomed; Paruach, an Israelite; Paruah.
of foreign origin; Parvajim, an Oriental region; Parvaim.
passive participle of פָּרַר in the sense of spreading out (compare פָּרַח); a skillet (as flat or deep); pan, pot.
from an unused root meaning to separate, i.e.; decide; a chieftain; village.
from the same as פָּרָז; an open country; (unwalled) town (without walls), unwalled village.
from the same as פָּרָז; magistracy, i.e. leadership (also concretely, chieftains); village.
or פְּרוֹזִי; from פְּרָזָה; a rustic; village.
for פְּרָזִי; inhabitant of the open country; a Perizzite, one of the Canaanitish tribes; Perizzite.
(Aramaic) corresponding to בַּרְזֶל; iron; iron.

a primitive root; to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish; [idiom] abroad, [idiom] abundantly, blossom, break forth (out), bud, flourish, make fly, grow, spread, spring (up).
from פָּרַח; a calyx (natural or artificial); generally, bloom; blossom, bud, flower.
from פָּרַח; progeny, i.e. a brood; youth.
a primitive root; to scatter words, i.e. prate (or hum); chant.
from פָּרַט; a stray or single berry; grape.
from פָּרָה; fruit (literally or figuratively); bough, (first-)fruit(-ful), reward.
from פָּרַץlemma פּרַץ missing vowel, corrected to פָּרַץ; violent, i.e. a tyrant; destroyer, ravenous, robber.
from an unused root meaning to break apart; fracture, i.e. severity; cruelty, rigour.
feminine active participle of the same as פֶּרֶךְ; a separatrix, i.e. (the sacred) screen; vail.
a primitive root; to tear; rend.
of Persian origin; Parmashta, a son of Haman; Parmasta.
of uncertain derivation; Parnak, an Israelite; Parnach.
a primitive root; to break in pieces, i.e. (usually without violence) to split, distribute; deal, divide, have hoofs, part, tear.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פָּרַס; to split up; divide, (U-) pharsin.
from פָּרַס; a claw; also a kind of eagle; claw, ossifrage.
of foreign origin; Paras (i.e. Persia), an Eastern country, including its inhabitants; Persia, Persians.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פָּרַס; {Paras (i.e. Persia), an Eastern country, including its inhabitants}; Persia, Persians.
feminine of פֶּרֶס; a claw or split hoof; claw, (cloven-) footed, hoof.
patrial from פָּרַס; a Parsite (i.e. Persian), or inhabitant of Peres; Persian.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פַּרְסִי; {a Parsite (i.e. Persian), or inhabitant of Peres}; Persian.
a primitive root; to loosen; by implication, to expose, dismiss; figuratively, absolve, begin; avenge, avoid, bare, go back, let, (make) naked, set at nought, perish, refuse, uncover.
from פָּרַע; the hair (as dishevelled); locks.
feminine of פֶּרַע (in the sense of beginning); leadership (plural concretely, leaders); [phrase] avenging, revenge.
of Egyptian derivation; Paroh, a general title of Egyptian kings; Pharaoh.
of Egyptian derivation; Paroh-Chophra, an Egyptian king; Pharaoh-hophra.
or פַּרְעֹה נְכוֹ; of Egyptian derivation; Paroh-Nekoh (or -Neko), an Egyptian king; Pharaoh-necho, Pharaohnechoh.
probably from פָּרַע and עָשׁ; a flea (as the isolated insect); flea.
the same as פַּרְעֹשׁ; Parosh, the name of our Israelite; Parosh, Pharosh.
from פַּרְעָה; chieftaincy; Pirathon, a place in Palestine; Pirathon.
or פִּרְעָתֹנִי; patrial from פִּרְעָתוֹן; a Pirathonite or inhabitant of Pirathon; Pirathonite.
probably from פָּרַר in the sense of rushing; rapid; Parpar, a river of Syria; Pharpar.

lemma פּרַץ missing vowel, corrected to פָּרַץ; a primitive root; to break out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative); [idiom] abroad, (make a) breach, break (away, down, -er, forth, in, up), burst out, come (spread) abroad, compel, disperse, grow, increase, open, press, scatter, urge.
from פָּרַץlemma פּרַץ missing vowel, corrected to פָּרַץ; a break (literally or figuratively); breach, breaking forth (in), [idiom] forth, gap.
the same as פֶּרֶץ; Perets, the name of two Israelites; Perez, Pharez.
patronymically from פֶּרֶץ; a Partsite (collectively) or descendants of Perets; Pharzites.
plural of פֶּרֶץ; breaks; Peratsim, a mountain in Palestine; Perazim.
from פֶּרֶץ and עֻזָּא; break of Uzza; Perets-Uzza, a place in Palestine; Perezuzza.
a primitive root; to break off or crunch; figuratively, to deliver; break (off), deliver, redeem, rend (in pieces), tear in pieces.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פָּרַק; to discontinue; break off.
from פָּרַק; rapine; also a fork (in roads); crossway, robbery.
from פָּרַק; soup (as full of crumbed meat); broth. See also מַרְפֵּא.

a primitive root; to break up (usually figuratively), i.e. to violate, frustrate; [idiom] any ways, break (asunder), cast off, cause to cease, [idiom] clean, defeat, disannul, disappoint, dissolve, divide, make of none effect, fail, frustrate, bring (come) to nought, [idiom] utterly, make void.
a primitive root; to break apart, disperse, etc.; break, chop in pieces, lay open, scatter, spread (abroad, forth, selves, out), stretch (forth, out).
a primitive root; to separate, literally (to disperse) or figuratively (to specify); also (by implication) to wound; scatter, declare, distinctly, shew, sting.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פָּרָשׁ; to specify; distinctly.
from פָּרָשׁ; excrement (as eliminated); dung.
the same as פֶּרֶשׁ; Peresh, an Israelite; Peresh.
from פָּרָשׁ; (compare סוּס); a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry; horseman.
or פַּתְשֶׁגֶן; of foreign origin; a transcript; copy.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פַּרְשֶׁגֶן; {a transcript}; copy.
perhaps by compounding פָּרָשׁ and פָּרַד (in the sense of straddling) (compare פַּרְשֵׁז); the crotch (or anus); dirt.
from פָּרָשׁ; exposition; declaration, sum.
a root apparently formed by compounding פָּרָשׁ and that of פָּרָז (compare פַּרְשְׁדֹן); to expand; spread.
of Persian origin; Parshandatha, a son of Haman; Parshandatha.
from an unused root meaning to break forth; rushing; Perath (i.e. Euphrates), a river of the East; Euphrates.
of Persian origin; a grandee; (most) noble, prince.
probably from an unused root meaning to disintegrate; stupidity (as a result of grossness or of degeneracy); extremity.
a primitive root; to spread; spread.
a primitive root; to tear in pieces; pull in pieces.
probably from פָּשַׁח; liberation; Pashchur, the name of four Israelites; Pashur.

a primitive root; to spread out (i.e. deploy in hostile array); by analogy, to strip (i.e. unclothe, plunder, flay, etc.); fall upon, flay, invade, make an invasion, pull off, put off, make a road, run upon, rush, set, spoil, spread selves (abroad), strip (off, self).
a primitive root; to stride (from spreading the legs), i.e. rush upon; go.
a primitive root (identical with through the idea of expansion); to break away (from just authority), i.e. trespass, apostatize, quarrel; offend, rebel, revolt, transgress(-ion, -or).
from פָּשַׂע; a stride; step.
from פָּשַׁע; a revolt (national, moral or religious); rebellion, sin, transgression, trespass.
a primitive root; to dispart (the feet or lips), i.e. become licentious; open (wide).
(Aramaic) corresponding to פָּתַר; to interpret; make (interpretations), interpreting.
(Aramaic) from פְּשַׁר; an interpretation; interpretation.
corresponding to פְּשַׁר; {an interpretation}; interpretation.
from the same as פַּשׁ as in the sense of comminuting; linen (i.e. the thread, as carded); flax, linen.
feminine of פִּשְׁתֶּה; flax; by implication, a wick; flax, tow.
from פָּתַת; a bit; meat, morsel, piece.
or פֹּתָה; (Ezekiel 13:19), from an unused root meaning to open; a hole, i.e. hinge or the female pudenda; hinge, secret participle
or פִּתְאֹם; from פֶּתַע; instantly; straightway, sudden(-ly).
of Persian origin; a dainty; portion (provision) of meat.
of Persian origin; a (judicial) sentence; decree, sentence.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פִּתְגָּם; a word, answer, letter or decree; answer, letter, matter, word.

a primitive root; to open, i.e. be (causatively, make) roomy; usually figuratively (in a mental or moral sense) to be (causatively, make) simple or (in a sinister way) delude; allure, deceive, enlarge, entice, flatter, persuade, silly (one).
from פָּתָה and אֵל; enlarged of God; Pethuel, an Israelite; Pethuel.
or פִּתֻּחַ ; passive participle of פָּתַח; sculpture (in low or high relief or even intaglio); carved (work) (are, en-) grave(-ing, -n).
of foreign origin; Pethor, a place in Mesopotamia; Pethor.

a primitive root; to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve; appear, break forth, draw (out), let go free, (en-) grave(-n), loose (self), (be, be set) open(-ing), put off, ungird, unstop, have vent.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פָּתַח; to open; open.
from פָּתַח; an opening (literally), i.e. door (gate) or entrance way; door, entering (in), entrance (-ry), gate, opening, place.
from פָּתַח; opening (figuratively) i.e. disclosure; entrance.
from פָּתַח; something opened, i.e. a drawn sword; drawn sword.
from פָּתַח; opening (the act); open(-ing).
from פָּתַח and יָהּ; Jah has opened; Pethachjah, the name of four Israelites; Pethakiah.
or פֶּתִי; or פְּתָאִי; from פָּתָה; silly (i.e. seducible); foolish, simple(-icity, one).
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to פָּתָה; open, i.e. (as noun) width; breadth.
of uncertain derivation; probably a figured mantle forholidays; stomacher.
from פְּתִי; silliness (i.e. seducibility); simple.
from פָּתַל; twine; bound, bracelet, lace, line, ribband, thread, wire.
a primitive root; to twine, i.e. (literally) to struggle or (figuratively) be (morally) tortuous; (shew self) froward, shew self unsavoury, wrestle.
from פָּתַל; tortuous (i.e. crafty); crooked.
of Egyptian derivation; Pithom, a place in Egypt; Pithom.
from an unused root meaning to twist; an asp (from its contortions); adder.

from an unused root meaning to open (the eyes); (compare פִּתְאוֹם); a wink, i.e. moment(used only (with or without preposition) adverbially, quickly or unexpectedly; at an instant, suddenly, [idiom] very.
a primitive root; to open up, i.e. (figuratively) interpret (a dream); interpret(-ation, -er).
or פִּתְרֹן; from פָּתַר; interpretation (of a dream); interpretation.
of Egyptian derivation; Pathros, a part of Egypt; Pathros.
patrial from פַּתְרוֹס; a Pathrusite, or inhabitant of Pathros; Pathrusim.
a primitive root; to open, i.e. break; participle x
from יָצָא; issue, i.e. (human) excrement; that (which) cometh from (out).
from an unused root meaning to be slender; the lotus tree; shady tree.

or צאוֹן; (Psalm 144:13), from an unused root meaning to migrate; a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men); (small) cattle, flock ([phrase] -s), lamb ([phrase] -s), sheep(-cote, -fold, -shearer, -herds).
from the same as צֹאן used denominatively; sheep pasture; Zaanan, a place in Palestine; Zaanan.
from יָצָא; issue, i.e. produce, children; that which cometh forth (out), offspring.
