from an unused root meaning to establish; a palanquin or canopy (as a fixture); also a species of lizard (probably as clinging fast); covered, litter, tortoise.
a primitive root; to mass (an army or servants); assemble, fight, perform, muster, wait upon, war.
(Aramaic) corresponding to פִּתְרוֹן in the figurative sense of summoning one's wishes; to please; will, would.

or (feminine) צְבָאָה; from צָבָא; a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship); appointed time, ([phrase]) army, ([phrase]) battle, company, host, service, soldiers, waiting upon, war(-fare).
or (more correctly) צְבִיִּים; or צְבִיִּם; plural of צְבִי; gazelles; Tseboim or Tsebijim, a place in Palestine; Zeboiim, Zeboim.
feminine active participle of the same as צָב; the canopier (with the article); Tsobebah, an Israelitess; Zobebah.
a primitive root; to amass, i.e. grow turgid; specifically, to array an army against; fight swell.
from צָבָה; turgid; swell.
(Aramaic) from צְבָא; properly, will; concretely, an affair (as a matter of determination); purpose.
passive participle of the same as צֶבַע; dyed (in stripes), i.e. the hyena; speckled.
a primitive root; to grasp, i.e. hand out; reach.
from צָבָה in the sense of prominence; splendor (as conspicuous); also a gazelle (as beautiful); beautiful(-ty), glorious (-ry), goodly, pleasant, roe(-buck).
for צִבְיָּה; Tsibja, an Israelite; Zibia.
for צְבִיָּה; Tsibjah, an Israelite; Zibiah.
feminine of צְבִי; a female gazelle; roe.
(Aramaic) a root corresponding to that of צֶבַע; to dip; wet.
from an unused root meaning to dip (into coloring fluid); a dye; divers, colours.
from the same as צֶבַע; variegated; Tsibon, an Idumaean; Zibeon.
plural of צָבוּעַ; hyenas; Tseboim, a place in Palestine; Zeboim.
a primitive root; to aggregate; gather (together), heap (up), lay up.
from פַּרְעֹשׁ; a pile; heap.
from an unused root apparently meaning to grip; a lock of stalks; handful.
contr. from an unused root meaning to sidle off; a side; figuratively, an adversary; (be-) side.
(Aramaic) corresponding to צַד; used adverbially (with preposition) at or upon the side of; against, concerning.
(Aramaic) from an unused root corresponding to צָדָה in the sense of intentness; a (sinister) design; true.
from the same as צַד; a siding; Tsedad, a place near Palestine; Zedad.
a primitive root; to chase; by implication, to desolate; destroy, hunt, lie in wait.
from צָדַק; just; Tsadok, the name of eight or nine Israelites; Zadok.
from צָדָה; (compare צְדָא); design; lying in wait.
plural of צַד; sides; Tsiddim (with the article), a place in Palestine; Ziddim.
from צָדַק; just; just, lawful, righteous (man).
a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense); cleanse, clear self, (be, do) just(-ice, -ify, -ify self), (be turn to) righteous(-ness).

from צָדַק; the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity; [idiom] even, ([idiom] that which is altogether) just(-ice), (un-)right(-eous) (cause, -ly, -ness).
(Aramaic) corresponding to צְדָקָה; beneficence; righteousness.
from צָדַק; rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity); justice, moderately, right(-eous) (act, -ly, -ness).
or צִדְקִיָּהוּ; from צֶדֶק and יָהּ; right of Jah; Tsidkijah, the name of six Israelites; Zedekiah, Zidkijah.
a primitive root; to glitter, i.e. be golden in color; [idiom] fine.
from צָהַב; golden in color; yellow.

a primitive root; to gleam, i.e. (figuratively) be cheerful; by transference to sound clear (of various animal or human expressions); bellow, cry aloud (out), lift up, neigh, rejoice, make to shine, shout.
a primitive root; to glisten; used only as denominative from יִצְהָר,; to press out oil; make oil.
from צָהַר; a light (i.e. window); dual double light, i.e. noon; midday, noon(-day, -tide), window.
or צָו; from צָוָה; an injunction; commandment, precept.
or צֹא; from an unused root meaning to issue; soiled (as if excrementitious); filthy.
or צֹאָה ; feminine of צוֹא; excrement; generally, dirt; figuratively, pollution; dung, filth(-iness). Marg. for חֶרֶא.
(Aramaic) corresponding to צַוָּאר; {the back of the neck (as that on which burdens are bound)}; neck.

or צַוָּר; (Nehemiah 3:5), or צַוָּרֹןlemma צַוָּרן missing vowel, corrected to צַוָּרֹן; (Song of Solomon 4:9), or (feminine) צַוָּארָה; (Micah 2:3), intensively from צוּר in the sense of binding; the back of the neck (as that on which burdens are bound); neck.
or צוֹבָה; or צֹבָה; from an unused root meaning to station; a station; Zoba or Zobah, a region of Syria; Zoba, Zobah.

a primitive root; also denominative from צַיִד; to lie alongside (i.e. in wait); by implication, to catch an animal (figuratively, men); to victual (for a journey); chase, hunt, sore, take (provision).
a primitive root; (intensively) to constitute, enjoin; appoint, (for-) bid, (give a) charge, (give a, give in, send with) command(-er, -ment), send a messenger, put, (set) in order.
a primitive root; to screech (exultingly); shout.
from צָוַח; a screech (of anguish); cry(-ing).
from an unused root meaning to sink; an abyss (of the sea); deep.
a primitive root; to cover over (the mouth), i.e. to fast; [idiom] at all, fast.
or צֹם; from צוּם; a fast; fast(-ing).
from צָעַר; small; Tsuar, an Israelite; Zuar.
a primitive root; to overflow; (make to over-) flow, swim.
from צוּף; comb of honey (from dripping); honeycomb.
or צוֹפַי; or צִיף; from צוּף; honey-comb; Tsuph or Tsophai or Tsiph, the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine; Zophai, Zuph.
from an unused root meaning to expand, breadth; Tsophach, an Israelite; Zophah.
from צָפַר; departing; Tsophar, a friend of Job; Zophar.
a primitive root; to twinkle, i.e. glance; by analogy, to blossom (figuratively, flourish); bloom, blossom, flourish, shew self.
a primitive root; to compress, i.e. (figuratively) oppress, distress; constrain, distress, lie sore, (op-) press(-or), straiten.
a primitive root (identical with through the idea of narrowness (of orifice)); to pour out, i.e. (figuratively) smelt, utter; be molten, pour.
or (feminine) צוּקָה; from צוּק; a strait, i.e. (figuratively) distress; anguish, [idiom] troublous.

a primitive root; to cramp, i.e. confine (in many applications, literally and figuratively, formative or hostile); adversary, assault, beset, besiege, bind (up), cast, distress, fashion, fortify, inclose, lay siege, put up in bags.

or צֻר; from צוּר; properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous); edge, [idiom] (mighty) God (one), rock, [idiom] sharp, stone, [idiom] strength, [idiom] strong. See also בֵּית צוּר.
the same as צוּר; rock; Tsur, the name of a Midianite and of an Israelite; Zur.
feminine of צוּר; a rock (Job 28:10); also a form (as if pressed out); form, rock.
from צוּר and אֵל; rock of God; Tsuriel, an Israelite; Zuriel.
from צוּר and שַׁדַּי; rock of (the) Almighty; Tsurishaddai, an Israelite; Zurishaddai.
a primitive root; to blaze; burn.
from צָחַח; dazzling, i.e. sunny, bright, (figuratively) evident; clear, dry, plainly, white.
from an unused root meaning to glow; parched; dried up.
a primitive root; to glare, i.e. be dazzling white; be whiter.
from צָחַח; glaring, i.e. exposed to the bright sun; higher place, top.
feminine of צְחִיחַ; a parched region, i.e. the desert; dry land.
from צְחִיחַ; bare spot, i.e. in the glaring sun; higher place.
from an unused root meaning to putrefy; stench; ill savour.
from צָחַח; a dry place, i.e. desert; drought.
a primitive root; to laugh outright (in merriment or scorn); by implication, to sport; laugh, mock, play, make sport.
from צָחַק; laughter (in pleasure or derision); laugh(-ed to scorn).
from an unused root meaning to dazzle; sheen, i.e. whiteness; white.
from the same as צַחַר; whiteness; Tsochar, the name of a Hittite and of an Israelite; Zohar. Compare יִצְחַר.
from the same as צַחַר; white; white.
from צָוָה; a ship (as a fixture); ship.
from the same as צוֹבָא; station; Tsiba, an Israelite; Ziba.

from a form of צוּד and meaning the same; the chase; also game (thus taken); (generally) lunch (especially for a journey); [idiom] catcheth, food, [idiom] hunter, (that which he took in) hunting, venison, victuals.
from the same as צַיִד; a huntsman; hunter.
or צֵדָה; feminine of צַיִד; food; meat, provision, venison, victuals.
or צִידֹן; from צוּד in the sense of catching fish; fishery; Tsidon, the name of a son of Canaan, and of a place in Palestine; Sidon, Zidon.
patrial from צִידוֹן; a Tsidonian or inhabitant of Tsidon; Sidonian, of Sidon, Zidonian.
from an unused root meaning to parch; aridity; concretely, a desert; barren, drought, dry (land, place), solitary place, wilderness.
from the same as צִיָּה; a desert; dry place.
lemma צִיוּן missing dagesh, corrected to צִיּוּן; from the same as צִיָּה in the sense of conspicuousness (compare נָצַח); a monumental or guiding pillar; sign, title, waymark.
the same (regularly) as צִיּוּןlemma צִיוּן missing dagesh, corrected to צִיּוּן; Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem; Zion.
or צִחָא; as if feminine of צִחֶה; drought; Tsicha, the name of two Nethinim; Ziha.
from the same as צִיָּה; a desert-dweller, i.e. nomad or wild beast; wild beast of the desert, that dwell in (inhabiting) the wilderness.
from an unused root meaning to confine; the pillory; stocks.
from צָעַר; small; Tsior, a place in Palestine; Zior.
or צִץ; from צוּץ; properly, glistening, i.e. a burnished plate; also a flower (as bright-colored); a wing (as gleaming in the air); blossom, flower, plate, wing.
the same as צִיץ; bloom; Tsits, a place in Palestine; Ziz.
feminine of צִיץ; a flower; flower.
feminine of צִיץ; a floral or wing-like projection, i.e. a forelock of hair, a tassel; fringe, lock.

from צוּר; a hinge (as pressed in turning); also a throe (as a phys. or mental pressure); also a herald or erranddoer (as constrained by the principal); ambassador, hinge, messenger, pain, pang, sorrow. Compare צִיר.
the same as צִיר; a form (of beauty; as if pressed out, i.e. carved); hence, an (idolatrous) image; beauty, idol.
a denominative from צִיר in the sense of ambassador; to make an errand, i.e. betake oneself; make as if...had been ambassador.
from צָלַל; shade, whether literal or figurative; defence, shade(-ow).
(Aramaic) probably corresponding to צָלַע in the sense of bowing; pray; pray.
a primitive root; to roast; roast.
feminine of צֵל; Tsillah, an antediluvian woman; Zillah.
from צָלַל in the sense of rolling; a (round or flattened) cake; cake.

or צָלֵחַ; a primitive root; to push forward, in various senses (literal or figurative, transitive or intransitive); break out, come (mightily), go over, be good, be meet, be profitable, (cause to, effect, make to, send) prosper(-ity, -ous, -ously).
(Aramaic) corresponding to צָלַח; to advance (transitive or intransitive); promote, prosper.
from צָלַח; something protracted or flattened out, i.e. a platter; pan.
from צָלַח; something prolonged or tall, i.e. a vial or salt-cellar; cruse.
from צָלַח; something advanced or deep, i.e. a bowl; figuratively, the bosom; bosom, dish.
passive participle of צָלָה; roasted; roast.
a primitive root; properly, to tumble down, i.e. settle by awaving motion; sink. Compare צָלַל, צָלַל.
a primitive root (identical with through the idea of vibration); to tinkle, i.e. rattle together (as the ears in reddening with shame, or the teeth in chattering with fear); quiver, tingle.
a primitive root (identical with through the idea of hovering over (compare צֶלֶם)); to shade, as twilight or an opaque object; begin to be dark, shadowing.
from צָלַל; shade; shadow.
from צֵלֶל and the active participle of פָּנָה; shade-facing; Tselelponi, an Israelitess; Hazelelponi (including the article).
from an unused root meaning to shade; a phantom, i.e. (figuratively) illusion, resemblance; hence, a representative figure, especially an idol; image, vain shew.
(Aramaic) or צְלֶם; (Aramaic), corresponding to צֶלֶם; an idolatrous figure; form, image.
from צֶלֶם; shady; Tsalmon, the name of a place in Palestine and of an Israelite; Zalmon.
from צֵל and מָוֶת; shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity); shadow of death.
feminine of צַלְמָוֶת; shadiness; Tsalmonah, a place in the Desert; Zalmonah.
from צֵל and מָנַע; shade has been denied; Tsalmunna, a Midianite; Zalmunna.
a primitive root; probably to curve; used only as denominative from צֵלָע,; to limp (as if one-sided); halt.
from צָלַע; a limping or full (figuratively); adversity, halt(-ing).
the same as צֶלַע; Tsela, a place in Palestine; Zelah.

or (feminine) צַלְעָה; from צָלַע; a rib (as curved), literally (of the body) or figuratively (of a door, i.e. leaf); hence, a side, literally (of a person) or figuratively (of an object or the sky, i.e. quarter); architecturally, a (especially floor or ceiling) timber or plank (single or collective, i.e. a flooring); beam, board, chamber, corner, leaf, plank, rib, side (chamber).
from an unused root of unknown meaning; Tsalaph, an Israelite; Zalaph.
from the same as צָלָף and אֶחָד; Tselophchad, an Israelite; Zelophehad.
from צֵל and צַח; clear shade; Tseltsach, a place in Palestine; Zelzah.
from צָלַל reduplicated; a clatter, i.e. (abstractly) whirring (of wings); (concretely) a cricket; also a harpoon (as rattling), a cymbal (as clanging); cymbal, locust, shadowing, spear.
from an unused root meaning to split; fissure; Tselek, an Israelite; Zelek.
from the feminine of צֵל; shady; Tsillethai, the name of two Israelites; Zilthai.
a primitive root; to thirst (literally or figuratively); (be a-, suffer) thirst(-y).
from צָמֵא; thirsty (literally or figuratively); (that) thirst(-eth, -y).
from צָמֵא; thirst (literally or figuratively); thirst(-y).
feminine of צָמָא; thirst (figuratively, of libidinousnes); thirst.
from צָמֵא; a thirsty place, i.e. desert; drought, dry ground, thirsty land.
a primitive root; to link, i.e. gird; figuratively, to serve, (mentally) contrive; fasten, frame, join (self).
a yoke or team (i.e. pair); hence, an acre (i.e. day's task for a yoke of cattle to plough); acre, couple, [idiom] together, two (donkeys), yoke (of oxen).
from an unused root meaning to fasten on; a veil; locks.
from צָמַק; a cake of dried grapes; bunch (cluster) of raisins.

a primitive root; to sprout (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); bear, bring forth, (cause to, make to) bud (forth), (cause to, make to) grow (again, up), (cause to) spring (forth, up).
from צָמַח; a sprout (usually concrete), literal or figurative; branch, bud, that which (where) grew (upon), spring(-ing).
or צָמִד; from צָמַד; a bracelet or arm-clasp; generally, a lid; bracelet, covering.
from the same as צַמָּה; a noose (as fastening); figuratively, destruction; robber.
or צְמִתֻת; from צָמַת; excision, i.e. destruction; used only (adverbially) with prepositional prefix to extinction, i.e. perpetually; ever.
a primitive root; to dry up; dry.
from an unused root probably meaning to be shaggy; wool; wool(-len).
patrial from an unused name of a place in Palestine; a Tsemarite or branch of the Canaanites; Zemarite.
dual of צֶמֶר; double fleece; Tsemarajim, a place in Palestine; Zemaraim.
from the same as צֶמֶר; fleeciness, i.e. foliage; highest branch, top.
a primitive root; to extirpate (literally or figuratively); consume, cut off, destroy, vanish.
from an unused root meaning to prick; a crag; Tsin, a part of the Desert; Zin.
from an unused root meaning to be prickly; a thorn; hence, a cactus-hedge; thorn.
or צֹנֶה; for צֹאן; a flock; sheep.
feminine of צֵן; a hook (as pointed); also a (large) shield (as if guarding by prickliness); also cold (as piercing); buckler, cold, hook, shield, target.
from an unused root perhaps meaning to be hollow; a culvert; gutter, water-spout.
a primitive root; to alight; (transitive) to cause to descend, i.e. drive down; fasten, light (from off).
or צָנִן; from the same as צֵן; a thorn; thorn.
or צָנוֹף; or (feminine) צָנִיפָה; from צָנַף; a head-dress (i.e. piece of cloth wrapped around); diadem, hood, mitre.
a primitive root; to blast or shrink; withered.
probably for צַאֲנָן; Tsenan, a place near Palestine; Zenan.
a primitive root; to humiliate; humbly, lowly.
a primitive root; to wrap, i.e. roll or dress; be attired, [idiom] surely, violently turn.
from צָנַף; a ball; [idiom] toss.
from the same as צֵן; a vase (probably a vial tapering at the top); pot.
probably from the same as צִנּוּר; a tube; pipe.
a primitive root; to pace, i.e. step regularly; (upward) to mount; (along) to march; (down and causatively) to hurl; bring, go, march (through), run over.
from צַנְתָּרָה; a pace or regular step; pace, step.
feminine of צַעַד; a march; (concretely) an (ornamental) ankle-chain; going, ornament of the legs.

a primitive root; to tip over (for the purpose of spilling or pouring out), i.e. (figuratively) depopulate; by implication, to imprison or conquer; (reflexive) to lie down (for coitus); captive exile, travelling, (cause to) wander(-er).
from an unused root meaning to wrap over; a veil; vail.
or צָעוֹר; from צָעַר; little; (in number) few; (in age) young, (in value) ignoble; least, little (one), small (one), [phrase] young(-er, -est).
the same as צָעִיר; Tsair, a place in Idumaea; Zair.
feminine of צָעִיר; smallness (of age), i.e. juvenility; youth.
a primitive root; to load up (beasts), i.e. to migrate; be taken down.
of Egyptian derivation; Tsoan, a place in Egypt; Zoan.
or (dual) צַעֲנַיִם; plural from צָעַן; removals; Tsaanannim or Tsaanajim, a place in Palestine; Zaannannim, Zaanaim.
from an unused root meaning to bestrew with carvings; sculpture; image (work).
a primitive root; to shriek; (by implication) to proclaim (an assembly); [idiom] at all, call together, cry (out), gather (selves) (together).
from צָעַק; a shriek; cry(-ing).
a primitive root; to be small, i.e. (figuratively) ignoble; be brought low, little one, be small.
from צָעַר; little; Tsoar, a place East of the Jordan; Zoar.
a primitive root; to adhere; cleave.
a primitive root; properly, to lean forward, i.e. to peer into the distance; by implication, to observe, await; behold, espy, look up (well), wait for, (keep the) watch(-man).
a primitive root (probably identical with צָפָה through the idea of expansion in outlook, transferring to action); to sheet over (especially with metal); cover, overlay.
from צָפָה; an inundation (as covering); [idiom] swimmest.
or צְפִי; from צָפָה; observant; Tsepho or Tsephi, an Idumaean; Zephi, Zepho.
from צָפָה; encasement (with metal); covering, overlaying.
probably for צִפְיוֹן; Tsephon, an Israelite; Zephon.
or צָפֹן; from צָפַן; properly, hidden, i.e. dark; used only of the north as aquarter (gloomy and unknown); north(-ern, side, -ward, wind).
the same as צָפוֹן; boreal; Tsaphon, a place in Palestine; Zaphon.
from צָפוֹן; northern; northern.
patronymically from צְפוֹן; a Tsephonite, or (collectively) descendants of Tsephon; Zephonites.
from the same as צֶפַע; excrement (as protruded); dung.
or צִפֹּר; from צָפַר; a little bird (as hopping); bird, fowl, sparrow.
the same as צִפּוֹר; Tsippor, a Moabite; Zippor.
from an unused root meaning to expand; a saucer (as flat); cruse.
from צָפָה; watchfulness; watching.
from צָפָה; watch-tower; Tsiphjon, an Israelite; Ziphion. Compare צְפוֹן.
from the same as צַפַּחַת; a flat thin cake; wafer.
plural of active participle of צָפָה; watchers; Tsophim, a place East of the Jordan; Zophim.
from צָפַן; a treasure (as hidden); hid.
(Aramaic) corresponding to צָפִיר; a he-goat; he (goat).
from צָפַר; a male goat (as prancing); (he) goat.
feminine formed like צָפִיר; a crown (as encircling the head); also a turn of affairs (i.e. mishap); diadem, morning.
from צָפָה; a sentry; watchtower.

a primitive root; to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk; esteem, hide(-den one, self), lay up, lurk (be set) privily, (keep) secret(-ly, place).
or צְפַנְיָהוּ; from צָפַן and יָהּ; Jah has secreted; Tsephanjah, the name of four Israelites; Zephaniah.
of Egyptian derivation; Tsophnath-Paneach, Joseph's Egyptian name; Zaphnath-paaneah.
from an unused root meaning to extrude; a viper (as thrusting out the tongue, i.e. hissing); adder, cockatrice.
feminine from the same as צֶפַע; an outcast thing; issue.
a primitive root; to coo or chirp (as a bird); chatter, peep, whisper.
from צוּף; a willow (as growing in overflowed places); willow tree.
a primitive root; to skip about, i.e. return; depart early.
(Aramaic) corresponding to צִפּוֹר; a bird.; bird.
from צָפַר and a word elsewhere unused meaning a swamp; a marsh-leaper, i.e. frog; frog.
feminine of צִפּוֹר; bird; Tsipporah, Moses' wife; Zipporah.
from צָפַר (in the denominative sense (from צִפּוֹר) of scratching); properly, a claw, i.e. (human) nail; also the point of astyle (or pen, tipped with adamant); nail, point.
from צָפָה; watch-tower; Tsephath, a place in Palestine; Zephath.
from an unused root meaning to encircle; a capital of a column; chapiter.
the same as צְפַת; Tsephathah, a place in Palestine; Zephathah.
or צִיקלַג; (1 Chronicles 12:1,20), of uncertain derivation; Tsiklag or Tsikelag, a place in Palestine; Ziklag.
from an unused root meaning to wind; a sack (as tied at the mouth); husk.

or צָר; from צָרַר; compare as in צֹר; narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding); adversary, afflicted(-tion), anguish, close, distress, enemy, flint, foe, narrow, small, sorrow, strait, tribulation, trouble.
from צָרַר; rock; Tser, a place in Palestine; Zer.
from צוּר; a stone (as if pressed hard or to a point); (by implication, of use) a knife; flint, sharp stone.
or צוֹר; the same as צֹר; a rock; Tsor, a place in Palestine; Tyre, Tyrus.
a primitive root; to burn; burn.
from צוּעָר; conflagration (of fire or disease); burning, inflammation.
or צְרֵדָתָה; apparently from an unused root meaning to pierce; puncture; Tseredah, a place in Palestine; Zereda, Zeredathah.
feminine of צַר; tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:; adversary, adversity, affliction, anguish, distress, tribulation, trouble.
feminine passive participle from the same as צְרִי; wounded; Tserujah, an Israelitess; Zeruiah.
feminine passive participle of צָרַע; leprous; Tseruah, an Israelitess; Zeruah.
or (shorter) צְרֹר; from צָרַר; a parcel (as packed up); also a kernel or particle (as if a package); bag, [idiom] bendeth, bundle, least grain, small stone.
a primitive root; to be clear (in tone, i.e. shrill), i.e. to whoop; cry, roar.
the same as צְרִי; Tseri, an Israelite; Zeri. Compare יִצְרִי.
or צֳרִי; from an unused root meaning to crack (as by pressure), hence, to leak; distillation, i.e. balsam; balm.
patrial from צֹר; a Tsorite or inhabitant of Tsor (i.e. Syrian); (man) of Tyre.
from צָרַח in the sense of clearness of vision; a citadel; high place, hold.
from an unused root meaning to need; need; need.
a primitive root; to scourge, i.e. (intransitive and figurative) to be stricken with leprosy; leper, leprous.
from צָרַע; a wasp (as stinging); hornet.
apparently another form for צִרְעָה; Tsorah, a place in Palestine; Zareah, Zorah, Zoreah.
or צׇרְעָתִי; patrial from צׇרְעָה; a Tsorite or Tsorathite, i.e. inhabitants of Tsorah; Zorites, Zareathites, Zorathites.
from צָרַע; leprosy; leprosy.
a primitive root; to fuse (metal), i.e. refine (literally or figuratively); cast, (re-) fine(-er), founder, goldsmith, melt, pure, purge away, try.
from צָרַף; refiner; Tsorephi (with the article), an Israelite; goldsmith's.
from צָרַף; refinement; Tsarephath, a place in Palestine; Zarephath.

a primitive root; to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive; adversary, (be in) afflict(-ion), beseige, bind (up), (be in, bring) distress, enemy, narrower, oppress, pangs, shut up, be in a strait (trouble), vex.
apparently by erroneous transcription for צְרֵדָה; Tsererah for Tseredah; Zererath.
perhaps from צָהַר; splendor; Tsereth, an Israelite; Zereth.
from the same as צֶרֶת and שַׁחַר with the article interposed; splendor of the dawn; Tsereth-hash-Shachar, a place in Palestine; Zareth-shahar.
perhaps for צְרֵדָה; Tsarethan, a place in Palestine; Zarthan. q
or קִיא; from קוֹא; vomit; vomit.
from קוֹא; probably the pelican (from vomiting); cormorant.
from קָבַב; a hollow, i.e. vessel used as a (dry) measure; cab.
a primitive root; to scoop out, i.e. (figuratively) to malign or execrate (i.e. stab with words); [idiom] at all, curse.
from קָבַב; the paunch (as a cavity) or first stomach of ruminants; maw.
from קָבַב; the abdomen (as a cavity); belly.
from קָבַב; a pavilion (as a domed cavity); tent.
from קָבַץ; a throng; company.
or קְבֻרָה; feminine passive participle of קָבַר; sepulture; (concretely) a sepulchre; burial, burying place, grave, sepulchre.
a primitive root; to admit, i.e. take (literally or figuratively); choose, (take) hold, receive, (under-) take.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קָבַל; to acquire; receive, take.

(Aramaic) or קֳבֵל; (Aramaic), (corresponding to קָבָל; (adverbially) in front of; usually (with other particles) on account of, so as, since, hence; [phrase] according to, [phrase] as, [phrase] because, before, [phrase] for this cause, [phrase] forasmuch as, [phrase] by this means, over against, by reason of, [phrase] that, [phrase] therefore, [phrase] though, [phrase] wherefore.
from קָבַל in the sense of confronting (as standing opposite in order to receive); a battering-ram; war.
from קָבַל in the sense of opposite (see קֹבֶל); the presence, i.e. (adverbially) in front of; before.
a primitive root; to cover, i.e. (figuratively) defraud; rob, spoil.
from קָבַע; a goblet (as deep like a cover); dregs.
a primitive root; to grasp, i.e. collect; assemble (selves), gather (bring) (together, selves together, up), heap, resort, [idiom] surely, take up.
from קָבַץ and אֵל; God has gathered; Kabtseel, a place in Palestine; Kabzeel. Compare יְקַבְצְאֵל.
feminine passive participle of קָבַץ; a hoard; [idiom] gather.
dual from קָבַץ; a double heap; Kibtsajim, a place in Palestine; Kibzaim.
a primitive root; to inter; [idiom] in any wise, bury(-ier).
or (feminine) קִבְרָה; from קָבַר; a sepulchre; burying place, grave, sepulchre.
from the feminine plural of קֶבֶר and תַּאֲוָה with the article interposed; graves of the longing; Kibroth-hat-Taavh, a place in the Desert; Kibroth-hattaavah.
a primitive root; to shrivel up, i.e. contract or bend the body (or neck) in deference; bow (down) (the) head, stoop.
from קָדַד; cassia bark (as in shrivelled rolls); cassia.
passive participle of קָדַם; a pristine hero; ancient.
or קָדֹשׁ; from קָדַשׁ; sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary; holy (One), saint.
a primitive root to inflame; to inflame; burn, kindle.
from קָדַח; inflammation, i.e. febrile disease; burning ague, fever.
or קָדִם; from קָדַם; the fore or front part; hence (by orientation) the East (often adverbially, eastward, for brevity the east wind); east(-ward, wind).
(Aramaic) corresponding to קָדוֹשׁ.; {sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary}; holy (One), saint.
a primitive root; to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help); come (go, (flee)) before, [phrase] disappoint, meet, prevent.

or קֵדְמָה; from קָדַם; the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward); aforetime, ancient (time), before, east (end, part, side, -ward), eternal, [idiom] ever(-lasting), forward, old, past. Compare קִדְמָה.
(Aramaic) or קְדָם; (Aramaic) (Daniel 7:13), corresponding to קֶדֶם; before; before, [idiom] from, [idiom] I (thought), [idiom] me, [phrase] of, [idiom] it pleased, presence.
feminine of קֶדֶם; the forward part (or relatively) East (often adverbially, on the east or in front); east(-ward).
from קָדַם; priority (in time); also used adverbially (before); afore, antiquity, former (old) estate.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קַדְמָה; former time; afore(-time), ago.
lemma קדְמָה missing vowel, corrected to קֵדְמָה; from קָדַם; precedence; Kedemah, a son of Ishmael; Kedemah.
from קָדַם; eastern; east.
or קַדְמֹנִי; from קַדְמוֹן; (of time) anterior or (of place) oriental; ancient, they that went before, east, (thing of) old.
from קָדַם; beginnings; Kedemoth, a place in eastern Palestine; Kedemoth.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to קָדַם; first; first.
from קֶדֶם and אֵל; presence of God; Kadmiel, the name of three Israelites; Kadmiel.
the same as קַדְמוֹנִי; ancient, i.e. aboriginal; Kadmonite (collectively), the name of a tribe in Palestine; Kadmonites.
from קָדַד; the crown of the head (as the part most bowed); crown (of the head), pate, scalp, top of the head.
a primitive root; to be ashy, i.e. darkcolored; by implication, to mourn (in sackcloth or sordid garments); be black(-ish), be (make) dark(-en), [idiom] heavily, (cause to) mourn.
from קָדַר; dusky (of the skin or the tent); Kedar, a son of Ishmael; also (collectively) Bedouin (as his descendants or representatives); Kedar.
from קָדַר; dusky place; Kidron, a brook near Jerusalem; Kidron.
from קָדַר; duskiness; blackness.
adverb from קָדַר; blackish ones (i.e. in sackcloth); used adverbially, in mourning weeds; mournfully.

a primitive root; to be (causatively, make, pronounce or observe as) clean (ceremonially or morally); appoint, bid, consecrate, dedicate, defile, hallow, (be, keep) holy(-er, place), keep, prepare, proclaim, purify, sanctify(-ied one, self), [idiom] wholly.
from קָדַשׁ; a sanctum; Kedesh, the name of four places in Palestine; Kedesh.

from קָדַשׁ; a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity; consecrated (thing), dedicated (thing), hallowed (thing), holiness, ([idiom] most) holy ([idiom] day, portion, thing), saint, sanctuary.
from קָדַשׁ; a (quasi) sacred person, i.e. (technically) a (male) devotee (by prostitution) to licentious idolatry; sodomite, unclean.
the same as קָדֵשׁ; sanctuary; Kadesh, a place in the Desert; Kadesh. Compare קָדֵשׁ בַּרְנֵעַ.

from the same as קָדֵשׁ and an otherwise unused word (apparently compounded of a correspondent to בַּר and a derivative of נוּעַ) meaning desert of a fugitive; Kadesh of (the) Wilderness of Wandering; Kadesh-Barnea, a place in the Desert; Kadeshbarnea.
feminine of קָדֵשׁ; a female devotee (i.e. prostitute); harlot, whore.
a primitive root; to be dull; be set on edge, be blunt.
a primitive root; to convoke; assemble (selves) (together), gather (selves) (together).
from קָהַל; assemblage (usually concretely); assembly, company, congregation, multitude.
from קָהַל; an assemblage; assembly, congregation.
feminine of active participle from קָהַל; a (female) assembler (i.e. lecturer); abstractly, preaching (used as a 'nom de plume', Koheleth); preacher.
from קָהַל; convocation; Kehelathah, a place in the Desert; Kehelathah.
from an unused root meaning to ally oneself; allied; Kehath, an Israelite; Kohath.
patronymically from קְהָת; a Kohathite (collectively) or descendants of Kehath; Kohathites.

or קָו; from קָוָה (compare קָוֶה); a cord (as connecting), especially formeasuring; figuratively, a rule; also a rim, a musical string or accord; line. Compare קַו־קַוlemma קַו־קַי yod, corrected to קַו־קַו.
or קָיָה; (Jeremiah 25:27), a primitive root; to vomit; spue (out), vomit (out, up, up again).
a form collateral to כּוֹבַע; a helmet; helmet.
a primitive root; to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect; gather (together), look, patiently, tarry, wait (for, on, upon).
from קָוָה; a (measuring) cord (as if for binding); line.
a primitive root; properly, to cut off, i.e. (figuratively) detest; begrieved, loathe self.

or קֹל; from an unused root meaning to call aloud; a voice or sound; [phrase] aloud, bleating, crackling, cry ([phrase] out), fame, lightness, lowing, noise, [phrase] hold peace, (pro-) claim, proclamation, [phrase] sing, sound, [phrase] spark, thunder(-ing), voice, [phrase] yell.
from קוֹל and יָהּ; voice of Jah; Kolajah, the name of two Israelites; Kolaiah.

a primitive root; to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative); abide, accomplish, [idiom] be clearer, confirm, continue, decree, [idiom] be dim, endure, [idiom] enemy, enjoin, get up, make good, help, hold, (help to) lift up (again), make, [idiom] but newly, ordain, perform, pitch, raise (up), rear (up), remain, (a-) rise (up) (again, against), rouse up, set (up), (e-) stablish, (make to) stand (up), stir up, strengthen, succeed, (as-, make) sure(-ly), (be) up(-hold, -rising).
(Aramaic) corresponding to קוּם; {to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)}; appoint, establish, make, raise up self, (a-) rise (up), (make to) stand, set (up).
from קוּם; height; [idiom] along, height, high, stature, tall.
from קוּם; elevation, i.e. (adverbially) erectly (figuratively); upright.
a primitive root; to strike a musical note, i.e. chant or wail (at a funeral); lament, mourning woman.
probably from קוּץ in the original sense of cutting off; curtailment; Koa, a region of Babylon; Koa.
or קֹף; of foreign origin,; a monkey; ape.
a primitive root; to clip off; used only as denominative from קַיִץ; to spend the harvest season; summer.
a primitive root (identical with through the idea of severing oneself from (compare קוּט)); to be (causatively, make) disgusted or anxious; abhor, be distressed, be grieved, loathe, vex, be weary.
a primitive root (identical with through the idea of abruptness in starting up from sleep (compare יָקַץ)); to awake (literally or figuratively); arise, (be) (a-) wake, watch.
or קֹץ; from קוּץ (in the sense of pricking); a thorn; thorn.
the same as קוֹץ; Kots, the name of two Israelites; Koz, Hakkoz (including the article).
feminine passive participle of קוּץ in its original sense; a forelock (as shorn); lock.
lemma קַו־קַי yod, corrected to קַו־קַו; from קַו (in the sense of a fastening); stalwart; [idiom] meted out.
a primitive root; also denominative from קִיר; to trench; by implication, to throw forth;  to wall up, whether literal (to build a wall) or figurative (to estop); break down, cast out, destroy, dig.
from קוּר; (only plural) trenches, i.e. a web (as if so formed); web.
or קֹרֵא; (1 Chronicles 26:1), active participle of קָרָא; crier; Kore, the name of two Israelites; Kore.
or קֹרָה; from קוּר; a rafter (forming trenches as it were); by implication, a roof; beam, roof.
a primitive root; to bend; used only as denominative for יָקֹשׁ,; to set a trap; lay a snare.
from the passive participle of קוֹשׁ and יָהּ; entrapped of Jah; Kushajah, an Israelite; Kushaiah.
from קָטַט in the sense of abbreviation; a little, i.e. (adverbially) merely; very.
from an unused root meaning to cut off; ruin; destroying, destruction.
from the same as קֶטֶב; extermination; destruction.
from קָטַר; perfume; incense.
feminine passive participle of קָטַר; perfumed; Keturah, a wife of Abraham; Keturah.
a primitive root; to clip off, i.e. (figuratively) destroy; be cut off.
a primitive root; properly, to cut off, i.e. (figuratively) put to death; kill, slay.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קָטַל; to kill; slay.
from קָטַל; a violent death; slaughter.
a primitive root (rather denominative from קָטָן); to diminish, i.e. be (causatively, make) diminutive or (figuratively) of no account; be a (make) small (thing), be not worthy.
from קָטֹן; a pettiness, i.e. the little finger; little finger.

or קָטֹן; from קוּט; abbreviated, i.e. diminutive, literally (in quantity, size or number) or figuratively (in age or importance); least, less(-er), little (one), small(-est, one, quantity, thing), young(-er, -est).
the same as קָטָן; small; Katan, an Israelite; Hakkatan (including the article).
a primitive root; to strip off; crop off, cut down (up), pluck.

a primitive root (identical with through the idea of fumigation in a close place and perhaps thus driving out the occupants); to smoke, i.e. turn into fragrance by fire (especially as an act of worship); burn (incense, sacrifice) (upon), (altar for) incense, kindle, offer (incense, a sacrifice).
a primitive root; to inclose; join.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to קָטַר; a knot (as tied up), i.e. (figuratively) a riddle; also a vertebra (as if a knot); doubt, joint.
from קָטַר; perfume; incense.
from קָטַר; fumigative; Kitron, a place in Palestine; Kitron.
from קָטַר; a fumigation; (sweet) incense, perfume.
from קָטָן; littleness; Kattath, a place in Palestine; Kattath.
a primitive root; to vomit; spue.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קַיִץ; harvest; summer.
or קִיטֹר; from קָטַר; a fume, i.e. cloud; smoke, vapour.
from קוּם; an opponent (as rising against one), i.e. (collectively) enemies; substance.
(Aramaic) from קוּם; an edict (as arising in law); decree, statute.
(Aramaic) from קוּם; permanent (as rising firmly); stedfast, sure.
from קוּם; an arising; rising up.
from קוּן in the original sense of fixity; a lance (as striking fast); spear.
the same as קַיִן (with a play upon the affinity to קָנָה); Kajin, the name of the first child, also of a place in Palestine, and of an Oriental tribe; Cain, Kenite(-s).
from קוּן; a dirge (as accompanied by beating the breasts or on instruments); lamentation.
the same as קִינָה; Kinah, a place in Palestine; Kinah.
or קִינִי; (1 Chronicles 2:55), patronymic from קַיִן; a Kenite or member of the tribe of Kajin; Kenite.
from the same as קֵן; fixed; Kenan, an antediluvian; Cainan, Kenan.
from קוּץ; harvest (as the crop), whether the product (grain or fruit) or the (dry) season; summer (fruit, house).
from קוּץ; terminal; out-(utter-) most.
perhaps from קָיָה; the gourd (as nauseous); gourd.
from קָלוֹן; intense disgrace; shameful spewing.
or קִר; (Isaiah 22:5), or (feminine) קִירָה; from קוּר; a wall (as built in a trench); [phrase] mason, side, town, [idiom] very, wall.
the same as קִיר; fortress; Kir, a place in Assyrian; also one in Moab; Kir. Compare קִיר חֶרֶשׂ.
or (feminine of the latter word) קִיר חֲרֶשֶׂת; from קִיר and חֶרֶשׂ; fortress of earthenware; Kir-Cheres or Kir-Chareseth, a place in Moab; Kir-haraseth, Kir-hareseth, Kirharesh, Kir-heres.
or קֵרֹס; from the same as קַרְסֹל; ankled; Keros, one of the Nethinim; Keros.
from קוֹשׁ; a bow; Kish, the name of five Israelites; Kish.
from קוֹשׁ; winding; Kishon, a river of Palestine; Kishon, Kison.
from קוֹשׁ; bowed; Kishi, an Israelite; Kishi.
(Aramaic) of Greek origin; a lyre; harp.
contracted from קָלַל; light; (by implication) rapid (also adverbial); light, swift(-ly).
(Aramaic) corresponding to קוֹל; {a voice or sound}; sound, voice.
a primitive root (rather identical with קָלָה through the idea of shrinkage by heat); to toast, i.e. scorch partially or slowly; dried, loathsome, parch, roast.
a primitive root; to be light (as implied in rapid motion), but figuratively, only (be (causatively, hold) in contempt); base, contemn, despise, lightly esteem, set light, seem vile.
for קָהַל; to assemble; gather together.
from קָלָה; disgrace; (by implication) the pudenda; confusion, dishonour, ignominy, reproach, shame.
apparently but a form for צַלַּחַת; a kettle; caldron.
a primitive root; to maim; lacking in his parts.
or קָלִיא; from קָלָה; roasted ears of grain; parched corn.
from קָלַל; frivolous; Kallai, an Israelite; Kallai.
from קָלָה; insignificance; Kelajah, an Israelite; Kelaiah.
from קָלַט; maiming; Kelita, the name of three Israelites; Kelita.

a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.); abate, make bright, bring into contempt, (ac-) curse, despise, (be) ease(-y, -ier), (be a, make, make somewhat, move, seem a, set) light(-en, -er, -ly, -ly afflict, -ly esteem, thing), [idiom] slight(-ly), be swift(-er), (be, be more, make, re-) vile, whet.
from קָלַל; brightened (as if sharpened); burnished, polished.
from קָלַל; vilification; (ac-) curse(-d, -ing).
a primitive root; to disparage, i.e. ridicule; mock, scoff, scorn.
from קָלַס; a laughing-stock; derision.
intensive from קָלַס; ridicule; mocking.
a primitive root; to sling; also to carve (as if a circular motion, or into light forms); carve, sling (out).
from קָלַע; a sling; also a (door) screen (as if slung across), or the valve (of the door) itself; hanging, leaf, sling.
intensive from קָלַע; a slinger; slinger.
from קָלַל; insubstantial; light.
from an unused root meaning to prick; a prong, i.e. hay-fork; fork.
feminine of active participle of קוּם; something that rises, i.e. a stalk of grain; (standing) corn, grown up, stalk.
from קוּם and אֵל; raised of God; Kemuel, the name of a relative of Abraham, and of two Israelites; Kemuel.
from קוּם; an elevation; Kamon, a place East of the Jordan; Camon.
or קִימוֹשׁ; from an unused root meaning to sting; a prickly plant; nettle. Compare קִמָּשׁוֹן.
from an unused root probably meaning to grind; flour; flour, meal.
a primitive root; to pluck, i.e. destroy; cut down, fill with wrinkles.
a primitive root; to wither; hew down, wither.
a primitive root; to grasp with the hand; take an handful.
from קָמַץ; a grasp, i.e. handful; handful.
from the same as קִמּוֹשׁ; a prickly plant; thorn.
contracted from קָנַן; a nest (as fixed), sometimes including the nestlings; figuratively, a chamber or dwelling; nest, room.
a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) zealous, i.e. (in a bad sense) jealous or envious; (be) envy(-ious), be (move to, provoke to) jealous(-y), [idiom] very, (be) zeal(-ous).
(Aramaic) corresponding to קָנָה; to purchase; buy.
from קָנָא; jealous; jealous. Compare קַנּוֹא.
from קָנָא; jealousy or envy; envy(-ied), jealousy, [idiom] sake, zeal.

a primitive root; to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own; attain, buy(-er), teach to keep cattle, get, provoke to jealousy, possess(-or), purchase, recover, redeem, [idiom] surely, [idiom] verily.

from קָנָה; a reed (as erect); by resemblance a rod (especially for measuring), shaft, tube, stem, the radius (of the arm), beam (of a steelyard); balance, bone, branch, calamus, cane, reed, [idiom] spearman, stalk.
feminine of קָנֶה; reediness; Kanah, the name of a stream and of a place in Palestine; Kanah.
for קַנָּא; jealous or angry; jealous.
probably from an unused root meaning to hunt; hunter; Kenaz, the name of an Edomite and of two Israelites; Kenaz.
patronymic from קְנַז,; a Kenizzite or descendant of Kenaz; Kenezite, Kenizzites.
from קָנָה; creation, i.e. (concretely) creatures; also acquisition, purchase, wealth; getting, goods, [idiom] with money, riches, substance.
from an unused root (meaning to erect); cinnamon bark (as in upright rolls); cinnamon.
a primitive root; to erect; but used only as denominative from קֵן; to nestle, i.e. build or occupy as anest; make...nest.
from an unused root probably meaning to wrench; perversion; end.
from קָנָה; possession; Kenath, a place East of the Jordan; Kenath.
a primitive root; properly, to distribute, i.e. determine by lot or magical scroll; by implication, to divine; divine(-r, -ation), prudent, soothsayer, use (divination).
from קָסַם; a lot; also divination (including its fee), oracle; (reward of) divination, divine sentence, witchcraft.
a primitive root; to lop off; cut off.
from the same as כּוֹס (or as קָשָׁה); properly, a cup, i.e. an ink-stand; inkhorn.
perhaps from קָלַע in the sense of enclosing; citadel; Keilah, a place in Palestine; Keilah.
from the same as קוֹעַ; an incision or gash; [phrase] mark.
probably from קָרַע; a bowl (as cut out hollow); charger, dish.
a primitive root; to shrink, i.e. thicken (as unracked wine, curdled milk, clouded sky, frozen water); congeal, curdle, dark, settle.
a primitive root; to contract, i.e. roll together; cut off.
from קָפַד; shrinking, i.e., terror; destruction.
or קִפֹּדlemma קִכֹּד kaf, corrected to קִפֹּד; from קָפַד; a species of bird, perhaps the bittern (from its contracted form); bittern.
from an unused root meaning to contract, i.e.; spring forward; an arrow-snake (as darting on its prey); great owl.
a primitive root; to draw together, i.e. close; by implication, to leap (by contracting the limbs); specifically, to die (from gathering up the feet); shut (up), skip, stop, take out of the way.
contracted from קָצַץ; an extremity; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) after; [phrase] after, (utmost) border, end, (in-) finite, [idiom] process.
a primitive root; to clip, or (generally) chop; cut down, shorn.
from קָצַב; shape (as if cut out); base (as if there cut off); bottom, size.
a primitive root; to cut off; (figuratively) to destroy; (partially) to scrape off; cut off, cut short, scrape (off).

or (negative only) קֵצֶה; from קָצָה; (used in a great variety of applications and idioms; compare קֵץ); an extremity; [idiom] after, border, brim, brink, edge, end, (in-) finite, frontier, outmost coast, quarter, shore, (out-) side, [idiom] some, ut(-ter-) most (part).
feminine of קָצֶה; (used like קָצֶה); a termination; coast, corner, (selv-) edge, lowest, (uttermost) participle
and (feminine) קִצְוָה; from קָצָה; (used like קָצֶה, but with less variety); a limit; end, edge, uttermost participle
from an unused root apparently meaning to incise; fennelflower (from its pungency); fitches.
from קָצָה in the sense of determining; a magistrate (as deciding) or other leader; captain, guide, prince, ruler. Compare עֵת קָצִין.
from קָצַע; cassia (as peeled; plural the bark); cassia.
the same as קְצִיעָה; Ketsiah, a daughter of Job; Kezia.
from קָצַץ; abrupt; Keziz, a valley in Palestine; Keziz.
from קָצַר; severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage); bough, branch, harvest (man).
a primitive root; to strip off, i.e. (partially) scrape; by implication, to segregate (as an angle); cause to scrape, corner.
a primitive root; to crack off, i.e. (figuratively) burst out in rage; (be) anger(-ry), displease, fret self, (provoke to) wrath (come), be wroth.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קָצַף; to become enraged; be furious.
(Aramaic) from קְצַף; rage; wrath.
from קָצַף; a splinter (as chipped off); figuratively, rage or strife; foam, indignation, [idiom] sore, wrath.
from קָצַף; a fragment; bark(-ed).
a primitive root; to chop off (literally or figuratively); cut (asunder, in pieces, in sunder, off), [idiom] utmost.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קָצַץ; {to chop off (literally or figuratively)}; cut off.

a primitive root; to dock off, i.e. curtail (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to harvest (grass or grain); [idiom] at all, cut down, much discouraged, grieve, harvestman, lothe, mourn, reap(-er), (be, wax) short(-en, -er), straiten, trouble, vex.
from קָצַר; shortness (of spirit), i.e. impatience; anguish.
from קָצַר; short (whether in size, number, life, strength or temper); few, hasty, small, soon.
from קָצָה; a termination (literally or figuratively); also (by implication) a portion; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) after; end, part, [idiom] some.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קְצָת; {a termination (literally or figuratively); also (by implication) a portion; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) after}; end, partly.
contracted from an unused root meaning to chill; cool; figuratively, quiet; cold, excellent (from the margin).
from the same as קַר; cold; cold.

a primitive root (rather identical with קָרָא through the idea of accosting a person met); to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications); bewray (self), that are bidden, call (for, forth, self, upon), cry (unto), (be) famous, guest, invite, mention, (give) name, preach, (make) proclaim(-ation), pronounce, publish, read, renowned, say.
a primitive root; to encounter, whether accidentally or in a hostile manner; befall, (by) chance, (cause to) come (upon), fall out, happen, meet.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קָרָא; {to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)}; call, cry, read.
properly, active participle of קָרָא; a caller, i.e. partridge (from its cry); partridge. See also קוֹרֵא.
from קָרָא; an encountering, accidental, friendly or hostile (also adverbially, opposite); [idiom] against (he come), help, meet, seek, [idiom] to, [idiom] in the way.

a primitive root; to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose; (cause to) approach, (cause to) bring (forth, near), (cause to) come (near, nigh), (cause to) draw near (nigh), go (near), be at hand, join, be near, offer, present, produce, make ready, stand, take.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קָרַב; {to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose}; approach, come (near, nigh), draw near.
from קָרַב; hostile encounter; battle, war.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קְרָב; {hostile encounter}; war.

from קָרַב; properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition); [idiom] among, [idiom] before, bowels, [idiom] unto charge, [phrase] eat (up), [idiom] heart, [idiom] him, [idiom] in, inward ([idiom] -ly, part, -s, thought), midst, [phrase] out of, purtenance, [idiom] therein, [idiom] through, [idiom] within self.
from קָרַב; near; approach, come (near, nigh), draw near.
from קָרַב; approach; approaching, draw near.
or קֻרְבָּן; from קָרַב; something brought near the altar, i.e. a sacrificial present; oblation, that is offered, offering.
perhaps from קָדַם in the sense of striking upon; an axe; ax.
feminine of קַר; coolness; cold.

a primitive root; to light upon (chiefly by accident); causatively, to bring about; specifically, to impose timbers (for roof or floor); appoint, lay (make) beams, befall, bring, come (to pass unto), floor, (hap) was, happen (unto), meet, send good speed.
from קָרָה; an (unfortunate) occurrence, i.e. some accidental (ceremonial) disqualification; uncleanness that chanceth.

or קָרֹב; from קָרַב; near (in place, kindred or time); allied, approach, at hand, [phrase] any of kin, kinsfold(-sman), (that is) near (of kin), neighbour, (that is) next, (them that come) nigh (at hand), more ready, short(-ly).
a primitive root; to depilate; make (self) bald.
or קֹרַח; from קָרַח; ice (as if bald, i.e. smooth); hence, hail; by resemblance, rock crystal; crystal, frost, ice.
from קָרַח; ice; Korach, the name of two Edomites and three Israelites; Korah.
from קָרַח; bald (on the back of the head); bald (head).
from קָרַח; bald; Kareach, an Israelite; Careah, Kareah.
or קׇרְחָא; (Ezekiel 27:31), from קָרַח; baldness; bald(-ness), [idiom] utterly.
patronymic from קֹרַח; a Korchite (collectively) or descendants of Korach; Korahite, Korathite, sons of Kore, Korhite.
from קָרַח; a bald spot (on the back of the head); figuratively, a threadbare spot (on the back side of the cloth); bald head, bare within.
from קָרָה; hostile encounter; contrary.
from קָרָא; called, i.e. select; famous, renowned.
(Aramaic) or קִרְיָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to קִרְיָה; {building; a city}; city.
from קָרָא; a proclamation; preaching.
from קָרָה in the sense of flooring, i.e.; building; a city; city.
plural of קִרְיָה; buildings; Kerioth, the name of two places in Palestine; Kerioth, Kirioth.

or (with the article interposed) קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע; (Nehemiah 11:25), from קִרְיָה and אַרְבַּע or אַרְבַּע; city of Arba, or city of the four (giants); Kirjath-Arba or Kirjath-ha-Arba, a place in Palestine; Kirjath-arba.
from קִרְיָה and בַּעַל; city of Baal; Kirjath-Baal, a place in Palestine; Kirjathbaal.
from קִרְיָה and the feminine plural of חוּץ; city of streets; Kirjath-Chutsoth, a place in Moab; Kirjath-huzoth.
dual of קִרְיָה; double city; Kirjathaim, the name of two placed in Palestine; Kiriathaim, Kirjathaim.

or (Jeremiah 26:20) with the article interposed; or (Joshua 18:28) simply the former part of the word; or קִרְיַת עָרִים; from קִרְיָה and the plural of יַעַר or עִיר; city of forests, or city of towns; Kirjath-Jearim or Kirjath-Arim, a place in Palestine; Kirjath, Kirjath-jearim, Kirjath-arim.

or קִרְיַת סֵפֶר; from קִרְיָה and a simpler feminine from the same as סַנְסִן, or (for the latter name) סֵפֶר; city of branches, or of a book; Kirjath-Sannah or Kirjath-Sepher, a place in Palestine; Kirjath-sannah, Kirjath-sepher.
a primitive root; to cover; cover.
a primitive root; to push or gore; used only as denominative from קֶרֶן,; to shoot out horns; figuratively, rays; have horns, shine.

from קָרַן; a horn (as projecting); by implication, a flask, cornet; by resemblance. an elephant's tooth (i.e. ivory), a corner (of the altar), a peak (of a mountain), a ray (of light); figuratively, power; [idiom] hill, horn.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קֶרֶן; a horn (literally or for sound); horn, cornet.
from קֶרֶן and פּוּךְ; horn of cosmetic; Keren-hap-Puk, one of Job's daughters; Keren-happuch.
a primitive root; properly, to protrude; used only as denominative from קֶרֶס (for alliteration with קָרַע),; to hunch, i.e. be hump-backed; stoop.
from קָרַס; a knob or belaying-pin (from its swelling form); tache.
from קָרַס; an ankle (as a protuberance or joint); foot.
a primitive root; to rend, literally or figuratively (revile, paint the eyes, as if enlarging them); cut out, rend, [idiom] surely, tear.
from קָרַע; a rag; piece, rag.

a primitive root; to pinch, i.e. (partially) to bite the lips, blink the eyes (as a gesture of malice), or (fully) to squeeze off (a piece of clay in order to mould a vessel from it); form, move, wink.
(Aramaic) corresponding to קֶרֶץ in the sense of a bit (to 'eat the morsels of' any one, i.e.; chew him up (figuratively) by slander; [phrase] accuse.
from קָרַץ; extirpation (as if by constriction); destruction.
from קָרַע; floor (as if a pavement of pieces or tesseroe), of abuilding or the sea; bottom, ([idiom] one side of the) floor.
the same as קַרְקַע; ground-floor; Karka (with the article prefix), a place in Palestine; Karkaa.
from קוּר; foundation; Karkor, a place East of the Jordan; Karkor.
from an unused root meaning to split off; a slab or plank; by implication, a deck of aship; bench, board.
from קָרָה in the sense of building; a city; city.
from קֶרֶת; city; Kartah, a place in Palestine; Kartah.
lemma קַרְתּן missing vowel, corrected to קַרְתָּן; from קֶרֶת; city-plot; Kartan, a place in Palestine; Kartan.
from קָשַׁשׁ; straw (as dry); stubble.
from an unused root (meaning to be hard); a cucumber (from the difficulty of digestion); cucumber.
a primitive root; to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken; attend, (cause to) hear(-ken), give heed, incline, mark (well), regard.
from קָשַׁב; a hearkening; [idiom] diligently, hearing, much heed, that regarded.
or קַשֻּׁב; from קָשַׁב; hearkening; attent(-ive).
or קַשְׂוָה; from an unused root meaning to be round; a jug (from its shape); cover, cup.

a primitive root; properly, to be dense, i.e. tough or severe (in various applications); be cruel, be fiercer, make grievous, be ((ask a), be in, have, seem, would) hard(-en, (labour), -ly, thing), be sore, (be, make) stiff(-en, (-necked)).

from קָשָׁה; severe (in various applications); churlish, cruel, grievous, hard((-hearted), thing), heavy, [phrase] impudent, obstinate, prevailed, rough(-ly), sore, sorrowful, stiff(necked), stubborn, [phrase] in trouble.
(Aramaic) or קשֹׁט; (Aramaic), corresponding to קֹשֶׁט; fidelity; truth.
a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) unfeeling; harden.
or קֹשְׁטְ; from an unused root meaning to balance; equity (as evenly weighed), i.e. reality; truth.
from קָשָׁה; obstinacy; stubbornness.
from קְשִׁי; hard ground; Kishjon, a place in Palestine; Kishion, Keshon.
from an unused root (probably meaning to weigh out); an ingot (as definitely estimated and stamped for a coin); piece of money (silver).
by reduplication from an unused root meaning to shale off as bark; a scale (of a fish); hence a coat of mail (as composed of or covered with jointed plates of metal); mail, scale.
a primitive root; to tie, physically (gird, confine, compact) or mentally (in love, league); bind (up), (make a) conspire(-acy, -ator), join together, knit, stronger, work (treason).
from קָשַׁר; an (unlawful) alliance; confederacy, conspiracy, treason.
from קָשַׁר; an (ornamental) girdle (for women); attire, headband.
a primitive root; to become sapless through drought; used only as denominative from קַשׁ; to forage for straw, stubble or wood; figuratively, to assemble; gather (selves) (together).
from קָשָׁה in the original sense (of קוֹשׁ) of bending; a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris; [idiom] arch(-er), [phrase] arrow, bow(-man, -shot).
intensive (as denominative) from קֶשֶׁת; a bowman; [idiom] archer. r

a primitive root; to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative); advise self, appear, approve, behold, [idiom] certainly, consider, discern, (make to) enjoy, have experience, gaze, take heed, [idiom] indeed, [idiom] joyfully, lo, look (on, one another, one on another, one upon another, out, up, upon), mark, meet, [idiom] be near, perceive, present, provide, regard, (have) respect, (fore-, cause to, let) see(-r, -m, one another), shew (self), [idiom] sight of others, (e-) spy, stare, [idiom] surely, [idiom] think, view, visions.
from רָאָה; a bird of prey (probably the vulture, from its sharp sight); glede. Compare דָּאָה.
from רָאָה; seeing, i.e. experiencing; see.
active participle of רָאָה; a seer (as often rendered); but also (abstractly) a vision; vision.
for רֹאֶה; prophet; Roeh, an Israelite; Haroeh (including the article).
from the imperative of רָאָה and בֵּן; see ye a son; Reuben, a son of Jacob; Reuben.
patronymic from רְאוּבֵן; a Reubenite or descendant of Reuben; children of Reuben, Reubenites.
from רָאָה; sight, i.e. satisfaction; behold.
feminine passive participle of רָאַם; raised; Reumah, a Syrian woman; Reumah.
from רָאָה; a mirror (as seen); looking glass.
from רָאָה; sight, whether abstractly (vision) or concretely (a spectacle); gazingstock, look to, (that) see(-th).
from רָאָה and יָהּ; Jah has seen; Reajah, the name of three Israelites; Reaia, Reaiah.
from רָאָה; sight; beholding.
a primitive root; to rise; be lifted up.
or רְאֵיםlemma רְאיֵם second vowel, corrected to רְאֵים; or רֵים; or רֵם; from רָאַם; a wild bull (from its conspicuousness); unicorn.
from רָאַם; something high in value, i.e. perhaps coral; coral.
or רָאמֹתxlit Râmôth corrected to Râʼmôth; plural of רָאמָה; heights; Ramoth, the name of two places in Palestine; Ramoth.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רֹאשׁ; the head; figuratively, the sum; chief, head, sum.

from an unused root apparently meaning to shake; the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.); band, beginning, captain, chapiter, chief(-est place, man, things), company, end, [idiom] every (man), excellent, first, forefront, (be-)head, height, (on) high(-est part, (priest)), [idiom] lead, [idiom] poor, principal, ruler, sum, top.
or רוֹשׁ; (Deuteronomy 32:32), apparently the same as רֹאשׁ; a poisonous plant, probably the poppy (from its conspicuous head); generally poison (even of serpents); gall, hemlock, poison, venom.
probably the same as רֹאשׁ; Rosh, the name of an Israelite and of a foreign nation; Rosh.
from the same as רֹאשׁ; a beginning; beginning.
feminine of רֹאשׁ; the head; head(-stone).

or רִאשֹׁן; from רִאשָׁה; first, in place, time or rank (as adjective or noun); ancestor, (that were) before(-time), beginning, eldest, first, fore(-father) (-most), former (thing), of old time, past.
from רִאשׁוֹן; first; first.
from the same as רֹאשׁ; the first, in place, time, order or rank (specifically, a firstfruit); beginning, chief(-est), first(-fruits, part, time), principal thing.
from רֹאשׁ; a pillow (being for the head); bolster.

by contracted from רָבַב; abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality); (in) abound(-undance, -ant, -antly), captain, elder, enough, exceedingly, full, great(-ly, man, one), increase, long (enough, (time)), (do, have) many(-ifold, things, a time), (ship-)master, mighty, more, (too, very) much, multiply(-tude), officer, often(-times), plenteous, populous, prince, process (of time), suffice(-lent).
by contraction from רָבַב; (or perhaps the same as רַב); an archer; archer.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רַב; {abundant}; captain, chief, great, lord, master, stout.

from רָבַב; abundance (in any respect); abundance(-antly), all, [idiom] common (sort), excellent, great(-ly, -ness, number), huge, be increased, long, many, more in number, most, much, multitude, plenty(-ifully), [idiom] very (age).

a primitive root; (compare רָבִיב); also as denominative from רְבָבָה; properly, to cast together , i.e. increase, especially in number; to multiply by the myriad; increase, be many(-ifold), be more, multiply, ten thousands.
a primitive root (rather identical with רָבַב through the idea of projection); to shoot an arrow; shoot.
from רָבַב; abundance (in number), i.e. (specifically) a myriad (whether definite or indefinite); many, million, [idiom] multiply, ten thousand.
a primitive root; to spread; deck.

a primitive root; to increase (in whatever respect); (bring in) abundance ([idiom] -antly), [phrase] archer (by mistake for רָבַב), be in authority, bring up, [idiom] continue, enlarge, excel, exceeding(-ly), be full of, (be, make) great(-er, -ly, [idiom] -ness), grow up, heap, increase, be long, (be, give, have, make, use) many (a time), (any, be, give, give the, have) more (in number), (ask, be, be so, gather, over, take, yield) much (greater, more), (make to) multiply, nourish, plenty(-eous), [idiom] process (of time), sore, store, thoroughly, very.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רָבָה; {to increase (in whatever respect)}; make a great man, grow.
feminine of רַב; great; Rabbah, the name of two places in Palestine, East and West; Rabbah, Rabbath.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to רָבָה; increase (of dignity); greatness, majesty.
from רָבַב; or רִבּוֹא from רָבַב; a myriad, i.e. indefinitely, large number; great things, ten ((eight) -een, (for) -ty, [phrase] sixscore, [phrase] threescore, [idiom] twenty, (twen) -ty) thousand.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רִבּוֹ; {a myriad, i.e. indefinitely, large number}; [idiom] ten thousand times ten thousand.
from רָבַב; a rain (as an accumulation of drops); shower.
from רָבַד; a collar (as spread around the neck); chain.
or רְבִעִי; from רָבַע; fourth; also (fractionally) a fourth; foursquare, fourth (part).
(Aramaic) corresponding to רְבִיעִי; {fourth; also (fractionally) a fourth}; fourth.
from רָבַב; multitude; Rabbith, a place in Palestine; Rabbith.
a primitive root; to soak (bread in oil); baken, (that which is) fried.
from an unused root meaning to be fruitful; fertile; Riblah, a place in Syria; Riblah.
from רַב and a foreign word for a Magian; chief Magian; Rab-Mag, a Babylonian official; Rab-mag.
from רַב and a foreign word for a eunuch; chief chamberlain; Rab-Saris, a Babylonian official; Rab-saris.
a primitive root; to squat or lie out flat, i.e. (specifically) in copulation; let gender, lie down.

a primitive root (rather identical with רָבַע through the idea of sprawling 'at all fours' (or possibly the reverse is the order of deriv.); compare אַרְבַּע); properly, to be four (sided); used only as denominative of רֶבַע; to be quadrate; (four-) square(-d).
from רָבַע; prostration (for sleep); lying down.
from רָבַע; a fourth (part or side); fourth part, side, square.
the same as רֶבַע; Reba, a Midianite; Reba.
from רָבַע; a quarter; fourth participle
from רָבַע; a descendant of the fourth generation, i.e. great great grandchild; fourth.

a primitive root; to crouch (on all four legs folded, like a recumbent animal); be implication, to recline, repose, brood, lurk, imbed; crouch (down), fall down, make a fold, lay, (cause to, make to) lie (down), make to rest, sit.
from רָבַץ; a couch or place of repose; where each lay, lie down in, resting place.
from an unused root probably meaning to clog by tying up the fetlock; fettering (by beauty); Ribkah, the wife of Isaac; Rebekah.
(Aramaic) from רַב; huge (in size); domineering (in character); (very) great (things).
(Aramaic) from רַבְרַב; a magnate; lord, prince.
from רַב and שָׁקָה; chief butler; Rabshakeh, a Babylonian official; Rabshakeh.
from an unused root meaning to pile together; a lump of clay; clod.
a primitive root; to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear); be afraid, stand in awe, disquiet, fall out, fret, move, provoke, quake, rage, shake, tremble, trouble, be wroth.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רָגַז; {to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)}; provoke unto wrath.
(Aramaic) from רְגַז; violent anger; rage.
from רָגַז; commotion, restlessness (of a horse), crash (of thunder), disquiet, anger; fear, noise, rage, trouble(-ing), wrath.
intensive from רָגַז; timid; trembling.
feminine of רֹגֶז; trepidation; trembling.

a primitive root;  also as denominative from רֶגֶל; to walk along; but only in specifically, applications, to reconnoiter, to be atale-bearer (i.e. slander); to lead about; backbite, search, slander, (e-) spy (out), teach to go, view.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רֶגֶל; {a foot, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda}; foot.

from רָגַל; a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda; [idiom] be able to endure, [idiom] according as, [idiom] after, [idiom] coming, [idiom] follow, (broken-)foot(-ed, -stool), [idiom] great toe, [idiom] haunt, [idiom] journey, leg, [phrase] piss, [phrase] possession, time.
from רֶגֶל; a footman (soldier); (on) foot(-man).
plural of active participle of רָגַל; fullers (as tramping the cloth in washing); Rogelim, a place East of the Jordan; Rogelim.
a primitive root (compare רֶגֶב, רוּעַ, רָקַם); to cast together (stones), i.e. to lapidate; [idiom] certainly, stone.
from רָגַם; stoneheap; Regem, an Israelite; Regem.
feminine of the same as רֶגֶם; a pile (of stones), i.e. (figuratively) a throng; council.
from רֶגֶם and מֶלֶךְ; king's heap; Regem-Melek, an Israelite; Regem-melech.
a primitive root; to grumble, i.e. rebel; murmur.

a primitive root; properly, to toss violently and suddenly (the sea with waves, the skin with boils); figuratively (in a favorable manner) to settle, i.e. quiet; specifically, to wink (from the motion of the eye-lids); break, divide, find ease, be a moment, (cause, give, make to) rest, make suddenly.
from רָגַע.; a wink (of the eyes), i.e. a very short space of time; instant, moment, space, suddenly.
from רָגַע; restful, i.e. peaceable; that are quiet.
a primitive root; to be tumultuous; rage.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רָגַשׁ; to gather tumultuously; assemble (together).
or (feminine) רִגְשָׁה; from רָגַשׁ; a tumultuous crowd; company, insurrection.
a primitive root; to tread in pieces, i.e. (figuratively) to conquer, or (specifically) to overlay; spend, spread, subdue.
a primitive root; to tread down, i.e. subjugate; specifically, to crumble off; (come to, make to) have dominion, prevail against, reign, (bear, make to) rule,(-r, over), take.
intensive from רָדָה; domineering; Raddai, an Israelite; Raddai.
from רָדַד in the sense of spreading; a veil (as expanded); vail, veil.
a primitive root; to stun, i.e. stupefy (with sleep or death); (be fast a-, be in a deep, cast into a dead, that) sleep(-er, -eth).
a primitive root; to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by); chase, put to flight, follow (after, on), hunt, (be under) persecute(-ion, -or), pursue(-r).
a primitive root; to urge severely, i.e. (figuratively) importune, embolden, capture, act insolently; overcome, behave self proudly, make sure, strengthen.
from רָהַב,; bluster(-er); proud, strength.
the same as רַהַב; Rahab (i.e. boaster), an epithet of Egypt; Rahab.
from רָהַב; insolent; proud.
from רָהַב; pride; strength.
a primitive root; to fear; be afraid.
from an unused root apparently meaning to hollow out; a channel or watering-box; by resemblance a ringlet of hair (as forming parallel lines); gallery, gutter, trough.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to רָאָה; aspect; form.
a primitive root; to tramp about, i.e. ramble (free or disconsolate); have the dominion, be lord, mourn, rule.
a primitive root; to slake the thirst (occasionally of other appetites); bathe, make drunk, (take the) fill, satiate, (abundantly) satisfy, soak, water (abundantly).
from רָוָה; sated (with drink); drunkenness, watered.
from an unused root probably meaning to cry out; outcry; Rohagah, an Israelite; Rohgah.
a primitive root (identical with רוּחַ); properly, to breathe freely, i.e. revive; by implication, to have ample room; be refreshed, large.
from רָוַח; room, literally (an interval) or figuratively (deliverance); enlargement, space.

a primitive root; properly, to blow, i.e. breathe; only (literally) to smell or (by implication, perceive (figuratively, to anticipate, enjoy); accept, smell, [idiom] touch, make of quick understanding.

from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, [idiom] cool, courage, mind, [idiom] quarter, [idiom] side, spirit(-ual), tempest, [idiom] vain, (whirl-) wind(-y).

(Aramaic) corresponding to רוּחַ; {wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)}; mind, spirit, wind.
feminine of רֶוַח; relief; breathing, respite.
from רָוָה; satisfaction; runneth over, wealthy.

a primitive root; to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively); bring up, exalt (self), extol, give, go up, haughty, heave (up), (be, lift up on, make on, set up on, too) high(-er, one), hold up, levy, lift(-er) up, (be) lofty, ([idiom] a-) loud, mount up, offer (up), [phrase] presumptuously, (be) promote(-ion), proud, set up, tall(-er), take (away, off, up), breed worms.
or רֻם; from רוּם; (literally) elevation or (figuratively) elation; haughtiness, height, [idiom] high.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רוּם; {to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)}; extol, lift up (self), set up.
(Aramaic) from רוּם; (literally) altitude; height.
from רוּם; elevation, i.e. (adverbially) aloft; on high.
from רוּם; height; Rumah, a place in Palestine; Rumah.
feminine of רוֹם; elation, i.e. (adverbially) proudly; haughtily.
from רָמַם; exaltation, i.e. (figuratively and specifically) praise; be extolled.
feminine active participle of רָמַם; exaltation, i.e. praise; high.
(or Romam from רוּם and עֵזֶר; I have raised up a help; Romamti-Ezer, an Israelite; Romamti-ezer.

a primitive root; to mar (especially by breaking); figuratively, to split the ears (with sound), i.e. shout (for alarm or joy); blow an alarm, cry (alarm, aloud, out), destroy, make a joyful noise, smart, shout (for joy), sound an alarm, triumph.
a primitive root; properly, to triturate (in a mortar), i.e. (figuratively) to agitate (by concussion); tremble.
a primitive root; to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush); break down, divide speedily, footman, guard, bring hastily, (make) run (away, through), post.
a primitive root; to pour out (literally or figuratively), i.e. empty; [idiom] arm, cast out, draw (out), (make) empty, pour forth (out).
a primitive root; to slaver (with spittle), i.e. (by analogy) to emit afluid (ulcerous or natural); run.
a primitive root; to be destitute; lack, needy, (make self) poor (man).
probably for רְעוּת; friend; Ruth, a Moabitess; Ruth.
(Aramaic) from an unused root probably meaning; to attenuate, i.e. (figuratively) hide; a mystery; secret.
a primitive root; to emaciate, i.e. make (become) thin (literally or figuratively); famish, wax lean.
from רָזָה; thin; lean.
from רָזַן; prince; Rezon, a Syrian; Rezon.
from רָזָה; thinness; leanness, [idiom] scant.
from רָזַן; a dignitary; prince.
from רָזָה; thinness; leanness.
a primitive root; to twinkle the eye (in mockery); wink.
a primitive root; probably to be heavy, i.e. (figuratively) honorable; prince, ruler.
a primitive root; to broaden (intransitive or transitive, literal or figurative); be an en-(make) large(-ing), make room, make (open) wide.
from רָחַב; a width; breadth, broad place.
or רְחוֹב; from רָחַב; a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area; broad place (way), street. See also בֵּית רְחוֹב.
or רְחוֹב; the same as רְחֹב; Rechob, the name of a place in Syria, also of a Syrian and an Israelite; Rehob.
from רָחַב; width (literally or figuratively); breadth, broad, largeness, thickness, wideness.
from רָחַב; roomy, in any (or every) direction, literally or figuratively; broad, large, at liberty, proud, wide.
the same as רָחָב; proud; Rachab, a Canaanitess; Rahab.
or רְחֹבֹת; plural of רְחֹב; streets; Rechoboth, a place in Assyria and one in Palestine; Rehoboth.
or רְחַבְיָהוּ; from רָחַב and יָהּ; Jah has enlarged; Rechabjah, an Israelite; Rehabiah.
from רָחַב and עַם; a people has enlarged; Rechabam, an Israelite king; Rehoboam.
from an unused root meaning to pulverize; a mill-stone; mill (stone).
a form of רַחוּם; Rechum, the name of a Persian and of three Israelites; Rehum.
from רָחַם; compassionate; full of compassion, merciful.

or רָחֹק; from רָחַק; remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition); (a-) far (abroad, off), long ago, of old, space, great while to come.
from the same as רַהַט; a panel (as resembling a trough); rafter.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רָחוֹק; {remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)}; far.
from an unused root meaning to journey; a ewe (the females being the predominant element of a flock) (as a good traveller); ewe, sheep.
the same as רָחֵל; Rachel, a wife of Jacob; Rachel.

a primitive root; to fondle; by implication, to love, especially to compassionate; have compassion (on, upon), love, (find, have, obtain, shew) mercy(-iful, on, upon), (have) pity, Ruhamah, [idiom] surely.
from רָחַם; compassion (in the plural); by extension, the womb (as cherishing the fetus); by implication, a maiden; bowels, compassion, damsel, tender love, (great, tender) mercy, pity, womb.
the same as רַחַם; pity; Racham, an Israelite; Raham.
from רָחַם; (compare רַחַם); the womb; matrix, womb.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רַחַם; (plural) pity; mercy.
or (feminine) רָחָמָה; from רָחַם; a kind of vulture (supposed to be tender towards its young); gier-eagle.
feminine of רַחַם; a maiden; damsel.
from רָחַם; compassionate; pitiful.
a primitive root; to brood; by implication, to be relaxed; flutter, move, shake.
a primitive root; to lave (the whole or a part of a thing); bathe (self), wash (self).
(Aramaic) corresponding to רָחַץ (probably through the accessory idea of ministering as a servant at the bath); to attend upon; trust.
from רָחַץ; a bath; wash(-pot).
feminine of רַחַץ; a bathing place; washing.

a primitive root; to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation); (a-, be, cast, drive, get, go, keep (self), put, remove, be too, (wander), withdraw) far (away, off), loose, [idiom] refrain, very, (be) a good way (off).
from רָחַק; remote; that are far.
a primitive root; to gush; indite.
from רוּחַ; a winnowing-fork (as blowing the chaff away); shovel.
a primitive root; to be moist; be wet.
from רָטַב; moist (with sap); green.
from an unused root meaning to tremble; terror; fear.
xlit ruwṭăphash corrected to ruṭăphash; a root compounded from רָטֹב and טָפַשׁ; to be rejuvenated; be fresh.
a primitive root; to dash down; dash (in pieces).
from רָוָה; irrigation, i.e. a shower; watering.

or רוּב; a primitive root; properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend; adversary, chide, complain, contend, debate, [idiom] ever, [idiom] lay wait, plead, rebuke, strive, [idiom] thoroughly.
or רִב; from רִיב; a contest (personal or legal); [phrase] adversary, cause, chiding, contend(-tion), controversy, multitude (from the margin), pleading, strife, strive(-ing), suit.
from רִיב; contentious; Ribai, an Israelite; Ribai.
from רוּחַ; odor (as if blown); savour, scent, smell.
(Aramaic) corresponding to רֵיחַ; {odor (as if blown)}; smell.
or רִפָה; from רוּף; (only plural), grits (as pounded); ground corn, wheat.
or (probably by orthographical error) דִּיפַת; of foreign origin; Riphath, a grandson of Japheth and his descendants; Riphath.
from רוּק; emptiness; figuratively, a worthless thing; adverbially, in vain; empty, to no purpose, (in) vain (thing), vanity.
or (shorter) רֵק; from רוּק; empty; figuratively, worthless; emptied(-ty), vain (fellow, man).
from רֵיק; emptily; figuratively (objective) ineffectually, (subjective) undeservedly; without cause, empty, in vain, void.
from רוּר; saliva; by resemblance, broth; spittle, white (of an egg).
or רֵאשׁ; or רִישׁ; from רוּשׁ; poverty; poverty.
from רָכַךְ; tender (literally or figuratively); by implication, weak; faint((-hearted), soft, tender ((-hearted), one), weak.
from רָכַךְ; softness (figuratively); tenderness.

a primitive root; to ride (on an animal or in a vehicle); causatively, to place upon (for riding or generally), to despatch; bring (on (horse-) back), carry, get (oneself) up, on (horse-) back, put, (cause to, make to) ride (in a chariot, on, -r), set.
from רָכַב; a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone; chariot, (upper) millstone, multitude (from the margin), wagon.
from רָכַב; rider; Rekab, the name of two Arabs and of two Israelites; Rechab.
from רָכַב; a charioteer; chariot man, driver of a chariot, horseman.
feminine of רֶכֶב; a chariot (collectively); chariots.
probably feminine from רָכַךְ; softness; Rekah, a place in Palestine; Rechah.
from passive participle of רָכַב; a vehicle (as ridden on); chariot.
or רְכֻשׁ; from passive participle of רָכַשׁ; property (as gathered); good, riches, substance.
from רָכַל; a scandal-monger (as travelling about); slander, carry tales, talebearer.
a primitive root; to soften (intransitively or transitively), used figuratively; (be) faint(-hearted), mollify, (be, make) soft(-er), be tender.
a primitive root; to travel for trading; (spice) merchant.
from רָכַל; merchant; Rakal, a place in Palestine; Rachal.
feminine passive participle of רָכַל; trade (as peddled); merchandise, traffic.
a primitive root; to tie; bind.
from רָכַס; a mountain ridge (as of tied summits); rough place.
from רָכַס; a snare (as of tied meshes); pride.
a primitive root; to lay up, i.e. collect; gather, get.
from רָכַשׁ; a relay of animals on a post-route (as stored up for that purpose); by implication, a courser; dromedary, mule, swift beast.
active participle of רוּם; high; Ram, the name of an Arabian and of an Israelite; Ram. See also בֵּית הָרָם.
