neuter and masculine respectively from δέω; a band, i.e. ligament (of the body) or shackle (of a prisoner); figuratively, an impediment or disability:--band, bond, chain, string.
from δεσμόν and φύλαξ; a jailer (as guarding the prisoners):--jailor, keeper of the prison.
from a derivative of δεσμόν (equivalent to δεσμέω); a place of bondage, i.e. a dungeon:--prison.
from the same as δεσμωτήριον; (passively) a captive:--prisoner.
perhaps from δέω and  (a husband); an absolute ruler ("despot"):--Lord, master.
of uncertain affinity; here; used also imperative hither!; and of time, hitherto:--come (hither), hither(-to).
from δεῦρο and an imperative form of  (to go); come hither!:--come, X follow.
from δεύτερος; secondary, i.e. (specially) on the second day:--next day.

from δεύτερος and πρῶτος; second-first, i.e. (specially) a designation of the Sabbath immediately after the Paschal week (being the second after Passover day, and the first of the seven Sabbaths intervening before Pentecost):--second … after the first.
as the comparative of δύο; (ordinal) second (in time, place, or rank; also adverb):--afterward, again, second(-arily, time).
middle voice of a primary verb; to receive (in various applications, literally or figuratively):--accept, receive, take. Compare λαμβάνω.
a primary verb; to bind (in various applications, literally or figuratively):--bind, be in bonds, knit, tie, wind. See also δεῖ, δέομαι.
probably akin to δέ; a particle of emphasis or explicitness; now, then, etc.:--also, and, doubtless, now, therefore.
of uncertain derivation; clear:--+ bewray, certain, evident, manifest.
from δῆλος; to make plain (by words):--declare, shew, signify.
probably for Δημήτριος; Demas, a Christian:--Demas.
from a compound of δῆμος and ἀγορά; to be a people-gatherer, i.e. to address a public assembly:--make an oration.
from  (Ceres); Demetrius, the name of an Ephesian and of a Christian:--Demetrius.
from δῆμος and ἔργον; a worker for the people, i.e. mechanic (spoken of the Creator):--maker.
from δέω; the public (as bound together socially):--people.
from δῆμος; public; (feminine singular dative case as adverb) in public:--common, openly, publickly.
of Latin origin; a denarius (or ten asses):--pence, penny(-worth).
from δή and ποτέ; a particle of generalization; indeed, at any time:--(what-)soever.
from δή and πού; a particle of asseveration; indeed doubtless:--verily.

a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). In composition it retains the same general importance.
from διά and the base of βάσις; to cross:--come over, pass (through).
from διά and βάλλω; (figuratively) to traduce:--accuse.
middle voice of a compound of διά and βεβαιόω; to confirm thoroughly (by words), i.e. asseverate:--affirm constantly.
from διά and βλέπω; to look through, i.e. recover full vision:--see clearly.
from διαβάλλω; a traducer; specially, Satan (compare שָׂטָן):--false accuser, devil, slanderer.
from διά and the base of ἄγγελος; to herald thoroughly:--declare, preach, signify.
from διά and γίνομαι; to elapse meanwhile:--X after, be past, be spent.
from διά and γινώσκω; to know thoroughly, i.e. ascertain exactly:--(would) enquire, know the uttermost.
from γραπτός and γνωρίζω; to tell abroad:--make known.
from διαγινώσκω; (magisterial) examination ("diagnosis"):--hearing.
from διά and γογγύζω; to complain throughout a crowd:--murmur.
from διά and γρηγορεύω; to waken thoroughly:--be awake.
from διά and ἄγω; to pass time or life:--lead life, living.
from διά and δέχομαι; to receive in turn, i.e. (figuratively) succeed to:--come after.
from a compound of διά and δέω; a "diadem" (as bound about the head):--crown. Compare στέφανος.
from διά and δίδωμι; to give throughout a crowd, i.e. deal out; also to deliver over (as to a successor):--(make) distribute(-ion), divide, give.
from διαδέχομαι; a successor in office:--room.
from διά and ζώννυμι; to gird tightly:--gird.
from διατίθεμαι; properly, a disposition, i.e. (specially) a contract (especially a devisory will):--covenant, testament.
from διαιρέω; a distinction or (concretely) variety:--difference, diversity.
from διά and αἱρέομαι; to separate, i.e. distribute:--divide.
from διά and καθαρίζω; to cleanse perfectly, i.e. (specially) winnow:--thoroughly purge.
middle voice from διά and a compound of κατά and ἐλέγχω; to prove downright, i.e. confute:--convince.

from διάκονος; to be an attendant, i.e. wait upon (menially or as a host, friend, or (figuratively) teacher); technically, to act as a Christian deacon:--(ad-)minister (unto), serve, use the office of a deacon.

from διάκονος; attendance (as a servant, etc.); figuratively (eleemosynary) aid, (official) service (especially of the Christian teacher, or technically of the diaconate):--(ad-)minister(-ing, -tration, -try), office, relief, service(-ing).

probably from an obsolete  (to run on errands; compare διώκω); an attendant, i.e. (genitive case) a waiter (at table or in other menial duties); specially, a Christian teacher and pastor (technically, a deacon or deaconess):--deacon, minister, servant.
from δίς and ἑκατόν; two hundred:--two hundred.
middle voice from διά and ἀκούω; to hear throughout, i.e. patiently listen (to a prisoner's plea):--hear.

from διά and κρίνω; to separate thoroughly, i.e. (literally and reflexively) to withdraw from, or (by implication) oppose; figuratively, to discriminate (by implication, decide), or (reflexively) hesitate:--contend, make (to) differ(-ence), discern, doubt, judge, be partial, stagger, waver.
from διακρίνω; judicial estimation:--discern(-ing), disputation.
from διά and κωλύω; to hinder altogether, i.e. utterly prohibit:--forbid.
from διά and λαλέω; to talk throughout a company, i.e. converse or (genitive case) publish:--commune, noise abroad.
middle voice from διά and λέγω; to say thoroughly, i.e. discuss (in argument or exhortation):--dispute, preach (unto), reason (with), speak.
from διά and λείπω; to leave off in the middle, i.e. intermit:--cease.
from διαλέγομαι; a (mode of) discourse, i.e. "dialect":--language, tongue.
from διά and ἀλλάσσω; to change thoroughly, i.e. (mentally) to conciliate:--reconcile.
from διά and λογίζομαι; to reckon thoroughly, i.e. (genitive case) to deliberate (by reflection or discussion):--cast in mind, consider, dispute, muse, reason, think.
from διαλογίζομαι; discussion, i.e. (internal) consideration (by implication, purpose), or (external) debate:--dispute, doubtful(-ing), imagination, reasoning, thought.
from διά and λύω; to dissolve utterly:--scatter.
from διά and μαρτυρέω; to attest or protest earnestly, or (by implication) hortatively:--charge, testify (unto), witness.
from διά and μάχομαι; to fight fiercely (in altercation):--strive.
from διά and μένω; to stay constantly (in being or relation):--continue, remain.
from διά and μερίζω; to partition thoroughly (literally in distribution, figuratively in dissension):--cloven, divide, part.
from διαμερίζω; disunion (of opinion and conduct):--division.
from διά and the base of νόμος; to distribute, i.e. (of information) to disseminate:--spread.
from διά and νεύω; to nod (or express by signs) across an intervening space:--beckon.
from a compound of διά and νοιέω; something thought through, i.e. a sentiment:--thought.
from διά and νοῦς; deep thought, properly, the faculty (mind or its disposition), by implication, its exercise:-- imagination, mind, understanding.
from διά and ἀνοίγω; to open thoroughly, literally (as a first-born) or figuratively (to expound):--open.
from διά and a derivative of νύξ; to sit up the whole night:--continue all night.
from διά and  (to effect); to accomplish thoroughly:--finish.
from διά and the genitive case of πᾶς; through all time, i.e. (adverbially) constantly:--alway(-s), continually.
from διά and a derivative of the base of πέραν; to cross entirely:--go over, pass (over), sail over.
from διά and πλέω; to sail through:--sail over.
from διά and a derivative of πόνος; to toil through, i.e. (passively) be worried:--be grieved.
from διά and πορεύομαι; to travel through:--go through, journey in, pass by.
from διά and ἀπορέω; to be thoroughly nonplussed:--(be in) doubt, be (much) perplexed.
from διά and πραγματεύομαι; to thoroughly occupy oneself, i.e. (transitively and by implication) to earn in business:--gain by trading.
from διά and the base of πρίζω; to saw asunder, i.e. (figuratively) to exasperate:--cut (to the heart).
from διά and ἁρπάζω; to seize asunder, i.e. plunder:--spoil.
from διά and ῥήγνυμι; to tear asunder:--break, rend.
from διά and  (clear); to clear thoroughly, i.e. (figuratively) declare:--tell unto.
from διά and σείω; to shake thoroughly, i.e. (figuratively) to intimidate:--do violence to.
from διά and σκορπίζω; to dissipate, i.e. (genitive case) to rout or separate; specially, to winnow; figuratively, to squander:--disperse, scatter (abroad), strew, waste.
from διά and σπάω; to draw apart, i.e. sever or dismember:--pluck asunder, pull in pieces.
from διά and σπείρω; to sow throughout, i.e. (figuratively) distribute in foreign lands:--scatter abroad.
from διασπείρω; dispersion, i.e. (specially and concretely) the (converted) Israelite resident in Gentile countries:--(which are) scattered (abroad).
middle voice from διά and στέλλω; to set (oneself) apart (figuratively, distinguish), i.e. (by implication) to enjoin:--charge, that which was (give) commanded(-ment).
from διΐστημι; an interval:--space.
from διαστέλλομαι; a variation:--difference, distinction.
from διά and στρέφω; to distort, i.e. (figuratively) misinterpret, or (morally) corrupt:--perverse(-rt), turn away.
from διά and σώζω; to save thoroughly, i.e. (by implication or analogy) to cure, preserve, rescue, etc.:--bring safe, escape (safe), heal, make perfectly whole, save.
from διατάσσω; arrangement, i.e. institution:--instrumentality.
from διατάσσω; an arrangement, i.e. (authoritative) edict:--commandment.
from διά and ταράσσω; to disturb wholly, i.e. agitate (with alarm):--trouble.
from διά and τάσσω; to arrange thoroughly, i.e. (specially) institute, prescribe, etc.:--appoint, command, give, (set in) order, ordain.
from διά and τελέω; to accomplish thoroughly, i.e. (subjectively) to persist:--continue.
from διά and τηρέω; to watch thoroughly, i.e. (positively and transitively) to observe strictly, or (negatively and reflexively) to avoid wholly:--keep.
from διά and τίς; through what cause ?, i.e. why?:--wherefore, why.
middle voice from διά and τίθημι; to put apart, i.e. (figuratively) dispose (by assignment, compact, or bequest):--appoint, make, testator.
from διά and the base of τρίβος; to wear through (time), i.e. remain:--abide, be, continue, tarry.
from a compound of διά and τρέφω; nourishment:--food.
from διά and αὐγάζω; to glimmer through, i.e. break (as day):--dawn.
from διά and φαίνω; appearing through, i.e. "diaphanous":--transparent.

from διά and φέρω; to bear through, i.e. (literally) transport; usually to bear apart, i.e. (objectively) to toss about (figuratively, report); subjectively, to "differ", or (by implication) surpass:--be better, carry, differ from, drive up and down, be (more) excellent, make matter, publish, be of more value.
from διά and φεύγω; to flee through, i.e. escape:--escape.
from διά and a derivative of φήμη; to report thoroughly, i.e. divulgate:--blaze abroad, commonly report, spread abroad, fame.
from διαβάλλω and φθείρω; to rot thoroughly, i.e. (by implication) to ruin (passively, decay utterly, figuratively, pervert):--corrupt, destroy, perish.
from διαφθείρω; decay:--corruption.
from διαφέρω; varying; also surpassing:--differing, divers, more excellent.
from διά and φυλάσσω; to guard thoroughly, i.e. protect:--keep.
from διά and a derivative of χείρ; to handle thoroughly, i.e. lay violent hands upon:--kill, slay.
from διά and the middle voice of χωρίζω; to remove (oneself) wholly, i.e. retire:--depart.
from διδακτός; instructive ("didactic"):--apt to teach.
from διδάσκω; (subjectively) instructed, or (objectively) communicated by teaching:--taught, which … teacheth.
from διδάσκαλος; instruction (the function or the information):--doctrine, learning, teaching.
from διδάσκω; an instructor (genitive case or specially):--doctor, master, teacher.
a prolonged (causative) form of a primary verb  (to learn); to teach (in the same broad application):--teach.
from διδάσκω; instruction (the act or the matter):--doctrine, hath been taught.
from δίς and δραχμή; a double drachma (didrachm):--tribute.
prolongation from δίς; double, i.e. twin; Didymus, a Christian:--Didymus.

a prolonged form of a primary verb (which is used as an alternative in most of the tenses); to give (used in a very wide application, properly, or by implication, literally or figuratively; greatly modified by the connection):--adventure, bestow, bring forth, commit, deliver (up), give, grant, hinder, make, minister, number, offer, have power, put, receive, set, shew, smite (+ with the hand), strike (+ with the palm of the hand), suffer, take, utter, yield.
from διά and ἐγείρω; to wake fully; i.e. arouse (literally or figuratively):--arise, awake, raise, stir up.
from διά and ἔξοδος; an outlet through, i.e. probably an open square (from which roads diverge):--highway.
from διερμηνεύω; an explainer:--interpreter.
from διά and ἑρμηνεύω; to explain thoroughly, by implication, to translate:--expound, interpret(-ation).
from διά and ἔρχομαι; to traverse (literally):--come, depart, go (about, abroad, everywhere, over, through, throughout), pass (by, over, through, throughout), pierce through, travel, walk through.
from διά and ἐρωτάω; to question throughout, i.e. ascertain by interrogation:--make enquiry for.
from δίς and ἔτος; of two years (in age):--two years old.
from διετής; a space of two years (biennium):--two years.
from διά and ἡγέομαι; to relate fully:--declare, shew, tell.
from διηγέομαι; a recital:--declaration.
neuter of a compound of διά and a derivative of an alternate of φέρω; carried through, i.e. (adverbially with εἰς and ὁ prefixed) perpetually:--+ continually, for ever.
from δίς and θάλασσα; having two seas, i.e. a sound with a double outlet:--where two seas meet.
from διά and the base of ἱκανός; to reach through, i.e. penetrate:--pierce.
from διά and ἵστημι; to stand apart, i.e. (reflexively) to remove, intervene:--go further, be parted, after the space of.
from διά and a derivative of ἰσχυρός; to stout it through, i.e. asservate:--confidently (constantly) affirm.
from δίκαιος and κρίσις; a just sentence:--righteous judgment.
from δίκη; equitable (in character or act); by implication, innocent, holy (absolutely or relatively):--just, meet, right(-eous).
from δίκαιος; equity (of character or act); specially (Christian) justification:--righteousness.
from δίκαιος; to render (i.e. show or regard as) just or innocent:--free, justify(-ier), be righteous.
from δικαιόω; an equitable deed; by implication, a statute or decision:--judgment, justification, ordinance, righteousness.
adverb from δίκαιος; equitably:--justly, (to) righteously(-ness).
from δικαιόω; aquittal (for Christ's sake):--justification.
from a derivative of δίκη; a judger:--judge.
probably from δεικνύω; right (as self-evident), i.e. justice (the principle, a decision, or its execution):--judgment, punish, vengeance.
probably from a primary verb  (to cast); a seine (for fishing):--net.
from δίς and λόγος; equivocal, i.e. telling a different story:--double-tongued.
from διά and ὅς; through which thing, i.e. consequently:--for which cause, therefore, wherefore.
from διά and ὁδεύω; to travel through:--go throughout, pass through.
from  (Bacchus); reveller; Dionysius, an Athenian:--Dionysius.
from διό and περ; on which very account:--wherefore.
from the alternate of Ζεύς and the alternate of πίπτω; sky-fallen (i.e. an aerolite):--which fell down from Jupiter.
from a compound of διά and a derivative of ὀρθός, meaning to straighten thoroughly; rectification, i.e. (specially) the Messianic restauration:--reformation.
from διά and ὀρύσσω; to penetrate burglariously:--break through (up).
from the alternate of Ζεύς and a form of the base of κοράσιον; sons of Jupiter, i.e. the twins Dioscuri:--Castor and Pollux.
from διά and ὅτι; on the very account that, or inasmuch as:--because (that), for, therefore.
from the alternate of Ζεύς and τρέφω; Jove-nourished; Diotrephes, an opponent of Christianity:--Diotrephes.
from δίς and (probably) the base of πλείων; two-fold:--double, two-fold more.
from διπλοῦς; to render two-fold:--double.
adverb from δύο; twice:--again, twice.
from δίς; properly, to duplicate, i.e. (mentally) to waver (in opinion):--doubt.
from δίς and στόμα; double-edged:--with two edges, two-edged.
from δίς and χίλιοι; two thousand:--two thousand.
from διά and   (to filter); to strain out:--strain at (probably by misprint).
from a derivative of δίς; to make apart, i.e. sunder (figuratively, alienate):--set at variance.
from a derivative of δίς and στάσις; disunion, i.e. (figuratively) dissension:--division, sedition.
from a compound of a derivative of δίς and a derivative of  (to cut); to bisect, i.e. (by extension) to flog severely:--cut asunder (in sunder).
from a variation of δίψος; to thirst for (literally or figuratively):--(be, be a-)thirst(-y).
of uncertain affinity; thirst:--thirst.
from δίς and ψυχή; two-spirited, i.e. vacillating (in opinion or purpose):--double minded.
from διώκω; persecution:--persecution.
from διώκω; a persecutor:--persecutor.

a prolonged (and causative) form of a primary verb  (to flee; compare the base of δειλός and διάκονος); to pursue (literally or figuratively); by implication, to persecute:--ensue, follow (after), given to, (suffer) persecute(-ion), press forward.
from the base of δοκέω; a law (civil, ceremonial or ecclesiastical):--decree, ordinance.
from δόγμα; to prescribe by statute, i.e. (reflexively) to submit to, ceremonially rule:--be subject to ordinances.

a prolonged form of a primary verb,   (used only in an alternate in certain tenses; compare the base of δεικνύω) of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem (truthfully or uncertainly):--be accounted, (of own) please(-ure), be of reputation, seem (good), suppose, think, trow.
from δόκιμος; to test (literally or figuratively); by implication, to approve:--allow, discern, examine, X like, (ap-)prove, try.
from the same as δόκιμος; test (abstractly or concretely); by implication, trustiness:--experience(-riment), proof, trial.
neuter of a presumed derivative of δοκιμή; a testing; by implication, trustworthiness:--trial, trying.
from δοκέω; properly, acceptable (current after assayal), i.e. approved:--approved, tried.
from δέχομαι (through the idea of holding up); a stick of timber:--beam.
from δόλος; guileful:--deceitful.
from δόλιος; to be guileful:--use deceit.
from an obsolete primary verb,  (probably meaning to decoy; compare δελεάζω); a trick (bait), i.e. (figuratively) wile:--craft, deceit, guile, subtilty.
from δόλος; to ensnare, i.e. (figuratively) adulterate:--handle deceitfully.
from the base of δίδωμι; a present:--gift.
from the base of δοκέω; glory (as very apparent), in a wide application (literal or figurative, objective or subjective):--dignity, glory(-ious), honour, praise, worship.
from δόξα; to render (or esteem) glorious (in a wide application):--(make) glorify(-ious), full of (have) glory, honour, magnify.
from the base of δίδωμι; a giving; by implication, (concretely) a gift:--gift, giving.
from the base of δίδωμι; a giver:--giver.
from a presumed compound of δοῦλος and ἄγω; to be a slave-driver, i.e. to enslave (figuratively, subdue):--bring into subjection.
from δουλεύω; slavery (ceremonially or figuratively):--bondage.
from δοῦλος; to be a slave to (literal or figurative, involuntary or voluntary):--be in bondage, (do) serve(-ice).
feminine of δοῦλος; a female slave (involuntarily or voluntarily):--handmaid(-en).
neuter of δοῦλος; subservient:--servant.
from δέω; a slave (literal or figurative, involuntary or voluntary; frequently, therefore in a qualified sense of subjection or subserviency):--bond(-man), servant.
from δοῦλος; to enslave (literally or figuratively):--bring into (be under) bondage, X given, become (make) servant.
from δέχομαι; a reception, i.e. convivial entertainment:--feast.
probably from an alternate form of  (to look); a fabulous kind of serpent (perhaps as supposed to fascinate):--dragon.
perhaps akin to the base of δράκων (through the idea of capturing); to grasp, i.e. (figuratively) entrap:--take.
from δράσσομαι; a drachma or (silver) coin (as handled):--piece (of silver).
from  (to pluck); a gathering hook (especially for harvesting):--sickle.
from the alternate of τρέχω; a race, i.e. (figuratively) career:--course.
a feminine diminutive of Drusus (a Roman name); Drusilla, a member of the Herodian family:--Drusilla.
of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible:--be able, can (do, + -not), could, may, might, be possible, be of power.

from δύναμαι; force (literally or figuratively); specially, miraculous power (usually by implication, a miracle itself):--ability, abundance, meaning, might(-ily, -y, -y deed), (worker of) miracle(-s), power, strength, violence, mighty (wonderful) work.
from δύναμις; to enable:--strengthen.
from δύναμαι; a ruler or officer:--of great authority, mighty, potentate.
from δυνατός; to be efficient (figuratively):--be mighty.
from δύναμαι; powerful or capable (literally or figuratively); neuter possible:--able, could, (that is) mighty (man), possible, power, strong.
prolonged forms of an obsolete primary         (to sink); to go "down":--set.
a primary numeral; "two":--both, twain, two.
a primary inseparable particle of uncertain derivation; used only in composition as a prefix; hard, i.e. with difficulty:--+ hard, + grievous, etc.
from δυσ- and a derivative of βαστάζω; oppressive:--grievous to be borne.
from δυσ- and a comparative of ἐντός (meaning a bowel); a "dysentery":--bloody flux.
from δυσ- and a presumed derivative of ἑρμηνεύω; difficult of explanation:--hard to be uttered.
from δυσ- and  (food); properly, fastidious about eating (peevish), i.e. (genitive case) impracticable:--hard.
adverb from δύσκολος; impracticably:--hardly.
from δύνω; the sun-set, i.e. (by implication) the western region:--west.
from δυσ- and a derivative of νοιέω; difficult of perception:--hard to be understood.
from a compound of δυσ- and φήμη; defamation:--evil report.
from δύο and δέκα; two and ten, i.e. a dozen:--twelve.
from δώδεκα; twelfth:--twelfth.
from δώδεκα and φυλή; the commonwealth of Israel:--twelve tribes.
from  (to build); properly, an edifice, i.e. (specially) a roof:--housetop.
from δῶρον; a gratuity:--gift.
accusative case of δωρεά as adverb; gratuitously (literally or figuratively):--without a cause, freely, for naught, in vain.
middle voice from δῶρον; to bestow gratuitously:--give.
from δωρέομαι; a bestowment:--gift.
apparent imperative of ἐάω; properly, let it be, i.e. (as interjection) aha!:--let alone.

from εἰ and ἄν; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.; often used in connection with other particles to denote indefiniteness or uncertainty:--before, but, except, (and) if, (if) so, (what-, whither-)soever, though, when (-soever), whether (or), to whom, (who-)so(-ever). See μή.

from a reflexive pronoun otherwise obsolete and the genitive case (dative case or accusative case) of αὐτός; him- (her-, it-, them-, also (in conjunction with the personal pronoun of the other persons) my-, thy-, our-, your-) self (selves), etc.:--alone, her (own, -self), (he) himself, his (own), itself, one (to) another, our (thine) own(-selves), + that she had, their (own, own selves), (of) them(-selves), they, thyself, you, your (own, own conceits, own selves, -selves).
of uncertain affinity; to let be, i.e. permit or leave alone:--commit, leave, let (alone), suffer. See also ἔα.
from ἕβδομος and a modified form of δέκα; seventy:--seventy, three score and ten.
multiple adverb from ἑβδομήκοντα; seventy times:--seventy times.
ordinal from ἑπτά; seventh:--seventh.
of Hebrew origin (עֵבֵר); Eber, a patriarch:--Eber.
from Ἐβέρ; Hebraic or the Jewish language:--Hebrew.
from Ἐβέρ; a Hebræan (i.e. Hebrew) or Jew:--Hebrew.
from Ἐβέρ; the Hebraistic (Hebrew) or Jewish (Chaldee) language:--Hebrew.
adverb from Ἑβραΐς; Hebraistically or in the Jewish (Chaldee) language:--in (the) Hebrew (tongue).
from ἐγγύς; to make near, i.e. (reflexively) approach:--approach, be at hand, come (draw) near, be (come, draw) nigh.
from ἐν and γράφω; to "engrave", i.e. inscribe:--write (in).
from ἐν and  (a limb); pledged (as if articulated by a member), i.e. a bondsman:--surety.
from a primary verb  (to squeeze or throttle; akin to the base of ἀγκάλη); near (literally or figuratively, of place or time):--from , at hand, near, nigh (at hand, unto), ready.
neuter of the comparative of ἐγγύς; nearer:--nearer.

probably akin to the base of ἀγορά (through the idea of collecting one's faculties); to waken (transitively or intransitively), i.e. rouse (literally, from sleep, from sitting or lying, from disease, from death; or figuratively, from obscurity, inactivity, ruins, nonexistence):--awake, lift (up), raise (again, up), rear up, (a-)rise (again, up), stand, take up.
from ἐγείρω; a resurgence (from death):--resurrection.
from ἐν and a derivative of καθίημι; subinduced, i.e. surreptitiously suborned as a lier-in-wait:--spy.
neuter plural of a presumed compound from ἐν and καινός; innovatives, i.e. (specially) renewal (of religious services after the Antiochian interruption):--dedication.
from ἐγκαίνια; to renew, i.e. inaugurate:--consecrate, dedicate.
from ἐν and καλέω; to call in (as a debt or demand), i.e. bring to account (charge, criminate, etc.):--accuse, call in question, implead, lay to the charge.
from ἐν and καταλείπω; to leave behind in some place, i.e. (in a good sense) let remain over, or (in a bad sense) to desert:--forsake, leave.
from ἐν and κατοικέω; to settle down in a place, i.e. reside:--dwell among.
from ἐν and a derivative of κέντρον; to prick in, i.e. ingraft:--graff in(-to).
from ἐγκαλέω; an accusation, i.e. offence alleged:--crime laid against, laid to charge.
middle voice from ἐν and  (to gird); to engirdle oneself (for labor), i.e. figuratively (the apron as being a badge of servitude) to wear (in token of mutual deference):--be clothed with.
from ἐγκόπτω; a hindrance:--X hinder.
from ἐν and κόπτω; to cut into, i.e. (figuratively) impede, detain:--hinder, be tedious unto.
from ἐγκρατής; self-control (especially continence):--temperance.
middle voice from ἐγκρατής; to exercise self-restraint (in diet and chastity):--can(-not) contain, be temperate.
from ἐν and κράτος; strong in a thing (masterful), i.e. (figuratively and reflexively) self-controlled (in appetite, etc.):--temperate.
from ἐν and κρίνω; to judge in, i.e. count among:--make of the number.
from ἐν and κρύπτω; to conceal in, i.e. incorporate with:--hid in.
from ἐν and the base of κῦμα; swelling inside, i.e. pregnant:--great with child.
from ἐν and χρίω; to rub in (oil), i.e. besmear:--anoint.
a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):--I, me. For the other cases and the plural see ἐμέ, ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἡμᾶς, ἡμεῖς, ἡμῖν, ἡμῶν, etc.
from ἔδαφος; to raze:--lay even with the ground.
from the base of ἑδραῖος; a basis (bottom), i.e. the soil:--ground.
from a derivative of  (to sit); sedentary, i.e. (by implication) immovable:--settled, stedfast.
from a derivative of ἑδραῖος; a support, i.e. (figuratively) basis:--ground.
of Hebrew origin (חִזְקִיָּה); Ezekias (i.e. Hezekeiah), an Israelite:--Ezekias.
from θέλω and θρησκεία; voluntary (arbitrary and unwarranted) piety, i.e. sanctimony:--will worship.
from ἔθος; to accustom, i.e. (neuter passive participle) customary:--custom.
from ἔθνος and ἀρχή; the governor (not king) of a district:--ethnarch.
from ἔθνος; national ("ethnic"), i.e. (specially) a Gentile:--heathen (man).
adverb from ἐθνικός; as a Gentile:--after the manner of Gentiles.
probably from ἔθω; a race (as of the same habit), i.e. a tribe; specially, a foreign (non-Jewish) one (usually, by implication, pagan):--Gentile, heathen, nation, people.
from ἔθω; a usage (prescribed by habit or law):--custom, manner, be wont.
a primary verb; to be used (by habit or conventionality); neuter perfect participle usage:--be custom (manner, wont).

a primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.:--forasmuch as, if, that, (al-)though, whether. Often used in connection or composition with other particles, especially as in εἴγε, εἰ δὲ μή(γε), εἰ καί, εἰ μή, εἰ μή τι, εἴ περ, εἴ πως, εἴ τις, ἐκ. See also ἐάν.
second person singular present of εἰμί; thou art:--art, be.
from εἰ and γέ; if indeed, seeing that, unless, (with negative) otherwise:--if (so be that, yet).
from εἰ, δέ, and μή (sometimes with γέ added); but if not:--(or) else, if (not, otherwise), otherwise.
from εἴδω; a view, i.e. form (literally or figuratively):--appearance, fashion, shape, sight.

a primary verb; used only in certain past tenses, the others being borrowed from the equivalent ὀπτάνομαι and ὁράω; properly, to see (literally or figuratively); by implication, (in the perfect tense only) to know:--be aware, behold, X can (+ not tell), consider, (have) know(-ledge), look (on), perceive, see, be sure, tell, understand, wish, wot. Compare ὀπτάνομαι.
neuter of a presumed derivative of εἴδωλον; an image-fane:--idol's temple.
neuter of a compound of εἴδωλον and a presumed derivative of θύω; an image-sacrifice, i.e. part of an idolatrous offering:--(meat, thing that is) offered (in sacrifice, sacrificed) to (unto) idols.
from εἴδωλον and λατρεία; image-worship (literally or figuratively):--idolatry.
from εἴδωλον and the base of λατρεύω; an image- (servant or) worshipper (literally or figuratively):--idolater.
from εἶδος; an image (i.e. for worship); by implication, a heathen god, or (plural) the worship of such:--idol.
optative (i.e. English subjunctive) present of εἰμί (including the other person); might (could, would, or should) be:--mean, + perish, should be, was, were.
from εἰ and καί; if also (or even):--if (that), though.
probably from εἴκω (through the idea of failure); idly, i.e. without reason (or effect):--without a cause, (in) vain(-ly).
of uncertain affinity; a score:--twenty.
apparently a primary verb; properly, to be weak, i.e. yield:--give place.
apparently a primary verb (perhaps akin to εἴκω through the idea of faintness as a copy); to resemble:--be like.
from εἴκω; a likeness, i.e. (literally) statue, profile, or (figuratively) representation, resemblance:--image.
from εἰλικρινής; clearness, i.e. (by implication) purity (figuratively):--sincerity.
from  (the sun's ray) and κρίνω; judged by sunlight, i.e. tested as genuine (figuratively):--pure, sincere.
a prolonged form of a primary but defective verb  (of the same meaning); to coil or wrap:--roll together. See also ἑλίσσω.
from εἰ and μή; if not:--but, except (that), if not, more than, save (only) that, saving, till.
from εἰ μή and the neuter of τὶς; if not somewhat:--except.

the first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist (used only when emphatic):--am, have been, X it is I, was. See also εἶ, εἴην, εἶναι, εἰσί, ἦν, ἔσομαι, ἐσμέν, ἐστέ, ἐστί, κέρδος, ἴσθι, ὦ.
present infinitive from εἰμί; to exist:--am, was. come, is, X lust after, X please well, there is, to be, was.
from εἰ and περ; if perhaps:--if so be (that), seeing, though.
from εἰ and -πώς; if somehow:--if by any means.
from εἰρήνη; to be (act) peaceful:--be at (have, live in) peace, live peaceably.
probably from a primary verb  (to join); peace (literally or figuratively); by implication, prosperity:--one, peace, quietness, rest, + set at one again.
from εἰρήνη; pacific; by implication, salutary:--peaceable.
from εἰρηνοποιός; to be a peace-maker, i.e. (figuratively) to harmonize:--make peace.
from εἰρήνη and ποιέω; pacificatory, i.e. (subjectively) peaceable:--peacemaker.

a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively).
a primary numeral; one:--a(-n, -ny, certain), + abundantly, man, one (another), only, other, some. See also εἷς καθ’ εἷς, μηδείς, μία, οὐδείς.
from εἰς and ἄγω; to introduce (literally or figuratively):--bring in(-to), (+ was to) lead into.
from εἰς and ἀκούω; to listen to:--hear.
from εἰς and δέχομαι; to take into one's favor:--receive.
from εἰς and  (to go); to enter:--enter (go) into.
from εἰς and ἔρχομαι; to enter (literally or figuratively):--X arise, come (in, into), enter in(-to), go in (through).
3rd person plural present indicative of εἰμί; they are:--agree, are, be, dure, X is, were.
from εἷς repeated with κατά inserted; severally:--one by one.
from εἰς and καλέω; to invite in:--call in.
from εἰς and ὁδός; an entrance (literally or figuratively):--coming, enter(-ing) in (to).
from εἰς and  (to leap); to rush in:--run (spring) in.
from εἰς and πορεύομαι; to enter (literally or figuratively):--come (enter) in, go into.
from εἰς and τρέχω; to hasten inward:--run in.
from εἰς and φέρω; to carry inward (literally or figuratively):--bring (in), lead into.
of uncertain affinity; a particle of succession (in time or logical enumeration), then, moreover:--after that(-ward), furthermore, then. See also ἔπειτα.
from εἰ and τέ; if too:--if, or, whether.
from εἰ and τὶς; if any:--he that, if a(-ny) man('s thing, from any, ought), whether any, whosoever.

a primary preposition denoting origin (the point whence action or motion proceeds), from, out (of place, time, or cause; literal or figurative; direct or remote):--after, among, X are, at, betwixt(-yond), by (the means of), exceedingly, (+ abundantly above), for(- th), from (among, forth, up), + grudgingly, + heartily, X heavenly, X hereby, + very highly, in, …ly, (because, by reason) of, off (from), on, out among (from, of), over, since, X thenceforth, through, X unto, X vehemently, with(-out). Often used in composition, with the same general import; often of completion.
as if a superlative of  (afar); each or every:--any, both, each (one), every (man, one, woman), particularly.
as if from ἕκαστος and τότε; at every time:--always.
of uncertain affinity; a hundred:--hundred.
from ἑκατόν and ἔτος; centenarian:--hundred years old.
from ἑκατόν and a presumed derivative of πλάσσω; a hundred times:--hundredfold.
from ἑκατόν and ἄρχω; the captain of one hundred men:--centurion.
from ἐκ and βάλλω; to eject (literally or figuratively):--bring forth, cast (forth, out), drive (out), expel, leave, pluck (pull, take, thrust) out, put forth (out), send away (forth, out).
from a compound of ἐκ and the base of βάσις (meaning to go out); an exit (literally or figuratively):--end, way to escape.
from ἐκβάλλω; ejection, i.e. (specially) a throwing overboard of the cargo:--+ lighten the ship.
from ἐκ and a form of γαμίσκω (compare ἐκγαμίσκω); to marry off a daughter:--give in marriage.
from ἐκ and γαμίσκω; the same as 1547:--give in marriage.
neuter of a derivative of a compound of ἐκ and γίνομαι; a descendant, i.e. (specially) grandchild:--nephew.
from ἐκ and δαπανάω; to expend (wholly), i.e. (figuratively) exhaust:--spend.
from ἐκ and δέχομαι; to accept from some source, i.e. (by implication) to await:--expect, look (tarry) for, wait (for).
from ἐκ and δῆλος; wholly evident:--manifest.
from a compound of ἐκ and δῆμος; to emigrate, i.e. (figuratively) vacate or quit:--be absent.
from ἐκ and δίδωμι; to give forth, i.e. (specially) to lease:--let forth (out).
from ἐκ and a compound of διά and ἡγέομαι; to narrate through wholly:--declare.
from ἔκδικος; to vindicate, retaliate, punish:--a (re-)venge.
from ἐκδικέω; vindication, retribution:--(a-, re-)venge(-ance), punishment.
from ἐκ and δίκη; carrying justice out, i.e. a punisher:--a (re-)venger.
from ἐκ and διώκω; to pursue out, i.e. expel or persecute implacably:--persecute.
from ἐκ and a derivative of δίδωμι; given out or over, i.e. surrendered:--delivered.
from ἐκδέχομαι; expectation:--looking for.
from ἐκ and the base of δύνω; to cause to sink out of, i.e. (specially as of clothing) to divest:--strip, take off from, unclothe.
of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither:--there, thither(-ward), (to) yonder (place).
from ἐκεῖ; thence:--from that place, (from) thence, there.
from ἐκεῖ; that one (or (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed:--he, it, the other (same), selfsame, that (same, very), X their, X them, they, this, those. See also οὗτος.
from ἐκεῖ; thither:--there.
from ἐκ and ζητέω; to search out, i.e. (figuratively)investigate, crave, demand, (by Hebraism) worship:--en- (re-)quire, seek after (carefully, diligently).
from ἔκθαμβος; to astonish utterly:--affright, greatly (sore) amaze.
from ἐκ and θάμβος; utterly astounded:--greatly wondering.
from ἐκ and a derivative of τίθημι; put out, i.e. exposed to perish:--cast out.
from ἐκ and καθαίρω; to cleanse thoroughly:--purge (out).
from ἐκ and καίω; to inflame deeply:--burn.
from ἐκ and κακός; to be (bad or) weak, i.e. (by implication) to fail (in heart):--faint, be weary.
from ἐκ and the base of κέντρον; to transfix:--pierce.
from ἐκ and κλάω; to exscind:--break off.
from ἐκ and κλείω; to shut out (literally or figuratively):--exclude.

from a compound of ἐκ and a derivative of καλέω; a calling out, i.e. (concretely) a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation (Jewish synagogue, or Christian community of members on earth or saints in heaven or both):--assembly, church.
from ἐκ and κλίνω; to deviate, i.e. (absolutely) to shun (literally or figuratively), or (relatively) to decline (from piety):--avoid, eschew, go out of the way.
from ἐκ and κολυμβάω; to escape by swimming:--swim out.
from ἐκ and κομίζω; to bear forth (to burial):--carry out.
from ἐκ and κόπτω; to exscind; figuratively, to frustrate:--cut down (off, out), hew down, hinder.
middle voice from ἐκ and κρεμάννυμι; to hang upon the lips of a speaker, i.e. listen closely:--be very attentive.
from ἐκ and λαλέω; to divulge:--tell.
from ἐκ and λάμπω; to be resplendent:--shine forth.
middle voice from ἐκ and λανθάνω; to be utterly oblivious of:--forget.
middle voice from ἐκ and λέγω (in its primary sense); to select:--make choice, choose (out), chosen.
from ἐκ and λείπω; to omit, i.e. (by implication) cease (die):--fail.
from ἐκλέγομαι; select; by implication, favorite:--chosen, elect.
from ἐκλέγομαι; (divine) selection (abstractly or concretely):--chosen, election.
from ἐκ and λύω; to relax (literally or figuratively):--faint.
from ἐκ and the base of μασσάομαι; to knead out, i.e. (by analogy) to wipe dry:--wipe.
from ἐκ and μυκτηρίζω; to sneer outright at:--deride.
from ἐκ and νεύω; (by analogy) to slip off, i.e. quietly withdraw:--convey self away.
from ἐκ and νήφω; (figuratively) to rouse (oneself) out of stupor:--awake.
neuter of a derivative from ἑκών; voluntariness:--willingly.
adverb from the same as ἑκούσιον; voluntarily:--wilfully, willingly.
from ἐκ and πάλαι; long ago, for a long while:--of a long time, of old.
from ἐκ and πειράζω; to test thoroughly:--tempt.
from ἐκ and πέμπω; to despatch:--send away (forth).
from ἐκ and a form of πέτομαι; to fly out, i.e. (by analogy) to extend:--stretch forth.
from ἐκ and πίπτω; to drop away; specially, be driven out of one's course; figuratively, to lose, become inefficient:--be cast, fail, fall (away, off), take none effect.
from ἐκ and πλέω; to depart by ship:--sail (away, thence).
from ἐκ and πληρόω; to accomplish entirely:--fulfill.
from ἐκπληρόω; completion:--accomplishment.
from ἐκ and πλήσσω; to strike with astonishment:--amaze, astonish.
from ἐκ and πνέω; to expire:--give up the ghost.
from ἐκ and πορεύομαι; to depart, be discharged, proceed, project:--come (forth, out of), depart, go (forth, out), issue, proceed (out of).
from ἐκ and πορνεύω; to be utterly unchaste:--give self over to fornication.
from ἐκ and πτύω; to spit out, i.e. (figuratively) spurn:--reject.
from ἐκ and ῥιζόω; to uproot:--pluck up by the root, root up.
from ἐξίστημι; a displacement of the mind, i.e. bewilderment, "ecstasy":--+ be amazed, amazement, astonishment, trance.
from ἐκ and στρέφω; to pervert (figuratively):--subvert.
from ἐκ and ταράσσω; to disturb wholly:--exceedingly trouble.
from ἐκ and teino (to stretch); to extend:--cast, put forth, stretch forth (out).
from ἐκ and τελέω; to complete fully:--finish.
from ἐκτενής; intentness:--X instantly.
neuter of the comparative of ἐκτενής; more intently:--more earnestly.
from ἐκτείνω; intent:--without ceasing, fervent.
adverb from ἐκτενής; intently:--fervently.
from ἐκ and τίθημι; to expose; figuratively, to declare:--cast out, expound.
from ἐκ and tinasso (to swing); to shake violently:--shake (off).
from ἐκ; the exterior; figuratively (as a preposition) aside from, besides:--but, except(-ed), other than, out of, outside, unless, without.
ordinal from ἕξ; sixth:--sixth.
from ἐκ and the base of τροπή; to deflect, i.e. turn away (literally or figuratively):--avoid, turn (aside, out of the way).
from ἐκ and τρέφω; to rear up to maturity, i.e. (genitive case) to cherish or train:--bring up, nourish.
from a comparative of ἐκ and  (to wound); a miscarriage (abortion), i.e. (by analogy) untimely birth:--born out of due time.
from ἐκ and φέρω; to bear out (literally or figuratively):--bear, bring forth, carry forth (out).
from ἐκ and φεύγω; to flee out:--escape, flee.
from ἐκ and φοβέω; to frighten utterly:--terrify.
from ἐκ and φόβος; frightened out of one's wits:-- sore afraid, exceedingly fear.
from ἐκ and φύω; to sprout up:--put forth.
from ἐκ and  (to pour); to pour forth; figuratively, to bestow:--gush (pour) out, run greedily (out), shed (abroad, forth), spill.
from ἐκ and χωρέω; to depart:--depart out.
from ἐκ and ψύχω; to expire:--give (yield) up the ghost.
of uncertain affinity; voluntary:--willingly.
feminine of a presumed derivative from an obsolete primary; an olive (the tree or the fruit):--olive (berry, tree).
neuter of the same as ἐλαία; olive oil:--oil.
from ἐλαία; an olive-orchard, i.e. (specially) the Mount of Olives:--Olivet.
of Hebrew origin (עֵילָם); an Elamite or Persian:--Elamite.
comparative of the same as ἐλάχιστος; smaller (in size, quantity, age or quality):--less, under, worse, younger.
from ἐλάσσων; to diminish, i.e. fall short:--have lack.
from ἐλάσσων; to lessen (in rank or influence):--decrease, make lower.
a prolonged form of a primary verb (obsolete except in certain tenses as an alternative of this) of uncertain affinity; to push (as wind, oars or dæmonical power):--carry, drive, row.
from ἐλαφρός; levity (figuratively), i.e. fickleness:--lightness.
probably akin to ἐλαύνω and the base of ἐλάσσων; light, i.e. easy:--light.
superlative of  (short); used as equivalent to μικρός; least (in size, amount, dignity, etc.):--least, very little (small), smallest.
comparative of ἐλάχιστος; far less:--less than the least.
of Hebrew origin (אֶלְעָזָר); Eleazar, an Israelite:--Eleazar.
from ἐλέγχω; refutation, i.e. reproof:--rebuke.
from ἐλέγχω; proof, conviction:--evidence, reproof.
of uncertain affinity; to confute, admonish:--convict, convince, tell a fault, rebuke, reprove.
from ἔλεος; pitiable:--miserable.
from ἔλεος; to compassionate (by word or deed, specially, by divine grace):--have compassion (pity on), have (obtain, receive, shew) mercy (on).
from ἔλεος; compassionateness, i.e. (as exercised towards the poor) beneficence, or (concretely) a benefaction:--alms(-deeds).
from ἐλεέω; compassionate (actively):--merciful.
of uncertain affinity; compassion (human or divine, especially active):--(+ tender) mercy.
from ἐλεύθερος; freedom (legitimate or licentious, chiefly moral or ceremonial):--liberty.

probably from the alternate of ἔρχομαι; unrestrained (to go at pleasure), i.e. (as a citizen) not a slave (whether freeborn or manumitted), or (genitive case) exempt (from obligation or liability):--free (man, woman), at liberty.
from ἐλεύθερος; to liberate, i.e. (figuratively) to exempt (from moral, ceremonial or mortal liability):--deliver, make free.
from the alternate of ἔρχομαι; an advent:--coming.
from  (an "elephant"); elephantine, i.e. (by implication) composed of ivory:--of ivory.
of Hebrew origin (אֶלְיָקִים); Eliakim, an Israelite:--Eliakim.
of Hebrew origin (אֱלִיעֶזֶר); Eliezer, an Israelite:--Eliezer.
of Hebrew origin (אֵל and הוֹד); God of majesty; Eliud, an Israelite:--Eliud.
of Hebrew origin (אֱלִישֶׁבַע); Elisabet, an Israelitess:--Elisabeth.
of Hebrew origin (אֱלִישָׁע); Elissæus, an Israelite:--Elissæus.
a form of εἱλίσσω; to coil or wrap:--fold up.
probably from ἑλκύω; an ulcer (as if drawn together):--sore.
from ἕλκος; to cause to ulcerate, i.e. (passively) be ulcerous:--full of sores.
probably akin to αἱρέομαι; to drag (literally or figuratively):--draw. Compare ἑλίσσω.
of uncertain affinity; Hellas (or Greece), a country of Europe:--Greece.
from Ἑλλάς; a Hellen (Grecian) or inhabitant of Hellas; by extension a Greek-speaking person, especially a non-Jew:-- Gentile, Greek.
from Ἕλλην; Hellenic, i.e. Grecian (in language):--Greek.
feminine of Ἕλλην; a Grecian (i.e. non-Jewish) woman:--Greek.
from a derivative of Ἕλλην; a Hellenist or Greek-speaking Jew:--Grecian.
adverb from the same as Ἑλληνιστής; Hellenistically, i.e. in the Grecian language:--Greek.
from ἐν and λόγος (in the sense of account); to reckon in, i.e. attribute:--impute, put on account.
of Hebrew origin (perhaps for אַלְמוֹדָד); Elmodam, an Israelite:--Elmodam.
from ἐλπίς; to expect or confide:--(have, thing) hope(-d) (for), trust.
from a primary  (to anticipate, usually with pleasure); expectation (abstractly or concretely) or confidence:--faith, hope.
of foreign origin; Elymas, a wizard:--Elymas.
of Chaldean origin (אֱלָהּ with pronominal suffix) my God:--Eloi.
genitive case compound of ἐμοῦ and αὐτός; of myself so likewise the dative case        , and accusative case        :--me, mine own (self), myself.
from ἐν and the base of βάσις; to walk on, i.e. embark (aboard a vessel), reach (a pool):--come (get) into, enter (into), go (up) into, step in, take ship.
from ἐν and βάλλω; to throw on, i.e. (figuratively) subject to (eternal punishment):--cast into.
from ἐν and βάπτω; to whelm on, i.e. wet (a part of the person, etc.) by contact with a fluid:--dip.
from ἐν and a presumed derivative of the base of βάσις; equivalent to ἐμβαίνω; to intrude on (figuratively):--intrude into.
from ἐν and  (to mount; causative of ἐμβαίνω); to place on, i.e. transfer (aboard a vessel):--put in.
from ἐν and βλέπω; to look on, i.e. (relatively) to observe fixedly, or (absolutely) to discern clearly:--behold, gaze up, look upon, (could) see.

from ἐν and  (to snort with anger); to have indignation on, i.e. (transitively) to blame, (intransitively) to sigh with chagrin, (specially) to sternly enjoin:--straitly charge, groan, murmur against.
a prolonged form of μέ; me:--I, me, my(-self).
of uncertain affinity; to vomit:--(will) spue.
from ἐν and μαίνομαι; to rave on, i.e. rage at:--be mad against.
of Hebrew origin (עִמָּנוּאֵל); God with us; Emmanuel, a name of Christ:--Emmanuel.
probably of Hebrew origin (compare יֵם); Emmaus, a place in Palestine:--Emmaus.
from ἐν and μένω; to stay in the same place, i.e. (figuratively) persevere:--continue.
of Hebrew origin (חֲמוֹר); Emmor (i.e. Chamor), a Canaanite:--Emmor.
a prolonged form of μοί; to me:--I, me, mine, my.
from the oblique cases of ἐγώ (ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἐμέ); my:--of me, mine (own), my.
a prolonged form of μόχθος; of me:--me, mine, my.
from ἐμπαίζω; derision:--mocking.
from ἐν and παίζω; to jeer at, i.e. deride:--mock.
from ἐμπαίζω; a derider, i.e. (by implication) a false teacher:--mocker, scoffer.
from ἐν and περιπατέω; to perambulate on a place, i.e. (figuratively) to be occupied among persons:--walk in.
from ἐν and the base of πλεῖστος;to fill in (up), i.e. (by implication) to satisfy (literally or figuratively):--fill.
from ἐν and πίπτω; to fall on, i.e. (literally) to be entrapped by, or (figuratively) be overwhelmed with:--fall among (into).
from ἐν and πλέκω; to entwine, i.e. (figuratively) involve with:--entangle (in, self with).
from ἐμπλέκω; elaborate braiding of the hair:--plaiting.
from ἐν and πνέω; to inhale, i.e. (figuratively) to be animated by (bent upon):--breathe.
from ἐν and πορεύομαι; to travel in (a country as a pedlar), i.e. (by implication) to trade:--buy and sell, make merchandise.
feminine from ἔμπορος; traffic:--merchandise.
neuter from ἔμπορος; a mart ("emporium"):--merchandise.
from ἐν and the base of πορεύομαι; a (wholesale) tradesman:--merchant.
from ἐν and  (to blow a flame); to enkindle, i.e. set on fire:--burn up.
from ἐν and πρός; in front of (in place (literally or figuratively) or time):--against, at, before, (in presence, sight) of.
from ἐν and πτύω; to spit at or on:--spit (upon).
from a compound of ἐν and φαίνω; apparent in self:--manifest, openly.
from ἐμφανής; to exhibit (in person) or disclose (by words):--appear, declare (plainly), inform, (will) manifest, shew, signify.
from ἐν and φόβος; in fear, i.e. alarmed:--affrighted, afraid, tremble.
from ἐν and  (to puff) (compare φύω); to blow at or on:--breathe on.
from ἐν and a derivative of φύω; implanted (figuratively):--engrafted.

a primary preposition denoting (fixed) position (in place, time or state), and (by implication) instrumentality (medially or constructively), i.e. a relation of rest (intermediate between εἰς and ἐκ); "in," at, (up-)on, by, etc.:--about, after, against, + almost, X altogether, among, X as, at, before, between, (here-)by (+ all means), for (… sake of), + give self wholly to, (here-)in(-to, -wardly), X mightily, (because) of, (up-)on, (open-)ly, X outwardly, one, X quickly, X shortly, (speedi-)ly, X that, X there(-in, -on), through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), under, when, where(-with), while, with(-in). Often used in compounds, with substantially the same import; rarely with verbs of motion, and then not to indicate direction, except (elliptically) by a separate (and different) preposition.
from ἐν and a derivative of ἀγκάλη; to take in one's arms, i.e. embrace:--take up in arms.
from ἐν and ἅλς; in the sea, i.e. marine:--thing in the sea.
from ἐν and ἀντί; in front (i.e. figuratively, presence) of:--before.
neuter of ἐναντίος; (adverbially) in the presence (view) of:--before, in the presence of.
from ἔναντι; opposite; figuratively, antagonistic:--(over) against, contrary.
from ἐν and ἄρχομαι; to commence on:--rule (by mistake for ἄρχω).
from a compound of ἐν and δέω (in the sense of lacking); deficient in:--lacking.
from ἐνδείκνυμι; an indication (concretely):--manifest token.
from ἐν and δεικνύω; to indicate (by word or act):--do, show (forth).
from ἐνδείκνυμι; indication (abstractly):--declare, evident token, proof.
from (the neuter of) εἷς and δέκα; one and ten, i.e. eleven:--eleven.
ordinal from ἕνδεκα; eleventh:--eleventh.
third person singular present of a compound of ἐν and δέχομαι; (impersonally) it is accepted in, i.e. admitted (possible):--can (+ not) be.
from a compound of ἐν and δῆμος; to be in one's own country, i.e. home (figuratively):--be at home (present).
a prolonged form of ἐνδύω; to invest (with a garment):--clothe in, wear.
from ἐν and δίκη; in the right, i.e. equitable:--just.
from a compound of ἐν and a derivative of the base of δῆμος; a housing in (residence), i.e. structure:--building.
from ἔνδοξος; to glorify:--glorify.
from ἐν and δόξα; in glory, i.e. splendid, (figuratively) noble:--glorious, gorgeous(-ly), honourable.
from ἐνδύω; apparel (especially the outer robe):--clothing, garment, raiment.
from ἐν and δυναμόω; to empower:--enable, (increase in) strength(-en), be (make) strong.
from ἔννομος and δύνω; to sink (by implication, wrap (compare ἐνδύω) on, i.e. (figuratively) sneak:--creep.
from ἐνδύω; investment with clothing:--putting on.
from ἐν and δύνω (in the sense of sinking into a garment); to invest with clothing (literally or figuratively):--array, clothe (with), endue, have (put) on.
feminine from ἐν and the base of ἑδραῖος; an ambuscade, i.e. (figuratively) murderous purpose:--lay wait. See also ἔνεδρον.
from ἐνέδρα; to lurk, i.e. (figuratively) plot assassination:--lay wait for.
neuter of the same as ἐνέδρα; an ambush, i.e. (figuratively) murderous design:--lying in wait.
from ἔννομος and the base of εἱλίσσω; to enwrap:--wrap in.
from ἔννομος and εἰμί; to be within (neuter participle plural):--such things as … have. See also ἔνι.
of uncertain affinity; on account of:--because, for (cause, sake), (where-)fore, by reason of, that.
from ἐνεργής; efficiency ("energy"):--operation, strong, (effectual) working.
from ἐνεργής; to be active, efficient:--do, (be) effectual (fervent), be mighty in, shew forth self, work (effectually in).
from ἐνεργέω; an effect:--operation, working.
from ἐν and ἔργον; active, operative:--effectual, powerful.
from ἐν and εὐλογέω; to confer a benefit on:--bless.
from ἐν and ἔχω; to hold in or upon, i.e. ensnare; by implication, to keep a grudge:--entangle with, have a quarrel against, urge.
from a prolonged form of ἐν; properly, within, i.e. (of place) here, hither:--(t-)here, hither.
from a compound of ἐν and θυμός; to be inspirited, i.e. ponder:--think.
from ἐνθυμέομαι; deliberation:--device, thought.
contraction for the third person singular present indicative of ἔνειμι; impersonally, there is in or among:--be, (there) is.
prolongation from a primary  (a year); a year:--year.
from ἐν and ἵστημι; to place on hand, i.e. (reflexively) impend, (participle) be instant:--come, be at hand, present.
from ἐν and ἰσχύω; to invigorate (transitively or reflexively):--strengthen.
ordinal from ἐννέα; ninth:--ninth.
a primary number; nine:--nine.
from a (tenth) multiple of ἐννέα and ἐννέα itself; ninety-nine:--ninety and nine.
from ἐννεύω; dumb (as making signs), i.e. silent from astonishment:--speechless.
from ἐν and νεύω; to nod at, i.e. beckon or communicate by gesture:--make signs.
from a compound of ἐν and νοῦς; thoughtfulness, i.e. moral understanding:--intent, mind.
from ἐν and νόμος; (subjectively) legal, or (objectively) subject to:--lawful, under law.
neuter of a compound of ἐν and νύξ; (adverbially) by night:--before day.
from ἐν and οἰκέω; to inhabit (figuratively):--dwell in.
from εἷς; oneness, i.e. (figuratively) unanimity:--unity.
from ἐν and ὀχλέω; to crowd in, i.e. (figuratively) to annoy:--trouble.
from ἐνέχω; liable to (a condition, penalty or imputation):--in danger of, guilty of, subject to.
from ἐντέλλομαι; an injunction, i.e. religious precept:--commandment.
from a compound of ἐν and τάφος; to inswathe with cerements for interment:--bury.
from ἐνταφιάζω; preparation for interment:--burying.
from ἐν and the base of τέλος; to enjoin:--(give) charge, (give) command(-ments), injoin.
from the same as ἐνθάδε; hence (literally or figuratively); (repeated) on both sides:--(from) hence, on either side.
from ἐντυγχάνω; an interview, i.e. (specially) supplication:--intercession, prayer.
from ἐν and τιμή; valued (figuratively):--dear, more honourable, precious, in reputation.
from ἐντέλλομαι; injunction, i.e. an authoritative prescription:--commandment, precept.
from ἐν and τόπος; a resident:--of that place.
from ἐν; inside (adverb or noun):--within.
from ἐν and the base of τροπή; to invert, i.e. (figuratively and reflexively) in a good sense, to respect; or in a bad one, to confound:--regard, (give) reference, shame.
from ἐν and τρέφω; (figuratively) to educate:--nourish up in.
from ἐν and τρόμος; terrified:--X quake, X trembled.
from ἐντρέπω; confusion:--shame.
from ἐν and τρυφάω; to revel in:--sporting selves.
from ἐν and τυγχάνω; to chance upon, i.e. (by implication) confer with; by extension to entreat (in favor or against):--deal with, make intercession.
from ἐν and  (to twist; probably akin to εἱλίσσω); to entwine, i.e. wind up in:--wrap in (together).
from ἐν and a derivative of τύπος; to enstamp, i.e. engrave:--engrave.
from ἐν and ὑβρίζω; to insult:--do despite unto.
middle voice from ἐνύπνιον; to dream:--dream(-er).
from ἐν and ὕπνος; something seen in sleep, i.e. a dream (vision in a dream):--dream.
neuter of a compound of ἐν and a derivative of ὀπτάνομαι; in the face of (literally or figuratively):--before, in the presence (sight) of, to.
of Hebrew origin (אֱנוֹשׁ); Enos (i.e. Enosh), a patriarch:--Enos.
middle voice from a compound of ἐν and οὖς; to take in one's ear, i.e. to listen:--hearken.
of Hebrew origin (חֲנוֹךְ); Enoch (i.e. Chanok), an antediluvian:--Enoch.
a primary numeral; six:--six.
from ἐκ and the base of ἄγγελος; to publish, i.e. celebrate:--shew forth.
from ἐκ and ἀγοράζω; to buy up, i.e. ransom; figuratively, to rescue from loss (improve opportunity):--redeem.
from ἐκ and ἄγω; to lead forth:--bring forth (out), fetch (lead) out.
from ἐκ and αἱρέομαι; actively, to tear out; middle voice, to select; figuratively, to release:--deliver, pluck out, rescue.
from ἐκ and αἴρω; to remove:--put (take) away.
middle voice from ἐκ and αἰτέω; to demand (for trial):--desire.
from ἐκ and the base of αἰφνίδιος; of a sudden (unexpectedly):--suddenly. Compare ἐξάπινα.
from ἐκ and ἀκολουθέω; to follow out, i.e. (figuratively) to imitate, obey, yield to:--follow.
plural ordinal from ἕξ and ἑκατόν; six hundred:--six hundred.
from ἐκ and ἀλείφω; to smear out, i.e. obliterate (erase tears, figuratively, pardon sin):--blot out, wipe away.
from ἐκ and ἅλλομαι; to spring forth :--leap up.
from ἐξανίστημι; a rising from death:--resurrection.
from ἐκ and ἀνατέλλω; to start up out of the ground, i.e. germinate:--spring up.
from ἐκ and ἀνίστημι; objectively, to produce, i.e. (figuratively) beget; subjectively, to arise, i.e. (figuratively) object:--raise (rise) up.
from ἐκ and ἀπατάω; to seduce wholly:--beguile, deceive.
from ἐκ and a derivative of the same as αἰφνίδιος; of a sudden, i.e. unexpectedly:--suddenly. Compare ἐξαίφνης.
middle voice from ἐκ and ἀπορέω; to be utterly at a loss, i.e. despond:--(in) despair.
from ἐκ and ἀποστέλλω; to send away forth, i.e. (on a mission) to despatch, or (peremptorily) to dismiss:--send (away, forth, out).
from ἐκ and a derivative of ἄρτιος; to finish out (time); figuratively, to equip fully (a teacher):--accomplish, thoroughly furnish.
from ἐκ and ἀστράπτω; to lighten forth, i.e. (figuratively) to be radiant (of very white garments):--glistening.
from ἐκ and the genitive case singular feminine of αὐτός (ὥρα being understood); from that hour, i.e. instantly:--by and by, immediately, presently, straightway.
from ἐκ and ἐγείρω; to rouse fully, i.e. (figuratively) to resuscitate (from death), release (from infliction):--raise up.
from ἐκ and  (to go); to issue, i.e. leave (a place), escape (to the shore):--depart, get (to land), go out.
from ἐκ and ἐλέγχω; to convict fully, i.e. (by implication) to punish:--convince.
from ἐκ and ἑλκύω; to drag forth, i.e. (figuratively) to entice (to sin):--draw away.
from a comparative of ἐκ and a presumed  (to spue); vomit, i.e. food disgorged:--vomit.
from ἐκ and ἐρευνάω; to explore (figuratively):--search diligently.
from ἐκ and ἔρχομαι; to issue (literally or figuratively):--come (forth, out), depart (out of), escape, get out, go (abroad, away, forth, out, thence), proceed (forth), spread abroad.

third person singular present indicative of a compound of ἐκ and εἰμί; so also         neuter present participle of the same (with or without some form of εἰμί expressed); impersonally, it is right (through the figurative idea of being out in public):--be lawful, let, X may(-est).
from ἐκ and  (to examine); to test thoroughly (by questions), i.e. ascertain or interrogate:--ask, enquire, search.
from ἐκ and ἡγέομαι; to consider out (aloud), i.e. rehearse, unfold:--declare, tell.
the tenth multiple of ἕξ; sixty:--sixty(-fold), threescore.
from ἔχω (in the sense of taking hold of, i.e. adjoining); successive:--after, following, X morrow, next.
middle voice from ἐκ and ἠχέω; to "echo" forth, i.e. resound (be generally reported):--sound forth.
from ἔχω; habit, i.e. (by implication) practice:--use.
from ἐκ and ἵστημι; to put (stand) out of wits, i.e. astound, or (reflexively) become astounded, insane:--amaze, be (make) astonished, be beside self (selves), bewitch, wonder.
from ἐκ and ἰσχύω; to have full strength, i.e. be entirely competent:--be able.
from ἐκ and ὁδός; an exit, i.e. (figuratively) death:--decease, departing.
from ἐκ and ὀλοθρεύω; to extirpate:--destroy.
from ἐκ and ὁμολογέω; to acknowledge or (by implication, of assent) agree fully:--confess, profess, promise.
from ἐκ and ὁρκίζω; to exact an oath, i.e. conjure:--adjure.
from ἐξορκίζω; one that binds by an oath (or spell), i.e. (by implication) an "exorcist" (conjurer):--exorcist.
from ἐκ and ὀρύσσω; to dig out, i.e. (by extension) to extract (an eye), remove (roofing):--break up, pluck out.
from ἐκ and a derivative of the neuter of οὐδείς; to make utterly nothing of, i.e. despise:--set at nought. See also ἐξουθενέω.
a variation of ἐξουδενόω and meaning the same:--contemptible, despise, least esteemed, set at nought.

from ἔξεστι (in the sense of ability); privilege, i.e. (subjectively) force, capacity, competency, freedom, or (objectively) mastery (concretely, magistrate, superhuman, potentate, token of control), delegated influence:--authority, jurisdiction, liberty, power, right, strength.
from ἐξουσία; to control:--exercise authority upon, bring under the (have) power of.
from a compound of ἐκ and ἔχω (meaning to stand out); prominence (figuratively):--principal.
from ἔξυπνος; to waken:--awake out of sleep.
from ἐκ and ὕπνος; awake:--X out of sleep.
adverb from ἐκ; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively:--away, forth, (with-)out (of, -ward), strange.
from ἔξω; external(-ly):--out(-side, -ward, - wardly), (from) without.
from ἐκ and  (to push); to expel; by implication, to propel:--drive out, thrust in.
comparative of ἔξω; exterior:--outer.
from ἑορτή; to observe a festival:--keep the feast.
of uncertain affinity; a festival:--feast, holyday.
from ἐπαγγέλλω; an announcement (for information, assent or pledge; especially a divine assurance of good):--message, promise.
from ἐπί and the base of ἄγγελος; to announce upon (reflexively), i.e. (by implication) to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself:--profess, (make) promise.
from ἐπαγγέλλω; a self-committal (by assurance of conferring some good):--promise.
from ἐπί and ἄγω; to superinduce, i.e. inflict (an evil), charge (a crime):--bring upon.
from ἐπί and ἀγωνίζομαι; to struggle for:--earnestly contend for.
from ἐπί and  (to assemble); to accumulate:--gather thick together.
from ἐπαινέω; praised; Epænetus, a Christian:--Epenetus.
from ἐπί and αἰνέω; to applaud:--commend, laud, praise.
from ἐπί and the base of αἰνέω; laudation; concretely, a commendable thing:--praise.
from ἐπί and αἴρω; to raise up (literally or figuratively):--exalt self, poise (lift, take) up.
from ἐπί and αἰσχύνομαι; to feel shame for something:--be ashamed.
from ἐπί and αἰτέω; to ask for:--beg.
from ἐπί and ἀκολουθέω; to accompany:--follow (after).
from ἐπί and ἀκούω; to hearken (favorably) to:--hear.
from ἐπί and the base of ἀκροατής; to listen (intently) to:--hear.
from ἐπί and ἄν; a particle of indefinite contemporaneousness; whenever, as soon as:--when.
neuter of a presumed compound of ἐπί and ἀνάγκη; (adverbially) on necessity, i.e. necessarily:--necessary.
from ἐπί and ἀνάγω; to lead up on, i.e. (technical) to put out (to sea); (intransitively) to return:--launch (thrust) out, return.
from ἐπί and ἀναμιμνήσκω; to remind of:--put in mind.
middle voice from ἐπί and ἀναπαύω; to settle on; literally (remain) or figuratively (rely):--rest in (upon).
from ἐπί and ἀνέρχομαι; to come up on, i.e. return:--come again, return.
middle voice from ἐπί and ἀνίστημι; to stand up on, i.e. (figuratively) to attack:--rise up against.
from a compound of ἐπί and ἀνορθόω; a straightening up again, i.e. (figuratively) rectification (reformation):-- correction.
from ἐπί and ἄνω; up above, i.e. over or on (of place, amount, rank, etc.):--above, more than, (up-)on, over.
from ἐπί and ἀρκέω; to avail for, i.e. help:--relieve.
from a compound of ἐπί and ἄρχω (meaning a governor of a district, "eparch"); a special region of government, i.e. a Roman præfecture:--province.
from ἐπί and an equivalent of αὐλή; a hut over the head, i.e. a dwelling:--habitation.
from ἐπί and αὔριον; occurring on the succeeding day, i.e. (ἡμέρα being implied) to-morrow:--day following, morrow, next day (after).
from ἐπί and αὐτός and (the dative case singular of) a derivative of  (a thief); in theft itself, i.e. (by analogy) in actual crime:--in the very act.
contracted from Ἐπαφρόδιτος; Epaphras, a Christian:--Epaphras.
from ἐπί and ἀφρίζω; to foam upon, i.e. (figuratively) to exhibit (a vile passion):--foam out.
from ἐπί (in the sense of devoted to) and  (Venus); Epaphroditus, a Christian:--Epaphroditus. Compare Ἐπαφρᾶς.
from ἐπί and ἐγείρω; to rouse upon, i.e. (figuratively) to excite against:--raise, stir up.
from ἐπί and εἰ; thereupon, i.e. since (of time or cause):--because, else, for that (then, -asmuch as), otherwise, seeing that, since, when.
from ἐπεί and δή; since now, i.e. (of time) when, or (of cause) whereas:--after that, because, for (that, -asmuch as), seeing, since.
from ἐπειδή and περ; since indeed (of cause):--forasmuch.
and other moods and persons of the same tense; from ἐπί and εἴδω; to regard (favorably or otherwise):--behold, look upon.
from ἐπεί and περ; since indeed (of cause):--seeing.
from a compound of ἐπί and εἰσάγω; a superintroduction:--bringing in.
from ἐπί and εἶτα; thereafter:--after that(-ward), then.
from ἐπί and (the accusative case plural neuter of) ἐκεῖνος; upon those parts of, i.e. on the further side of:--beyond.
middle voice from ἐπί and ἐκτείνω; to stretch (oneself) forward upon:--reach forth.
middle voice from ἐπί and ἐνδύω; to invest upon oneself:--be clothed upon.
from ἐπενδύομαι; a wrapper, i.e. outer garment:--fisher's coat.
from ἐπί and ἔρχομαι; to supervene, i.e. arrive, occur, impend, attack, (figuratively) influence:--come (in, upon).
from ἐπί and ἐρωτάω; to ask for, i.e. inquire, seek:--ask (after, questions), demand, desire, question.
from ἐπερωτάω; an inquiry:--answer.
from ἐπί and ἔχω; to hold upon, i.e. (by implication) to retain; (by extension) to detain; (with implication, of νοῦς) to pay attention to:--give (take) heed unto, hold forth, mark, stay.
from a comparative of ἐπί and (probably)  (threats); to insult, slander:--use despitefully, falsely accuse.

a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. In compounds it retains essentially the same import, at, upon, etc. (literally or figuratively).
from ἐπί and the base of βάσις; to walk upon, i.e. mount, ascend, embark, arrive:--come (into), enter into, go abroad, sit upon, take ship.

from ἐπί and βάλλω; to throw upon (literal or figurative, transitive or reflexive; usually with more or less force); specially (with ἑαυτοῦ implied) to reflect; impersonally, to belong to:--beat into, cast (up-)on, fall, lay (on), put (unto), stretch forth, think on.
from ἐπί and βαρέω; to be heavy upon, i.e. (pecuniarily) to be expensive to; figuratively, to be severe towards:--be chargeable to, overcharge.
from ἐπί and a reduplicated derivative of the base of βάσις (compare ἀναβιβάζω); to cause to mount (an animal):--set on.
from ἐπί and βλέπω; to gaze at (with favor, pity or partiality):--look upon, regard, have respect to.
from ἐπιβάλλω; a patch:--piece.
from ἐπί and βοάω; to exclaim against:--cry.
from a presumed compound of ἐπί and βούλομαι; a plan against someone, i.e. a plot:--laying (lying) in wait.
from ἐπί and a derivative of γάμος; to form affinity with, i.e. (specially) in a levirate way:--marry.
from ἐπί and γῆ; worldly (physically or morally):--earthly, in earth, terrestrial.
from ἐπί and γίνομαι; to arrive upon, i.e. spring up (as a wind):--blow.
from ἐπί and γινώσκω; to know upon some mark, i.e. recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge:--(ac-, have, take)know(-ledge, well), perceive.
from ἐπιγινώσκω; recognition, i.e. (by implication) full discernment, acknowledgement:--(ac-)knowledge(-ing, - ment).
from ἐπιγράφω; an inscription:--superscription.
from ἐπί and γράφω; to inscribe (physically or mentally):--inscription, write in (over, thereon).
from ἐπί and δεικνύω; to exhibit (physically or mentally):--shew.
from ἐπί and δέχομαι; to admit (as a guest or (figuratively) teacher):--receive.
from a compound of ἐπί and δῆμος; to make oneself at home, i.e. (by extension) to reside (in a foreign country):--(be) dwelling (which were) there, stranger.
middle voice from ἐπί and διατάσσω; to appoint besides, i.e. supplement (as a codicil):--add to.
from ἐπί and δίδωμι; to give over (by hand or surrender):--deliver unto, give, let (+ (her drive)), offer.
from ἐπί and a derivative of ὀρθός; to straighten further, i.e. (figuratively) arrange additionally:--set in order.
from ἐπί and δύνω; to set fully (as the sun):--go down.
from ἐπιεικής; suitableness, i.e. (by implication) equity, mildness:--clemency, gentleness.
from ἐπί and εἴκω; appropriate, i.e. (by implication) mild:--gentle, moderation, patient.
from ἐπί and ζητέω; to search (inquire) for; intensively, to demand, to crave:--desire, enquire, seek (after, for).
from ἐπί and θάνατος; doomed to death:--appointed to death.
from ἐπιτίθημι; an imposition (of hands officially):--laying (putting) on.
from ἐπί and θυμός; to set the heart upon, i.e. long for (rightfully or otherwise):--covet, desire, would fain, lust (after).
from ἐπιθυμέω; a craver:--+ lust after.
from ἐπιθυμέω; a longing (especially for what is forbidden):--concupiscence, desire, lust (after).
from ἐπί and καθίζω; to seat upon:--set on.
middle voice from ἐπί and καλέω; to entitle; by implication, to invoke (for aid, worship, testimony, decision, etc.):--appeal (unto), call (on, upon), surname.
from ἐπικαλύπτω; a covering, i.e. (figuratively) pretext:--cloke.
from ἐπί and καλύπτω; to conceal, i.e. (figuratively) forgive:--cover.
from ἐπί and a derivative of καταράομαι; imprecated, i.e. execrable:--accursed.
from ἐπί and κεῖμαι; to rest upon (literally or figuratively):--impose, be instant, (be) laid (there-, up-)on, (when) lay (on), lie (on), press upon.
from  (compare ἐπικουρία) (a noted philosopher); an Epicurean or follower of Epicurus:--Epicurean.
from a compound of ἐπί and a (prolonged) form of the base of κοράσιον (in the sense of servant); assistance:--help.
from ἐπί and κρίνω; to adjudge:--give sentence.
middle voice from ἐπί and λαμβάνω; to seize (for help, injury, attainment, or any other purpose; literally or figuratively):--catch, lay hold (up-)on, take (by, hold of, on).
middle voice from ἐπί and λανθάνω; to lose out of mind; by implication, to neglect:--(be) forget(-ful of).
middle voice from ἐπί and λέγω; to surname, select:--call, choose.
from ἐπί and λείπω; to leave upon, i.e. (figuratively) to be insufficient for:--fail.
from a derivative of ἐπιλανθάνομαι; negligence:--X forgetful.
from ἐπί and λοιποί; left over, i.e. remaining:--rest.
from ἐπιλύω; explanation, i.e. application:--interpretation.
from ἐπί and λύω; to solve further, i.e. (figuratively) to explain, decide:--determine, expound.
from ἐπί and μαρτυρέω; to attest further, i.e. corroborate:--testify.
from ἐπιμελέομαι; carefulness, i.e. kind attention (hospitality):--+ refresh self.
middle voice from ἐπί and the same as μέλω; to care for (physically or otherwise):--take care of.
adverb from a derivative of ἐπιμελέομαι; carefully:--diligently.
from ἐπί and μένω; to stay over, i.e. remain (figuratively, persevere):--abide (in), continue (in), tarry.
from ἐπί and νεύω; to nod at, i.e. (by implication) to assent:--consent.
from ἐπί and νοῦς; attention of the mind, i.e. (by implication) purpose:--thought.
from ἐπίορκος; to commit perjury:--forswear self.
from ἐπί and ὅρκος; on oath, i.e. (falsely) a forswearer:--perjured person.
feminine singular participle of a comparative of ἐπί and  (to go); supervening, i.e. (ἡμέρα or νύξ being expressed or implied) the ensuing day or night:--following, next.
perhaps from the same as ἐπιοῦσα; tomorrow's; but more probably from ἐπί and a derivative of the present participle feminine of εἰμί; for subsistence, i.e. needful:--daily.
from ἐπί and πίπτω; to embrace (with affection) or seize (with more or less violence; literally or figuratively):--fall into (on, upon) lie on, press upon.
from ἐπί and πλήσσω; to chastise, i.e. (with words) to upbraid:--rebuke.
from ἐπί and πνίγω; to throttle upon, i.e. (figuratively) overgrow:--choke.
from ἐπί and potheo (to yearn); to dote upon, i.e. intensely crave possession (lawfully or wrongfully):--(earnestly) desire (greatly), (greatly) long (after), lust.
from ἐπιποθέω; a longing for:--earnest (vehement) desire.
from ἐπί and a derivative of the latter part of ἐπιποθέω; yearned upon, i.e. greatly loved:--longed for.
from ἐπιποθέω; intense longing:--great desire.
from ἐπί and πορεύομαι; to journey further, i.e. travel on (reach):--come.
from ἐπί and the base of ῥαφίς; to stitch upon, i.e. fasten with the needle:--sew on.
from ἐπί and ῥίπτω; to throw upon (literally or figuratively):--cast upon.
from ἐπί and some form of the base of σημαίνω; remarkable, i.e. (figuratively) eminent:--notable, of note.
from a compound of ἐπί and a derivative of σῖτος; a provisioning, i.e. (concretely) food:--victuals.
middle voice from ἐπί and the base of σκοπός; to inspect, i.e. (by implication) to select; by extension, to go to see, relieve:--look out, visit.
from ἐπί and σκηνόω; to tent upon, i.e. (figuratively) abide with :--rest upon.
from ἐπί and a derivative of σκιά; to cast a shade upon, i.e. (by analogy) to envelop in a haze of brilliancy; figuratively, to invest with preternatural influence:--overshadow.
from ἐπί and σκοπέω; to oversee; by implication, to beware:--look diligently, take the oversight.
from ἐπισκέπτομαι; inspection (for relief); by implication, superintendence; specially, the Christian "episcopate":--the office of a "bishop", bishoprick, visitation.
from ἐπί and σκοπός (in the sense of ἐπισκοπέω); a superintendent, i.e. Christian officer in genitive case charge of a (or the) church (literally or figuratively):--bishop, overseer.
from ἐπί and σπάω; to draw over, i.e. (with ἀκροβυστία implied) efface the mark of circumcision (by recovering with the foreskin):--become uncircumcised.
apparently a middle voice of ἐφίστημι (with νοῦς implied); to put the mind upon, i.e. comprehend, or be acquainted with:--know, understand.
from ἐπί and a presumed derivative of ἵστημι; an appointee over, i.e. commander (teacher):--master.
from ἐπί and στέλλω; to enjoin (by writing), i.e. (genitive case) to communicate by letter (for any purpose):--write (a letter, unto).
from ἐπίσταμαι; intelligent:--endued with knowledge.
from ἐπί and στηρίζω; to support further, i.e. reestablish:--confirm, strengthen.
from ἐπιστέλλω; a written message:--"epistle," letter.
from ἐπί and στόμα; to put something over the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) to silence:--stop mouths.
from ἐπί and στρέφω; to revert (literally, figuratively or morally):--come (go) again, convert, (re-)turn (about, again).
from ἐπιστρέφω; reversion, i.e. morally, revolution:--conversion.
from ἐπί and συνάγω; to collect upon the same place:--gather (together).
from ἐπισυνάγω; a complete collection; especially a Christian meeting (for worship):--assembling (gathering) together.
from ἐπί and συντρέχω; to hasten together upon one place (or a particular occasion):--come running together.
from the middle voice of a compound of ἐπί and συνιστάω; a conspiracy, i.e. concourse (riotous or friendly):--that which cometh upon, + raising up.
from a compound of ἐπί and  (to trip); figuratively, insecure:--dangerous.
from ἐπί and ἰσχύω; to avail further, i.e. (figuratively) insist stoutly:--be the more fierce.
from ἐπί and σωρεύω; to accumulate further, i.e. (figuratively) seek additionally:--heap.
from ἐπιτάσσω; an injunction or decree; by implication, authoritativeness:--authority, commandment.
from ἐπί and τάσσω; to arrange upon, i.e. order:--charge, command, injoin.
from ἐπί and τελέω; to fulfill further (or completely), i.e. execute; by implication, to terminate, undergo:--accomplish, do, finish, (make) (perfect), perform(X -ance).
from  (enough); serviceable, i.e. (by implication) requisite:--things which are needful.
from ἐπί and τίθημι; to impose (in a friendly or hostile sense):--add unto, lade, lay upon, put (up) on, set on (up), + surname, X wound.
from ἐπί and τιμάω; to tax upon, i.e. censure or admonish; by implication, forbid:--(straitly) charge, rebuke.
from a compound of ἐπί and τιμή; properly, esteem, i.e. citizenship; used (in the sense of ἐπιτιμάω) of a penalty:--punishment.
from ἐπί and the base of τροπή; to turn over (transfer), i.e. allow:--give leave (liberty, license), let, permit, suffer.
from ἐπιτρέπω; permission, i.e. (by implication) full power:--commission.
from ἐπί and τρόπος (in the sense of ἐπιτροπή); a commissioner, i.e. domestic manager, guardian:--steward, tutor.
from ἐπί and τυγχάνω; to chance upon, i.e. (by implication) to attain:--obtain.
from ἐπί and φαίνω; to shine upon, i.e. become (literally) visible or (figuratively) known:--appear, give light.
from ἐπιφανής; a manifestation, i.e. (specially) the advent of Christ (past or future):--appearing, brightness.
from ἐπιφαίνω; conspicuous, i.e. (figuratively) memorable:--notable.
a form of ἐπιφαίνω; to illuminate (figuratively):--give light.
from ἐπί and φέρω; to bear upon (or further), i.e. adduce (personally or judicially (accuse, inflict)), superinduce:--add, bring (against), take.
from ἐπί and φωνέω; to call at something, i.e. exclaim:--cry (against), give a shout.
a form of ἐπιφαύω; to begin to grow light:--begin to dawn, X draw on.
from ἐπί and χείρ; to put the hand upon, i.e. undertake:--go about, take in hand (upon).
from ἐπί and  (to pour); --to pour upon:--pour in.
from ἐπί and χορηγέω; to furnish besides, i.e. fully supply, (figuratively) aid or contribute:--add, minister (nourishment, unto).
from ἐπιχορηγέω; contribution:--supply.
from ἐπί and χρίω; to smear over:--anoint.
from ἐπί and οἰκοδομέω; to build upon, i.e. (figuratively) to rear up:--build thereon (thereupon, on, upon).
from ἐπί and  (to urge); to drive upon the shore, i.e. to beach a vessel:--run aground.
